Manager.description: After notifications loads for the first time, and user is on a tablet, the first row should be selected so that the detail view is loaded with content.
Manager.title: Select first row of notifications after refresh on tablet

Manager.description: This is on a Nexus 7 on 4.1: http://cl.ly/image/3K0X051Y2L18
Manager.title: Funky chars around comment reply

Manager.description: The placeholder used for the note comment view is the WP logo. If the image is private or fails to load for any reason, the WP logo will just hang around. We should have a better placeholder image as well as handle the image load fail better.
Manager.title: Images that aren't able to load show the WordPress logo placeholder

Manager.description: If you tap on a post, only on xlarge device in landscape, the app force closes. Has to do with the menu drawer icon not existing.
Manager.title: Reader crashes on xlarge device in landscape

Manager.description: Just one report of this so far: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{org.wordpress.android/org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.NotificationsActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2180) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2230) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:141) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1234) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5039) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:793) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:560) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.NotificationsListFragment$NotesAdapter.addAll(NotificationsListFragment.java:143) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.NotificationsActivity.onCreate(NotificationsActivity.java:79) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5104) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1080) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2144) ... 11 more
Manager.title: NotificationsActivity Crash

Manager.description: java.lang.IllegalStateException: sender id not set on constructor at com.google.android.gcm.GCMBaseIntentService.getSenderIds(GCMBaseIntentService.java:125) at com.google.android.gcm.GCMBaseIntentService.onHandleIntent(GCMBaseIntentService.java:237) at android.app.IntentService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(IntentService.java:59) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123) at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:60)
Manager.title: java.lang.IllegalStateException: sender id not set on constructor

Manager.description: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{org.wordpress.android/org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.NotificationsActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:1956) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:1981) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:123) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1147) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4424) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:817) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:584) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.SingleLineListFragment.onActivityCreated(SingleLineListFragment.java:48) at android.support.v4.app.Fragment.performActivityCreated(Fragment.java:1468) at android.support.v4.app.FragmentManagerImpl.moveToState(FragmentManager.java:931) at android.support.v4.app.FragmentManagerImpl.moveToState(FragmentManager.java:1088) at android.support.v4.app.FragmentManagerImpl.moveToState(FragmentManager.java:1070) at android.support.v4.app.FragmentManagerImpl.dispatchActivityCreated(FragmentManager.java:1861) at android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity.onStart(FragmentActivity.java:547) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnStart(Instrumentation.java:1133) at android.app.Activity.performStart(Activity.java:4475) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:1929) ... 11 more

Manager.description: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground() at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:278) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerSetException(FutureTask.java:273) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:124) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:307) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) at android.os.AsyncTask$SerialExecutor$1.run(AsyncTask.java:208) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1076) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:569) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderImplFragment$loadReaderTask.doInBackground(ReaderImplFragment.java:221) at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderImplFragment$loadReaderTask.doInBackground(ReaderImplFragment.java:181) at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:264) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:305) ... 5 more
Manager.title: Reader NPE

Manager.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.FollowRow.isSiteId(FollowRow.java:136) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.FollowListener$FollowResponseHandler.onResponse(FollowListener.java:39) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.FollowListener$FollowResponseHandler.onResponse(FollowListener.java:27) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:60) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:17) at com.android.volley.ExecutorDelivery$ResponseDeliveryRunnable.run(ExecutorDelivery.java:99) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:138) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:3701) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:878) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:636) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
Manager.title: FollowRow NPE

Manager.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.util.JSONUtil.queryJSON(JSONUtil.java:51) at org.wordpress.android.models.Note.buildReply(Note.java:132) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.NoteCommentFragment$3.onReply(NoteCommentFragment.java:249) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.ReplyField$1.onClick(ReplyField.java:62) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:3652) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:14354) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:605) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4512) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:794) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:561) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
Manager.title: JSONUtil NPE

Manager.description: On the Nexus 7. Steps to reproduce: In the post detail panel, tap to edit a post. Make a change (or not) and hit the back button to return to the post list. Choose "Discard" when prompted to save your changes. Back on the post list, tap to refresh the list. You're prompted that you have local changes, even though you just discarded them.
Manager.title: Refreshing posts after discarding changes still prompts you about unsaved changes.

Manager.description: If I check a few new categories in the list, then refresh the list, the categories I just checked are forgotten.
Manager.title: Refreshing the categories list forgets categories that were just checked.

Manager.description: Go to the categories list and tap to add a new category. Tap to open the parent category list. Child categories are indented but do not show the "step" graphic that is shown on the main categories list.
Manager.title: The parent category list under Add New Category is missing the step graphic

Manager.description: If I have the category "marco,polo", it shows up as a single category on the category list, but as two categories: "marco" and "polo" on the post editor. Fun fact: You can create categories that include a comma :)
Manager.title: A category containing a comma shows up as two categories on the edit screen.

Manager.description: Edge case. It is possible to have a category that is whitespace, and that category can have child categories. The categories list displays these correctly, however the whitespace category is not displayed on the edit screen when checked.
Manager.title: Blank categories are displayed in the category list but not on the edit screen.

Manager.description: When returning from the categories list I'm always taken back to the top of the post editor. It would be better if it kept the scroll offset so I can see the categories I just added. Nexus 7.
Manager.title: Edit screen forgets scroll position when returning from categories list

Manager.description: On the post editor, tap to edit content. Dismiss the keyboard. Notice that the formatting bar is not visible. Scroll down a little bit. Now the formatting bar is back. Tapping the buttons inserts markup where the cursor last appeared in the content view.
Manager.title: Formatting bar lingers after dismissing keyboard

Manager.description: Another edge case most likely. Add a new category to a post via the web admin. In the app, refresh the post list. Edit the post. Notice the category you added via the admin is included in the posts categories. Tap the + button to add a new category. Without refreshing the category list, tap the back button. Since the new category did not exist in the apps copy of the category list it was removed from the post. If you let the category list refresh before returning to the post editor the category will be retained.
Manager.title: Post can loose a category if its not in the category list when categories are added.

Manager.description: If I create a new category from within the app it seems like it should be checked in the categories list by default. It shows up unchecked.
Manager.title: Creating a new category does not automatically add it

Manager.description: @maxme any thoughts on this one? java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{org.wordpress.android/org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.SelectCategoriesActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2211) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2261) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:141) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1256) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5103) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:737) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.models.CategoryNode.createCategoryTreeFromDB(CategoryNode.java:84) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.SelectCategoriesActivity.populateOrFetchCategories(SelectCategoriesActivity.java:99) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.SelectCategoriesActivity.onCreate(SelectCategoriesActivity.java:75) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5133) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1087) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2175) ... 11 more
Manager.title: NPE in CategoryNode

Manager.description: If you have a category with quotes like "Cars" it will force close when refreshing the categories.
Manager.title: Categories in quotes causes a f/c

Manager.description: Unconfirmed user report: I noticed that setting the featured image in the app will sometimes set it for multiple posts... I notice it more when I have multiple posts pending or if I update a post to add an image.
Manager.title: Featured image assigned to multiple posts?

Manager.description: Few users has reported the issue where the "View Site" feature doesn't work on their sites. Error message: "Web Page Not Available message - The Web page at file:///android_asset/webkit/ might be temporarily down ...". Seems that this is a common issue for those apps that use native webView to access web-pages. http://www.cynosurex.com/Forums/DisplayComments.php?file=Java/Android/Android_4_has_a_.file....android_asset.webkit.._bug http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2046401
Manager.title: "View Site" feature error when the site has Adobe Flash items in it.

Manager.description: We need to find a way to set a PIN or passphrase lock for the entire app that effectively locking in any sensitive information. (See the DropBox app for a nice implementation of it). It's a much requested feature from our users.
Manager.title: Passcode/PIN lock

Manager.description: User requested ability to make links have the 'nofollow' attribute.
Manager.title: Add ability for links created in the app to be 'nofollow'

Manager.description: Our app is plagued with this issue on JellyBean: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=38770 We need to set the EditPostActivity to not be hardware accelerated to fix it I think.
Manager.title: Text Overlap in Post Editor

Manager.description: User report: If I read a long post and scroll down a bunch, when I go to the next post, it drops me off near the bottom of that post – as if it’s matching up the position of the previous post.
Manager.title: Reader: detail view stays at current scroll position

Manager.description: When a push notification is received we currently don't update the local data which results in a delay if the user opens the app via the notification. Let's update the notifications in the background when we receive the push.
Manager.title: Fetch new notifications when a push is received

Manager.description: I think it'd make sense to not have the checkbox on the pin lock preference, since you use a separate preference to enable it anyways. Thoughts @daniloercoli?
Manager.title: Remove checkbox from pin lock preference?

Manager.description: We should give the pin lock the MP6 look with blue bg and OpenSans font.
Manager.title: Give pin lock NUX/MP6 styling

Manager.description: EXIF data isn't being preserved for image thumbnails: ​http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/rfe-preserve-exif-information-in-attached-images
Manager.title: EXIF Data for Resized Images

Manager.description: Comments should be able to be filtered by their status. ​https://twitter.com/the_tim/status/19755927005 http://android.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/75
Manager.title: Filter Comments by Status

Manager.description: Wordpress allows uploading arbitrary files if correctly configured. If the android app allowed that too, one could upload gpx tracks and have them visualized by the gp2graphics plugin for wordpress! Add another item in the media choose dialog that lets users choose a file with a file manager (if installed).
Manager.title: Uploading arbitrary files

Manager.description: A user requested that spam comments be visible in the comment list.
Manager.title: Show spam comments

Manager.description: I'm using the source code view in my blog when writing new articles. The problem is that the WordPress Android app does have such a mode. So when I write new articles or edit older articles it adds line breaks " " etc. automatically when saving the article. Please add a "source only" edit mode to the app which does not automatically add HTML tags.
Manager.title: Problem with article source code

Manager.description: It would be extremely useful if Wordpress for Android supported custom post types, custom taxonomies, and custom fields. I would like to formally request that the functionality be added.
Manager.title: Custom post types, custom taxonomies, and custom fields

Manager.description: I found some Vectors used in the code, where ArrayLists should be enough (iterating inside of a method in example). Vectors are synchronized and therefor coming with some overhead compared to ArrayLists. So use ArrayLists, where no concurrent access to the List is needed (what is in most cases the case). An example: ViewPosts.getRecentPostsTask.onPostExecute(). Vectors are created and used there only. Why do you need it to be synchronized?
Manager.title: Exchange Vectors with ArrayLists

Manager.description: In my blog, I use relative URLs. This is the case for image URLs and for anchors leading into my blog. I use it anywhere, where I can, so my blog will work after a global domain change, too. But the Client is not able to resolve them. Images are missing and links are opened with ​file://.. instead of ​http://blog/ .. I'll add an image of my post view before my patch, a screenshot after my patch and the patch itself, that resolves the problem. Patch is here: http://android.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/257
Manager.title: ViewPostFragment does not resolve relative urls (patch added)

Manager.description: as mentionned here ​http://androiddevel.wordpress.com/2012/01/23/heres-whats-on-the-list-for-2-0-5/#comment-7908 As the default image size currently doesn't work (it always uploads pictures à 500px), we have to change the size of the uploaded media in the text editor, by taping on the picture. There's a slider for that purpose. The slider is not really precise if you're not a kid with tiny fingers. A spinner or even a text field would be really better. Even if i have a big screen (4.3"), it takes at least 30 seconds before i can make my picture 960px wide (it always fall on 940px, or 970px when i remove my finger), whereas it would take like 2 seconds with a spinner or a text field.
Manager.title: Unusable slider for image size in the editor

Manager.description: If a user taps the Dashboard button and their site uses http auth, the load will fail.
Manager.title: Loading the Dashboard should support HTTP auth

Manager.description: The 'Default Image width' selector uses a bunch of predefined dimensions in it. I think it should show the predefined dimensions the user has set on the blog options. Something like this: Original size Max (actual dimensions read from options) Medium (actual dimensions read from options) Small (actual dimensions read from options) Custom (Maybe?)
Manager.title: Use image resize dimensions in blog's options

Manager.description: As reported by a memember: "because it cuts posts with "Umlaut" like äüö and so on at their first appearance and drops the rest even in the editor..." Confirmed using the same characters on a test blog. Only the content in the post preceding the ä umlat character was displayed both in the preview and in the editor.
Manager.title: Posts containing umlats are incorrectly parsed.

Manager.description: See: ​http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/increase-java-timeout
Manager.title: Investigate Timeout Length

Manager.description: When adding a self hosted blog on a spotty wifi connection you can get trapped on the "Attempting to configure blog" screen for a long period of time. It might make sense to make this dismissable and let the user reattempt to add the blog with a better connection, or another time, than be stuck waiting for the call to timeout/finish.
Manager.title: Trapped on the configure blog screen.

Manager.description: From a fresh install of the app go to the reader. Be sure to have subscribed to several blogs. Tap a story from a blog in the list. On the story detail, tap the blog's title link to open the blog in an in-app browser. If this is the first time you have looked at this blog you will see a tiny blue loading bar at the top of the page repeatedly filling over and over like the page is in a loading loop. Tap the back button. Tap on the blog's title again. This time the blog loads. This seems to happen the first time you view a blog in the reader. Nexus One / 2.3.6 Video of the loading bar. The video quality isn't that great but maybe you can make out the loading bar at the top of the view. ​http://videos.videopress.com/v5N5ALGx/20120814-103511_dvd.mp4
Manager.title: Web view in the reader gets stuck in a loading loop

Manager.description: Testing quick video with a short 2 second video. From the posts lists, tap to show the dashboard and choose quick video When I hit publish I'm taken back to the posts list. I see my quick video post under local drafts and sometimes I see the activity spinner spinning. If I'm patient, I'll see the spinner start (possibly a second time) and the quick photo post will finally move out of the local drafts and into the posts list. If I choose quick video from the dashboard (and without posts in the background) I don't see any indication of progress. If I return to the posts list at this point I don't see a local draft, but if I refresh the successfully uploaded quick video appears after the sync. This is mostly a UX issue where there is a couple of points where it is unclear what is happening with the quick video I took. Nexus One / 2.3.6
Manager.title: Quick Video progress is unclear

Manager.description: Went back to look at my quick video posts in a browser and noticed that they were all empty. Tried another post via the app and it was empty too. The blog I was testing with does not use video press if that makes a difference. Nexus One / 2.3.6
Manager.title: Quick Video posts are empty

Manager.description: There are many AsyncTasks in different Activities that comunicates with the network. The data will load when the user opens the Activity. That means, the user has to wait until the data is downloaded. We can do all this stuff in backgound. Another advantage: we don't need the error handling on each Activity. I started implementing a background service. It's a lot of work and I will add more patches here in the next time. Patch at: http://android.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/363
Manager.title: Do all network communication in background service

Manager.description: From a user: Our WordPress site uses a plugin that allows us for custom statuses. I noticed that the WP app doesn't recognize these custom statuses. Is there a way to resolve that? On the go this would be a great too, but if I can't access my posts, the app renders itself useless.
Manager.title: Custom Status Support

Manager.description: A user has reported that sharing a link from the browser to the app will sometimes strip the anchor tag, so the link isn't clickable.
Manager.title: Sharing a link sometimes strips the anchor tag

Manager.description: Originally reported by a user, the use of umlauts such as ü, ä, ö may render the app unusable - you can't add the blog to the app. Using the full untranslated URL doesn't seem to help (e.g. "​http://xn--bcher-kva.de/" for "​http://bücher.de"). More investigation required.
Manager.title: Blog URLs with umlauts may break the app

Manager.description: When I am in the app and I want to start a new blog on wordpress.com, I go to the menu and select "Add Account". When I select "Start new blog at WordPress.com" it only gives me an option to create a new account. What I wanted to do was start a new blog under my existing WordPress.com account.
Manager.title: Add new blog at WordPress.com with existing account

Manager.description: When viewing a list of posts in the reader, the comment count of any individual post seems to be 1 less than the actual comment count.
Manager.title: Comment Count Incorrect in the Reader

Manager.description: Unconfirmed, from user email: When editing a post with the --more-- tag in it, each time it's opened extra white space is added before and after. As this affects how the post is formatted when viewed in a browser, it has to be fixed every time a minor edit is done. Tested this a bit. I'm not 100% sure this is what the user meant but I noticed that if I have a post content that looks like this in the web editor: This is some text before the more tag Test test This is some text after. it shows up like this in the Android editor: This is some text before the more tag Test test This is some text after. Publishing without removing the carriage returns changes the post layout.
Manager.title: Editing a Post with 'More' tag causes extra whitespace

Manager.description: Some users are still having the HTML brackets stripped from content uploaded from the app. Let's explore a solution that might fix this for users that are still running old versions of PHP and libxml2 on their host. Ref: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/posts-published-through-xmlrpc-have-lt-stripped-out
Manager.title: Solution for libxml2 problem

Manager.description: Edit a page Add an image. Tap the image and check the option to use it as a featured image. Do not check the option to include the image in the content. Publish the page. An image tag for the featured image is included in the post body even though you did not check the option to do this. The image tag is missing a src attribute, and has android-uri="content:// ... " instead.
Manager.title: Featured images on pages are broken.

Manager.description: A user has requested to be able to upload transparent PNGs to their posts. Currently the app fills any transparent parts of the uploaded image with black.
Manager.title: Support for uploading transparent PNG-24s

Manager.description: ViewComments looks pretty nasty, uses a lot of threading. It should be updated to use AsyncTask for the moderation tasks.
Manager.title: Modernize ViewComments.java

Manager.description: We can add a view with "@android:id/empty" to list activities to show a message when the list is empty, similar to how the iOS shows "No Posts Yet. Why not create one? See ​http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/ListActivity.html
Manager.title: Add placeholder views to show when a list view is empty

Manager.description: On the nexus 7 in portrait orientation Go to the post list. Scroll all the way down and load more posts. Rotate to landscape orientation. The posts list is scrolled up a bit making it look like you lost your place. Maybe there is a way to keep the list fully scrolled when rotating?
Manager.title: Scroll position appears to be lost when rotating.

Manager.description: On the nexus 7. You'll need multiple browsers installed to see this probably. Go to the comment list On the comment detail, tap the hyperlink for the commenter's website. Dismiss the action modal Watch closely as all the gravatars reload.
Manager.title: Weird redrawing behavior on the Comment list.

Manager.description: The Code in ViewPostsFragment is quite poor (pointing finger at the 2009 version of myself!), instead of creating a bunch of string arrays that are merged together (yikes), we can use a CursorAdapter to manage the listview data. It'll be much cleaner and probably more efficient too.
Manager.title: Use a CursorAdapter for the ListView in ViewPostsFragment

Manager.description: From user support request: When i use the french caracter "é" the publication seems to be done but the article published is truncated.
Manager.title: Post content is truncated on special characters

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to comments. Tap a comment midway down the list to select it and view it in the detail screen. Refresh the comments list. When the refresh finishes the first comment in the list is selected.
Manager.title: Refreshing comments list forgets the selected comment.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the comments list. Check one or more comments. Notice the moderation options appear. Send the app to the background. Resume the app. Nothing is checked but the moderation options are still visible.
Manager.title: Comments list forgets checked items when resuming from background.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 On the settings screen, the scroll bar is left of the right side. This creates a visual gap and it looks like the bar is out of place. Also, if its still visible when I tap a cell the cell background color intersects the scroll bar. Can the views be adjusted so the scroll bar is fully right aligned? I can't figure this one out. We're using the SherlockPreferenceActivity, so I'm wondering if it's a bug with ABS. Further research required.
Manager.title: Settings screen scroll bar seems out of place.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to settings. Tap a blog. Expand the dropdown for Default Image Width. Rotate to a different orientation. The select list should resize to match the new orientation.
Manager.title: Default Image Width select list should resize in response to an orientation change.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2. Go to the reader. While its syncing and there is no content visible, tap the ActionBar to invoke the topic list. The list appears centered and empty except for "Topics" as the title. Maybe we should ignore these clicks until the topics list has loaded for the first time.
Manager.title: Reader topics list can be empty

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 This is probably too impractical to affect many, but documenting here. From a desktop browser, create a new post on your blog with lots and lots of text. I used the full text of Shakespeare's Hamlet from Project Gutenberg. Try to view the post in the app. Crash. So there is probably an upper limit of how much text can be displayed in the post view.
Manager.title: Crash when loading a post with oodles and oodles of text.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 This was a little weird. I tried deleting a post by clicking the trashcan icon. I confirmed I wanted to delete the post. I saw the toast that the post was deleted. However the post was still visible on the screen until the post list refreshed. I think the right UX would be to show the toast after the post was removed.
Manager.title: Deleting post : confirmation appeared but post was still visible.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to a post preview that has an image. Tap the image. You should be prompted to open the image in an external application. We should probably just show this in-app.
Manager.title: Images in previews try to open externally.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the post list. Tap to share a post detail. While the app is "Attempting to fetch URL" try to hit the back button to dismiss the modal. The modal will not dismiss.
Manager.title: Share Post does not respond to back button.

Manager.description: If you are on a reader detail page, then press home and leave the app for a while, when you return to the app it will load a blank detail view.
Manager.title: Reader Detail Page can be Blank

Manager.description: This is hard to reproduce, but it occasionally happens for me: Load the Reader Change topics See if the list refreshes correctly Sometimes the list won't refresh until I 'dirty' the view by scrolling it.
Manager.title: Reader requires scrolling sometimes to refresh content

Manager.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Go to the post editor. Tap in the content field to invoke the keyboard. Tap the back button to dismiss the keyboard. The cursor is now in the title field. Try this with the title and tags fields. Notice the cursor remains in the correct text field after dismissing the keyboard.
Manager.title: Post Editor: Tapping the back button do dismiss the keyboard changes text fields.

Manager.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Open the sliding menu. Scroll down to the bottom and tap Dashboard. Reopen the menu, you've been scrolled back to the top. Scroll back down to the bottom of the list. Close the menu. Open the menu again. This time the menu kept its scroll offset.
Manager.title: Menu changes scroll position when switching tabs.

Manager.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Go to settings. Tap the Post Signature option to edit the text. Tap the cancel button. The modal dismisses but the keyboard remains.
Manager.title: Cancelling post signature does not dismiss the keyboard.

Manager.description: When users can't connect to their self-hosted site they are stuck and leave a bad review. We should link them to the forums and/or eritreo.it for further assistance.
Manager.title: Link users that can't connect to forums

Manager.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the post list Pick an item midway down the list. Refresh the post list and wait for it to finish. The first item is now selected. Page list has the same behavior
Manager.title: Post/Page list loses its place after refreshing.

Manager.description: Provide expanded information when tapping on a gravatar.
Manager.title: Gravatar Profile Activity

Manager.description: Perhaps another field to the image settings could be added for a custom link. User request.
Manager.title: Custom image link URLs

Manager.description: A user has requested that the app allow changing of the text color in posts/pages.
Manager.title: Change text color?

Manager.description: These are the steps I took, some may not be necessary: Create a new post In the editor add an image, then add another image. Tap the first image and make it featured and include in content, and give it a caption. Tap the second image and give it a caption. Rotate the device. The caption of the second image is now included in the post content.
Manager.title: Image caption appears in the editor after rotating.

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Create a new post. Make some edits and tap the back button. Choose Save when prompted to save the post as a local draft. Edit the post. Tap the publish button. The post will publish but will remain as a local draft, and the post list does not automatically refresh. Tap refresh. You are prompted that you are about to overwrite local changes. Choose OK. After refreshing the local draft is gone.
Manager.title: Local drafts linker after publishing and the post list does not refresh.

Manager.description: The app can quickly reach the login limit on WP.com. Investigate where app might be making multiple requests that would cause the limit to be reached. Bail out if first request 403's.
Manager.title: Login limit reached

Manager.description: Two-step auth users on WP.com can quickly get confused when trying to sign into the app. We should add clear instructions in the app to help them create an application-specific password. I've added a better description of the error in ​146107f4f05d7dae759381ecfe8ca6c5e0a0ed84. Unfortunately the support page ​http://en.support.wordpress.com/security/two-step-authentication/#application-specific-passwords doesn't work fine on mobile browser, and redirect users there doesn't seem to be an option. I've then tried to redirect the user to the settings page ​https://wordpress.com/?ssl=forced#!/settings/security/, but even this one is not "mobile friendly".
Manager.title: Better UI for two-step users

Manager.description: If you pick from the media gallery before visiting the gallery, it will be blank.
Manager.title: Gallery picker is blank if never visited media

Manager.description: Add an image from the media library Observe that it is much smaller than if you would have added from the regular android gallery.
Manager.title: Images are crazy tiny after adding from media library

Manager.description: I was wondering if there is any plans and/or interest in refactoring this code into 2 projects (in the same repo). For example the repo structure could be: /WordPress-Android/ /app/ /workpress-sdk/ What I was thinking here was that there are sure to be people out there that need to use wordpress in their own app and instead of them copying this code out of the repo into their own app they could just fork this repo and use it as a library. This way any bugs they fix or extensions they make could be pushed back for others to use and likewise any changes made to this repo they could also easily leverage.
Manager.title: Wordpress Android SDK

Manager.description: I'm getting quite used to using the 'Up' button in android apps to go back. The reader detail view doesn't have one since it doesn't use the action bar. Do you think there's room up there to add some sort of back button?
Manager.title: 'Up' button in reader detail?

Manager.description: I'm seeing the transparent action bar overlay the content a bit when the scroll view is scrolled all the way to the top:
Manager.title: Native Reader: Small overlap of action bar and content

Manager.description: A lot of login failures are due to fat-fingered email addresses, so if the user enters an email address on the sign-in screen we could help by fixing the most common mis-types (such as using ".xom" instead of ".com" or typing "@gmal.com" instead of "@gmail.com"). I already wrote code for the WPReader login which does this for 18 common typos - feel free to assign back to me if you'd like me to add it to WPAndroid.
Manager.title: NUX - add email auto-correct

Manager.description: If you tap sign-in when app starts and then tap the back button, the app closes. I expected it to return to the "Welcome to WordPress" screen.
Manager.title: NUX - back button closes app from sign-in

Manager.description: The TOS text on the "Create Account" screen is very faint - probably won't show up at all on some devices.
Manager.title: NUX - TOS text is too faint

Manager.description: The "Required Fields" transparent overlay that appears when you try to create an account without filling everything in seems a bit severe compared to how friendly the rest of the NUX is. Perhaps use setError instead? http://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/TextView.html#setError(java.lang.CharSequence)
Manager.title: NUX - "Required Fields" is a bit unfriendly

Manager.description: Reproduce: login as user XXX on Android device comment on Web blog written by user XXX with user YYY reply from XXX to YYY a Push Notification is received "Comment from XXX" (but the REST call to refresh notes doesn't include it) branch master and develop
Manager.title: Push Notifications received for user own content

Manager.description: The placeholder text 'No articles in this topic' isn't centered vertically in the Reader.
Manager.title: Native Reader: 'No articles in this topic' placeholder isn't centered

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Native Reader: need to enable showing images in comments

Manager.description: Right now a post with a VideoPress video shows an image of the video without a clickable player overlay.
Manager.title: Native Reader: VideoPress support needs work

Manager.description: Once Triton switches from topics to tags, need to change "Topic" to "Tag" in Reader's UI.
Manager.title: Native Reader: change topics to tags

Manager.description: A user commented that when they are viewing comments, the refresh button is at the far right. But when viewing Posts, the refresh button is moved over to the left to make room for the add post button. Maybe they should be swapped?
Manager.title: Swap Refresh/New Post ActionBar buttons?

Manager.description: Users have requested that we add support for ordered and unordered lists in the editor.
Manager.title: Add support for lists in the post editor

Manager.description: Inconsistency in geotagging in Android: New Post > Geotagging option shows up Send to WordPress from Gallery > Geotagging option does not show up I do the second one most often and have to save the post as draft and re-edit before publishing to get the location added. Two other issues: Draft a post and set my current location, then leave. Return to post from another location and my original location automatically gets overridden. There’s no way to set a location other than the current one (but I think that may go against most use cases of the app so probably okay to not have)
Manager.title: Geotagging Inconsistencies

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Native Reader: retain scroll position when switching between portrait/landscape

Manager.description: Create a new post Add some text in bold, leave the cursor at the end of the text. Add an image, then save the post as a local draft. Edit the post again, the image will be lost because the bold span wrapped around the entire image.
Manager.title: Post Editor: Formatting blocks can be applied around images
Post editor shows html entities in localized post formats

Manager.description: Create a new post Set post format to "Audio" Publish Edit this post and change post format to "Standard" Re-Publish Post format is still "Audio" (local and server side)
Manager.title: There is no way to change the post format after publishing

Manager.description: Google released an updated ActionBar icon pack that includes xxhdpi icons. We should add these for icons we are using in the app. http://developer.android.com/design/downloads/index.html
Manager.title: Add xxhdpi ActionBar Icons

Manager.description: Scrolling the notification ListView isn't very smooth, and it looks like there's work happening on the UI thread that causes it scrolling to "hiccup" every now and then.
Manager.title: Janky scrolling in notification ListView

Manager.description: Apparently we need to have two folders with the same strings in them in order to support Hebrew properly: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5074769/cyanogenmod-translate-a-project/
Manager.title: Add duplicate of 'values-he' folder named 'values-iw'

Manager.description: Strings from the Reader seem to refer to people in second person, like "You and one other like this" We generally try to refer to users in first person, so a string like that would read "I and one other" although that sounds a bit weird when I just typed it.
Manager.title: "Second person" strings

Manager.description: We should remove the following values from the strings.xml file, since they aren't needed for translation: app_name underline link strike For the formatting bar text, we can just set the HTML for those in code. Unless the formatting bar buttons can change by locale, not sure about that.
Manager.title: Remove formatting buttons and app name from strings file

Manager.description: If there is a local draft in the post list, refreshing the post list prompts the user that refreshing will overwrite local changes. This always happens, even when there are no changes since the last refresh. Edit: Edited vs creating a new issue. This is always happening when refreshing the post list on any of my test blogs regardless of if there are local drafts in the list or not. Nexus 7, 2.5 beta 3.
Manager.title: Post List: Refresh always prompts about local changes

Manager.description: To reproduce: Tap to select a post other than the first in the list Tap the refresh button The selected post is now the first in the list. Expecting the post I was viewing to still be the selected one (unless of course it was deleted on the server) Nexus 7 / 2.5 b3
Manager.title: Post List: Refreshing post list always selects the first post

Manager.description: To reproduce: Long tap on a post in the list other than the one currently selected. Choose the edit action from the menu that appears. Tap back and dismiss the editor. Notice that the post detail shows the post that was the subject of the longpress but it is not selected in the list. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3
Manager.title: Post List: Longpress + action does not update selected post in list.

Manager.description: Fringe case probably To reproduce: Have a blog with one comment. On the comments detail, delete the comment. Notice that the moderation buttons remain but the comment text is gone and the comment list is empty. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3
Manager.title: Comment Detail: Deleting last comment does not clear moderation buttons

Manager.description: To reproduce Be viewing media in the app. From the web admin, delete all media In the app, refresh the media list After refreshing the list will be empty but the detail still shows the last selected item. Nexus 7 / 2.5 b 3
Manager.title: Media: Detail can still show deleted media

Manager.description: To reproduce: Tap on a media item in the list In the detail tap into the title field. Edit the title text Tap the Next button on the keyboard. The title field looses focus and the keyboard remains visible but the caption field is not being edited. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3
Manager.title: Media: Tapping Next when editing title does not advance to caption.

Manager.description: In landscape orientation the "uploaded" badge partially covers the last character of the "Uploaded on: " date. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3
Manager.title: Media: Date partially obscured by "uploaded" badge in landscape orientation

Manager.description: To reproduce: On the media list, long press to enter selection mode. Select a single item and tap the post button. Edit the post and publish. You're back on the media list, notice that there is an extra copy of the item at the bottom of the list. Rotate to change orientation. Notice that the thumbnails for both the original and the extra copy are missing, as well as the dimensions. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3
Manager.title: Media: Creating a post from media page creates a "ghost" media item and breaks UI

Manager.description: The cursor is always active in one of the text fields. Rotating invokes the keyboard, even if it has been previously dismissed. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3
Manager.title: Media: Keyboard appears when changing orientation

Manager.description: To reproduce: Long press on the media list to invoke selection mode. Select multiple images and tap the Gallery button. On the edit gallery screen, tap the + icon. The screen that appear has a title bar with a done button and "0 selected" label, but there is no other content. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3
Manager.title: Edit Gallery: Tapping + icon shows a blank screen.

Manager.description: Maybe I'm being nit picky but it seems a little weird that the refresh spinner in the action bar and the large spinner in the themes feature would not spin in the same direction.
Manager.title: Themes: Loading spinners turn in opposite directions

Manager.description: The thumbnail on the detail screen takes a little time to load, even though it looks like the same image that was on used in the list. This is most noticeable the first time you view the detail. Even if we need to fetch a new image at a different size it seems like we could prime the detail image with the one from the list.
Manager.title: Themes: Detail thumb seems to take a long time to load.

Manager.description: If you view site from the Themes detail, it looks like a new task is started to show the view site tab. From this point a user can open the sidebar and choose a different option, posts for example. At this point the user has moved out of the themes feature but tapping the back softkey will dump them back into Themes instead of dismissing the app.
Manager.title: Themes: View site probably shouldn't start a new task

Manager.description: To reproduce: Choose a theme from the themes list. On the detail screen, tap the activate button. Quickly change orientation. The activate button resets (the spinner is gone) The call to activate the theme will complete but the activate and preview buttons remain instead of showing the view site button.
Manager.title: Themes: Rotating while activating breaks the ui

Manager.description: To reproduce: Go to the themes feature and let it load. Tap the refresh button in the action bar The large spinner reappears over the loaded themes in the list. This seems especially weird as I can still scroll the list while its refreshing. I'd expect either that the large spinner would not appear, or that I would not be able to scroll while it was visible.
Manager.title: Themes: Large spinner appears when refreshing and overlaps list items

Manager.description: Reported by Dan, "I opened the nav drawer from the reader and it went kinda crazy (develop in the emulator)."
Manager.title: Reader: Crazy menu drawer

Manager.description: Edit an existing post Add an image to the post Tap the image, and tick the box to set it as featured Observe that the image does not get set as the feature image.
Manager.title: Setting Featured Image for existing post not working

Manager.description: Get out a large tablet like the nexus 10 that has multiple blogs Select 'Comments' form the navigation drawer Rotate the device Observe that the blog switches and the comments list is refreshed.
Manager.title: Rotating comment view on tablet switches blogs

Manager.description: If you bulk moderate comments, a spinner shows up with the label 'Moderating comment', it should say 'Moderating comments'
Manager.title: Pluralization issue when bulk moderating comments

Manager.description: On my gingerbread device, tapping 'Live Preview' loads m.wordpress.com. Doesn't happen on a 4.3 device.
Manager.title: Themes: Gingerbread device loads m.wordpress.com for theme preview

Manager.description: Open and edit an already published page. Tap on the content, and then tap on the media icon. Select library, and pick a picture from there. Upload the changes. The page is uploaded, with changes you may eventually done in post editor, but the new picture is missing, and just an empty IMG tag is in place.
Manager.title: Add a picture to an already published page is broken

Manager.description: Currently you can't remove a featured image from a post, only add. Perhaps we should make it more like WPiOS where there is a separate section in the post editor for adding/updating/removing a featured image.
Manager.title: Can't remove a featured image from a post

Manager.description: If you tap to edit a page and then immediately hit the back button, you're asked whether to save your changes. You should only be asked to save changes if changes were actually made.
Manager.title: Edit Page always asks to save changes

Manager.description: I see lot of these messages in console: 10-17 17:12:38.483: W/CursorWrapperInner(7043): Cursor finalized without prior close() We need to close cursors properly.
Manager.title: Cursor finalized without prior close()

Manager.description: I received a push notification that Koke commented on a post of mine. I tapped the notification and was taken to an empty activity. There was no ActionBar so I couldn't go elsewhere in the app, and hitting the back button closed the app. I had to force close and restart in order to use the app again.
Manager.title: Empty activity when app started from push notification

Manager.description: I tapped a push notification about a new comment and was taken to that comment, and then I tapped the "x" icon beneath "MODERATE COMMENT." This resulted in "Moderating comment" to blink as though the comment was being moderated, but it never stopped blinking even after I waited several minutes. Note that this doesn't happen when tapping an existing note in the notification list - it only happens after tapping on a push notification. I've reproduced this three times.
Manager.title: Moderating comment never completes

Manager.description: If you sign in to a different WP.com account when accessing stats for a Jetpack site, it will override the global WP.com account. We need to use a separate instance of WPRestClient in stats for self-hosted sites.
Manager.title: Stats API Key Issues

Manager.description: Instead of opening Chrome, handle navigation inside the app.
Manager.title: Use AuthenticatedWebView in native Reader

Manager.description: If you view the stats for a site with brand new or really low traffic, the chart data does not get rendered.
Manager.title: Stats: Chart is empty when there is a low amount of traffic

Manager.description: In the first stats view, swipe to the 3rd pane and then back to the first. Notice that all of the stats data is gone from the first pane.
Manager.title: Stats: Data cleared after viewing 3rd pane of data

Manager.description: This project need two library android-menudrawer-master https://github.com/SimonVT/android-menudrawer ActionBarSherlock https://github.com/JakeWharton/ActionBarSherlock clone it and add to wordpress-android
Manager.title: Dependent public libraries

Manager.description: i have add android-menudrawer-master and ActionBarSherlock, and set android target to 4.2.2, but error still. It's because cannot find class Config in requestAccessToken function of WordPress.java
Manager.title: cannot find class Config in requestAccessToken function of WordPress.java

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Can't share Image via WhatsApp

Manager.description: Tried to deleted all the pages from my blog but the list is not correctly refreshed when the last page is removed from the blog. Pages list still has an entry for that page (that was correctly removed from the blog). Restarting the app fixes the issue. Tried to quickly fix it but found 2 strange behaviors in PostsListFragment: getRecentPostsTask returns success = false when the posts/pages list returned from the server is empty. It should return true, since the network connection is correctly completed. When false is returned the UI is not updated. If you delete all the pages from the app db, and return true (as it should be) in getRecentPostsTask, the method loadPosts is called. The latter calls refreshPosts, and goes in a loop...
Manager.title: The posts/pages list is not updated when you delete the last page/post of your blog

Manager.description: The article here http://wp.me/p18Fb6-15t crashes the webview. I tried to preview a new theme on the site, but the theme preview screen uses a webview internally, and the app crashed. Same crash when I used the "View Site" option, or the reader details screen.
Manager.title: Webview crashes on page with tons of unicode characters

Manager.description: The Visitors and Views chart looks nice but I think we should add labels to the vertical dividers to give some context of how many views the bars correspond with.
Manager.title: Add vertical labels to stats chart

Manager.description: Edit an existing post Tap in the content area, then the camera icon, then 'Create gallery' Select some images for the gallery and insert in into the post. Publish the post. Observe that the gallery is not in the post.
Manager.title: Can't add a gallery to existing post

Manager.description: From a fresh install, launch the app and choose to add a self hosted blog. The placement of the optional settings and sign in buttons are off. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Add Self-Hosted Blog: Weird button alignment

Manager.description: I can't reproduce this, but I got this crash after scrolling down the post list and loading more posts: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$PostListAdapter cannot be cast to android.widget.HeaderViewListAdapter at android.widget.ListView.removeFooterView(ListView.java:390) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment.loadPosts(PostsListFragment.java:259) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$getRecentPostsTask$1.run(PostsListFragment.java:644) at android.app.Activity.runOnUiThread(Activity.java:4673) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$getRecentPostsTask.onPostExecute(PostsListFragment.java:640) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$getRecentPostsTask.onPostExecute(PostsListFragment.java:609) at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:631) at android.os.AsyncTask.access$600(AsyncTask.java:177) at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:644) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5103) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:737) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
Manager.title: Crash in PostsListFragment loadPosts()

Manager.description: To reproduce: Configure pin lock. Go to media. Tap the add button Choose capture photo. Take a photo or cancel. You are prompted by the pin lock. This seems a little weird. From the user's perspective the app has not been backgrounded (even though I'm in the camera activity) and its interrupting the task at hand. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Media/Pin Lock: Prompted with PIN lock when returning from photo capture

Manager.description: Got to the Media list. In the detail pane, edit the caption or description Rotate the device to change orientation. Your changes are gone. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Media: Changing orientation while editing resets fields.

Manager.description: Go to the media list and tap refresh. Rotate to change the orientation. The spinner has stopped but view is still refreshing. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Media: Changing orientation while refreshing interrupts spinner

Manager.description: Not sure if this is a server issue or app issue. When publishing a quick video the following error appears. "Error: An error occurred while uploading media: Could not write file wpid-VID_20131023_181817.3gp (Invalid file type)" Should the file type be .3gp? 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Quick Vid: Error uploading. Invalid File Type

Manager.description: Start with a local draft post with embedded media. (Via quick vid with no wifi for instance.) Notice you can see the video thumb in the post detail. Switch to the media view. Notice the local vid has a local file path. Hit refresh. The local vid vanishes. (doH!) Go back to the post list. The thumb is now missing from the post detail. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Media: Refreshing media list deletes locally saved media

Manager.description: Discovered after noticing "View Admin" to go to the wrong page if the user's password contains spaces.
Manager.title: DashboardActivity.loadAuthenticatedUrl() doesn't encode username or password

Manager.description: Turn off wifi. Take a quick video. Try to publish. The app tries to upload the video even though wifi is turned off. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Publishing a post doesn't check network availability

Manager.description: Total edge case. Turn off wifi. Take a quick video and publish. When you're back on the post list, notice that the quick vid is missing. Switch to a different tab (pages, comments, etc) then back. Now you see the post. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Quick Vid: Post list doesn't show new local draft when publishing and wifi is disabled.

Manager.description: Have a few different local videos in the media list. Tap one to select it. All local media items are selected. edit: local images are also affected
Manager.title: Media: Tapping to select local media selects them all.

Manager.description: I changed the post format of a published post from "Standard" to "Status" and re-published it, but the next time I edited the post I noticed the format was still "Standard." Reproduced this several times, both with a published post and a draft post.
Manager.title: Can't change post format

Manager.description: Go to airplane mode. Go to the media screen and tap the refresh button. Nothing happens. Expected a prompt about no connectivity, similar to the one on the post list. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Media: Tapping refresh with no internet connection does nothing.
Category button doesn't align with "View Map" button when geo-location enabled

Manager.description: Edge case. Be in airplane mode and have multiple blogs in the app. Tap to change blogs to a blog you have not previously synced. Immediately you see the no connectivity prompt when the post list tried to refresh. (Maybe it would be better to fail silently in this case.) Dismiss the prompt and notice that the post list is completely empty, but the detail still shows the detail of the selected post of the previous blog. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Post list: List can be empty after changing blogs with no internet connection.

Manager.description: Maybe not a bug per se, but... Be in airplane mode and visit the themes tab. You'll see a toast informing you that the app "Failed to fetch themes". Seems like we should use dialogs or toasts consistently across the app.
Manager.title: Themes: Inconsistent no connectivity message.

Manager.description: Go to settings while logged out. Tap to sign in to a .com account. Tap the home button with the login dialog visible. Launch the app again. The pin code screen appears but the login dialog is overlapping it. Fun fact: I can still authenticate with the pin lock visible :)
Manager.title: Pin Lock: Login dialog can overlap Pin Code screen.

Manager.description: Edge case. To reproduce. Go to the media list and notice the item in the detail screen. Go to the web admin and edit the caption and description of the media item that was in the detail. Go back to the app and refresh the media list. The detail did not update with the changes. Tap the selected item in the list. Now its updated.
Manager.title: Media: Refreshing media list does not update detail caption/description

Manager.description: Go to the media list. Tap the add button and capture a photo. Once its uploaded, sign into the webadmin and confirm the image exists. In the detail screen, edit the caption and description. Click save, then refresh. The item you just captured vanishes from the list. Refresh the web admin and its gone from there as well. Seeing this on a blog hosted on appfog running 3.4.2, but can not reproduce on 3.6. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Media: Editing media in the app deletes it from the server on WP 3.4.2

Manager.description: Go to add a self hosted blog. Add a blog that is hosted on .com (because you can totally do that) You are not logged into .com if you check Settings. Probably we should check the blog options to see if its a .com blog and register those credentials as such.
Manager.title: Add Blog: Adding a .com blog via self-hosted pathway does not log you into .com

Manager.description: To reproduce: Be on the notifications screen and tap the back button to dismiss the app.(Doing this with the home button doesn't work) Tap to launch the app again. The notifications list has duplicated its items. You may need to scroll down to see the dups. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Notifications: Duplicate notifications when resuming.

Manager.description: The status notification that a post is being uploaded should have a progress bar, at least when uploading an image or (especially) a video.
Manager.title: Post upload needs a progress bar

Manager.description: When I hit the trash icon on a post that's a local draft, after confirming that I want to delete the draft I should be returned to the post list since the draft no longer exists. Instead, I'm left looking at the draft I just deleted, and I can even hit the trash icon to delete it again.
Manager.title: After deleting a local draft, you should be returned to the post list

Manager.description: To reproduce: Be logged into .com and have a .com blog in the app. Add a new blog to the app. Use the self hosted path way and add a .com blog. View stats on the first .com blog added the normal way. Switch to the .com blog you added via the self-hosted path. Stats still show the first .com blog's stats even after refreshing.
Manager.title: Stats: Wrong stats shown for .com blog added via self-hosted pathway.

Manager.description: To reproduce. On a self hosted blog, add some media attachments to your blog. Login to the server and manually move / delete the image files. Go to the app and view the media feature. The media items with the missing images will show a placeholder in the list but if you tap the list it will disappear. The detail always shows empty space where the image should be. A 404 image might be nice. Maybe a bit of an edgecase but I'm thinking of blogs with missing media due to bad migrations or broken gallery plugins. 2.5 beta 4(?) / Nexus 7
Manager.title: Media: 404 images show as empty space in the list and detail.

Manager.description: Go to the Media screen and capture a new photo. While the photo is uploading, tap it to view the detail. The title is blank. 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3
Manager.title: Media: Uploading media has not title on the detail screen

Manager.description: Fringe case probably. Go to the themes feature. While the list is refreshing, and no themes are currently displayed, background the app. Relaunch the app. You're on an empty themes page. In this case it might be nice to kick off a refresh to save the user a tap.

Manager.description: Go to the themes feature. Tap the refresh button to start refreshing the list. Tap a theme to view its detail while the refresh icon is spinning. On the detail page, notice the spinner is visible and it overlaps the actionbar extras menu. Bonus: Tap back to return to the themes list. Now you have two refresh spinners, overlapping each other, one of which is still rotating. 2.5 beta 4 Nexus 4 / 4.3

Manager.description: Enable the PIN lock feature, and try to use the QuickPicture/QuickVideo feature. When returning from the camera app the PIN Lock is shown on the screen. Even if you set the extended timeout on PIN Lock. This is because multiple activities are launched when the user hits the QuickPicture Item in the sidebar: Sidebar -> EditPostActivity -> Camera Activity. It's not a huge problem since QP is only used by a small % of users.
Manager.title: QuickPost doesnt' like PIN Lock

Manager.description: When you delete a draft that doesn't have a title, you get this dialog:
Manager.title: Ugly dialog text when deleting an untitled draft

Manager.description: While researching #181, I discovered that WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying by 'blogID' which is incorrect, it should be querying by the internal 'id'. If you add two self-hosted blogs with the same 'blogID' (it is usually '1') it will pull in posts for the wrong blog and cause problems very quickly.
Manager.title: WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying the wrong blog ID.

Manager.description: If you open a media item for editing then make any changes, those changes are lost without warning when you hit the back button.
Manager.title: Media edits are lost after hitting back button

Manager.description: Was trying to upload a picture to the blog from the media library. Found out that if you tap on the picture to show the details when it is in "uploading" state, the MediaItemFragment doesn't show a preview of the picture (even if it's a local picture stored on the phone). This is because the ImageView that holds the pictures in MediaItemFragment is populated by an AsyncTask in background (correct, since bitmap decoding could take time), but at the same time another AsyncTask is uploading the picture in MediaUploadService, and there are no available threads to complete the rendering operation. When the uploading is completed the Rendering is finally done, since a thread is now available to run the task. AsyncThreads should be used for short operations only. Don't know if there is a simple way to increase the number of concurrent threads in AsyncTask. Same issue if you tap on another picture while the current picture is in "uploading". The preview of the 2nd picture is not shown on the screen even if it already uploaded on the blog, or available locally on the phone.
Manager.title: Pictures are uploaded in a service that internally uses AsyncTask

Manager.description: PostsListFragment is doing a bunch of things incorrectly (I think it has remained largely unchanged since wpToGo in 2008...) Some ToDos: Remove the separate calls to load the local drafts and uploaded posts. A while back the local drafts were changed to be stored in the same table as uploaded posts, so we only need one query. Use a proper BaseAdapter/CursorAdapter for retrieving and displaying the posts data from the db. Proper m/v/c. Maybe use DateUtils.getRelativeTimeSpanString() for displaying the relative date to now? Add infinite scroll (see Notifications for an implementation of this) Make sure that these changes also fix #181.
Manager.title: Refactor PostsListFragment

Manager.description: Right now findLocalChanges in WordPressDB checks the entire table, but it should just check for the current blog. https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/master/src/org/wordpress/android/WordPressDB.java#L1759
Manager.title: findLocalChanges should be specific to the current blog

Manager.description: Create a new post and include an image from the phone. Publish the post. Notice the toast informing you that the post is being uploaded. On a slow connection, once the toast is gone there is a fair amount of time before the refresh spinner starts animating (because the list is being refreshed maybe?). Probably the spinner should be animating from the start of the file upload.

Manager.description: After adding Danilo's 3.6 self-hosted test site to the app, I waited a few seconds for the app to retrieve that blog's posts but it was taking too long so I switched to one of my blogs from the drawer. The posts from the 3.6 site suddenly appeared - but they were showing under the wrong blog (since I switched blogs). I switched back to the 3.6 site and after waiting a while a dialog appeared stating "Sorry, posts could not be refreshed at this time." I switched back to my blog again, and it was still showing the posts from the 3.6 site. Restarting the app didn't resolve the problem - my blog continued to show the wrong posts until I deleted it from the app. I believe the problem lies in PostListFragment's getRecentPostsTask. It uses WordPress.currentBlog.getId() when saving retrieved posts, but the current blog id may have changed since the task was started so the posts get saved under the wrong blog.
Manager.title: Posts shown for wrong blog

Manager.description: If a post fails to upload, the status notification message changes to let you know of the failure but you only see that once you pull down on the Android status bar. To alert the user to the failure, the status icon should change to the standard Android error icon.

Manager.description: A user reported an issue with logging in to a site (http://www.androidpolice.com). The RSD response returned an HTTPS URL but the site would redirect all HTTPS request to HTTP. This confused the app and returned and ugly XML parser error in the app: This was fixable by instructing the user to enter the full path to xmlrpc.php, but the app can probably be smarter about catching this issue and then trying the URL again without using HTTPS.
Manager.title: Can't connect to site that uses HTTPS redirect

Don't show Java exception in NUX error dialog

Manager.description: In EditPostActivity.java, the "status" field should reflect the data backing what is being displayed in the view but currently there is no code (or resource string such as post_future) to change/link the publishing of a post/page with a future date (publish field) to also update the "status" field to reflect the Post's data value of "future". Proposed is the following: When setting the "publish" date to a future point in time, the mStatusSpinner is also updated Once the local data is saved by the user, update the "status" field/spinner to reflect the backing data of "future" Once the local data is published by the user then update the "status" spinner. I vote for item 1 as it will cover both the a local saved page/post and the publish to remote and in turn update of the local data. Also, this will require a little bit of work as the state (selectable options) will need to change based on the date. It should be easy for the user to change back to publish "immediately" from some future date/time. Please provide input!
Manager.title: Should the "Status" field/spinner be updated to "Future" when changing the "publish" to a future point in time in EditPostActivity.java/View to reflect the Data?
