Manager.description: Tapping on a mention or comment like notification doesn't open any kind of detail view or show any additional context.
Manager.title: Notifications with missing detail views: mentions and comment likes

Manager.description: The comments UI is very old, using checkboxes for multi-select and a ghetto popup view with moderation buttons on it. This should be updated to use the Holo scheme with long-press to enter a bulk selection/moderation mode. This concept was created a while back for inspiration: I would vote to not do the tabs however, just keep them all in one list. A lot of behind the scenes changes could also be done to better the CommentsActivity. Especially getting rid of all of the threading and just use AsyncTasks.
Manager.title: Modernize Comments UI with Conextual ActionBar for moderation and multi-select

Manager.description: The orange rectangle in the screenshot below is the focused button:
Manager.title: "New Articles Available" button in Native Reader must not be focusable when hidden

Manager.description: If you sign out of the app when the Reader is showing then sign back in, the previous reader articles continue to appear. The reader database should be reset when the user signs out, and if the reader is the current activity it should be cleared.
Manager.title: Reader database should be cleared on signout

Manager.description: Comment unification currently relies on the REST API, which will break for non-Jetpack .org users.
Manager.title: Comment unification should use XMLRPC rather than REST

Manager.description: Repro: Load comment pane. Tick check boxes for several comments. Buttons appear below comment list. Buttons have colored text and delete button is a word rather than an icon. Compare to single-comment moderation buttons ingrayscale and with a trashcan icon. Should there be consistency one way or another here?
Manager.title: Batch comment moderation buttons are inconsistent

Manager.description: When adding an image to a post either by capturing from within the WP editor or when browsing from the photo library, you can't crop or change the orientation. A real life scenario: I snapped a couple of photos of things my daughter had hand-written. They're in the photo library now. I upload to a post. Oops, they're sideways. I try to rotate within the WP app with no luck. I go into the photo library and rotate and crop. Now I have a duplicate image. What's worse, if I left the post mid-composition to edit the photos, my changes to the post are lost unless I remembered to save a draft first. Now I reinsert into the post and publish. If there's an API for doing even just basic rotating and cropping from within the app (say from the screen you get when you double-click an image within the editor), it'd make for a much improved workflow and reduce the likelihood of data loss.
Manager.title: Media: Simple image editing would be useful

Manager.description: Currently, wpcom users without blogs are redirected to the "Create a new blog" view and can't just login and "browse" reader.
Manager.title: Let users without blogs to sign in

Manager.description: Must look like this mockup:
Manager.title: Improve UI for Post/Page empty list

Manager.description: When viewing the comment list on a tablet, if you delete the comment currently displayed in the detail view, the detail view doesn't change to reflect the deletion.
Manager.title: Deleting a comment from the comment list doesn't remove it from comment detail on tablets

Manager.description: I clicked a post in the reader and left a comment. About four hours later, I went back to check for more comments and noticed that the timestamp said my comment had been 8 hours ago. The timestamp for the post itself was 5 hours in the past. The first comment had a timestamp 10 hours past. Seems like the comment timestamps may be off. In the screen shot, observe post time at top right and the first comment time near bottom right.
Manager.title: post and comment timestamps in single post reader are wrong

Manager.description: No option to set a post as Sticky via the app.
Manager.title: Add Sticky support for Posts

Manager.description: When you press the refresh button in the reader, it still shows the 'x new articles' button. Maybe it should just load the articles instead of showing the prompt?
Manager.title: Native Reader: Should refresh just load the new articles?

Manager.description: The + button in the action bar wasn't clear to me as far as what it would do when I tapped it. A tag icon might be better?
Manager.title: Native Reader: + button unclear

Manager.description: If you are viewing a topic that is way down the tags list, you will have to scroll back up to get to FP or Blogs I Follow in the drop down list. Maybe those could always be shown, or the dropdown list could always be scrolled to the top when opening?
Manager.title: Native reader: Should tags drop down always be scrolled to the top?

Manager.description: Should look like this WPiOS mockup:
Manager.title: Better UI for Post/Page empty view

Manager.description: Instead of opening Chrome, handle navigation inside the app. WebView should re-use the "wordpress.com" cookie set by the native reader. Or set it, if not available.
Manager.title: Use In-app WebView in Notifications

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Footer text in "Post like" notifications doesn't show the post content/URL of the post, and often contains a sentence a little bit redundant/out of context.

Manager.description: When you tap an item in the reader ListView, it should show a highlight.
Manager.title: Reader ListView touch highlight stopped working

Manager.description: Should match:
Manager.title: Fix up margins/padding in Notifications list

Manager.description: Customers will still want the ability to delete/spam a comment.
Manager.title: Comment unification over-simplfied moderation

Manager.description: Repro: Snap a vertically oriented photo. Write a new post. Insert the photo. Observe that it is oriented horizontally in the editor. Publish. Result: The photo is oriented correctly in spite of the sideways preview. Expected: The preview will display correctly as well. The first time I noticed this, I wasted some time going back in and rotating the image.
Manager.title: Images are rotated in composition window

Manager.description: When viewing things in the reader, I see a plus/minus toggle at top left. I'm not sure what it does. I think it's probably a follow/unfollow button, but I'm not sure. There's no confirmation when I toggle to the minus state (which seems bad for a presumably destructive action), and I'm really not sure it does anything at all.
Manager.title: Reader: What does the plus/minus button do?

Manager.description: Repro: Open reader and tap a post to expand. Tap the down arrow at bottom of screen to advance to next post in stream (this step may be optional). Leave a comment on a subsequent post. Tap the down arrow to advance to the next post. Scroll down and observe that your comment appears in the comment list for the post you've just tapped to. If you tap back up, your comment still appears on the original post too. I gather it posts only to the correct post and that this is merely a rendering bug. The screen shot shows my comment appended to the next post in my list, clearly out of context.
Manager.title: Reader: comment appended to next post in stream

Manager.description: I tried to approve a comment, and it failed. I then had an approve button overlaying the reply view:
Manager.title: 'Approve' view overlaying comment reply view

Manager.description: The app seems to start the uploading, and the notification "Uploading post" does appear in the notifications centers, but the upload never finished with a success. I Getting "Server failed to respond" after 2/3 minutes. Not sure if the problem is on my side, or in the app.
Manager.title: Cannot upload a post with a pictures in it

Manager.description: In the web mobile reader, you can tap on a comment to reply to that comment (so it displays nested in the comments list). Possible in the native reader?
Manager.title: Native reader: Reply to comment

Manager.description: Corresponding iOS task: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#538
Manager.title: Automatically manage a WordPress.com user's blogs

Manager.description: setError on both username and password fields
Manager.title: Use setError instead of modal when user enter wrong credentials in sign in screen

Manager.description: See: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/comment-replies-fail-on-https-sites?replies=5
Manager.title: User can't reply to comment notifications via Jetpack and HTTPS

Manager.description: Hello, I have 2 users, each one with his posts (private posts), when i switch-login from one to the other, I see the posts from the last user. This is solved if I refresh, but where can I set an automatic refresh for the current user at login (both in 'view admin' and 'my posts')? I browsed the issues list, but found nothing of the sort. Many thanks :)
Manager.title: Re login with different user - shows posts from last user

Manager.description: The app starts a network connection as soon as you change a setting in the notifications settings screen, resulting in multiple network connections where the order of execution is not preserved, and could cause wrong settings to be saved on the server. As an example, I was changing 2 settings, but the 2nd network call finished/arrived on the server before the first. The 1st connection overwrote settings just few seconds later.
Manager.title: Try to use one network call only when saving changes in Notifications settings screen

Manager.description: I was reading a post in the detail view, and rotated my device. The scroll position reset to the top and I had to scroll down to find where I left off before rotating.
Manager.title: Native Reader: Rotating loses scroll position

Manager.description: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/WordPressDB.java?source=c#L389
Manager.title: Method checkForExistingBlog always return false when a blogName contains a double quote (")

Manager.description: Lessen padding in menu drawer rows so more fit into the view w/o scrolling. Fix padding in notifications follow/likes views to match up with new indented row divider.
Manager.title: Layout cleanup

Manager.description: I just noticed some differences:
Manager.title: Use the same background color for empty views

Manager.title: 'Next' button on title EditText should go full screen with content

Manager.description: When the reader's loaded with content and I want to scroll, I tend to want to scroll out to the side, where there's some space. It keeps me from inadvertently clicking links and lets me thumb scroll. Having to scroll the content itself is a minor annoyance. Would it be possible to scroll by swiping any part of the content pane?
Manager.title: Reader: Can't scroll outside content area
Either drop mshots featured images in the reader, or crop them better

Manager.description: Repro: View a post like notification. Observe that there are users who've liked your post whom you haven't followed. Click the + sign to follow a blog. Check your next post like notification. Observe that the person whose blog you just followed shows up as unfollowed still. It'd be optimal if the UX updated to reflect the actual updated follow state for given users/blogs.
Manager.title: Notifications: Follows don't update UX

Manager.description: Repro: Load the reader. Toggle to a view or tag you haven't viewed before. While the app fetches posts, you see a "No articles found with this tag" message. Then the articles load. It's a little weird, for a view that you know has content (e.g. "Blogs I Follow") to get a notice that no such content exists. Maybe on the first viewing, the message should be "Fetching content" or something more accurate instead, with the "no articles" message reserved for when there are in fact no articles. It's only a brief flash of an inaccurate message, but it really bugged me. :)
Manager.title: Reader: No articles with this tag yet

Manager.description: As reported here: [redacted]
Manager.title: Reader: tag list in the ActionBar isn't obvious on landscape tablet

Manager.description: Some of the recent post editor changes have made it tough to tap on an image to view its settings. Also, it appears that editing a post, then editing an image's settings will not persist when saving the post again.
Manager.title: Post Editor: Hard to tap on image and image settings don't update when editing a draft

Manager.description: In Notifications, I clicked a comment reply to one of my posts and typed some text, but when I tapped to post, I got a failure. I tried on a different post on a different blog with the same result. Both were private blogs; I have no public blogs to test in my notifications. I'm not sure whether that's a factor or not.

Manager.description: It's a nice effect, but it's weird to have a translucent ActionBar there and nowhere else in the app (esp. since tapping through to the post detail uses yet another ActionBar effect).
Manager.title: Drop the translucent ActionBar in the reader's post list

Manager.description: During development for Issue #333 I had to contend with the following: (Note: I removed the crashes when working on #333 but the behaviors are still broken) The mechanism for displaying / switching / invoking the switcher/button to load more than the max amount of comments and then display that work is being done (switches to a view w/ text + animated icon.) For the following reasons: It is long clickable and will crash the application in some cases It never stops animating after clicking the switcher.button, letting the switcher animate until the new comments are refreshed, the view removed, reloaded and then pressing the "refreshMenuItem". This will result in many crashes based on changing views / action modes etc. It uses a class wide variable which is shadowed by local variables in many places making it difficult to debug. It would be quicker to re-architect.
Manager.title: CommentListFragment's ViewSwitcher should be revisited

Manager.description: Doesn't happen every time. Race condition maybe? From a fresh install, sign in with a WP.com account with multiple blogs. Go to Settings Tap Show / Hide blogs Hide the first blog (which was my default blog) Refresh. Tap back. Notice that the blog you just hid is not in the list. Tap back to dismiss settings. Notice a different blog is now showing its post list. Confirm in the side bar that the blog is not visible. Go back to settings. The blog you removed is back in the list. Tap show / hide blogs. The previously removed blog is checked. Nexus 4. KitKat.
Manager.title: Hidden blog sometimes becomes visible again.

Manager.description: Related to #472 probably. From a fresh install, sign in with a WP.com account with multiple blogs. Go to Settings Tap Show / Hide blogs Hide the first blog (which was my default blog) Refresh. Tap back. Notice that the blog you just hid is not in the list. Tap back to dismiss Settings. A different blog is showing in the post list. View settings again. Dismiss settings. The content of the blog you dismissed is visible in the post list for a split second. Nexus 4 / KitKat
Manager.title: Hidden blog flashes its content when returning from Settings.

Manager.description: Comment reply about a reblog shows some CDATA from the XML. Maybe specific to reblogs?
Manager.title: Notifications: Comment reply notification shows CDATA from XML

Manager.description: I replied to a comment notification. When the reply was sent, I tapped back to the notifications list. I saw my comment reply as the first item in the list. I tapped the refresh button. When the list refreshed, my reply was gone. Maybe since this was me replying it shouldn't have been there at all? Nexus 4 / KitKat
Manager.title: Notifications: Reply to comment shows up in Notifications list, disappears when refreshing list.

Manager.description: I tapped on a notification comment in the list. I had previously moderated this comment and trashed it. On the detail page I tapped approve. When I tapped back to the notifications list the comment notification was still prefaced with the [Trash] badge.
Manager.title: Notifications: Moderated comments do not refresh 'badge' in list.

Manager.description: On the notification detail screen, if I'm viewing a comment notification a long press does not invoke text selection mode. However, if I'm viewing an achievement notification, it does. Seems like we should be consistent.
Manager.title: Notifications: Text selection disabled for comment notifications, enabled for others.

Manager.description: The left side of the like icons and the avatars on the comments list are off by a pixel or two. It would look a little cleaner to have them aligned.
Manager.title: Reader: Comments / Likes avatars should left align

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Reader Detail: Rotating orientation scrolls detail to the top

Manager.description: This is a little tricky to reproduce but I got the knack of it after a little practice. Go to the reader detail. Scroll down a bit. Notice the toolbars vanish as expected while scrolling down. Now swipe down to scroll back toward the top, but as you swipe down, make sure you swipe across the bottom toolbar as well. If you get the timing right, the toolbars disappear.
Manager.title: Reader Detail: Toolbars can vanish when scrolled to top.

Manager.description: Scroll down the Reader list a bit. Take note of the visible story, then rotate the device to change orientation. The app tries to set the scroll offset so the user is looking at the same story, but the animation is distracting. Maybe make it instantaneous instead?
Manager.title: Reader List: Content scrolls jumps after changing orientation.

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Switch to a topic. I choose "Coffee" Tap to edit topics. Switch from followed tags to popular tags Add "humor" Switch back to followed tags. Remove humor. Remove another topic (not the one you're viewing. I chose Movies) Add the topic back. Dismiss the topics form. Notice that the list refreshes. You see new stories for the topic (movies in my case) but the title will be the topic you were previously viewing. All steps might not be necessary to reproduce.
Manager.title: Reader: Wrong topic title shown after editing topics

Manager.description: Find an article that is too brief to scroll. Swipe up / down on the story. Notice the toolbars still show and hide but since we're not scrolling I'd expect them to stick around. nexus 4 / kitkat
Manager.title: Reader Detail: Swiping on non-scrolling story still dismisses toolbars.

Manager.description: Find a story with video content. From the detail screen, tap on the video. Tap the video to start playing. Tap the back key to return the reader detail screen. You can still hear the video playing and there's no apparent way to stop it.
Manager.title: Reader: Video plays after dismissing video.

Manager.description: I started off in a reader detail. Tap the share icon and choose a destination app. I choose Simplenote. A link is shared to the target application. You see the application appear. Tap the home button. Tap the WordPress app icon to return to the app. The UI of the app you shared to appears. You can tap the back button instead of the home button to return to the WordPress app's UI but we shouldn't expect this flow from everyone. Nexus 4 / KitKat
Manager.title: Sharing: Confusion returning to the app after sharing.

Manager.description: Tap on an item in the post list. The item gets a grey overlay or sorts to indicate its being touched. Notice the reblog and like icons remain blue but the comment icon is orange.
Manager.title: Reader: Post list comment icon changes color when user presses on a list item

Manager.description: Find a post that has a lot of likes. I chose one with 70+. View the detail and tap on the likes to view the list. Scroll the list. Notice its not a very smooth scrolling experience.
Manager.title: Reader: Like list stutters when scrolling.

Manager.description: On a reader detail, tap to view the list of likes. Scroll down the list, then change orientation. You're back at the top of the list.
Manager.title: Reader: Like list looses place when rotating.

Manager.description: Start with one blog in the app. I was logged in with a wp.com account with four blogs, three of which were hidden. Go to settings. Tap to create a new wp.com blog. You're returned to the settings screen when you're done and you see the newly added blog in the list. Dismiss the settings screen. Check the sidebar. Notice the blog picker is absent and you can't switch to your newly added blog. Nexus 4 / KitKat
Manager.title: Sidebar doesn't show newly added .com blog as an option.

Manager.description: Go to the reader and set the topic to Posts I Like. Unlike a post. Refresh the list. The post is still there in its unliked state.
Manager.title: Reader: Posts I Like shows unliked posts.

Manager.description: In the editor tap to edit the content. Somewhere in the middle of the content, tap one of the formatting options. I chose bold. Notice the opening bold tag is set, and the bold option is highlighted. Move the cursor to a point in the text prior to the opening bold tag. Tap the bold format option again to set the closing tag. We could argue that this is on the user, but if the cursor is moved prior to the start of the format tag it might make sense to reset the button's state.
Manager.title: Editor: End tag can be set before starting tag.

Manager.description: I have a vague memory of this issue being opened before but I couldn't find the ticket after a quick search. In the editor, tap the link option on the format bar. In the link dialog, tap the next button on the keyboard. The cursor should move to the next text field but it remains in the first text field. Rotate the app to landscape orientation. The dialog shows a full screen text field with a next button added to the UI. Tap this button. Nothing happens. Nexus 4 / KitKat.
Manager.title: Editor: Link dialog "Next" button on keyboard or form doesn't do anything.

Manager.description: Edit a post. Make sure it has enough content to scroll. Insert the cursor near the top of the screen. Tap the photo option on the format bar to insert an image at the cursor position. I chose to insert an image from the gallery. Pick an image to return to the editor. Notice that the textfield has scrolled to the bottom of the screen, but the image has been inserted in the correct location. We want to avoid scrolling away from where the image was inserted.
Manager.title: Editor: Editor scrolls to bottom after inserting media

Manager.description: In the post list, long press on a draft post. In the intents dialog, you'll see options for sharing and commenting. These seem out of place. If you choose sharing, you'll be met with a connection error. If you choose comment, you'll be able to leave a comment on the draft. How weird is that?
Manager.title: Posts: Long press on draft includes comment and share options.

Manager.description: From the post list, create a new post. Go into options and change the status to draft. Return to the editor, add a title and some text and save. Tap on the newly created draft in the post list and edit it. Position the cursor and try to add an image from a gallery. You'll see the image added in the editor. Tap save. Tap to view the draft post. The image is not there, neither is there any HTML for it. Try again, but this time take a photo instead of choosing an image from your gallery. After taking the photo you're returned to the editor. Notice that everything above the photo thumbnail is missing. Tap save. Tap to view the draft. None of the changes you observed are there.
Manager.title: Editor: Unable to add imags to an edited post.

Manager.description: Start in landscape orientation. From a post detail, tap the comment icon to view the Write Comment dialog. Rotate to portrait orientation. Rotate back to landscape. The form is replaced by a full screen text field. Nexus 4 / KitKat

Manager.description: From the post list, tap to view a post detail. Tap to edit the post. Notice the cursor is in the title field. Tap the preview icon to view a quick preview of the post. Manager.title: Media: Sharing a video to a WP.com post doesn't use VideoPress shortcode

Manager.description: I think some poor naming has caused some problems in the app. In the Blog model we have getId() and getBlogId(). The 'id' is the local id of the blog, corresponds to the unique key in the local SQLite blog table. The 'blogId' is the remote blog ID, which is typically just '1' for WordPress.org blogs, and on Multi-site and WordPress.com it is a unique integer that identifies the individual blog across the site instance. The problem I'm seeing is that we are often using getBlogId() as the key for other objects, such as in Media. If a user has multiple self-hosted blogs with a blogId of '1' then they are going to see media items for both blogs when they visit media. I think we need to rename these to be clearer, and do an audit of the app and fix instances where we should use the id instead of the blogId.
Manager.title: Incorrect Usages of blog.getId() and blog.getBlogId()?

Manager.description: This is sporadic, but sometimes the current user's avatar doesn't appear in the likes beneath a post, and shows as an empty row in the liking users screen. This only started happening recently, and UserPrefs.getCurrentUserId returns 0 when this occurs.
Manager.title: Reader: current user missing from likes

Manager.description: util/AppLog.java is a replacement for Android's Log which enables viewing and sharing the log from within the app (useful for support and debugging). First extend the log to accept an identifier that tells which part of the app each log entry came from (Reader, posting, API, etc.), then start replacing calls to Log.x with AppLog.x application-wide.
Manager.title: Replace Log.x with AppLog.x application-wide

Manager.description: In some cases, the default drawable (R.drawable.reader_photo_default) shown by WPNetworkImageView while the featured image is downloaded doesn't resize to fit the imageView. Instead, it shows as a small grey box in the top left corner.
Manager.title: Reader: default drawable that appears while featured image is downloaded doesn't resize

Manager.description: In some cases, the default drawable (R.drawable.reader_photo_default) shown by WPNetworkImageView while the featured image is downloaded doesn't resize to fit the imageView. Instead, it shows as a small grey box in the top left corner. Fading in avatars is unnecessary since they're usually so small that the animation isn't noticeable. Images should only fade in when not cached (isImmediate=false), but when isInLayoutPass=true and isImmediate=true, the image is always faded in.
Manager.title: Reader: WPNetworkImageView issues

Manager.description: If you open a post from the reader post list and that post is updated by the detail view (due to changes in likes/comments), the featured image may disappear when you return to the post list.
Manager.title: Reader: featured image disappears after returning from detail view

Manager.description: Selecting a picture from the MediaLibrary and tapping the new post icon will result in a super small picture in post editor for private and !Jetpack blogs. It is barely tappable.
Manager.title: Media: sharing a picture from MediaLibrary results in a super small picture in post editor

Manager.description: The liking users screen is supposed to slide up from the bottom when it opens then slide back out when it closes, but on KitKat it also fades out when it closes. https://cloudup.com/cTQvStjgBcK
Manager.title: Reader: remove fade out when liking users closes

Manager.description: The animated message that appears when you remove a tag goes to the top of the activity when you remove the last tag. It should instead stop above the "Enter a tag" field. https://cloudup.com/cy5fhiOJldl
Manager.title: Reader: message animation bug when removing the last tag

Manager.description: The post in this screenshot doesn't allow comments, yet the post list still shows a comment icon for it.
Manager.title: Reader: comment icon appears in post list even when post doesn't allow comments

Manager.title: Reader: empty space when blog name is unknown

Manager.description: Title has it. See the picture for details: https://cloudup.com/cMAKzSxJGGO
Manager.title: Reader: In comments with emoticons, URLs are not clickable

Manager.description: Common: Replace #2c9eca by #2ea2cc for the background. Primary active button color: #1e8cbe - inactive: #0074a2 Use our custom icons and tint them #999999 Change text fields font to Open Sans (password hint too) Remove inset shadows from buttons and links Login screen: Replace W logo with new logo, no shadows. Add a show/hide password in the password field (hidden by default) Nudge the bottom two links up a bit (10dp) Nudge the sign in button down Add an info button (see iOS app) moved to #669 (waiting for a responsive help/faq page) Create Account screen: Move title up Title: increase line-height a bit Add a non-breaking space between "on" and "wordpress.com" in the title Change “.wordpress.com” color to #999 and size to match hint size Add a show/hide password in the password field (hidden by default) Nudge the create account button down Change android:windowSoftInputMode to pan Modify the string "By creating an account you agree to the Terms of Service." Create Blog screen: Move title up (match previous screen) Title: increase line-height a bit Change “.wordpress.com” color to #999 and size to match hint size Nudge the create blog button down
Manager.title: NUX design tweaks

Manager.description: When someone try to compile the project with android support v19 installed, he gets: A problem occurred configuring root project 'WordPress-Android'. > Could not resolve all dependencies for configuration ':_debugCompile'. > Could not find any version that matches com.android.support:support-v4:18.0.+. Required by: :WordPress-Android:unspecified :WordPress-Android:unspecified > org.wordpress:actionbarsherlock:4.4.0 :WordPress-Android:unspecified > org.wordpress:drag-sort-listview:0.6.1 :WordPress-Android:unspecified > org.wordpress:slidinguppanel:1.0.0 Note: it seems impossible to install android-support-library 18.0.+ with the current android sdk if you haven't installed it earlier. cc @astralbodies
Manager.title: Can't resolve com.android.support:support-v4:18.0.+ dependency with newly installed android sdk

Manager.description: In the Android app, the "auto-hide" bottom toolbar in reader detail can appear if the user scrolls while commenting. It should instead remain in the same state it was when the user started their comment.
Manager.title: Reader: auto-hide toolbar shouldn't appear when commenting

Manager.description: Creating a draft on Android has a different behavior than on the Web interface. When creating a draft, you leave the Publish: at Immediately and change the status to draft it will save the publish date (as current date/time) when you access the post in the web interface, the publish time will be the time the draft was created. Therefore when you press publish it gets published back in time. This is a different behavior than the web interface where when saving a draft the Publish date stays to "Immediately" and then later on when you hit publish it sets to the current publish date and not the previous draft date.
Manager.title: Creating Draft on Android App sets publish time to current time

Manager.description: ex: "Attempting to refresh categories" -> "Refreshing categories"
Manager.title: Change strings starting with "attempting to..." to something more optimistic

Manager.title: Categories: Remove wait dialogs

Manager.description: On the account creation fragment, you can still edit the TextViews after you tap "Create Account." Same problem when signing into an existing account.
Manager.title: TextViews still editable during account creation

Manager.description: There's a noticeable delay when you sign out of the app, most likely due to resetting/clearing the databases. Possible culprits include WordPressDB.deactivateAccounts() and ReaderDatabase.reset(), both of which should use a transaction.
Manager.title: Possible ANR on sign out

Manager.description: Right now reader post detail is an activity, but it should be available as a fragment so it can be used by the notification list when in dual-pane mode (so tapping a notification related to a post shows it in the reader post detail on the right).
Manager.title: Reader post detail needs to be a fragment

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Logout Login with a wpcom user on a slow connection Click Reader in the menu drawer Following screen appears (note the refresh button doesn't spin): We should show the user something is loading. Bonus: a special empty view if the the request timeout or user's disconnected (this empty view could be reused in other places).
Manager.title: After first login with a super slow connection, the reader stays in an empty state for a while

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Logout Login Close the drawer Scroll down and Click "Load More Posts" Note: "Load More Posts" string capitalization is wrong ("Load more posts" is correct).
Manager.title: "You've made changes to..." always pop up after clicking "Load More Posts"

Manager.description: Steps to repro: Start a new post Take a new picture and add it to the post (or select it from device library) Tap to edit picture settings Change the size of the picture to 300px (any value is OK here) and tap OK. Tap again to edit picture settings, and you will see the resize slider set to 2000px (the default value). Previous settings were lost. If you try to upload the post on the blog, the picture is uploaded by using the original size, and can result in something like the folowwing if the picture is really big: PHP Fatal error: Allowed memory size of 67108864 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 10373353 bytes) in /home/mhd-01/www.eritreo.it/htdocs/wp-trunk/wp-includes/class-IXR.php on line 199
Manager.title: Pictures are not resized according to settings

Manager.description: There is not a way to edit a comment in 2.6.
Manager.title: Brick back the ability to edit a comment in comment details screen.

Manager.description: If a post with likes is displayed in reader post detail and the author later disables likes, or likes are later removed, the post will show a like count without any liking avatars. Example:
Manager.title: Reader: post detail like count not updated after likes disabled

Manager.description: Right now updating the likes for a post in reader detail is done in a separate call after updating the post itself, but appending ?meta=likes to the post request will return the likes along with the post, avoiding the need for a separate request.
Manager.title: Reader: Updating likes shouldn't require a separate network request

Manager.description: When the reader is first displayed, it makes these network requests: Update current user Update cookies Update followed blogs Update tags Updating tags should be prioritized over the other requests since the reader can't show anything until tags exist. Correcting this should help with #697
Manager.title: Reader: retrieve tags before other requests

Manager.description: Hello, in an earlier Version of Wordpress for Android i can set the default image Size for the Pic Upload. In the latest new Versions i must do these Settings for every Post and Picture.
Manager.title: Auto Resize Picture

Manager.description: We should follow this punctuation recommendation from Android Writing Style: Don't use a period after a single sentence or phrase used in isolation, such as in a toast, label, or notification. Wherever two or more sentences run together, use a period for each sentence. Note that this will require checking the context for each string ending in a period, to be sure it's not concatenated with another string for display.
Manager.title: Remove periods from short strings
Sign in button text is cut off at the bottom when virtual keyboard is visible
NPE on resume in StatsActivity

Manager.description: In CommentListFragment, moderateComments() and deleteComments() rely on the variable checkedCommentTotal to determine which moderation toast message to display (the singular R.string.comment_moderated or the plural R.string.comments_moderated). However, checkedCommentTotal is always zero so the singular version of the toast message is always displayed.
Manager.title: CommentListFragment moderation messages are always singular

Manager.title: CommentListFragment: add infinite scroll

Manager.description: Since the switch to gradle we haven't been running proguard on the release builds. I tried to enable it but ran into some issues with loading local images into a web view, like in the reader detail view where it loads the video play button overlay. We will need to make sure all the stuff we want to load from the file system is in the 'assets' folder, or if we want to use images with different densities, exclude the R class from proguard.
Manager.title: Run proguard for release builds

Manager.description: I noticed we need to add the 'Up' button to the action bar in a few places: Manage notifications screen WebViewActivity
Manager.title: Missing 'Up' button in a few activities

Manager.description: This started out as #757 (add infinite scroll to comments), but the more I dug in the more I realized I was building on a very shaky foundation. It makes more sense to take the time to redo comments, specifically: New schema for the comment table to includes a primary key Do away with passing around Maps of comments that include hard-coded column names Store unformatted comment dates Stop deleting existing comments whenever we retrieve new ones Unbind the CommentAdapter from the CommentListFragment so it can be re-used Simplify the comment moderation/deletion code Merge with #333 to add contextual ActionBar Last but not least, add inifinite scroll to the comment list
Manager.title: Rewrite comments

Manager.description: Create a new post Insert an emoji character in the post content. Upload the post You'll get an 'Illegal character' error message.
Manager.title: Can't upload post with emoji: "Illegal Character"

Manager.description: WordPress.getCurrentBlog() tries to recover a blog object if there wasn't one previously set, so it's safer to use than WordPress.currentBlog throughout the app.
Manager.title: Make WordPress.currentBlog private and use WordPress.getCurrentBlog() instead

Manager.description: I have four notifications that are being marked as unread every time I open the app. I checked the API for the unread state -- all were marked as 0. With some more testing I noticed that these notifications are marked as read when the app is opened via the app icon but unread when opened via a push notification.
Manager.title: notifications not marked as read in app

Manager.description: See wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#625
Manager.title: Add "Forgot Password?" button on sign NUX in form

Manager.description: When replying to a comment notification, the user can see less than three lines of the comment being replied to. A comment itself gives you less than two lines. An idea would be to hide the moderation buttons and/or hide the notification action. Some screenshots to illustrate the issue (the red lines indicate what scrolls):
Manager.title: not enough room to review text when replying to a notification or comment

Manager.description: If the date is in the previous year but within the past 11 months, don't show the year.
Manager.title: Remove unnecessary year from timespan

Manager.title: Comments: add labels to moderation buttons

Manager.description: Hello I have a self hosted WordPress blog. I have been using the Android app to post content for years. Since the last update, or so it would seem, I have been experiencing a consistent and annoying bug. If I select an image and try and share it to WordPress via the app, the post always fails with the message sorry an error occurred while accessing this blog. Also, no local draft version of the post is kept, which means that I have to start all over again. If I open the WordPress app directly, and select the image from within the app, it will then always post without issue. This behaviour has been repeated on a Samsung galaxy note 10.1 running Android 4.1.1 and a Samsung galaxy S4 running Android 4.3. Both are running WordPress for Android 2.6. Thank you, Richard
Manager.title: Consistent error while posting through sharing
Gravatar difference in detail view, comment vs. notification screens

Manager.description: I've had support threads with two users so far that can't upload posts in 2.6. They can uninstall the app and it will work for a while, but then posts won't upload and error with the blog_not_found error, which I believe happens here: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/util/PostUploadService.java#L207 One user gave me an author account on the site and I can't reproduce so far. Both users are attempting to upload images, so I'm wondering if #730 might have helped with this. I'm going to send the 2.6.1 beta to them to see if it fixes the issue.
Manager.title: Some users are losing posts when attempting upload

Manager.description: I'm able to duplicate the "cannot serialize null" error several testers have reported. The exception occurs in XMLRPCClient.java when the passed "params" are serialized. As the screenshot below illustrates, the "params" object starts at index 1 which causes a null exception when params[0] is serialized. (Repro'd on Genymotion S2 emulator, Android v2.3.7) If I close the app after the exception occurs then return to the post list, the post is gone.
Manager.title: "Cannot serialize null" uploading modified post

Manager.description: Add the wpcom Authorization Header to XML-RPC requests (when needed), and get rid of password. I had already implemented this here bdb50be but it did not make the cut for 2.6.1 (We can reuse that code though). Keep the following things in consideration: username/password are still used in a lot of place. Ex: AuthenticatedWebViewActivity, ReaderAuthActions (search for WordPress.WPCOM_PASSWORD_PREFERENCE). We should switch those calls to the OAuth Header. The backend first check the Authentication Header, if available it will use it for authentication purpose, completely ignoring the username/password available within the XML-RPC request document. ^ I think we can even skip the storage of password in the app when the bullets above are completed. Related: #851
Manager.title: Add wpcom Authorization Header to XML-RPC requests

Manager.description: The "Need help?" link available in WPComLoginActivity directs to http://android.wordpress.org/faq/ which isn't mobile-friendly, and doesn't address login problems. We should have a separate page for that link which specifically tackles login issues.
Manager.title: "Need help?" link needs a new page on android.wordpress.org

Manager.description: The sign-in process when authentication fails (see #902) needs some tweaks: The "connection error" dialog is unfriendly For .org blogs, the connection error says "Load settings now" which is an odd way to ask the user to change their login The title of the "WordPress.com login" dialog is hard-coded "Need help?" should use the same color as other hyperlinks in the app The sign-in dialog looks out of place with the rest of the app (should use the dialog or popup theme instead of having its own background and button style) The password field should ideally have the same show/hide feature that the initial account login has WPComLoginActivity should be moved out of the stats package so it's clear it can be used elsewhere
Manager.title: Cosmetic issues with sign-in

Manager.description: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/ui/notifications/NotificationUtils.java#L176 The only parameter needed for setting notification settings is "settings". Manager.title: Remove extraneous Notification Settings REST parameters

Manager.description: PostUploadService resizes images by first loading them into memory, which is inefficient and possibly error-prone on "lesser" devices. This needs to be rewritten.
Manager.title: Rewrite image resizing in PostUploadService

Manager.description: From a play store comment: "The app has become unusable for me as an HTTP Basic registration is no longer possible new, it is only from the previous version to update itself."
Manager.title: Can't login on a self hosted with http auth

Manager.description: WPImageSpan resizes images by loading them into memory, which is inefficient and possibly error-prone on "lesser" devices. This needs to be rewritten.
Manager.title: Rewrite image resizing in WPImageSpan

Manager.description: I think one of the causes for #862 was that we are passing a localTableBlogId to the Posts model to load an existing post. There was no currentBlog, so the blogId was set to -1 and 'lost' in the database. We should simply pass a local post id to a method in wpDB that will retrieve the post. No need for the 'blogId' or 'isPage' parameters either. We could then remove the constructor in Posts.java that did database work.
Manager.title: Load posts from wpDB method, clean up Post model

Manager.description: We should alert users when they log on self hosted instances with self signed SSL certificate
Manager.title: Better handling of self signed SSL certificate for self hosted instances

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: New script to automatically run some checks before a release is published on a store

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Skip focus on ".wordpress.com" textview in the create account screen

Manager.description: Even on my Nexus 5 stats seems quite slow. Looking around the stats package, I see a lot of places where work is done on the UI thread, unnecessary reloading/redrawing is done, and optimizations like the view holder pattern aren't being used.
Manager.title: Optimize stats

Manager.description: Same issue on page list - https://cloudup.com/cV0NmEH3h6z
Manager.title: Post List, "Load more posts" should be hidden when there is no more post to fetch

Manager.description: Steps: Sign in with a self-hosted JP connected site and don't enter your wpcom credentials Visit stats with a JetPack enabled self hosted site The credential pop over should appear Hit the back button You should see this toast:
Manager.title: Stats, unfriendly toast error when dismissing the JetPack login popover

Manager.description: Hide all blogs within the app, open the reader and go to the details screen. Tap reblog and you will see the blogs dropdown item empty.
Manager.title: Reader: Empty reblog dropdown if you hide all blogs

Manager.description: User reported this: In blog settings, change resize setting to 500px. Create a new post. Add a picture from the media library (make sure it is larger than 500px). Publish the post. Observe that the image is set to whatever size it was uploaded at, and not resized to 500px.
Manager.title: Adding pic from media library doesn't honor resize settings

Manager.description: Steps to repro: Revoke the Oauth token, and simulate an error when the app calls get/token
Manager.title: Capture OAuth authentication failure edge cases

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Make sFactory members private and prevent call to the setter in non test mode

Manager.description: It happens all the time with these 2 notifs https://cloudup.com/cA6sx0cB8CF - they probably have the same timestamp, I guess the list is resorted at some point with a different comparison method (or first come from a db query and sorted after).
Manager.title: Notification list sorting by date sometimes swap 2 notes

Manager.description: Right now the AppLog is only visible to beta testers, but it would be helpful if we enabled it for all users. Before doing this, first do a thorough check to make sure nothing private is exposed in the log.
Manager.title: Expose AppLog to all users

Manager.description: From the Comments list, tap a comment. Add a reply to the comment. Navigate back to the list, and you won't see your comment reply there until you refresh.
Manager.title: Comment reply doesn't show in list after adding reply from comment detail.

Manager.description: If you are on the 'highlights' tab in the Photos app, there is a share button where you can share all of the pictures you captured in a day. The WordPress app doesn't show as a share target.
Manager.title: Can't share highlights group from Photos app

Manager.description: We should probably avoid asking the user to trust the certificate if the connection is with wpcom. Wrong certificate, MITM.
Manager.title: Make sure SetupBlogTask do not ask for 'trust SSL' on wpcom

Manager.description: Skip hiding the ActionBar if we're near the bottom of the page, otherwise it quickly hides and then re-appears while scrolling near the bottom. https://cloudup.com/ccKeeSGCG3w Reported in review of PR #966
Manager.title: Reader detail: smarter hiding of ActionBar

Manager.description: I was trying to add a self-hosted test blog that replied to getUsersBlogs with a malformed document and got a "There is no network available" error message :(
Manager.title: Make sure to show the correct error message on login failure

Manager.description: Right now it's possible to reblog a post in the same blog it was created in. Not sure if it's possible (depends on whether we have the relevant IDs), but try to prevent or at least warn about this. Reported in review of PR #966
Manager.title: Reader: prevent reblogging on source blog

Manager.description: Comments are loaded 20 at a time. When you scroll to the end of them, the next 20 are loaded. But since comments are cached, there's a chance you could miss some due to the gap between new comments are those cached. Ex: if you previously loaded 20 comments then use the app again after 40 more comments were posted, you'd get the most recent 20 of those comments but 20 of them would never show up.
Manager.title: Comment paging needs to handle the gap between new and cached

Manager.description: No description provided.

WordPress-Android/src/org/xmlrpc/android/XMLRPCClient.java Lines 484 to 488 in f4a937c } catch (Exception e) { // wrap any other Exception(s) around XMLRPCException deleteTempFile(method, tempFile); throw new XMLRPCException(e); } ref #999
Manager.title: XMLRPCClient, don't encapsulate all caught exceptions in a new XMLRPCException

Manager.description: If the refresh icon is animating when the detail is shown, it may overlap the share icon. Need to stop animating the icon when the detail appears. https://cloudup.com/cqSZsH9xMYh
Manager.title: Reader: refresh icon overlaps share icon

Manager.description: Right now each activity that can show an animated refresh icon is required to locate the refresh menu item in onCreateOptionsMenu() and pass it to startAnimatingRefreshButton() / stopAnimatingRefreshButton(). This should be rewritten so only the WPActionBarActivity needs to locate the icon, and descendants can call startAnimatingRefreshButton/stopAnimatingRefreshButton without passing the menu item. Or even better, replace it with pull-to-refresh.
Manager.title: Smarter refresh icon

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Use Photon in Media Item details screen when applicable

Manager.description: We should use WPTextView in the nav drawer, so we get the Open Sans font in there.
Manager.title: Use WPTextView in the nav drawer

Manager.description: Install the app fresh. Load notifications, make sure your account has more than 40 notifications. Scroll to the bottom, and observe that no more notifications are loaded.
Manager.title: Verify Infinite Scroll is Working Properly in Notifications

Manager.description: The media section of the app doesn't show pictures if the blog is HTTP password protected. Also, isPhotonCapable should reply false for HTTP password protected blog, since Photon cannot be used to retrieve images for those blogs.
Manager.title: Make sure images are shown in Media section for HTTP protected blogs

Manager.description: Create a new post. Don't add any content or make any other changes. Tap the publish button. The app uploads the blank post, but then the upload fails with a notification that a title, content, or excerpt was missing. We should just check for the required content before uploading.
Manager.title: Don't publish blank posts.

Manager.description: Right now we're using Constants.USER_AGENT as the user agent for various areas in the app. This should be changed to include the app version, OS version and device name.
Manager.title: User agent should be more descriptive

Reader detail: line spacing too small for heading tags

Manager.description: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/xmlrpc/android/ApiHelper.java#L855 When private static String getResponse(final String url, boolean trustAllSslCertificates, int maxRedirection) is called with trustAllSslCertificates = true, makes Volley and other libs based on HttpsURLConnection trust all ssl certificates. This change is applied to all request already in the Volley queue, and new direct HTTP requests made outside volley. A potentially MITM attack could happen on a site that was not marked as "trusted domain". We should probably use a dedicated HTTP stack, as we did in Media section of the app.
Manager.title: trustAllSslCertificates could open security issues

I don't get the slider option (it used to be there) Granted, I can get the slider option on the individual pictures in the post, but picking the right pixel width for each photo is annoying. Putting the slider element in the default width selector would be much appreciated.

Manager.description: If a post doesn't have a featured image, the app first checks for a "featured_media" object, and if that doesn't exist it then searches the content looking for a suitably large image. There are a few bugs with this right now, though: If "featured_media" exists but is empty, the app skips searching for a large image If app only searches WP posts for large images (so RSS posts coming from a WP blog are skipped) When post detail shows the featured image above the post, it crops it unnecessarily Featured image is sometimes incorrectly changed when post is updated by detail view
Manager.title: Reader: featured image fixes

Manager.description: I have an issue with viewing, and publishing posts to a site within a WordPress network, and this site has a domain mapped to it. I have three other sites from the same network connected to the android app, and I can view and publish posts for these other sites. These other sites are not domain mapped. I've used the app previously to create a page (not a post!) on the same blog, and I can still view this page in the app. I'm using a HTC Salsa running Android 2.3.3, and the WordPress app I'm using is 2.6.3 The WordPress network I'm using is self hosted running 3.8.1
Manager.title: Issues with WordPress network and domain mapped sites

Manager.description: Do not set the BasicCredentialsProvider when HTTP authentication is not necessary. Add preemptive authentication when HTTP Basic auth is enabled on the blog. (this will save one network call on each single request).
Manager.title: XML-RPC Client - HTTP Basic Auth improvements

Manager.description: Steps to repro: Go to posts and do a PTR Quickly open the drawer and change to another blog The progress bar is still going and you cannot do a PTR in the view. Even worst: if something bad happened during the PTR underlying network calls (say credentials errors) the loading bar is always running, you need to switch to comment to dismiss it. Also check pages and comments screens. Important: PTR on posts calls ApiHelper.RefreshBlogContentTask by passing the current blog as one parameter. RefreshBlogContentTask internally calls ApiHelper.refreshComments(mContext, commentParams); without passing the blog object (It relies on WordPress.getCurrentBlog()). So if you switch blog, the call to refreshComments will be done to the wrong URL (the url of the 2nd blog) with the credentials of the first blog.
Manager.title: Stop progress bar when the user changes blog

Manager.description: While testing #1138 I noticed that blog.getWpVersion was always blank/null. This was because I had just added the blog to the app, and RefreshBlogContentTask hadn't been run for it yet. Looks like it is only run when you switch blogs, or return to the app. We could either run RefreshBlogContentTask after adding a blog to the app, or just get the options as an additional step in the Account setup process?

Manager.description: PostUploadService calls the method WordPress.postUploaded by only passing the postID. WordPress.postUploaded internally calls the method OnPostUploaded of the current OnPostUploadedListener. Later in PostsListFragment->OnPostUploaded we use the postID and call getCurrentBlog to retrieve the post from the server and update the posts list. If the user switches blog while uploading, he/she will receive an error on the post list.
Manager.title: PostUploadService refreshes the newly creeated post without taking in consideration the blogID

Manager.description: Hi ! I want to contribute in the wp-android client development through GSOC this year. Some of the enhancements that I would like to make are: view comments from posts section Filter posts based upon tags, categories and post status home option in navigation drawer Detailed explanation of ideas is in my gsoc proposal[1]. I want to discuss more about the ideas and their implementation with my possible mentors. Thanks Aman [1] http://www.google-melange.com/gsoc/proposal/public/google/gsoc2014/amandevey/5668600916475904
Manager.title: Gsoc-2014 project ideas

Manager.description: Moderating 10 comments means 10 network calls, on a slow network that can lead to an horrible user experience because that step is blocking the UI and there is no way to stop it (back button doesn't work). We should either make the back button cancel the current action or remove the blocking loading dialog (background task but not trivial)
Manager.title: Better UX when bulk moderating comments

Manager.description: The app plays a default sound for push notifications. We should add the ability to select a different sound in Notifications settings. Many other Android apps have this feature. (via Feature Request public forum: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/custom-notification-sound-setting?replies=1#post-20333)
Manager.title: Custom Notification Sound Setting

Manager.description: From @aerych: I pull to refresh, refresh finishes and I see a prompt that I have 20 new posts. Tap the prompt. The first post visible in the list is 7 days old. Pull to refresh again, when it refreshes the newest post is 4 days old. Rinse/ repeat, now its 1 day old. Pull to refresh one final time and I get 17 results (hey I reached the end of the list) and the most recent item is 22min. This only happens when FP hasn't been refreshed for several days. Most likely caused by this code which loads newer posts based on timestamp, which shouldn't apply to FP.
Manager.title: Reader: FP requires multiple refreshes to be current

Manager.description: The code that is behind Stats use 2 different "Threaded" object. ThreadPoolExecutor and Volley. I think this we can simply the code, and only rely on Volley + one thread that control networks calls status. In details the app does the following steps when the user hits on Stats: User taps on the Stats UI Element in menu drawer, the main application thread receives the input from the system, and takes the control. It pushes the Stats screen onto the UI stack, and starts a new thread. The main application thread is now free, and the UI is responsive. This new thread does the following things: Creates a new ThreadPoolExecutor (*) Creates and enqueues 13 new Tasks into the ThreadPoolExecutor Control the ThreadPoolExecutor till the end of execution The ThreadPoolExecutor executes the given tasks by using its internally pooled threads. The max number of threads in the pool is a number between 2 and 4 (included) and it’s determined by following code: private static int getMaxConcurrentTasks() { int numProcessors = Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors(); return Math.min(numProcessors > 1 ? numProcessors : 2, 4); } Each tasks enqueued in the executor briefly does the following things: creates the REST path (string) create a REST request enqueue the rest request into the network layer and wait the response. parse the response broadcast an update message with the new data in it. The UI will read the message and the main thread updates the UI with new values. The network layer (Volley) is a component with its own threads in it. So in an ideal situation (where the number of free threads in Volley > of the number of threads ThreadPoolExecutor) we will have a number between 2 and 4 (included) of concurrent async network connections. I think we can create a single new thread that enqueues networks calls into Volley and wait till the responses. If the user go away from Stats, this thread should remove the calls from the Volley queue.
Manager.title: Remove ThreadPoolExecutor and only use Volley threading capabilities

Manager.description: I noticed that each fragment available in the Stats screen is updated (reloaded) twice on refresh. To understand where the problem is, consider the two ViewsByCountries Fragments only. If you do a pull to refresh you will see that each of those fragments are updated twice during the refresh. This is because the StatsService code notifies the observers when the network request finisheswith the following code: getContentResolver().notifyChange(StatsContentProvider.STATS_GEOVIEWS_URI, null); Ref: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/ui/stats/service/StatsService.java#L447 There is no trace of query parameter "timeframe" there. So both fragment will be updated on each response. I tried to put the "timeframe" in that call with the following code: if (StatUtils.getCurrentDate().equals(date)) { getContentResolver().notifyChange(Uri.parse(StatsContentProvider.STATS_GEOVIEWS_URI.toString()+"?timeframe="+ StatsTimeframe.TODAY.name()), null); } else if (StatUtils.getYesterdaysDate().equals(date)) { getContentResolver().notifyChange(Uri.parse(StatsContentProvider.STATS_GEOVIEWS_URI.toString()+"?timeframe="+ StatsTimeframe.YESTERDAY.name()), null); } else { AppLog.e(AppLog.T.STATS, "Timeframe unknown in ViewsByCountryListener"); } but this doesn't resolve the issue, even if I register the observers with the notifyForDescendents set to false like below. Query parameters are ignored when changes are notified. getActivity().getContentResolver().registerContentObserver(getGroupUri(), false, mContentObserver);
Manager.title: Update the correct Fragment when new data is ready

Manager.description: I stumbled upon an issue today: From Notifications, tap on a comment notification where the comment is in 'Unapproved' status. Edit the comment, change some text in the comment. Tap upload button. 'An error occurred while editing the comment'. XML-RPC error is that the comment's status was invalid. The code is using 'unapproved' here, when it should be 'hold': WordPress-Android/src/org/wordpress/android/ui/comments/EditCommentActivity.java Line 233 in 80232ed postHash.put("status", mComment.getStatus()); Changing it to CommentStatus.toString(mComment.getStatusEnum()) fixed it for me, but I'll let you investigate @nbradbury ;)
Manager.title: Comments: Can't edit comment retrieved from REST API

Manager.description: Current message says: Are you sure you want to delete the post ''?
Manager.title: Change the alert message when deleting an untitled post/page

Manager.description: Reported on the forum here: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/http-authentication-stopped-working-for-271?replies=3#post-20368
Manager.title: HTTP Digest authentication (RFC 2617) stopped working in 2.7

Manager.description: Each post in the reader should show the primary tag assigned to that post. Tapping the tag should display all posts with that tag and enable subscribing to the tag. See the web reader for examples. Note: the "primary" tag is the tag assigned to a post that's most commonly used in other posts on that blog.
Manager.title: Show tags in Reader posts

Manager.description: The best thing is maybe to move IDs from local.properties to gradle.properties and remove Config.java generation from build.gradle
Manager.title: Fix the gradle script so if local.properties file is modified, Config.java is regenerated

Manager.description: The app launches slower than it used to. Theory: A library or some new code is not using AsyncTask executeOnExecutor?
Manager.title: Lag when starting app

Manager.description: See WordPress-Android/src/org/wordpress/android/ui/accounts/CreateUserAndBlog.java Lines 29 to 31 in d7b7cdc final public static int WORDPRESS_COM_API_BLOG_VISIBILITY_PUBLIC = 0; final public static int WORDPRESS_COM_API_BLOG_VISIBILITY_PRIVATE = 1; final public static int WORDPRESS_COM_API_BLOG_VISIBILITY_HIDDEN = 2;
Manager.title: Public/private/blocksearchengines codes defined in CreateNewBlog.java != REST api

Manager.description: The button "Open in WordPress app" is in the twitter card, but tapping on it opens wp app, but doesn’t go to article.
Manager.title: Twitter deep links stopped working

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Add Jetpack Stats

Manager.description: If a push notification is showing on the device, and the user ignores it and navigates to notifications in the app instead, we should dismiss the push notification.
Manager.title: Auto-dismiss notifications

Manager.description: I have the following setup: fqdn.example.com is my default host (which replies when not using SNI), and everything there requires authorization, since that's where my web admin solution lives. example.com runs my WordPress, but is only reachable via SNI. WordPress-Android – or rather, xmlrpc – doesn't use SNI in the setup phase, which means I always get the "We can't log you in" screen. The logs clearly show xmlrpc choking on the 403, and my webserver log indicates that the client is not using SNI. Can you implement SNI in xmlrpc, please?
Manager.title: SNI in xmlrpc, esp. during setup process

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Update translations and add new languages for 2.8 beta

Manager.description: Not sure whether this is a mobile apps issue or a more general one, but following a blog sometimes results in it being followed as an external feed. This means its posts show up in the Reader without the ability to like, comment, etc.
Manager.title: Reader: Investigate following a blog vs following a feed

Manager.description: The web reader shows the first tag on each post, and tapping that tag shows all posts with that tag along with a Follow button so you can follow that tag.
Manager.title: Reader: show first tag on each post

Manager.description: In several places, AnalyticsTracker uses an activity's onCreate() to record when the user accessed a feature. This will result in inflated stats since the activity is re-created when the device is rotated.
Manager.title: AnalyticsTracker needs to take activity re-creation into account

Manager.description: It seems that only happens when: Sign in with wpcom credentials Sign out Sign in with a self hosted site Navigate the app and watch the logs, you should see some network errors prefixed with "WordPress-READER" see #1283
Manager.title: Reader network calls even when not connect to a wpcom account

Manager.description: When returning to WPActionBarActivity from settings, onActivityResult() always calls onBlogChanged() regardless of whether the blog has changed. This results in unnecessary work being done, most notably that stats data is updated.
Manager.title: WPActionBarActivity calls onBlogChanged() after returning from settings

Manager.description: There are two missing Uri.encode on lines 170 and 172 here: 1a4de16 Not a big deal since the server replies with correct values, but better to fix it now.
Manager.title: Missing URLEncoding in a Stats batch call

Manager.description: Pages opened in the WebViewActivity often don't appear correctly compared to how they appear when opened in the Android browser. My guess is that this is due to us using a custom user agent which throws off the page's browser sniffing.
Manager.title: Web pages don't appear correctly inside app

Manager.description: There is currently no way to edit your blog subscriptions, nor is there a way to view/add recommended blogs.
Manager.title: Reader needs to show followed blogs and recommended blogs

Manager.description: Enable Don't keep activities option in device settings. Open app, tap new post button. Add an image from the device gallery. Observe it is added to the post. Add another image from the device gallery. Observe that the first image is now gone.
Manager.title: Disappearing images in post editor after activity is closed

Manager.description: From the notifications, list tap on a notification that has a gravatar loaded. When the detail view loads, the gravatar is loaded again. Could be slight differences in the URL that cause the cache load to fail.
Manager.title: Gravatars are re-downloaded when it seems like they should be cached.

Manager.description: It's confusing, maybe change it temporarily to Uploading, if the upload fails change it back to Local draft. This is especially confusing when uploading a big post (say 10 pictures), start to write a new one, come back to the list, both post have the same status.
Manager.title: When a post is uploading it's still tagged "Local draft" in the post list

Manager.title: Stats, weird animation on a 10" tablet when clicking today/yesterday

Manager.description: See https://cloudup.com/cyuBEkDLd7U
Manager.title: Pin lock, 10" tablet wrong screen size on first pin enter
Reader: add border to blockquotes

Manager.description: Suggested by our users. +Personally, I usually share all the pics to the same blog but I don't want to tick "always use these settings" cause there are always a few exceptions.
Manager.title: ShareIntentReceiver, default select blog and action (new post / media) by last used

Manager.description: Either have a timer on the toast or maybe allow any tap in the table list to dismiss it.
Manager.title: Pull to refresh tip/toast should dismiss easier

Manager.description: Create a new post, give it a title but no content Insert a picture and set it as the featured image Publish the post Edit it in the app The featured image doesn't appear anywhere in the post editor.
Manager.title: Featured image missing after editing a post

Manager.description: I fired up one of my Android devices that I don't use regularly. Since the last time I used the device, I've moved two sites over to WordPress.com. Those sites didn't show up in the site selector, even after poking around the app for a bit. When I went into Settings to see if the site was hidden, the list showed the new sites. Pop back to the main screen and the sidebar shows the new sites as well.
Manager.title: WordPress.com sites don't refresh automatically

Manager.description: Enable swiping between posts in the reader detail as a way to navigate between posts, so the user doesn't have to return to the post list to see the next post.
Manager.title: Enable swiping between posts in the reader

Manager.description: Remove this: This need a better design. I'm pretty sure some users are losing their writing because of this. Suggestion: Auto save post locally while the user edits it (like emacs is doing, dump to disk each N characters/words) and auto save when he leaves the post editor (back button, go to Reader, etc.) Pseudo-sync with the server: try to upload the post as a draft when the user leaves the post editor
Manager.title: Remove the "Would you like to save your changes" dialog when user hit back button on post editor

Manager.description: I think we can improve the understandability of the post publish button by removing the 'paper airplane' icon and using text instead. @bummytime did this in his post draft saving project and I really liked how it looked. If the post status is 'publish' then the button will read 'PUBLISH', any other status will change it to 'SAVE'. I also thought it made sense to have this button be available in the post settings and preview fragments, so you can publish/save from wherever you are in the editor. I made a video to demo how it could work: https://cloudup.com/cnDXLXdnJ5Q Thoughts?
Manager.title: Better post publish/save button

Manager.description: When the user taps a photo in the reader detail to view it full-screen, use the makeThumbnailScaleUpAnimation feature of ActivityOptionsCompat to zoom into the full-screen activity.
Manager.title: Reader: zoom into full-screen photo

Manager.description: using Wordpress for Android v2.8 on a Galaxy S4. Self-hosted Wordpress In my listing of comments on my site, there are some 20 spam comments, listed as "Pending". However, trying to remove them fails, and I will explain why. I had them listed in the app, but then went to the blog with my browser and removed them in Wordpress instead. Ever since, I cannot remove them from the app. When I try to either mark them spam or trash them, I get "an error occurred while moderating" and the comment is not removed from the listing. The log shows that there is an error 404 on the request.
Manager.title: unable to remove spam from comments listing

Manager.description: http://android.wordpress.org/development/ has a sentence that reads "You can follow the changes to our source code in [Trac](You can follow the changes to our source code in Trac.).", with "Trac" linked to http://android.trac.wordpress.org/, which in turn has the message "The WordPress for Android project has moved to GitHub, which you can find here: [...]". So I guess that sentence should be removed altogether. I would've fixed it myself opened a pull request, but I don't know where you're hosting the website sources -- apparently they aren't in the gh-pages branch.
Manager.title: Remove link to Trac on android.wordpress.org

Manager.description:
I was checking the error reports for 2.8, and noticed some reports were the Stats batch call itself was successful, but one of the nested calls failed. We need to catch and handle the "single call" error in batch responses. {"\/sites\/null\/stats\/search-terms?date=2014-05-06":{"errors":{"unknown_blog":["Unknown blog"]},"error_data":{"unknown_blog":404}},"\/sites\/null\/stats\/search-terms?date=2014-05-05":{"errors":{"unknown_blog":["Unknown blog"]},"error_data":{"unknown_blog":404}}}
Manager.title: Handle single call error in REST Batch calls

Manager.description: If the comment push notification doesn't contains the note full data ("note_full_data" key) the app stores in the DB just a placeholder for that note. In most of case this is not an issue, since a call to refreshNotes() is done immediately after, and the note is updated with full details. In some situations the call to refreshNotes() can fail due to bad network signal, or other unknown issues, and the note stored in the DB is then incomplete. When the user taps on the PN entry in notification center, the app is launched, and the method showCommentForNote of CommentDetailFragment is reached. That method tries to get the comment by using the blogId and the commentID that are both not available (since the note object is just a placeholder) resulting in an error and a blank details screen. A REST call with both blogID and commentID set to 0 is done.
Manager.title: Opening the app from a comment PN could take the user to a blank notification details screen

Manager.description: Install the app fresh(I was running develop 9bc4d3d) Sign in to a WordPress.com account. Load the reader at Freshly Pressed. Back button out of the app to close it. Head over to WordPress.com in a desktop browser, change your password. Open the app again, you'll get a sign in prompt. Sign in with the new password. Open menu drawer and open Posts, then open it again and go back to the Reader. This is what I see, PTR doesn't refresh the view:
Manager.title: Changing password results in unresponsive/blank Reader

Manager.description: We can probably move to one single batch network call that loads all the Stats, instead of doing 4 batch calls (One batch call for each Stats type). The iOS app does this. Double check performance before calling the PR.
Manager.title: Stats - One network call that rule them all

Manager.description: From @nbradbury comment on #1368 A few issues: several routines use SysUtils.canUseExecuteOnExecutor(), which determines whether AsyncTasks can use executeOnExecutor (API 11+). We can remove that function and always use executeOnExecutor(), and remove @suppresslint("NewApi") from those routines. we can remove values-large-v11 Places that still unnecessarily check for API level: NotificationsWebViewActivity.onCreate() PreferencesActivity.initializeActionBar() EditPostContentFragment.savePostContent() AboutActivity.onCreate() StatsActivity.isInLandscape()
Manager.title: Cleanup the gingerbread removal

Manager.title: Rename "Blogs visibility" title to "Blogs"

Manager.title: Rotating some views refresh data (network call)

Remove spell checker from the "tag/url to follow" box

Manager.description: Some of the features in "Gallery Settings" are available to WordPress.com sites only. The app doesn't check if the current blog is Self-Hosted or not when creating that screen, resulting in unexpected result on self-hosted blogs. For example if the user select type = Slideshow. Ref: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/slideshow-gallery-seems-not-to-work?replies=1 http://codex.wordpress.org/The_WordPress_Gallery
Manager.title: Gallery doesn't work well on self-hosted sites
