Manager.title: Post Editor: Change save button text to 'Upload' when editing published posts

Manager.description: Priority to fix the "caches" issue.
Manager.title: Try to update the gradle script to make it easier to work on libraries used by WPAndroid

Manager.description: When you add an image from the Photos app (or any other app that doesn't store the image locally), the image has to be downloaded before being inserted in the editor. Currently we show a toast message that the image is downloading, which isn't so great. It'd be much better to animate in a progress bar view so that the user can view the download progress. It also doesn't appear that there's any messaging if the download fails, which can cause confusion.
Manager.title: Improve UX when adding externally hosted image

Manager.description: wp.simperium.app_secret=? wp.simperium.app_name=? Check that the app works with incorect values (without notifications).
Manager.title: Add a fake wp.simperium.app_secret and wp.simperium.app_name in gradle.properties-example

Manager.description: In order to switch to native fragment we need to get rid of child fragments in Stats since support-v13 does with native fragment what v4 does with support-Fragment except child/nested fragments. Nested fragments then require API17 or higher. Ref: #1432
Manager.title: Drop Child Fragments in Stats

Manager.description: We can revert this commit de9bb66 and switch back to native activity / fragment. Important Note: Wait until #1435 is fixed before starting working on this.
Manager.title: Use native fragments and drop using v4.support.Fragment

Manager.description: Edit an uploaded post Tap the image icon, select 'create gallery'. Save your gallery, you'll see the placeholder in the content area. Update the post, and observe that the gallery is lost.
Manager.title: Gallery disappears after adding to uploaded post

Manager.description: To match the update to the iOS app - wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#1724
Manager.title: Reblogging redesign

Manager.description: If the app is opened to the Stats panel, and you try to swipe to refresh, the UI appears to fail to refresh. However, after a few seconds stats update automatically, appearing the the app is performing a background refresh of the stats, but with no indication to the user that this is happening. Once the stats update, swiping to refresh works without issue. This doesn't happen if the app opens to a different panel, or you switch to a different panel and then switch back.
Manager.title: Refreshing stats on app open

Manager.description: In the past the /read/following/mine/ endpoint didn't return the name, description or other meta info for each subscription. Now that it has been updated to support ?meta=site,feed make the necessary changes in the Reader.

Manager.description: In case when the tab bar is merged with the title / action bar. Text and separators should be white.
Manager.title: Blog discovery weird styling on a landsape 7" or 10" tablet

Manager.description: Load Media. Long-press on a media to show the CAB. Rotate, your app asplode.
Manager.title: Crash when rotating with CAB showing in Media

Manager.description: The Reader skips Photon for https images, which due to a backend change that forces https is causing images to be downloaded fullsize, consuming far more memory than necessary.
Manager.title: Reader shouldn't skip Photon for https images

Manager.description: The method does a pretty simple check: getLocalTablePostId() >= 0 which will evaluate true for almost all posts, including remote posts that are published.
Manager.title: Post.isNew() returns true for not-new posts

Manager.description: Since the simperium merge, WordPressDB_NotificationsTest.java is no longer valid.
Manager.title: Remove old notification tests

Manager.description: Happen on 800x480 screens for instance:
Manager.title: PIN lock screen truncated on small screens in landscape

Manager.description: If you swipe to dismiss a notification, and then receive another notification, you'll see that it has grouped the two notifications together even though you've dismissed the first one. Question: Should dismissing a notification also mark that note as read, if possible?
Manager.title: Swiping away a push notification should remove it from future notifications

Manager.description: If I'm signed in to the app using a WordPress.com account, there is a certain expectation that tracking and analytics services might well be tracking my behaviour when using the app. If I'm only signed in to the app using a self-hosted account, I absolutely do not expect tracking or analytics services to be tracking my behaviour. In fact, I was surprised to see data being sent to api.mixpanel.com and reports.crashlytics.com despite only being signed in to the app with my self-hosted account. Not only that, but the data being sent to api.mixpanel.com is obfuscated, so it's not possible to tell what data is being sent without hunting through the source code of the app and figuring it out. Communication with third party tracking services should not happen while you're using a self-hosted account. The app is called "WordPress for Android", not "WordPress.com for Android". I do not expect tracking data to be sent to third party services while I am not using WordPress.com.
Manager.title: Exclude third party tracking when using self-hosted accounts

Manager.description: A user reported an issue where he can't open the notification details screen from the notification center when tapping on the comment notification row. I bet the app doesn't refresh the notification content in background when receiving a PN object with the comment_id absent in the payload. The notification details screen requires both the blog_id, and the comment_id, to retrieve the actual notification data. Ref: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/cant-read-comments-from-notifications-screen
Manager.title: Notification: Make sure to load the whole notification content for self-hosted site from PN

Manager.description: Since Wordpress Android 2.9 and #1384, I can't use the application with my website. I don't have my own SSL certificate, so I use the shared certificate provided with my mutual hosting. But of course the certificate name doesn't match the website domain name, so the SNI failed and I always get the "We can't log you in" screen (full trace here). With a Web browser, I get a warning about that but I can tell that I'm OK to continue. But currently with the Wordpress app, unless I'm mistaken, I don't see any way to bypass the SNI. So I think you should add either an option to disable it or a warning dialog to bypass it as for a browser.
Manager.title: SNI prevents me from using the app

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Add Opt Out Setting for Mixpanel

Manager.description: The web reader enables three types of blocking: I think having all three in the mobile apps is overkill, but they should enable blocking individual blogs.

Manager.description: In tag preview, tapping the back button doesn't navigate back through the tags you've previewed. Change this by remembering the previewed tags and enable back navigation. Note that this should be done without creating a new fragment for each tag.

Manager.description: When uploading an image from the device it looses all its EXIF meta data such as gps location and panorama details for instance. It would be nice to enable/disable image cleaning in the app settings, so the user can choose to preserve or remove the "x:xmpmeta" information.
Manager.title: EXIF data not preserved after upload

Manager.description: I'd like to see the app working with more languages. I, myself, want it to work in hebrew, but I'm sure there are lots of people out there looking for other languages.
Manager.title: Addtional Languages support

Manager.description: s/Add Location/Add location/ s/Current Location/Current location/ Also we should review recent strings to check they match the Android writing style https://developer.android.com/design/style/writing.html
Manager.title: Minor string issue on location feature

Manager.description: I wasn't sure where to post this, and I'm not sure if the bug is related specifically to Freshly Pressed or all blogs with post titles that use i/em/strong tags, but see the attached image for what I'm referring to. I spotted this error on June 7th, and admittedly haven't searched Issues to see if it's been raised before, so do with it what you will. Cheers.
Manager.title: i/em/strong Tags Shown in Freshly Pressed Post Titles

Manager.title: Reader opens multiple detail views

Manager.title: Add Helpshift to the app for real time support

Manager.description: One user first noticed this behaviour of zombie draft posts. I noticed it, only after using the "Share picture with WordPress" feature a lot (but I'm not sure this is related). Publish post "A" via "Share with WordPress" Publish post "B" via "Share with WordPress" Publish post "..." via "Share with WordPress" Notice post "B" is published and a draft "B" is also there
Manager.title: Draft post coming from nowhere after post has been published

Manager.description: Don't ask passcode lock if am in login page.
Manager.title: Don't show the lock screen for login page

Manager.description: From a user: When sharing multiple photos to a post from the G+ gallery, several posts got stuck in local draft. I had to edit and publish again. Every post except one successfully published on the second attempt. One lost all content, including several images. We also have comments on the Play Store from users who lost their work and can't find a local draft version. Seems only related to local drafts. This is going to be hard to reproduce...
Manager.title: Some users lose content they're working on

Manager.description: The app already has quick post capabilities for photo and video. How about a quick post capability for a status / aside post ? This would give us the ability to post quick tweet-like things. I would hope that the status / aside post format would be automatically set. The Twitterify plugin automatically creates wordpress tags by entering hashtags.
Manager.title: Quick Post Status / Aside

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Add analytics for how many users are previewing a theme

Manager.description: Adding a blog to the app, in which your user role is "Contributor", will show you a Username/password prompt just after the login. I think the refresh blog task doesn't get the 401 error well, and fire/broadcast a wrong event. In this case username or password wrong.
Manager.title: Adding a blog to the app with "Contributor" role does show a wrong error message

Manager.description: Here's a list of classes that should be moved: ui: ReaderVideoUtils AniUtils SimperiumUtils ThemeHelper Media* widgets: WPEditText WPAlertDialogFragment FlowLayout
Manager.title: Move a few Utils classes before migration to new Utils Library

Manager.description: The app won't build with the new android studio version. There is an easy fix though. props @maxme
Manager.title: Upgrade to Android Studio (Beta)

Manager.description: Right now many fragments have a hasActivity() method, but we can replace this with a simple call to isAdded() now that we requires ICS+ (isAdded() was added to SDK 11).
Manager.title: Replace hasActivity() with isAdded()

Manager.description: If the user performs a pull-to-refresh when there's no connection, the PTR message should let the user know there's no connection and not bother performing the refresh. Similar iOS ticket here
Manager.title: Let user know about no connection in PTR

Manager.description: In the https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/tree/feature/modularization branch we changed directory structure, so we need to edit scripts in tools/ to work with this new structure.
Manager.title: Fix our scripts in the `tools` directory

Manager.description: We should use WPQuoteSpan for blocks in comments, they have better formatting.
Manager.title: Fix BlockQuote styling in comments detail view

Manager.description: Building with libraries from source should be as easy to setup for new developers as building from artifacts.
Manager.title: Create setup task or script for development libraries

Manager.description: Post endpoints return "likes_enabled" and "sharing_enabled" but the mobile apps don't honor them. They should rely on these values to determine whether to show the like/share/reblog features.
Manager.title: Support "likes_enabled" and "sharing_enabled"

Manager.description: If a feed has an empty title, it should show the feed domain. Right now it shows an empty white space instead.
Manager.title: Reader blog preview empty title

Manager.description: The list of followed blogs incorrectly uses case sensitive sorting by name.
Manager.title: Reader followed blogs uses case insensitive sorting

Would really appreciate your help!

Manager.description: List the likes for a comment GET /sites/$site/comments/$comment_ID/likes/ Like a comment POST /sites/$site/comments/$comment_ID/likes/new Remove your like from a comment POST /sites/$site/comments/$comment_ID/likes/mine/delete Get your like status for a comment GET /sites/$site/comments/$comment_ID/likes/mine/
Manager.title: Enable comment likes in the Reader

Manager.description: Tapping on a bar in the chart should (at least in this first iteration) do the following, and be in par with the web version: Day Chart type ---> Open the in-app web view on the stats details page. Week/Month Chart type ---> Show a widget (toast?) with details in it.
Manager.title: Tapping on the Bar Chart should open the details view

Manager.title: feature/modularization branch is broken

Manager.description: Thanks @mjangda for this: I got 2 new email notifications from Gmail in succession; they ended up being stacked into one I went to Gmail on my computer (the notification was still active in my notification drawer on the device and I had it visible) I opened the newest email on my computer A few seconds later, the notification for that email got dismissed and the notification changed from the stacked view (“2 new emails”) to the single one (“New email from…”) I opened the next email on my computer as well The remaining notification was also dismissed It would be really amazing to be able to have this sort of behaviour for the WordPress app as well. If I view a notification from my computer, we should get rid of that notification for the user. Also useful when you have a tablet and a phone and read notifications from one device.
Manager.title: Send "read signal" PNs to automatically dismiss notifications in the app

Manager.description: If a comment can be liked by the user, we should show a like button in the comment notification.
Manager.title: Add like button to comment notifications

Manager.description: This should solve an issue we have with a few device filtered out of the Play Store (and failing back to 2.5.1) because they don't declare "armeabi" as supported binary.
Manager.title: Depends on multi-configuration emailchecker 0.3 build

Manager.title: Reader: hiding comment reply isn't intuitive

Manager.title: Unfollow error and follow/following button inconsistencies

Manager.title: Present the equivalent bar chart hover information by not using a Toast

Scroll to the bottom of Stats Keep track of the "exit screen" of the app

Manager.title: Refresh of Stats doesn't work if you switch app

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Reader detail needs a scrollbar

Manager.description: I just noticed the bar highlighting is done onSingleTapUp, should we highlight the bar onShowPress and run the action onSingleTapUp? From the documentation: The user has performed a down MotionEvent and not performed a move or up yet. This event is commonly used to provide visual feedback to the user to let them know that their action has been recognized i.e. highlight an element.
Manager.title: Improve highlighting of tapped bar

Manager.description: Pros: obviously fix the local dependency management dependency management across different git repositories and branches Cons: devs will have to be careful to commit modified submodules within the working branch we can't symlink submodules to an unique local git repo (not a big deal) Note: README will need an update
Manager.title: Use git submodules instead of using the cloneWordPressLibraries gradle task

Manager.description: Sign in to WordPress.com for a username that is connected to a Jetpack site. Add the self-hosted site to the app. From notifications, try to moderate a comment. You should see an error message. If you swap steps #1 and #2, the issue isn't there.
Manager.title: Can't moderate Jetpack site stats in certain scenario

Manager.description: If you navigate to a WordPress site from within the app (say, from a link in a notification), the bar appears at the top letting you know that you're logged into the site but you're unable to like a post.
Manager.title: Can't like from in-app browser

Manager.description: "Reader shows a thumbnail with a play button, which indicates to me that I can tap to play the video. When I do actually tap the thumbnail I’m just taken to the post and have to find and click the video again. We should either enable click-to-play on the Excerpt card or show a thumbnail without the play button."
Manager.title: Remove video player overlay from Reader post list

Manager.description: In Reader, click on a post to view full post. Click on reblog. Button turns orange. Change your mind about reblogging and press physical back button. Reblog button is still orange.
Manager.title: Reader reblog icon stays orange

Manager.description: If you comment on a post or like a post from the detail view, the comment/like count doesn't increase when you return to the list view.
Manager.title: Comment/like count doesn't change after returning from Reader detail

Manager.description: Right now tapping the comment icon in the post list simply opens the detail view. It should instead scroll to the comments, and show the comment form. Note that the iOS app shows the comment form in the list view - it doesn't open the detail view at all.
Manager.title: Tapping comment icon in post list should open comment form

Manager.description: If the app is paused while the reader list view is showing, if the user returns to the app after a long time it doesn't automatically update (ie: check for new posts).
Manager.title: Reader doesn't update when resumed

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Use OpenSans in Stats

Manager.description: This is a minor nit but it has bugged for me a while. On the sign in screen, the change to the eye icon when the password is visible isn't very noticeable. We should change the tint of the icon to make it more obvious.
Manager.title: Change color of eye icon when password is visible

Manager.description: Right now ReaderPostPagerActivity only shows posts that are already cached on the device. It should support infinite scroll so older posts are downloaded as the user scrolls towards the last cached post.
Manager.title: Add infinite scroll to ReaderPostPager

Manager.description: Go to widgets, and add QuickPress to your home screen. Select a blog. Observe that the QuickPress shortcut is not added. This is on Android 4.4.3 on a Moto G.
Manager.title: QuickPress is broken

Manager.description: 07-29 11:47:10.414 2597-2597/org.wordpress.android E/AndroidRuntime﹕ FATAL EXCEPTION: main java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.comments.CommentsListFragment$UpdateCommentsTask.onPostExecute(CommentsListFragment.java:516) at org.wordpress.android.ui.comments.CommentsListFragment$UpdateCommentsTask.onPostExecute(CommentsListFragment.java:410) at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:631) at android.os.AsyncTask.access$600(AsyncTask.java:177) at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:644) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4745) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:786) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
Manager.title: Crash when first loading comment

Manager.description: See video Update: The problem appears to be that the request to get the Reader tags isn't completing before the posts are downloaded. Possible solution is to automatically add the default tag ("Freshly Pressed") to the tag table before any requests are made.
Manager.title: Very slow Reader after login

Manager.description: A user's notifications stopped syncing in the 3.0 beta. The only solution was to force quite the app and launch it again, which got them working again. We should make sure the connection is working when the NotificationsActivity starts, or perhaps we just need to make sure the buckets have started.
Manager.title: Notifications stuck, won't sync

Manager.description: @drw158 I've updated the tooltip by setting the text size to the same value used in the Bargraph. Below are the new screenshots. Current version:
Manager.title: Graph and tooltip should use the same text size

Manager.description: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#2003
Manager.title: Use the /me endpoint to populate Mixpanel's email address field (only for .com users)

Manager.description: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#2081
Manager.title: Add a property to track last seen screen for when the app is closed

Manager.description: Trying to live preview a theme for a wordpress.com site with a mapped domain throws a permissions error.
Manager.title: Theme Previews broken for mapped domains

Manager.description: Followed blogs in the iOS app shows each blog's icon, but this is missing from the Android app.
Manager.title: Reader followed blogs should show blog icon

Manager.description: Post preview text feels pretty cramped up
Manager.title: Use the same line-height, font size, letter-spacing in Post preview and Post editor

Manager.description: Images in comments should display ReaderPhotoViewerActivity when tapped.
Manager.title: Images in Reader comments aren't tappable

Manager.description: Remove all references to setBuiltInZoomControls
Manager.title: Crash report 3.0: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: ZoomButtonsController

Manager.description: For instance, (no reference to the post or blog, technical details, not sure if the post has been uploaded without the media) Also we should be careful, and not show network layer or API errors to the user - errors should be the way to tell them what failed, and what they can do next.
Manager.title: Upload media error when uploading a new post is unclear
Achievement icon too big in notification

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Auto refresh the post list

Manager.description: Several of our v3.0 users are experiencing this: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can not perform this action after onSaveInstanceState at android.app.FragmentManagerImpl.checkStateLoss(FragmentManager.java:1323) at android.app.FragmentManagerImpl.enqueueAction(FragmentManager.java:1341) at android.app.BackStackRecord.commitInternal(BackStackRecord.java:597) at android.app.BackStackRecord.commit(BackStackRecord.java:575) at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderPostListActivity.showListFragmentForTag(ReaderPostListActivity.java:214) at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderPostListActivity.access$200(ReaderPostListActivity.java:36) at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderPostListActivity$1.onUpdateResult(ReaderPostListActivity.java:274) at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.actions.ReaderTagActions$5$1.run(ReaderTagActions.java:194) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:733) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:157) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5356) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1265) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1081) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)
Manager.title: IllegalStateException in ReaderPostListActivity

Manager.description: Blog preview suffers from the following problems: The mshot which scales down as you scroll is a nice idea, but it ends up taking too much space and is distracting when you really just want to see the blog's posts The mshot takes a while to generate on the server, so you end up seeing a big gray box for too long The code to make the header "sticky" and scale the mshot is convoluted at best, and adds too much overhead The blog info header is inconsistent with the header that appears when previewing posts in a tag The follower count doesn't change when you follow/unfollow the blog Following a blog you just unfollowed doesn't work
Manager.title: Redesign blog preview

Manager.description: The issue probably comes from a commit between 3.0-beta-3 and 3.0-rc-1
Manager.title: Application is killed/restarted causing multiple issues

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Add versionCode property to Mixpanel events

Manager.description: Add the following code to the correct spot: AnalyticsTracker.track(AnalyticsTracker.Stat.STATS_SCROLLED_TO_BOTTOM); Props @sendhil Ref: #1625 (comment)
Manager.title: Add Mixpanel analytics event "stats scrolling to bottom"

Manager.description: The code to choose a featured image when one isn't defined is slow and sometimes fails due to the faulty detection of single-quoted attributes.
Manager.title: Reader: smarter extraction of featured image

Manager.description: The detail view already has some gallery support, but excerpts in the list view do not. Would be nice to show a "collage" from the gallery where the featured image currently appears. Equivalent iOS issue here
Manager.title: Reader should support galleries

Manager.description: Downloading and displaying posts takes too long. Some of this is likely due to a slow backend, but it's possible my parsing is contributing to the problem. If the problem is due to the slow default JSON parser, switching to Jackson or GSON might be warranted.
Manager.title: Investigate slow parsing of posts

Manager.description: Unconfirmed user report: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/videos-not-working-291
Manager.title: Reader not opening YouTube app for videos?

Manager.description: It would be helpful if analytics tracked when a push notification was received.
Manager.title: Add notification tracking to analytics

Manager.description: Related iOS issue here. Cloudup videos should already work in the detail view since it relies on a WebView - this issue is specifically about adding their thumbnails as featured images in the list view. https://dev.cloudup.com/#items-thumbs
Manager.title: Add support for Cloudup video thumbnails

Manager.description: The file opened here is never closed.
Manager.title: Unclosed file resource in StatUtils

Manager.description: Testing on very low-memory emulators has shown that the app can get killed due to the memory requirements of ReaderPostPagerActivity, and I've seen a few TRIM_MEMORY_RUNNING_CRITICAL instances when using that ViewPager on a N5.
Manager.title: Reduce memory usage in the Reader ViewPager

Manager.description: The following post displays different images on the web, iOS and Android readers at different times. As of writing up this bug report, I see the same on all three but we received a report that iOS and Android were showing a different image from the web. This is also being tracked at wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#2217. props @drw158
Manager.title: Featured image discrepancies on reader if no featured image is set

Manager.description: This looks like a recently introduced problem. We have a string constant here which contains the pref key to store the last active activity name, but there's a different hard-coded pref key here which is what the app relies on to return to the last active activity. As a result the last active activity isn't restored when the app is next started. Note: we also use the same hard-coded pref key here
Manager.title: Last activity is no longer restored

Manager.description: PR #1587 - which was merged into 3.1 - enables blocking a blog from the reader list view. This feature should also be available from the detail (pager) view.
Manager.title: Reader: enable blocking a blog from the detail view

Manager.description: Scrolling the application log is janky, rewrite it using a ListView.
Manager.title: AppLogViewActivity is janky

Manager.description: Visit site button should use home url instead of wordpress root url.
Manager.title: Visit Site button uses site_url() instead of home_url()

Manager.description: Yes! We have post format support but we don't have support for post_type! Custom Post types are not supported by WordPress for Android in self-hosted sites. Should we add it to the app?
Manager.title: We don't have post type support!

Manager.description: Steps: Share a link to the WP app (e.g. Chrome -> Share -> WP) The link appears in the Content TextEdit but can't be edited by tapping the "link" icon.
Manager.title: Auto-linked url are not editable

Manager.description: Before removing Helpshift from 3.1, I'll would like to test a very straight integration and check if we see the same problems in a 3.1-rc-1.
Manager.title: Remove deferred Helpshift initialization

Manager.description: Open a long reader article, maybe one with comments. Scroll to the bottom. Observe that the action buttons and action bar do not appear. Reproduced on 3.0.2 on a Moto G running 4.4.3
Manager.title: Reader: Action buttons not shown when bottom of post detail is reached

Manager.description: Hide all blogs Open notifications Tap a note that shows a list of people (ex: someone followed your blog) Tap a person in the list to open their blog Instead of opening the blog, you see a toast saying "An error occurred when accessing this blog." This is because the AuthenticatedWebViewActivity used to display the page requires a current blog.
Manager.title: AuthenticatedWebViewActivity fails with no current blog

Manager.description: When a Reader detail fragment is shown for a post, it requests the latest version of the post. This can change the post's timestamp, which is used to sort the posts in the list view. This can cause the post to be re-sorted when returning to the list if the list doesn't sort by published date (such as Freshly Pressed and Posts I Like).
Manager.title: Timestamp is changed when post requested by reader detail

Manager.description: If a post has likes, the first time you visit the detail view the liking users don't show up. They do show up the second time you view the post.
Manager.title: Reader detail: liking users don't appear the first time

Manager.description: The comment endpoint now supports a heirarchical=1 parameter, which returns comments in pages of nested comments. Replace the current method of retrieving comments in the detail view with this. As part of this work, also handle deleted comments. Right now deleted comments continue to appear in the Reader since they exist in the comment table.
Manager.title: Use new hierarchical comment API in the Reader detail

Manager.description: In #1750 @nbradbury experimented with full width images in the reader comments. They looked great but there was an issue with a large amount of whitespace beneath uncached images.
Manager.title: Add full-width images in reader comments

Manager.description: When swiping through posts in ReaderPostPagerActivity, sometimes the content of the post being swiped into view doesn't appear until you raise your finger to end the swipe (even if the swipe is incomplete). Demo video here
Manager.title: Reader detail web content doesn't appear during swipe

Manager.description: We should display the blog url instead of the empty string (like it's done in other places).
Manager.title: Empty line in the blog selector when sharing a text/picture to a blog with an empty name

Manager.description: See #1763 (comment)
Manager.title: Too many SimpleDateFormat objects in StatUtils

Manager.description: When the user taps an image in the Reader to view it full-size, scan the post for other images and enable swiping between them in the photo viewer.
Manager.title: Enable swiping between photos in photo viewer

Manager.description: This video shows that there's a comment on the post, but tapping through to the detail view doesn't show any comments. https://cloudup.com/czV7UyIkrYA
Manager.title: Bug: comments not appearing in Reader detail

Manager.description: When a post failed to upload, we're displaying the error coming from the server, which is very cryptic for the user and doesn't help him to fix the problem.
Manager.title: Improve error messages on failed post upload

Manager.description: Change the Reader background color to match the light blue used by the web and iOS apps.
Manager.title: Change Reader background color

Manager.description: There should be some visual indicator letting users know they can swipe through posts in the Reader detail view.
Manager.title: Reader swipe view needs indicator

Manager.description: ...They obviously fail and show a Toast error (Posts / Stats / Media). Other views does nothing.
Manager.title: Some views try to refresh content while in airplane mode

Manager.description: Images in private blogs fail to download in the photo viewer (HTTP 400). Need to add auth support to Volley image requests.
Manager.title: Private images don't appear in reader photo viewer

Manager.description: It'd be nice if I could show the stats for a site directly from notifications. I could create a new StatsFragment instance, and pass it a siteId to display stats for.
Manager.title: Allow Stats to be a fragment that will show stats for a given site id

Manager.description: Be logged in or Login. Go to Notifications and check you have some. Logout. Login. Go to Notifications, you'll see an empty screen. The only way to get notification back in sync is to kill and restart the app.
Manager.title: Logout then login gives you an empty notification screen

Manager.description: Right now content shown by the post detail WebView resizes as images are loaded due to the images not having height/width set. Investigate using attachment data to get the height/width ratio of the images, and then using that to set the height/width.
Manager.title: Reader: use attachment data to improve rendering

Manager.description: From an activity, open the menu and tap 'Sign out'. There's a visible lag as the app crunches through some work. Perhaps it needs an AsyncTask?
Manager.title: App hangs when signing out

Manager.description: Some users complained their posts list on the app is not in sync with their web posts list.
Manager.title: Refresh the posts/pages list on activity creation

Manager.description: Now that #1787 is fixed, if a stat type range is tapped we can now push a stats fragment.
Manager.title: Integrate notifications with native stats

Manager.description: If a comment is less than one line, it will be wrapped incorrectly in the notification comment detail view.
Manager.title: Short comment notifications don't display properly in detail view

Manager.description: When calling ReaderActivityLauncher.showReaderPostDetail() to show a single post in the Reader, the post never appears if it hasn't already been downloaded due to this. I've tagged this for 3.2 since it needs to be fixed in order for the notification redesign to work.
Manager.title: Reader post detail fails to show posts that aren't already downloaded

Manager.description: The second step is to start emulators and run test on them.
Manager.title: Travis CI configuration to compile and run lint

Manager.description: FP remains empty after the reader db is upgraded - have to switch to another tag and then back again for anything to appear. https://cloudup.com/cIBIODzMYqT This was seen while using PR #1799.
Manager.title: Reader doesn't load FP after upgrade

Manager.description: Reintegrate helpshift with the 3.5.0 library version and check the app restart issue is fixed.
Manager.title: Helpshift reintegration

Manager.description: Crash reports show several instances of an IllegalStateException here. Problem may be due to not having default values for the post_id and blog_id fields.
Manager.title: IllegalStateException in ReaderPostTable.getPostFromCursor()

Manager.description: Add support for inline images within notification blocks in the next release.
Manager.title: Inline image support to notification blocks

Manager.description: Right now the Reader detail shows the full content of the post followed by all of its comments. This is a real battery/bandwidth hog since each detail view requests the latest comments, yet users can quickly swipe left-to-right between posts without ever seeing the comments. It's also a pain because the scrollbar doesn't tell you how long the article you're reading is (instead it's how long the article is + the length of its comments). Investigate replacing this with a separate activity for comments. Related iOS issue
Manager.title: Use a separate activity for reader detail comments

Manager.description: Corresponding iOS Issue - wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#2437
Manager.title: Drop Taplytics and Utilize Mixpanel A/B Testing

Manager.description: Reader detail may crash when a very large 'text' column is stored. Same cause as #1838, which was fixed by skipping the text column when viewing a list of posts, which won't work in the reader detail view since the text is necessary. Possible solution is to detect the size of the JSON text when parsing the response and limiting how much of it is stored.
Manager.title: IllegalStateException in ReaderPostDetail

Manager.description: Go to the Reader, tap tag icon and swipe to 'Followed Blogs' tab. Enter in the URL to a blog that you aren't following yet. After the blog has been added, tap it in the list to show the blog preview. Observe that the posts list never shows any posts. After an (in-person!) discussion with @nbradbury, he thinks it might be that the app doesn't know what the siteId is for the site yet which is why no posts are shown.
Manager.title: Empty Posts List in Blog Preview after Subscribing

Manager.description: Embedded video elements aren't resized to fit the display width, causing them to extend beyond the viewport.
Manager.title: Reader doesn't resize video elements

Manager.description: We should try to merge those two webviews in one. AuthenticatedWebViewActivity is used in a lot of places so we need to be extremely careful with testing. Keeping it for the next week when I will be on a big monitor :)
Manager.title: Try to merge AuthenticatedWebViewActivity and DotComAuthenticatedWebViewActivity

Manager.description: From one of our user: When using the web-based interface, if an image is inserted too large for a theme's width, the largest version possible for the theme is displayed. Something about how the image is inserted using the app makes this value absolute for the image and breaks the width of a few templates I have tested with on .org (twenty-fourteen and interface at least).﻿
Manager.title: Inserting big images can break the width of certain themes

Manager.description: Use or create a library to avoid widow words in text views. Remove non-breaking space characters in strings.xml Use that especially when we get text from the server:
Manager.title: Better management of widow words

Manager.description: See screenshot below and followed your blog WP Beta: Note: this is a self hosted JP blog.
Manager.title: Empty user names in follow notifications

Manager.description: Add a "time_in_app" property to the "Application Closed" event.
Manager.title: Add ability to see how long a user uses the app for to Analytics

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Reader should store whether a post is in a Jetpack blog

Manager.title: Reader comment likes don't stick

Manager.description: When the user likes a post in the reader list view, the content may be removed and will not appear in the detail view.
Manager.title: Liking a post in the reader list may remove its content

Manager.description: The detail view in notifications should listen for Simperium note bucket changes. For example, when viewing a follow notification and you receive a new follower, we could update the list instantly.
Manager.title: Notifications detail should listen for note changes

Manager.description: See [AnalyticsTrackerWPCom][https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/WordPress/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/analytics/AnalyticsTrackerWPCom.java] stats aren't used adds unnecessary network activity
Manager.title: Remove wordpress.com reader stats ping

Manager.description: The media/themes lists would look better if we: Cropped the images to square in media Removed the grey border from around a grid item Have the theme screenshot extend beneath theme title so that the alpha shows
Manager.title: Improve Media/Themes Grid Layout

Manager.description: From a user: I just tried to upload a post to WordPress using the latest version of the Android app, but instead it has deleted the entire content on the post. The progress bar showed it had uploaded all the images, then at the last second it gave an error saying missing peer certificate or something like that. When I opened it again in the WordPress App, it was blank! Only the post settings (keywords/categories etc) remain. I was able to upload a different post 5 min before and I have uploaded one since as well (5 min after this happened). I checked on the server and the post is there, but it's blank. Only categories are there. Pictures are on the server, but not attached to any post. Not sure how this could happen, may worth to take a closer look at the posting service.
Manager.title: Post is blank after an error during the upload

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Notifications: Badge view is no longer vertically centered

Manager.description: On a dual pane post list: when switching from a blog with a selected post to a blog with no post: Note: This will be fixed when we drop the dual pane screens.
Manager.title: Landscape tablet, post list updates but not the selected post

Manager.description: Not sure when this started happening, but at some point reader detail lost the ability to show images in private posts (they appear as broken images now).
Manager.title: Reader detail fails to show images in private posts

Manager.description: For some EditText, we should automatically save the content and restore it when the user is back. Example usage: User starts typing a comment in the Reader then navigate back to the post content - if he taps the comment button again (on the same post), the app should retrieve previously typed comment and prefill the comment box. The ideal solution should work on any EditText widget.
Manager.title: Auto save and restore EditText content

Manager.description: On Lollipop our post FAB has a shadow via the elevation property, but there isn't a shadow on earlier Android versions. We may be able to use one of the FAB drawables from IOSched.
Manager.title: FAB needs a shadow

Manager.description: Looks like this should span the full width, but there's some blue space to the sides:
Manager.title: Reader comment form has goofy margin

Manager.description: Load a post like notification Tap the title at the top Observe 'WordPress' displayed in the title:
Manager.title: 'WordPress' displayed as title in post preview

Manager.description: The width of the menu drawer is hard-coded. Instead it should follow the spec with the necessary fudging to determine the optimal width.
Manager.title: Menu drawer width doesn't follow the spec

Manager.description: Settings shouldn't have a different background color Selection color should be gray-ish Add a divider below notifications Follow the specs regarding margins
Manager.title: Drawer tweaks

Manager.description: Using a RecyclerView would add animations when notifications are added/removed/updated in the list 👍
Manager.title: Notifications: Convert to RecyclerView

Manager.description: With the addition of the header, there's now a tiny amount of scroll in the nav drawer. Maybe we can tighten it up a bit to get rid of that scroll so you can clearly see all of the items? https://cloudup.com/cTrPoWDu7_y
Manager.title: Awkward bit of scrolling in the nav drawer

Manager.description: While converting notifications to use RecyclerView, I noticed that the Reader doesn't preserve the list scroll position when you rotate. I think we can use this property to get the position of visible elements: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v7/widget/LinearLayoutManager.html#findFirstCompletelyVisibleItemPosition()
Manager.title: Reader: Post List RecyclerView should restore its scroll offset on rotate/recreate

Manager.description: Only for publishing and scheduling (not updating). WPiOS code: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS/blob/d008ffdc06b5cd8bd42aec366a38a4d0bdb2b805/WordPress/Classes/ViewRelated/Post/WPLegacyEditPostViewController.m#L680
Manager.title: Add a word count property to publish and schedule mixpanel events

Manager.description: Since the switch to round avatars, we need to match up the moderation progress bar overlay to be circular as well:
Manager.title: Moderation progressbar needs rounding

Manager.description: WPiOS ref: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#2890
Manager.title: Adjust site menu tracking, replace properties by events

Manager.description: When switching between drawer activities, there's sometimes some very brief flicker on the incoming activity. Hard to reproduce, but I see it most often when switching between posts and comments.
Manager.title: Flicker when switching between drawer activities

Manager.description: If you reply to a comment in the Reader, it will show at the correct indent for a split second, and then reappear with no indent: https://cloudup.com/c3ER9PBYSC0
Manager.title: Reader: Adding a comment reply won't appear at correct indent hierarcy

Manager.description: Including the header view in each row seems excessive, and it causes a few weird animation issues in certain scenarios (such as when trashing a comment that contains the header). Might work best to have them be their own rows, which would fix the animation stuff but make the adapter harder to maintain...
Manager.title: Notifications: List headers refactor?

Manager.description: Corresponding WPiOS file - https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPressCom-Analytics-iOS/blob/da9f87cb6c04fadbc787ff1562437c363fd943fa/WordPressCom-Analytics-iOS/WPAnalytics.h Here are the endpoints that are presently missing in Android: WPAnalyticsStatAddedSelfHostedSiteButJetpackNotConnectedToWPCom, WPAnalyticsStatEditorDiscardedChanges, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedBlockquote, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedBold, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedHTML, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedImage, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedItalic, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedLink, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedMore, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedOrderedList, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedStrikethrough, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedUnderline, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedUnlink, WPAnalyticsStatEditorTappedUnorderedList, WPAnalyticsStatLoginFailed, WPAnalyticsStatLoginFailedToGuessXMLRPC, WPAnalyticsStatNotificationFollowAction, WPAnalyticsStatNotificationLiked, WPAnalyticsStatNotificationUnapproved, WPAnalyticsStatNotificationUnfollowAction, WPAnalyticsStatNotificationUnliked, WPAnalyticsStatNotificationsMissingSyncWarning, WPAnalyticsStatSelectedLearnMoreInConnectToJetpackScreen, WPAnalyticsStatSkippedConnectingToJetpack, WPAnalyticsStatSupportOpenedHelpshiftScreen, WPAnalyticsStatSupportReceivedResponseFromSupport, WPAnalyticsStatSupportSentMessage, WPAnalyticsStatSupportSentReplyToSupportMessage,
Manager.title: Align Android's Stats tracking with iOS's

Manager.description: Same fix as #2078 except for the comment list - demo video.
Manager.title: Comment moderation needs round background

Manager.title: App crash on startup on some devices without Google services

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Update translations before 3.5 release

Manager.description: Right now the reader scans IMG tags looking for a suitable featured image when one isn't specified in the post, but it should first check the attachments when the post is initially parsed.
Manager.title: Reader should check attachments for suitable featured image

Manager.description: The toolbar title should be 72dp from the left according to these guidelines: http://www.google.com/design/spec/layout/metrics-keylines.html Also see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26455027/android-api-21-toolbar-padding
Manager.title: Set toolbar title keyline to match material guidelines

Manager.description: Tapping someone in your list of "Recent Followers" should show you that person's blog, but instead it does nothing - video demo.
Manager.title: Nothing happens when a follower is tapped

Manager.description: These appear to be isolated to Android 4.X, I don't see it on Lollipop: Blog spinner doesn't have proper right padding. (Note, I had a similar issue in Simplenote and I fixed it by changing the drawer layout's width to match_parent) Drawer shadow gets cut off at the bottom.
Manager.title: Nav Drawer Layout Issues

Manager.description: http://www.google.com/design/spec/layout/metrics-keylines.html Discussion started here: #2106
Manager.title: Update reader spacings to match Material guidelines

Manager.description: The icon that appears when you have more than one PN looks empty on Lollipop due to the lighter background.
Manager.title: Push notification icon looks empty on lollipop

Manager.description: The new Stats need a "Material-ization" of the UI. Modifying just few things in this first version will make a good call.
Manager.title: Material-ization of Stats

Manager.description: Rotating the device a couple times while years data is loading ends up with a bar chart with only one year visible. The ugly chart appears when there isn't enough data to fill the whole viewport/space reserved to the graph. Try to debug this on blogs created in the last year.
Manager.title: Bar chart issue on "Years" timeframe with few data

Manager.description: Merge the first patch (total rewrite of Stats) #2105 Fine grain control on Stats rest calls #2141 Optional Fix the issue where the graph with few items in it is rendered badly #2117
Manager.title: Calypso Stats Stab list

Manager.description: The "message bar" used in the reader is hacky, requiring an included layout in each activity/fragment that uses it. Rewrite it as a custom view.
Manager.title: Rewrite reader message bar

Manager.description: Using http://pngquant.org/ - only do that for the biggest images (background, logo, etc)
Manager.title: Optimize biggest png to reduce final apk size

Manager.description: Customer reports that clicking the follow button in Reader detail correctly changed the color of the button text but didn't change the text to "Following." Scrolling down and then back up somehow corrected the text. Same thing happened a couple of times while viewing Freshly Pressed, but unable to repro after leaving FP and coming back to it.
Manager.title: Reader detail follow color

Manager.description: When sharing a post to Twitter, the tweet simply contains the URL of the post. It would be better if it included the title, and preferably used a wp.me link rather than the full post link. It would also be nice to include the twitter handle of the author, but this may not be possible. For example, here's what our own publicize feature publishes:
Manager.title: Reader sharing to Twitter needs work

Manager.description: Add a LICENSE file with the proper license for this project. Update the README file to include the name of the license.
Manager.title: Missing LICENSE

Manager.description: Probably due to the transparent-status-bar-under-navigation-drawer patch
Manager.title: Weird status bar color on 10" tablet landscape

Manager.description: Comments in the reader use a gray background color if they're from the author of the post, which doesn't look good with the blue activity background.
Manager.title: Change background color for reader author comments

Manager.description: Start the app fresh. Load notifications, tap into a like or follow notification Observe for a few seconds, and you'll see a flicker as all of the list reloads.
Manager.title: Notification detail list flicker

Manager.description: In the iOS app, when the user returns to the reader it loads new content above where you left off, so it stays scrolled to the post you were last looking at. Consider mimicking this in the Android app, perhaps with some indication that newer posts exist.
Manager.title: Reader should remember where the user left off

Manager.description: On user interaction, we need to request data for endpoints that really need to be updated.
Manager.title: Fine grain control on what endpoints are called upon user interaction

Manager.description: I believe it should be in the right corner of the detail view in this case. Probably a lot of work because we'd need to do something about the toolbar in the detail view:
Manager.title: FAB is out of place on a landscape tablet

Manager.description: Right now the reader syncs the user's tags/lists only at startup, or when they tap the tag icon at the top right of the reader. This means tags/lists added from the web reader may not appear in the app if it's already running.
Manager.title: Reader should sync tags/lists more regularly

Manager.description: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.MenuBuilder at android.support.v7.widget.ActionMenuView.getMenu(ActionMenuView.java:620) at android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar.ensureMenu(Toolbar.java:825) at android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar.getMenu(Toolbar.java:817) at android.support.v7.internal.app.ToolbarActionBar.getMenu(ToolbarActionBar.java:554) at android.support.v7.internal.app.ToolbarActionBar.setListMenuPresenter(ToolbarActionBar.java:558) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.setSupportActionBar(ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.java:178) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity.setSupportActionBar(ActionBarActivity.java:92) at org.wordpress.android.ui.WPDrawerActivity.onCreate(WPDrawerActivity.java:107) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsActivity.onCreate(PostsActivity.java:61) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5122) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1150) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2315) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2403) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:165) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1373) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:107) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:194) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5391) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:833) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:600) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java) Samsung specific issue, see: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=78377 There is a workaround by using proguard to rename the class.
Manager.title: Crash report 3.5: NoClassDefFoundError / Samsung 4.2.2 issue

Manager.description: Tapping on the title of the article In "Post and Pages" should open the post details page. The "more" icon instead should offer the ability to open it in the Reader.
Manager.title: Add single post details page

Manager.description: It's close, needs to be adjusted by a few dps:
Manager.title: Notifications: Align to 72dp ActionBar Title

Manager.description: Happens at least on a LG Optimus G and a Huawei Ascend G510
Manager.title: Users report the hamburger icon is not tapable

Manager.description: Simperium/simperium-android#167
Manager.title: ANR on the Notification screen

Manager.description: Especially on WPDrawerActivity subclasses where the menu drawer is initialized in onCreate.
Manager.title: Remove "android:configChanges" config in AndroidManifest.xml if not really needed

Manager.description: The app should reopen the last active activity. I tested a bit and I can't reproduce the problem (last active activity is reoppened).
Manager.title: Users report landing screen is always "Posts" since 3.5

Manager.description: When you tap on a post title in Stats, it shows the post in the Reader but it says 'WordPress' in the title. I believe it will use the activity title if it is available, but perhaps it isn't able to get it because there's a Spinner being used in the action bar?
Manager.title: Stats: Viewing post shows 'WordPress' in Reader title

Manager.description: "Recommended Blogs" should be titled "Blogs you may like" to more closely match the web reader (and, soon, iOS app).
Manager.title: Reader: rename "Recommended blogs"

Manager.description: If you reply to a comment in Notifications or the Reader, you won't get any autocorrect suggestions above the keyboard. From a quick poke around in the code, it appears to be related to using a subclass of AutoCompleteTextView
Manager.title: Autocorrect stopped working in comment reply field

Manager.description: See: https://developer.wordpress.com/docs/oauth2/ https://developer.wordpress.com/2014/07/04/authentication-improvements-for-testing-your-apps/
Manager.title: Add a paragraph in CONTRIBUTING.md to explain how to get a OAUTH.APP.ID/SECRET

Manager.description: Some wp.com users don't have a primary site, so the api won't provide a site id. We should fall back to using the Url if it was provided, and open it in the in-app browser.
Manager.title: Notifications: Fall back to using URL when loading blog preview

Manager.description: Some wp.com users have a primary site marked as private, so the Reader API will receive a 403 as response code (ex: https://public-api.wordpress.com/rest/v1/sites/kevinjmorrisuk.wordpress.com ) and the UI shows a simple error message "Unable to show this blog" in a Toast. I don't have much control over the Reader Blog Preview page from Stats, so it's hard for me to do something if an error occurs in the Reader. Should we modify the Blog preview page, and open the blog URL in the in-app browser when something is wrong with the REST API call? I bet we have the same issue on self-hosted blog that are HTTP password protected. /cc @nbradbury @roundhill
Manager.title: Stats: Should we fall back to using URL when loading blog preview of private blogs, or HTTP protected blogs

Manager.description: Pictures are shown as top-level entry in "Posts and Pages" module, but cannot be opened in the Reader when tapping on them. The Reader api returns a 404 error since they are not posts/pages. This should be probably fixed in the backend. A new field that identifies the kind of the item should do the trick. Once we see a picture, we will call the in-app web browser instead of Reader.
Manager.title: Stats: Pictures are shown as entry in "Posts and Pages" module but cannot be opened in Reader

Manager.description: Capitalizing a topic can result in a properly formatted topic like "WordPress" being displayed as "Wordpress" (capital P dangit!). Tweak the logic so we only capitalize when necessary.
Manager.title: Reader: Adjust how topics are capitalized

Manager.description: We finally have a nice color system in WordPress.com for the grays and the naming. I'd like to update the colors file to reflect those changes. Here are the latest colors: https://wordpress.com/design-handbook/colors/ This will include changing the variable names to be more consistent with WordPress.com. For example, instead of grey_extra_light, grey_medium_light, etc, it would be gray_light, gray_dark, gray_lighten_20, etc.
Manager.title: Design: update colors and variables

Manager.description: The blog name extends to the edge, which looks wrong when pressed.
Manager.title: Blog name in reader blog preview should use wrap_content

Manager.description: When a user hit the login error "We can't log you in", we should give him some options to read and share the server response and contact support if the server response doesn't help. This error should only happen on self hosted sites, most of the time it's due to a server misconfiguration. We should also consider some common self hosted errors like a 403 on xmlrpc.php (we could redirect to the FAQ)
Manager.title: On generic login error, add a button to easily share server response or contact support

Manager.description: The reader blog preview needs an "empty message" of some sort (right now it just shows an empty list with no indication of why it's empty).
Manager.title: Blog preview needs empty message

Manager.description: Title has it. There are 2 TODOs in place in the code.
Manager.title: Stats: Track analytics on StatsViewAllActivity and StatsSinglePostDetailsActivity

Manager.description: Title has it, it is currently the light blue color.
Manager.title: Edit comment activity background should be white

Manager.description: We have a couple of tickets from customers reporting that following never works, but the app log doesn't include any information about the failure.
Manager.title: Better logging of reader follow failures

Manager.description: Ideally it would be the same w/h as all avatar and icons outer constraints. https://cloudup.com/cnUhHtF3aOJ
Manager.title: The touch target of the More button seems too small

Manager.description: Alignment, line height, and maybe letter spacing is off for the View All link. See what I mean: https://cloudup.com/cbOSteYVppY
Manager.title: Alignment, line height, and maybe letter spacing is off for the View All link.

Manager.description: Due to the length of the list in the Followers detail view, and the need to have pagination, I think it would be best to duplicate the pagination at the top of the screen as well. Perhaps this could only be done on devices where all items can’t be shown without scrolling, that would be a nice touch.
Manager.title: Duplicate the pagination at the top of the screen as well

Manager.description: Ultimately we’ll probably want Views and Visitors to have the same y-scale, just throwing this in here
Manager.title: Views and Visitors should probably have the same y-scale

Manager.description: There should be a little more space below the Views: labels in the post summary, i.e. https://cloudup.com/cYOPImghgaL
Manager.title: Add a little more space below the Views labels in post details screen

Manager.description: The API now has an option to get flat country icons, we should use them https://cloudup.com/cvAVI2PLyyq
Manager.title: Use flat icon in Countries

Manager.description: There should be a map for the Countries module, even if it’s only illustrative like a generated heatmap.
Manager.title: Add a map in Countries module

Manager.description: “No stats available” message should use the same copy/style as the “No activity this period” and overlay an empty chart with “ghost” bars to indicate that the days are still tappable. Compare to web stats.
Manager.title: “No stats available” message should use the same copy/style as the “No activity this period”

Manager.description: We're showing 7 bars on small screen and 9 on bigger devices. Should we fallback to 5/9 like the web version?
Manager.title: Number of bars in Graph
Design tweaks part I
Design tweaks part II

Manager.description: Chart changes width when switching between different data sets, presumably because its width is dependent on the width of the y-axis label elements ... these should probably be unrelated. Maybe better to allow for up to 1M on the y-axis as a max, always, and then let y-axis labels overflow into the chart itself?
Manager.title: Chart changes width when switching between different data sets

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Update translations before 3.6 release

Manager.description: Behavior when changing orientation should be consistent. Here's a list of screens I've checked and what network calls they make on configuration change: Activity Behavior Posts/Pages always auto-refresh Select Post Categories (inside Edit Post Settings) no auto-refresh Comments no auto-refresh Media no auto-refresh Reader varies, see below Notifications no auto-refresh Stats no auto-refresh Stats - Single Post Details no auto-refresh Stats - View All no auto-refresh Themes no auto-refresh Manage Blogs (Settings > Show/hide WordPress.com blogs) no auto-refresh Reader details: Will always auto-update /read/menu and read/following/mine. Will also auto-update /read/liked or /read/following if those are selected from the menu. Will auto-update selected blog if 10 minutes have passed since last refresh.
Manager.title: Don't unconditionally auto-refresh remote data on configuration change

Manager.description: It was used for debugging, it's not very useful and generate too many mixpanel events
Manager.title: Remove Mixpanel MEMORY_TRIMMED_COMPLETE event

Manager.title: Crash report 3.6: ClassCastException in StatsCommentsFragment

Manager.description: When creating activities which use the SwipeToRefreshHelper, the SwipeRefreshLayout isn't displayed while loading. This appears to be a known issue with the v4 support library (since 21.0.0). It seems that the SwipeRefreshLayout is actually loading and working properly, but it's hidden behind the action bar. Some discussion and possible workarounds here.
Manager.title: SwipeRefreshLayout is not displayed in freshly created activities

Manager.description: If you load a theme, and tap 'Live Preview', the preview is loaded and changes the title to the URL of the site. If you leave the preview, the URL title sticks.
Manager.title: Previewing a theme permanently sets title

Manager.description: The follow button added to the toolbar in this PR looks out of place, despite matching the follow buttons used elsewhere in the app. Try other approaches, such as dark blue with white text.
Manager.title: Redesign reader follow button in toolbar

Manager.description: I noticed that images seem to take a while to load in the app occasionally. I decided to see how large the images were that photon was returning in the Reader, for example. They are quite large! Luckily photon has a quality parameter that we can use to trim down the size. Here's what the app currently gets, I'm pretty sure photon is defaulting to 100 (uncompressed). This file is 139KB: I tried the same at quality=80 and it takes the size down to 57KB (woot): And here's quality=50, which I think pushes the quality down too far (39KB): We should add another optional parameter to PhotonUtils.getPhotonImageUrl() where we can pass the quality value in to whatever we desire. It'd be even cooler to adjust the quality value based on the device's current connection.
Manager.title: Take Advantage of Photon's Quality Parameter

Manager.description: See the video: https://cloudup.com/c5frJpd8Nec and this https://cloudup.com/co1xaAjoiMl This should probably happen even on Post preview screen when opened from notification.
Manager.title: Reader - Blog preview screen screen doesn't open "modal" on 10" tablets

Manager.description: From an user: I have three blogs named “XXX”. I only wanted two to be visible, but it wasn’t immediately clear which one was which. I had to exit the hide screen, and look at the post screen for each blog. If we provided the URL / subdomain it would clear up which was which.
Manager.title: Add url subtitles on Show/hide blogs settings

Manager.description: Should we do that automattically?
Manager.title: Update AboutActivity copyright year

Manager.description: Current error message when a user tries to login: generic message: "We can't log you in" We must change it to: "No network available" and only display the "cancel" button.
Manager.title: Login screen: in airplane mode, show a "No connection" error

Manager.description: Let's implement a new URL handler that will help us troubleshoot Notification issues: wordpress://notifications?bucket_name=string When received, the app should map the Notifications bucket as specified. This will allow us to use enterprise builds to retrieve entities stored in [any random] bucket, and test how they are rendered.
Manager.title: Notifications test bucket for devs

Manager.description: The notifications list should show a replied icon if a user has replied to a comment notification: https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/618551/5865730/21bea10e-a251-11e4-9d93-48372fb2d2ad.png
Manager.title: Notifications: Add replied noticon to list view

Manager.description: Permission Denial: not allowed to send broadcast android.intent.action.MEDIA_MOUNTED from pid=13367, uid=10242 14 – StackTrace: java.lang.SecurityException: Permission Denial: not allowed to send broadcast android.intent.action.MEDIA_MOUNTED from pid=13367, uid=10242
Manager.title: Replace ACTION_MEDIA_MOUNTED broadcast that seems protected since Kitkat

Manager.description: I've found myself double posting via the app a number of times What I do: Create a post Add an image Hit publish Say to myself "hmm, I didn't get any confirmation, I wonder if that worked?" Open the post Hit publish again Facepalm
Manager.title: Double Posting

Manager.description: I've figured out the process for this, but it seems very counter-intuitive to press the back button in order to publish a post that you're working on. I would wager that we're losing users who get frustrated and leave (I almost did)
Manager.title: Getting from Post Creation (keyboard up) to Publish

Manager.description: It happens rarely on site defining RSD link like
Manager.title: Crash report 3.7-rc-2: invalid rsd or xmlrpc URL starting with "//example.com" (no scheme)

Manager.description: Use the strip parameter with Photon-ized images to save a little bandwidth.
Manager.title: Use Photon strip parameter

Manager.description: Module tab behavior is reversed. Active tab should be solid while inactive tab should be hollow: Add a bit more space after column title:
Manager.title: Minor UI updates for 3.8

Manager.description: Make two-factor authentication easier: Remove the requirement for an app-specific password, instead allow entry of the time-based code from an auth app or sms. Maybe integrate with the auth apps to see if we can get the code instantly (not sure if authy/google have available intents for something like that) Implement #911 so that xml-rpc requests will still work.
Manager.title: Improve WP.com Two-Factor Authentication

Manager.description: The login screens seem to be using the default lollipop green-ish blue-ish color for the accent:
Manager.title: Incorrect accent color on login activity

Manager.description: We should show each site's icon beside it in the list of blogs. In order to do this, we need to store the icon/image retrieved from the REST "me" call here in the accounts table.
Manager.title: Add site images to accounts DB

Manager.description: The blog list in ManageBlogsActivity could benefit from the addition of the blavatar of each blog.
Manager.title: Show blavatars on ManageBlogsActivity

Manager.description: Use new /read/feed/{feedId}/posts to get posts in a feed when showing blog preview (currently previewing a feed fails to show its posts).
Manager.title: Use new feed endpoint for Reader blog preview

Manager.description: Some users want to use the app translated in a different language than their device. Or even use a language not supported by Android. We should create a language selector in the Settings screen to force a certain language selection.
Manager.title: Language selector in Settings

Manager.description: Now that the following button is in the toolbar, scroll the header that appears in blog/tag preview with the posts.
Manager.title: Reader blog/tag preview header should scroll with the posts

Manager.description: In the list of blogs/feeds you follow, the default blavatar is the WP icon regardless of whether the site is WP. This bug was one I introduced in this PR.
Manager.title: Reader shouldn't show WP icon for non-WP sites

Manager.description: For consistency with the iOS app, drop the mshot and follower count, and show the blavatar.
Manager.title: Drop mshot and follower count from reader blog preview

Manager.description: After unfollowing a blog from the detail view and returning to the list view, tapping a post opens the wrong detail.
Manager.title: Reader opens incorrect post

Manager.description: The app is incorrectly looking for the comment actions in the last item in the array. It should instead look for a comment type block within the body, and grab the actions from that: WordPress-Android/WordPress/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/models/Note.java Lines 234 to 240 in b52152b JSONObject getCommentActions() { if (mActions == null) { mActions = queryJSON("body[last].actions", new JSONObject()); } return mActions; }
Manager.title: Notifications: Correct comment notification 'action' block retrieval

Manager.description: In blog preview, if the request to get the posts for a blog fails the user sees a message saying "this blog is empty." It should instead say that the posts could not be loaded.
Manager.title: Reader empty blog message shows on failure

Manager.description: Add a site to your account that has no title Go to Settings -> Show/hide WordPress.com blogs You'll find the site in the 'h' section of the list (I'm assuming because of the 'http' in the site URL)
Manager.title: Blogs with no title show in unexpected spot in show/hide blogs view

Manager.description: A new Helpshift conversation can be started from the login screen after an error, on the help screen or in the settings screen after login. We must track the origin (have a look at Helpshift analytics or simply use a tag)
Manager.title: Track origin of new Helpshift conversations

Manager.description: Try out an event bus with the reader as an experiment. We may want to use an event bus more widely in the future, and this gives us a small area to test with.
Manager.title: Use EventBus for reader

Manager.description: If a site in the Show/Hide WordPress.com blogs list doesn't have a blavatar, it shows the app icon which looks a bit strange with the new materialized icon. It should use a standard WP logo.
Manager.title: Show/Hide WordPress.com blogs list shows app icon

Manager.description: One report of this in 3.7: Fatal Exception: java.lang.IllegalStateException Fragement no longer exists for key f0: index 0
Manager.title: Reader photo viewer illegal state

Manager.description: Caused by using API 16 removeOnGlobalLayoutListener() instead of the deprecated removeGlobalOnLayoutListener() here.
Manager.title: 3.7 ReaderPostList NoSuchMethod exception

Manager.description: Do not open the Reader Blog Preview by using the blogURL, since the method is deprecated. Use the blogID.
Manager.title: Remove deprecated method call in Followers -> Blog Preview

Manager.description: The web version of Stats has introduced a 2-columns layout on desktop, and large mobile screen. We need to experimenting it, and check if replicable on this native app, or add a padding to the left and right. The latter is the solution used on all other app's screens.
Manager.title: UI layout on larger tablets

Manager.description: The web version of Stats is going to introduce a new way to show users the relation between the counts of Views and Visitors. We should replicate the new UI in this native app. Below is a screenshot of what is going to be web stats on mobile. The PR is not yet merged/deployed to users, and minor changes could happen in the next few days, but we can already start implementing it, since changes required to show 2 dataset in the graph are not small.
Manager.title: New Approach to Views / Visitors

Manager.description: The app is incorrectly looking for site_id in a site range, it should be pulling id.
Manager.title: Notifications: Correct site id retrieval for 'site' range type

Manager.description: Line 52-53 in CONTRIBUTING.md: * hotfix/x.y.z if the change if a fix for a released version, * release/x.y if the change if a fix for a beta or release candidate, Should be: * hotfix/x.y.z if the change is a fix for a released version, * release/x.y if the change is a fix for a beta or release candidate,
Manager.title: typo in CONTRIBUTING.md

Manager.description: Maybe it would be nice to show the build information of TravisCI in the readme?
Manager.title: Build status information in readme

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to the Stats menu Scroll down to the Referrers section Expand some of the sites including multiple URLs Scroll back up and tap on the graph to choose a different date Scroll down: some of the previously expanded links still appear over the new data.
Manager.title: Layout issues with group items on period change (ie. Referrers)

Manager.description: We're now using EventBus in the reader. We should port our old event broadcast to it. SuggestionService + receivers XMLRPCClient + receivers StatisticsService + receivers MediaUploadService + receivers NotificationsUtils + receivers BlogList Update + receivers Ref. #2332
Manager.title: Replace local event broadcasting by EventBus

Manager.description: This is an edgecase. It should probably be prioritized as such. I start photo-posts by sharing from the gallery to the WordPress app. If I start uploading a post like that, and then immediately start another, no photo will be inserted in the post editor. Steps to reproduce: open photo gallery, share photo to WordPress app, hit publish before the previous post has successfully uploaded, pick another photo in the photo gallery, share to the WordPress app to start a post The 2nd post will be empty. There will be a brief toast that says "Loading...", but no photo is inserted in the editor. Here's a logcat: https://cloudup.com/ccFZ1t8RjMG The obvious workaround is to wait for the first post to upload before starting the next.
Manager.title: Can't insert pictures via share intent if in the process of uploading another post

Manager.description: A few times this weekend I returned to the app in the Reader, and it automatically refreshed the list. But sometimes it wouldn't save my place in the list, instead refreshing the entire list and I was at the top and lost my place. It still showed the 'New Posts ^' button even though I was at the very top of the new posts. I think it's only doing this if the app was killed and is starting up again. Hard one to reproduce.
Manager.title: Reader occasionally shows 'New Posts' after refresh.
Action bar text looks small in landscape orientation
