Manager.title: Crash report 3.7: pointerIndex out of range in SwipeRefreshLayout

Manager.description: In #2376 I added styling to the reply header, but as originally described the title of the post should use a different color as well. This would involve adding color support to NotificationsUtils.getSpannableContentFromIndices. cc: @roundhill
Manager.title: Notification reply header post color

Manager.description: If you go to the comments for a post that doesn't have any comments, the message "No comments yet" appears in the middle of the screen. This message needs to be removed if you post a comment.
Manager.title: Reader comment empty message not removed after adding comment

Manager.description: Web version of stats changed the logic around that module. It's always on the screen now. We need to replicate the behavior on Android.
Manager.title: Do not remove the Authors module from the screen

Manager.description: Add support for BoldLight and BoldLightItalic to TypefaceCache. This will be needed for the upcoming "masterbar" changes.
Manager.title: TypefaceCache should support semi-bold

Manager.description: Action bar has a zero elevation settings on most screens, excepted on notification details (at least).
Manager.title: Set a consistent elevation (shadow) across the app on the action bar

Manager.description: Current stats color mix colors from the handbook and custom colors. We've made that change #2185 (comment) - we can revert it if we only want custom colors or update the Web version accordingly. I've added a TODO in the develop branch here: WordPress-Android/WordPress/src/main/res/values/colors.xml Lines 113 to 115 in e062fae
Manager.title: Update stats colors before 3.9 code freeze

Manager.description: Now that we are adding the "View Admin" button in the "My Site" page, there is no need to have that button in the BlogPreferencesActivity anymore. Aside from that, there are some other possible changes we might need to make as a result of all the masterbar changes.
Manager.title: Update Blog Preferences page to reflect masterbar changes

Manager.description: The implementation details and necessary activity for it is a bit unclear at the moment. We basically want a way to add new media to the selected blog from the my site page.
Manager.title: Implement "Add Media" button in My Site page

Manager.description: CommentListFragment is accessing extras without doing a null check here. This appears to be harmless in the release version, but needs to be fixed for our masterbar branch.
Manager.title: CommentListFragment NPE

Manager.description: In #2185 the value of black was changed to @color/grey_dark which is pretty confusing :) That needs to be changed back to #000000 and all text color references to it should be changed to use @color/grey_dark.
Manager.title: Correct the definition and usage of color/black

Manager.description: I am getting this build error: Error:A problem was found with the configuration of task ':checkVanillaDebugManifest'. File 'C:\Users\NAME\AndroidStudioProjects\WordPress\src\main\AndroidManifest.xml' specified for property 'manifest' does not exist. But the manifest is in: 'C:\Users\NAME\AndroidStudioProjects\WordPress\WordPress\src\main\AndroidManifest.xml Android Studio is looking for it in the wrong place. Where do I change the location? Thanks
Manager.title: android studio 1.1.0

Manager.description: Add tracking so we can tell when reader post detail was opened from: Normal post list Blog preview Tag preview Related iOS PR here.
Manager.title: Track where reader post detail is opened from

Manager.description: Implement wpios - WPAnalyticsStatEditorAddedPhotoViaLocalLibrary add new properties to that event to count number of medias added at the same time (media multi selection) maybe trigger it here
Manager.title: New analytics to track number of selected pictures in the media picker

Manager.description: From #2317 For every media item selected by the user a WPImageSpan is added to the post. This work is done serially and on the main thread, if there are too many items selected the editor will hang until all the spans are generated. The bitmaps for the WPImageSpans should be generated on a background thread to reduce user impact. See video
Manager.title: Adding media to post should be done on background thread

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Update translations before 3.8 release

Manager.description: Introduced in #2185, the new color makes the dialog hard to read: I temporarly changed it to grey_darken_30: @drw158 Can we use another existing (transparent?) color or define a new one?
Manager.title: Change the sign in dialog background color

Manager.description: Instead of having a blank tab with a loading indicator when the picker is loading new site images/videos: show an empty view saying "Fetching images/videos..." (like in Post/Page screen). If the app fails to load the media library: display a toast (already done) and change the empty view (from "Fetching" to "Unable to fetch images" - copy the Post/Page screen behavior).
Manager.title: Empty views in the media picker

Manager.description: XMLRPCClientInterface interface changed (new getResponse() method), both mocks should be updated accordingly
Manager.title: Update XMLRPCClientCustomizableJSONMock and XMLRPCClientCustomizableXMLMock

Manager.description: Open media features. Turn off the internet connection. Delete an item from the grid list. It's deleted on the app, but not deleted on the website. Sony Xperia C2005. API 18. Jelly Bean.
Manager.title: Offline delete media item doesn't work as expected

Manager.description: Would be great to get to the bottom of the missing notification, but if it can't be found the previous activity should be loaded.
Manager.title: Sometimes tapping a notification leads to blank screen

Manager.description: We need an Account model where we keep information about the user such as their username, email, gravatar url, if it's a WordPress.com user or not etc. Ideally there should be a way to get the default WordPress.com account user so we can use that information in the new "Me" page. This will also be good for us developers for information management on account login/logout and when the user updates his/her information.
Manager.title: Storing account details for the user

Manager.description: Its possible to dismiss the edit media screen, and even open the menu, without dismissing the keyboard. To reproduce: Open the menu and tap Media Tap an item to view its detail Tap to edit the item Tap into one of the textfields to invoke the keyboard. Tap the back button on the Action bar You've navigated back to the detail view but the keyboard is still visible. Bonus: Keep tapping back til you reach the root activity Tap to open the menu. The keyboard is still present.
Manager.title: Media: Keyboard remains visible when tapping back button

Manager.description: When you tap on Notifications, the highlight shows over the border at the bottom of the header: Sony Z3 compact, Android 4.4.4
Manager.title: Navigation Drawer: Notifications tap highlight shows over border

Manager.description: A 'View all followers' link is going to be added to the footer of new follower notifications. When tapped it should show a list of all of the followers of the site. Perhaps we can use the same fragment that Stats uses to show the follower list.
Manager.title: Notifications: Show view of all followers

Manager.description: Per discussion on #2426, this was only noticed on API 16.
Manager.title: Offline delete media item doesn't work as expected on API 16

Manager.description: In some cases PostUploadService.onDestroy() is not called, and a post could be stuck in "uploading" state. It's tricky but we must find a way to clean this state in some cases on PostsList onCreate.
Manager.title: Clean the "uploading" state for failed post uploads or app crash

Manager.description: As part of the masterbar changes, we'll need a new "Me" page. https://cloudup.com/ib8bQhApGYd
Manager.title: Me page

Manager.description: We get users from time-to-time who sign out of the app only to discover all their local drafts have disappeared when they sign back in again. It would be great if there was some kind of warning that these drafts will be lost if they continue with signing out.
Manager.title: Show a warning message before signing out when local drafts are present

Manager.description: Create a new post with the app. Tap the image icon and choose “Select from media library” or choose an image from the "Site images" tab with the media picker (for 3.9+) Choose an image then tap it to edit and tick the box next to “Use as featured image”. Publish the post.
Manager.title: Featured images not working when selected from WP Media Library

Manager.description: For instance: I'm sure we already had an issue opened for this, but I can't find it, and I don't remember what we did.
Manager.title: Some vietnamese characters aren't supported in the font used in the Reader

Manager.description: There appears to be a lag when loading the reader detail view for private posts that contain images, either in the post or in another post that is being loaded in the view pager. It looks to be a block in the ReaderWebView here: WordPress-Android/WordPress/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/ui/reader/views/ReaderWebView.java Lines 221 to 229 in 17c21cd DefaultHttpClient client = new DefaultHttpClient(); HttpGet httpGet = new HttpGet(url); httpGet.setHeader("Authorization", "Bearer " + mToken); try { HttpResponse httpResponse = client.execute(httpGet); InputStream responseInputStream = httpResponse.getEntity().getContent(); return new WebResourceResponse(httpResponse.getEntity().getContentType().toString(), "UTF-8", responseInputStream); } catch (IOException e) { AppLog.e(AppLog.T.READER, "Invalid reader detail request: " + e.getMessage()); The docs say that shouldInterceptRequest() is run on a non-ui thread.
Manager.title: Reader: Lag when loading detail view

Manager.description: in gradle.build we have: compile 'com.crashlytics.android:crashlytics:+' and it resolves to: +--- com.crashlytics.android:crashlytics:+ -> 1.1.13 It looks like they have a new package name: "com.crashlytics.sdk.android:crashlytics" from https://dev.twitter.com/crashlytics/android/build-tools
Manager.title: Update crashlytics / fabric version

Manager.description: PersistentEditText, WordPressGraphView, WordPressComRest could be moved from source project dependencies to maven artefacts
Manager.title: Reduce the number of source project dependencies

Manager.description: We're passing an ordinal value of StatsViewType to StatsViewAllActivity in a few places. We shouldn't need to do this since enums are serializable. Ref: #2464 (comment)
Manager.title: Don't pass ordinal of StatsViewType

Manager.description: WordPress-iOS Ref wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#3463 Helpshift now permits to listen to different events happening in their lib - SDK doc: https://www.helpshift.com/docs/api/android/v3.x/reference/com/helpshift/Helpshift.HelpshiftDelegate.html
Manager.title: Adding tracking for when a user replies to Helpshift

Manager.description: I have several MP3s in my media library, and they display incorrectly in the media browser. When I first visit the media browser there's just an empty white box for each MP3, but after scrolling that white box changes to a thumbnail of one the images in my library.
Manager.title: Incorrect handling of audio files in media browser

Manager.description: If you are logged in as a user on a self-hosted blog, you get a Connection error when backgrounding/foregrounding the app (if WordPress.SECONDS_BETWEEN_BLOGLIST_UPDATE has passed) Screencap from @maxme:
Manager.title: Connection error for non-WPCom users

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Strip GPS data from uploaded pictures if the geolocation option is disabled on post

Manager.description: We've probably lost to code that reset variable isStatsUpdating when switched to EventBus.
Manager.title: Stats - Can't refresh stats after a successful refresh

Manager.description: We would like to centralize how the activities are launched using the new ActivityLauncher class within the viewpager-main-activity branch, so that it'll be easier to maintain in the future and will give us the ability to add animations and so on from one central place.
Manager.title: Centralize how activities are launched

Manager.description: The placeholder that appears when an image failed to download is too dark. Prior to the color palette change it was a light/medium gray.
Manager.title: WPNetworkImageView error placeholder is too dark

Manager.description: I've made small changes to the Tracks library. Need to create a 1.0.1 version, upload the new artifacts to Maven, and change the references in Analytics.
Manager.title: Stats - upgrade the Tracks lib to 1.0.1

Manager.description: As part of masterbar changes, we would like to remove the Logout button from SettingsActivity and move it to the new MeActivity instead. As part of this, let's make the following change in ActivityLauncher: public static void viewSettings(Activity activity) { should be updated as public static void viewSettings(Context context) {. Since we won't need to use startActivityForResult for SettingsActivity, we don't need to know about the activity anymore.
Manager.title: Move logout to Me page

Manager.description: The users can only add a new site from the SettingsActivity. We should also add it to the SitePickerActivity and maybe remove it from the settings page. /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Implement the ability to add a new site in site picker

Manager.description: Code To-Do #2394 Implement "Add Media" button in My Site page (PR #2624) #2645 Redesign reader toolbar (PR #2694) Add third-party FAB, use FAB menu on site picker (PR #2692) #2631 Site picker should mimic web #2628 Logged out reader #2524 Enable logging out of WordPress.com without affecting self-hosted #2608 Site picker cardview pre-L (PR #2609) Use card view for site picker Default blavatar for site picker shouldn't be mystery man (b58194c) #2543 Merge the "show/hide" blog list with the new site picker (PR #2569) #2546 Better tablet layout of My Sites fragment and Me fragment #2453 Me page #2493 Move logout to the Me page (PR #2520) #2504 Site Picker needs ability to add a site [ ] Consistent transitions in ActivityLauncher (may not be necessary - defaults may be fine) #2393 Update Blog Preferences page #2506 Update Settings page Add drop shadow to avatar on Me page Scroll fragment to the top when user taps the active tab (hat tip to @roundhill for the idea) Remove unused resources (lint --check UnusedResources) (PR #2596) Moderating comments from notifications doesn't work Bugs #2625 HTML entities in site title in the My Site tab #2618 Stats on non-JP self-hosted (PR #2580 includes the fix) Switching site bug (requires enabling "Don't keep activities"): https://cloudup.com/csCnBeltWho (PR #2626) #2610 PTR progress on notifications fragment doesn't go away (PR #2611) #2621 "Disconnect from WordPress.com" appears broken when app restarted (PR #2622) #2600 account model issues - must be fixed before dealing with other self-hosted issues (PR #2602) #2584 user can remove the current site if it's self-hosted (PR #2607) #2571 reader shows PTR spinner when it shouldn't #2547 Notifications issues #2545 Post list too wide on tablet #2542 Notification settings crash Crash in photo viewer (tap photo in reader detail) Blank tabs after returning to the app (fixed in 60dbf37) PTR progress appears beneath the reader toolbar Reader toolbar should reappear after user taps "New posts" Site Picker sorts .org blogs to the bottom of the list When you switch from develop to feature/viewpager-main-activity branch, current blog is null in My Site page. Cropped text in the Me tab on small screen ("Disconnect from WordPress."): https://cloudup.com/cIoCouMrtnY #2594 Me tab must be scrollable (matters only on a landscape phone) #2594 Me tab is trying to display stuff (gravatar/@username) with a wporg only account and "Disconnect from wpcom". (PR #2606) Notifications tab is Empty with a wporg account only + a Toast "notifications can't be refreshed..." everytime the Fragment is created. The empty view should say "You need a wpcom account / jetpack to get notifications" (PR #2606) Incorrect helpshift tag when a conversation is started from Me -> Support #2597 Testing Verify smooth upgrade from previous version(s) Verify that sharing still works (ex: share photo from Android Gallery to create a WP post) Verify flow with no wp.com account Verify layouts on both 7" and 9" tablets Verify layouts on 480x800 (look for cropping, etc.) Make sure the login/logout works correctly
Manager.title: Masterbar Punch List

Manager.description: I think this is the culprit. This is an issue with both selecting media and gallery creation.
Manager.title: Selecting images from self-hosted site does not add them to the editor

Manager.description: I noticed several make.wordpress.org sites in my site list that I don't recall ever adding. There seems to have been a slurp of all make sites at some point. I went in to settings to see about removing them and noticed that they all show up as make.wordpress.org. The subdirs that make them unique (/design, /core, /mobile, /flow, etc.) do not show. Contrast this to the iOS app, which does show the subdirs.
Manager.title: Self-hosted multisite subdir sites don't show the subdir in settings list

Manager.description: While testing #2499 I noticed a lot of flickering/refreshing in the media picker's "Site Images" tab, and I believe it's caused by the listener calling notifyDataSetChanged() every time a media item is downloaded (see here). This causes the entire grid to be refreshed with each download.
Manager.title: Unnecessary refresh in media picker

Manager.description: Reported by several users on different devices: Nexus 5 - 5.0.1 Samsung Galaxy S5 - 5.0 ? - 4.4 I wasn't able to repro, potential steps: Create a new post Tap the image button in the toolbar
Manager.title: Tapping the image button in the editor returns the user back to the post list with a local draft

Manager.description: The web version of Stats has just removed the module (sorry @tonyr59h :( it was a last minute decision ) and it will be re-introduced only if there will be a lot of complaints.... Web doesn't have scheduled releases and beta testing phase, they can remove and upgrade Stats in a while. Before a final decision is made about the Published module, hide this module in the mobile app, and don't even start the network call. We will remove the code in the next release, if the Stats team has took a final decision about it. If hiding the module is a problem, I can remove the code altogether. Seems that the final decision to remove the module is taken. We need to remove this on mobile then. /cc @astralbodies @jonathansadowski
Manager.title: Remove the Published Module for now

Manager.description: Insights has just been merged in the web version of Calypso-Stats. We should add this feature to the mobile app. Need help from designers. @jancavan //cc @astralbodies
Manager.title: Add the insights screen

Manager.description: Right now logging out from the Me page always shows the sign-in screen, even if the user has a self-hosted site. It should instead log them out of .com and stay on the Me page. If the user displays the site picker, we should make sure it doesn't show any of their .com blogs.
Manager.title: Masterbar: logout of .com when user has self-hosted

Manager.description: A new notifications panel is coming. It will add the ability to manage notifications for the notifications stream, email, and app push notifications (even multiple devices) from one place.
Manager.title: Add Notifications Settings Panel

Manager.description: If the notification detail activity wasn't able to load the note, it should finish itself. This way the user will be back at the notifications list instead of an empty screen.
Manager.title: Finish notification detail activity if note could not be found

Manager.description: When you're writing a post and press the hardware back button to get out of full screen mode, it brings you back to the previous page. If you have "Use virtual keyboard for text input" in the emulator, it works as expected: https://cloudup.com/ixIdTcFUPQ7
Manager.title: Legacy editor doesn't go out of full screen when hardware back button is pressed

Manager.description: Site picker should be reviewed by a designer (current margins/padding look "cheap"), and the default blavatar shouldn't be the mystery man (since it's a site, not a user).
Manager.title: Masterbar: site picker tweaks

Manager.description: @maxme We need to change events name for Tracks in 4.0 The assumption we made of using the same events names of the Mixpanel tracker seems wrong. It's just a renaming, so I think we can squeeze this in 4.0 Ref: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#3536
Manager.title: Update Tracks event names to follow guidelines

Manager.description: There is an issue where logged out .com users are incorrectly seen by the Tracks tracker as logged in. Background: We've recently implemented an enhancement in the app where the .com username is retained across logout. We now need to be carefully when checking the .com login state. otherwise we can end up in issues like this one, where the user is not logged to .com, but the .com username is stored in preferences, and the tracks was incorrectly assuming that the user was logger.
Manager.title: Make sure to correctly track the .com login state in Tracks

Manager.description: Maybe worth a 3.9.1 if the issue happens for all users. Comment from the Play Store: Every time I go to "View Site" it asks me to login first A second one: After the last update keeps asking you to log in each time you start (remember the option is ignored) Another one: Every time I want to "view full site" on my blog I need to put in my password even though I checked the "remember this password" box. This never happened before the update.
Manager.title: Report 3.9: "View site" authentication issue

Manager.description: The "show/hide" list of blogs in settings can be dumped and its functionality moved to the site picker.
Manager.title: Masterbar: merge the "show/hide" blog list with the new site picker
Masterbar: post list too wide on tablet

Manager.description: These two new fragments should use left/right margin or padding similar to the Reader on tablets. Reader example 1 Reader example 2
Manager.title: Masterbar: better tablet layout of My Sites fragment and Me fragment

Manager.description: Sometimes the unread indicator doesn't go away if you open the app from a push notification. I changed some of the push notifications settings (unticked 'Follows') and it didn't seem to save to the server.
Manager.title: Masterbar: Notifications issues

Manager.description: We should add a way to open the system image picker if they need it.
Manager.title: With the new media picker, users can't browse all folders on their device

Manager.description: I think the editor should link and use the src code of WordPressAnalytics. Like the other library project WordPressUtils that it uses and links. dependencies { compile 'com.android.support:appcompat-v7:21.0.+' compile 'com.android.support:support-v4:21.0.+' releaseCompile project(path:':libs:analytics:WordPressAnalytics', configuration: 'release') debugCompile project(path:':libs:analytics:WordPressAnalytics', configuration: 'debug') releaseCompile project(path:':libs:utils:WordPressUtils', configuration: 'release') debugCompile project(path:':libs:utils:WordPressUtils', configuration: 'debug') } Otherwise we need to make sure to publish new artifacts on each update to the WordPressAnalytics prj. We have modified WordPressAnalytics without incrementing the release number, and publish new artifacts, resulting in weird errors in AS, that could take time to developer to understand what is happening.
Manager.title: Proposal - Editor should use src code of WordPressAnalytics

Manager.description: A placeholder for this week's activity.
Manager.title: Refactor Stats fragments by making them highly modulars and less "Activity" dependent

Manager.description: Seems that the graph library grabs the highest number and then uses it as the top line of the graph. It then tries to find the halfway mark by dividing that by two and displaying that line. However if the highest number is odd it still only displays the half way line as a rounded integer which throws off the visual.
Manager.title: Graph looks a bit off on low numbers Stats

Manager.description: Sometimes when returning to the app at the reader, it shows the new posts prompt, but scrolling up triggers PTR instead of scrolling up. If I scroll down a bit, then it allows me to scroll up.
Manager.title: Masterbar: reader shows PTR spinner when it shouldn't

Manager.description: When returning to the reader after viewing an image in the full-screen photo viewer, there's sometimes a graphical glitch in the status bar. I'm pretty sure this is an Android bug which has since been fixed, but I recall a similar bug elsewhere that was resolved by changing an activity's background from a @color to an actual @drawable.
Manager.title: Reader: status bar glitch after viewing photo

Manager.description: A new block will be added that will show that a user has replied to a comment. It should link to the comment list for the post in the reader.
Manager.title: Notificaitons: Add Support for 'Replied' block in comment notifications

Manager.description: Would be great to know if the user forced the language or if they're using the default device language.
Manager.title: Track user language on mixpanel / nosara

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Add a very simple first implementation of caching network requests

Manager.description: Want to experimenting a bit with the onBind way of starting a service. It should be better for Stats to communicate with the service in this way. At least we will have an easy way to stop it when it's not needed, without handling race conditions and checking the network queue.
Manager.title: Try to use onBind on the Stats Service

Manager.description: When reblogs are disabled for a site, the reader still shows a reblog button for its posts. Attempting to reblog one of those posts fails.
Manager.title: Reader: reblog button appears when reblogs disabled

Manager.description: As @maxme points out, if the current site is self-hosted the user can remove it via My Sites > Settings. The "My Sites" pages needs to be smart enough to handle this situation (right now it continues to show the self-hosted site that was just removed).
Manager.title: Masterbar: user can remove the current site if it's self-hosted

Manager.description: I was trying to mark a comment as spam from the notifications screen, but wasn't able to do that. Steps to repro: Receive a notification of new comment Go to the Notifications screen and tap on the comment Tap on the Spam icon The app takes you back to the notifications screen, but the comment is still there, and it's not marked as spam. You can tap on the comment again, open the details screen, and check the status of the comment: Still marked as "Pending" or "Approved"; Refreshing notifications doesn't help.
Manager.title: Cannot mark a comment as SPAM from the notifications screen

Manager.description: Once we switch to the latest support library, experiment with the new SortedList in the reader to see if it's a more efficient and less error-prone way to display new posts (due to its batched updating features).
Manager.title: Use SortedList in reader post list

Manager.description: Testing on a nexus 7 device with android 5.1, app 4.0-rc-2. This is what the image viewer looks like. I think it's the fact that the images are coerced/skewed to a landscape format.
Manager.title: Image viewer is really pixellated and ugly

Manager.description: 480x800 emulator:
Manager.title: Disconnect from WordPress.com text cut off on small screen

Manager.description: Backup codes and recovery codes are 8 characters, currently the app limits it to 7.
Manager.title: 2FA Should Allow 8 Characters for Code Entry

Manager.description: Two related issues: Empty account stored in db on fresh install - this is due to migratePreferencesToAccountTable being called at startup here even when there's nothing to migrate AccountModel sets isWordPressDotComUser to true when the access token is set here even when the token is empty - so when the above empty account is read from the database, it reads the empty token from the db which causes isWordPressDotComUser to be set to true for the returned account
Manager.title: Account model issues

Manager.description: This is just a reminder for me. I think it's an issue on the REST API, but in the meanwhile is better to show a "Unknown" instead of an empty row when the name of the author is null/"null"/empty.
Manager.title: Can we make the Authors module work properly for Jetpack sites?

Manager.description: There are site picker differences between Lollipop and pre-Lollipop. Here it is on Lollipop, as it should appear: And here it is on a KitKat emulator (notice the spacing differences and the unnecessary dividers):
Manager.title: Site picker cardview pre-L

Manager.description: If you perform a pull-to-refresh on the notifications page, the progress spinner never goes away.
Manager.title: Notifications PTR progress doesn't go away

Manager.description: In the reader list, on a post with a VideoPress video, a featured image could be previewed instead of a video preview. https://cloudup.com/i0Aa0Jqob_a
Manager.title: Reader picks previous Featured Image instead of video preview
Tapping the "Edit" button on an inserted video should open a specific dialog, not the image editing one

Manager.description: Go to the Media Library Tap the + button to add a new picture Either select "Capture" or "Select from local library" Nothing happens: the picture is not uploaded, no Toast error
Manager.title: Adding new pictures to the Media Library is broken

Manager.description: Self hosted blog Steps on the app (Android, Version 3.9.1) Steps to replicate on the App Create a post Geo tag the post Publish - Great, the post is geo tagged (verified on the site) Edit post - edit contents of the post Update/publish, the post geo tag gets cleared (verified on the site) Edit post again Update/publish, the post geo tag appears again (verified on the site) Let me know if you need any more information to replicate
Manager.title: geo location gets cleared on updating the post

Manager.description: Right now tapping the Stats button on a self hosted site show a Toast: "Stats couldn't be refreshed at this time." It should instead work like PR #2606 and let the user know they need to login for stats.
Manager.title: Masterbar: stats on non-JP self-hosted

Manager.description: Tap "Disconnect from WordPress.com" on the Me page, you'll be returned to the login screen Force kill the app, then restart it You're returned to the Me page as a logged in user, as though you never disconnected
Manager.title: "Disconnect from WordPress.com" doesn't work

Manager.description: When adding a page the settings button shows "Post settings" instead of "Page Settings" It looks like there's a todo here.
Manager.title: Page settings button shows wrong text

Manager.description: Worth checking other calls to getBlogName()
Manager.title: HTML entities in site title in the My site tab

Manager.description: Use flat styling (same as web) rather than cards ADD SITE should be ADD WORDPRESS Possibly use a FAB rather than a button for adding a site Quick mockup from @folletto :
Manager.title: Site picker should mimic web

Manager.description: When the user isn't signed into WordPress.com but a self-hosted blog has been added to the app, the avatar on the Me page is hidden but the shadow frame containing the avatar remains visible.
Manager.title: Avatar frame on me page should be hidden for self-hosted

Manager.description: We should add the notification_type property to the following notification events: wpandroid_push_notification_received : add notification_type:{comment|like|follow|...} wpandroid_notifications_notification_details_opened: : add notification_type:{comment|like|follow|...}
Manager.title: Analytics - Add properties to notification events

Manager.description: I've checked all reports, it an Android 4.2.2 bug only. Probably a platform bug. I tried to repro on a 4.2.2 emulator with en-gb or en-au selected but it didn't crashed. Also it's weird because the crash occurs on a Fragment.getString(STR, number) call only in StatsCommentsFragment, when it's also used other stats fragment (StatsFollowersFragment for example). It's rare (8 users affected), but I suspect it's super annoying (crash loop on app start). java.lang.AssertionError: couldn't initialize LocaleData for locale en-gb at libcore.icu.LocaleData.initLocaleData(LocaleData.java:167) at libcore.icu.LocaleData.get(LocaleData.java:121) at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:1039) at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:1009) at java.lang.String.format(String.java:1988) at android.content.res.Resources.getString(Resources.java:445) at android.app.Fragment.getString(Fragment.java:801) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsCommentsFragment.updateUI(StatsCommentsFragment.java:92) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsAbstractListFragment$3.onReceive(StatsAbstractListFragment.java:456) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.executePendingBroadcasts(LocalBroadcastManager.java:297) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.access$000(LocalBroadcastManager.java:46) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager$1.handleMessage(LocalBroadcastManager.java:116) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:107) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:194) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5422) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:837) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:604) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)
Manager.title: Crash report 3.9.1: AssertionError in StatsCommentsFragment

Manager.description: There are a couple of problems with Jetpack sites. Make sure .com authentication is working fine in the following situations: Blank app, add a Jetpack site, Go to Stats. (The .com login should popup here and credentials should be stored at blog level) App connected with .com account. Add a Jetpack site that is already connected with the same .com account. Go to stats, the app should try to load the stats by using the main .com account App connected with .com account. Add a Jetpack site that is NOT connected with main .com account. Go to stats, the app should try to load the stats by using the main .com account, then the login to .com should popup. Inserting the correct credentials must load stats.
Manager.title: Stats - Handle Authentication issues for Jetpack sites

Manager.description: If you go into My Site -> Comments -> Single Comment and reply to a comment and go back to the Comments page, the new comment is not added to the list. I think we should trigger a refresh when a new comment is added through the app.

Manager.description: While trying out LeakCanary I discovered a leak in PostsActivity. I believe the leak is caused by calling WordPress.setOnPostUploadedListener(this)in the list fragment here without ever removing that listener when the fragment is destroyed.

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Exclude xxxhdpi drawables from the build (excepted for app_icon.png)

Manager.description: It takes about a second for the sites to load in the SitePickerActivity even though the divider is already visible. Even though the delay is not long, it kind of makes it look like the app is less responsive. Maybe there is some optimization we can do to make it load faster?
Manager.title: Slight delay when loading the SitePickerActivity

Manager.description: The receiver is only registered in onCreate and unregistered in onDestroy, it's odd that we've gotten into this state to begin with. Will probably just have to surround with a try/catch block to prevent the crash. java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to destroy activity {org.wordpress.android/org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity}: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Receiver not registered: org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity$4@413a9f10 at android.app.ActivityThread.performDestroyActivity(ActivityThread.java:3451) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleDestroyActivity(ActivityThread.java:3469) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$1200(ActivityThread.java:141) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1287) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5041) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:793) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:560) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java) Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Receiver not registered: org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity$4@413a9f10 at android.app.LoadedApk.forgetReceiverDispatcher(LoadedApk.java:657) at android.app.ContextImpl.unregisterReceiver(ContextImpl.java:1339) at android.content.ContextWrapper.unregisterReceiver(ContextWrapper.java:445) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity.onDestroy(EditPostActivity.java:310) at android.app.Activity.performDestroy(Activity.java:5273) ...
Manager.title: IllegalArgumentException when unregistering receiver in EditPostActivity

Manager.description: We get quite a few requests for this in tickets. https://simplenote.desk.com/agent/case/62654
Manager.title: Add markdown support to the app

Manager.description: The notification settings fragment and related code in NotificationsUtils seems overly complicated. I think it relates to the actual /devices/ endpoint in the REST API that requires some odd data formatting to be passed to it. If we create a better version of the endpoint then I think the client code could be much-improved.
Manager.title: Notification Settings could use a Refactor

Manager.description: Tapping "Manage Notifications" under Settings doesn't show the fragment if the device was just rotated. Video example.
Manager.title: Settings > Manage Notifications bug after rotation

Manager.description: checkForBlogChangeAndFinish is no longer necessary since blogs are no longer shown/hidden in Settings.
Manager.title: Settings no longer needs to check for blog changes

Manager.title: NPE creating image span after image loads

Manager.description: Reproduced on 4.0 and 4.1. On a "root" activity (Reader or Notifications for instance) tap the back button, the current activity restarts. Expected behavior: the app is put in background and the home screen is shown. Problem comes from our WPLaunchActivity which is still in the activity backstack, so when a "root" activity finishes, WPLaunchActivity is created and re-launch the current "root" activity.
Manager.title: Back button doesn't quit the app

Manager.description: ref #2694 IMO, we should show the scrollbar in the tag list https://cloudup.com/cLSJarAZtTF - it's not obvious I can scroll the view here: https://cloudup.com/cS2l3XstY26
Manager.title: Add a visible scrollbar in the Reader's tag list

Manager.description: The upload state for a media item isn't localized - see here.
Manager.title: Media upload state isn't localized

Manager.description: As a result of #2694 the swipe-to-refresh progress appears from underneath the tag toolbar, which violates material layering. It should appear above the toolbar instead.
Manager.title: Reader swipe-to-refresh progress should overlap toolbar

Manager.description: If you rotate the device while the reader post list is scrolled, the tag toolbar appears at the top and overlaps the topmost post. A similar bug occurs after tapping the "new posts" message.
Manager.title: Reader tag toolbar overlaps after rotating

Manager.description: Starting the app briefly animates in the launch activity, then animates in the main activity. Demo video here.
Manager.title: Double animation when launching app

Manager.description: Several of the notification layouts use a selector drawable for the background, which prevents the ripple effect from appearing on Lollipop. Using android:background="?android:selectableItemBackground" should provide the ripple effect automatically (and downgrade to a simple highlight on earlier devices).
Manager.title: Missing ripple in notifications

Manager.description: Title has it. Note: We also need to publish 1.0.3 artifacts to Maven.
Manager.title: Update tracks library to version 1.0.3

Manager.description: Matt pointed out to us that for users with a lot of sites on their mobile app it was very difficult to find a particular blog as you had to scroll a lot. Let's add in the ability to search through the blog list to be able to more quickly find a particular site.
Manager.title: Users should be able to search through their blog list

Manager.description: While working on #2714, I noticed quite a bit of cruft in WPNetworkImageView that we should clean up.
Manager.title: Cleanup WPNetworkImageView

Manager.description: Use an x (close) icon in the site picker rather than the standard left-pointing arrow.
Manager.title: Use "x" rather than back arrow in site picker

Manager.description: Right now when you like a post in the reader detail, your avatar gets added to the row of liking avatars without any animation. Investigate using android:animateLayoutChanges=“true” in the XML layout, or setLayoutTransition(new LayoutTransition()) programmatically, so that your avatar animates in/out more elegantly.
Manager.title: Animate reader detail likes

Manager.description: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Fragment StatsGeoviewsFragment{182d5db7} not attached to Activity at android.app.Fragment.getResources(Fragment.java:788) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsGeoviewsFragment$1.onGlobalLayout(StatsGeoviewsFragment.java:72) at android.view.ViewTreeObserver.dispatchOnGlobalLayout(ViewTreeObserver.java:912) at android.view.ViewRootImpl.performTraversals(ViewRootImpl.java:1881) at android.view.ViewRootImpl.doTraversal(ViewRootImpl.java:1061) at android.view.ViewRootImpl$TraversalRunnable.run(ViewRootImpl.java:5885) at android.view.Choreographer$CallbackRecord.run(Choreographer.java:767) at android.view.Choreographer.doCallbacks(Choreographer.java:580) at android.view.Choreographer.doFrame(Choreographer.java:550) at android.view.Choreographer$FrameDisplayEventReceiver.run(Choreographer.java:753) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5254) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:903) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:698)
Manager.title: Crash report 4.1-rc-1: StatsGeoviewsFragment not attached to Activity

Manager.description: User reports the reader tag toolbar overlapping the post after returning to the app and getting new posts. Similar to #2712.
Manager.title: 4.1: reader tag toolbar overlap after returning to app

Manager.description: When viewing a media item you see a blank white space while the image loads but its not obvious that the image is actually loading. On a slow-ish connection it feels like something is broken.
Manager.title: Show a loading indicator in MediaItemFragment when image is loading

Manager.description: Easy solution is to add a 'Saved draft' toast appear if you leave the post editor w/o publishing: Just had a “crap did I just lose my post?!” moment. Go to the WP icon (My Sites?) Tap on “Add” for “Blog Posts” Add some content Hit the back button You’re now back in the My Sites section without any sort of confirmation or indication on how to get back to the post you were in. Thankfully it was saved as a Local Draft so my work was still there but it was a panicked moment.
Manager.title: Show a toast after saving a draft

Manager.description: I've seen a few apps that will compact the tabs and left-align them when in a tablet UI in landscape: It appears that the material guidelines recommend this as well: http://www.google.com/design/spec/components/tabs.html#tabs-specs Current look: @joen and @drw158, any thoughts?
Manager.title: More Compact Tabs for Tablet UI?

Manager.description: Right now the FAB to add a site remains visible and active when you're editing site visibility. It should be hidden instead.
Manager.title: Site picker should hide FAB when editing site visibility

Manager.description: Currently in my site page if the blog is empty, we have kind of an empty page which is not very user friendly: https://cloudup.com/ct5jiYNpZT0 As @nbradbury mentioned in this comment it would be good to have an empty state where we can have an add site or switch site button there. I am hoping @mnt can help us with the design of it.
Manager.title: Better handle null blog in MySiteFragment

Manager.description: ReaderAnim was originally created for reader-specific animations, but we're now using some of those routines outside the reader. Move these routines (or perhaps this whole class) outside of the reader package.
Manager.title: Move animation routines out of ReaderAnim

Manager.description: The icons next to the various labels on the My Site and Me fragments need to be tappable.
Manager.title: "My Site" and "Me" icons aren't tappable

Manager.description: The first three fragments in the masterbar use android:paddingLeft="@dimen/content_margin" and android:paddingRight="@dimen/content_margin" to keep the page content from being too wide (especially important on landscape tablets). Note: may want to fix this as part of #2732 since it'll be more noticeable after that change.
Manager.title: Add content padding to notifications

Manager.description: The only way to get out of the help screen is by pressing the back button, we should add an 'x' or an up arrow to the top-left corner.
Manager.title: Add a button to get out of the Help activity

Manager.description: We should add a transparent layer over the background when the FAB menu is visible (and change menu styling at the same time) We should hide the fab menu when the user touch the background (feels natural and we don't want to allow actions, like tapping or scrolling while the menu is opened). Maybe contribs for https://github.com/futuresimple/android-floating-action-button
Manager.title: FAB menu enhancements

Manager.description: I think as a result of #2742, the scrollbar is inset within the content area of the notes list. The reader has the scrollbar in a better position, maybe that style/position can be copied.
Manager.title: Notifications scrollbar looks off

Manager.description: The web version of Stats has introduced a 2-columns layout on desktop, and large mobile screen. We need to experimenting it, and check if replicable on this native app, or add a padding to the left and right. The latter is the solution used on all other app's screens.
Manager.title: Improve UI on tablets

Manager.description: A new range type named match has been added. They should be styled with bold text.
Manager.title: Notifications: Add support for 'match' range types

Manager.description: If you open a comment push notification and then try to perform a moderation action, nothing happens. From a quick debug, it appears that NotificationsListFragment is null in the onActivityResult() of WPMainActivity.
Manager.title: Notifications: Comment moderation doesn't work when opened from push

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Add accessibility labels for tabbar

Manager.description: Same as this iOS issue.
Manager.title: Non-ascii character tags cannot be followed in the Reader

Manager.description: Sometimes when tapping around and switching between Insights and Days it seems to get stuck in loading mode, the chart doesn't load and there doesn't seem to be a way to cancel out of it. I haven't been able to reproduce consistently.
Manager.title: Stuck on the Loading indicator

Manager.description: This is a test for baymax
Manager.title: A test for baymax

Manager.description: No label to start.
Manager.title: Another test for Baymax

Manager.description: Once Insights is done, move the modules not specific to a date period to the Insights screen. From the web change: There are 4 modules that aren't specific to the selected period that have always been sitting unnaturally at the bottom of the period page, and labeled "Other Recent Stats". We should move these modules to the Insights page. cc: @daniloercoli
Manager.title: Move the non-periodic modules from period screens to Insights screen

Manager.description: From this post: http://pento.net/2015/05/11/oh-hai-%F0%9F%91%B6/
Manager.title: Notifications Don't Show Post Title Emoji

Manager.description: Tweets which contain a WordPress.com link show an "Open in WordPress app" button that should open the link in the native reader. Instead, it simply displays the reader without opening the post. Demo video. Update: After checking into this, it doesn't seem to be limited to the masterbar branch after all - it fails on earlier builds as well. This used to work, and it looks like we're still correctly following the Twitter cards docs which leads me to believe the problem is on Twitter's end (especially since a similar problem exists in the iOS app).
Manager.title: Twitter "Open in WordPress app" fails with masterbar release

Manager.description: You can't open links in notifications that aren't hosted on WordPress.com.
Manager.title: Notifications: Can't open external Urls

Manager.description: While reviewing #2784, I noticed we're using different way to check for a wordpress.com url across the app (hostname ends with wordpress.com, url contains wordpress.com).
Manager.title: Add a utility method to check if a URL is wpcom

Manager.description: There is a new parameter for sending device/app locale through for localized error messages, etc. Update our API calls to provide this on every call, if so desired.
Manager.title: Add locale parameter to WordPress.com API calls

Manager.description: When you first open the Android app after downloading it there's an option at the bottom of the screen to "just try the app". This will let users create notes without signing into, or creating, an account. If they later create a new account in the app the notes are copied into it. However if they sign into an existing account, the notes that were created offline will appear on the device but they never appear in the same account when signing in through a web browser. If the user then signs out of their account on the device and signs back in again, all those "local notes" are lost. I think it might be better to remove the option to create notes without an account, or at the very least, provide a warning that signing into an account will result in notes being lost. I hope this makes sense!
Manager.title: Creating notes without an account can result in losing notes

Manager.description: Preserve the scroll position after rotating. Keep 2-level lists state upon rotation scroll to top when switching between timeperiod
Manager.title: Preserve the scroll position after rotating.

Manager.description: Calypsofication of the post list requires using cards which can be trashed - meaning some animation will be required. Switching to a RecyclerView will greatly simplify this. I've made this a separate task from supporting cards in order to keep the PRs smaller.
Manager.title: Use RecyclerView for post list

Manager.description: The third-party UndoBar can be removed and replaced with the Snackbar in the Android design support library. Note that adding the design support library shouldn't be done until after #2814 is merged.
Manager.title: Replace UndoBar with new Snackbar

Manager.description: The culprit. java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.media.MediaBrowserActivity$3.onItemClick(MediaBrowserActivity.java:205) at android.widget.AdapterView.performItemClick(AdapterView.java:308) at android.widget.AbsListView.performItemClick(AbsListView.java:1524) at android.widget.AbsListView$PerformClick.run(AbsListView.java:3531) at android.widget.AbsListView$3.run(AbsListView.java:4898) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:733) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5579) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1268) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1084) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)
Manager.title: 4.1 crash - NPE accessing blog in MediaBrowserActivity

Manager.description: The labels for the Most popular day / Most popular hour, where it says X% of Weekly Views / X% of Daily Views. This should be "X% of views", like this: https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3073557/8050203/77c6e1cc-0e69-11e5-8a03-d27caa5d713e.png
Manager.title: Stats - Fix "Most popular day / Most popular hour" labels

Manager.description: Stats and Reblog (not sure if there are other screens affected by this issue) use a spinner that is not correctly positioned when the device is in landscape. See pictures below:
Manager.title: The spinner needs some padding/centering when the device is in landscape

Manager.description: Tap a comment notification in the note list From the detail, trash or spam the comment The detail closes and you're returned to the note list, but the comment notification doesn't go away until the undo bar disappears I believe the problem is that the NoteVisibilityChanged event posted here isn't being received by the NotificationListFragment here because the fragment isn't active yet. @roundhill
Manager.title: Moderating a comment note doesn't remove the note until the undo bar disappears

Manager.description: Repro Steps: Hide site A In SitePickerActivity click the search icon and search for/select site A. Click 'View Site' Expected: WebView of current blog is shown Current behavior: WebView of first visible blog is shown
Manager.title: Searching and selecting non-visible site does not allow you to 'Visit Site'

Manager.description: Currently you are only able to update the default media width by selecting static amounts from a drop down list. Are we able to change it so it is either more like the slider option in iOS so that you can have finer control or a field to enter in the exact amount you want?
Manager.title: Default Media Width

Manager.description: The reader subs screen shows a list of popular tags which isn't locale-friendly, and is being dropped from the web reader (where it's used for the "Recommended blogs" feature). It should be dropped from the mobile apps as well. Note: make sure the logged-out reader works even without this feature.
Manager.title: Drop popular tags from the reader

Manager.description: In #2651 we merged the logged-out reader code, but those changes made to ReaderPostListFragment ReaderPostAdapter were lost here.
Manager.title: Restore logged-out reader changes

Manager.description: Reblogging is being dropped from the reader on all platforms. It may come back at some point, but not until after some serious re-thinking and re-designing. Note: don't work on this until after #2828 has been merged.
Manager.title: Drop reader reblog

Manager.description: Right now the site picker uses two adapters: SitePickerAdapter, which is the adapter when not searching SitePickerSearchAdapter, which extends SitePickerAdapter and is used only when searching It would be good to consolidate those into a single adapter to avoid duplication, and could prevent problems down the road (ex: changes in SitePickerAdapter's LoadSitesTask aren't copied over to the search adapter).
Manager.title: Use single adapter for site picker

Manager.description: When you follow a tag in ReaderSubsActivity, it should become the active tag when you return to the reader.
Manager.title: Adding a reader tag should switch to that tag

Manager.description: WordPress.getBlog - There is a catch Exception without any logging. Wonder why if is possibile to be less generic on the type of Exception catched there. WordPress.getCurrentBlog - Does check the visibility of the blog before returning the blog. Is it really necessary? Why I cannot have a current blog set in the app even if it was hidden? Sometimes I want to access the blog, check the stats, etc, even if it's hidden in the app. Thinking to the situation where you open the app from a notification, read the notification, and want to check stats or other things on the blog.
Manager.title: WordPress.getBlog and WordPress.getCurrentBlog could love a refactor

Manager.description: I introduced a bug in #2830 which stopped the app from requesting recommended blogs, so the "Blogs You Like" page in reader subs is never updated.
Manager.title: Recommended blogs aren't being requested

Manager.description: User-generated content in the Reader should use the Merriweather font added in #2805.
Manager.title: Switch reader to Merriweather

Manager.description: Now that #2841 adds the design support library, drop the hackish SlidingTabLayout (borrowed from IOsched) and use the "official" material TabLayout instead.
Manager.title: Switch to material tabs

Manager.title: Crash report 4.1 - NPE updating post settings

Manager.description: Stats cache may crash when a very large response is stored in the tbl_stats.jsonData 'text' column. Never happened yet, but storing very large text columns could result in an IllegalStateException when the row was read due to the 2MB size limit for Android's CursorWindow ( see here and here ). Easy fix is to detect the size of the JSON text when parsing the response and limiting how much of it is stored. See: #1878
Manager.title: Potential IllegalStateException in Stats Cache

Manager.description: At some point after 4.2, this code stopped working, so hitting the back arrow in the toolbar no longer navigates back.
Manager.title: Reader detail back navigation doesn't work

Manager.description: The removal of reblogs in #2836 introduced a visual bug with RSS posts (or any posts that don't allow comments or likes). The height of the footer gets reduced due to the missing reblog icon (which previously was made invisible for these posts, forcing the footer height to be maintained).
Manager.title: Fix footer height of reader card view

Manager.description: Now that we're using v22.1 of the Android Support Library, we should convert ActionBarActivity to AppCompatActivity. See the AppCompat section of this blog post for details.
Manager.title: Convert ActionBarActivity to AppCompatActivity

Manager.description: The Calypsofication of posts/pages requires switching to a CardView (more easily done now that #2802 is merged), which involves: Featured image display above the post (similar to the reader) Buttons for Edit / View / Stats - edit shows the post editor, view shows the published post in a webView, stats shows the stats detail screen for that post Only Me / Everyone switch for multi-author blogs This is the largest - and primary - task for the Calypsofication effort.
Manager.title: CardView for posts/pages

Manager.description: The Merriweather font was added in #2805, but the Light variation wasn't included because it wasn't necessary. It turns out that it is necessary after all, so add the Light font assets and support them in TypefaceCache
Manager.title: Add Merriweather Light font

Manager.description: MediaUtils shows .webp images are not yet recognized. They are available in API 14+ so we should be able to add support.
Manager.title: Add WebP image format support

Manager.description: Implement the General portion of the Site Settings. This includes Title, Tagline, Language, Visibility, and Related Posts (going to be implemented with Self-hosted username/password as separate issue). Update #3036
Manager.title: General Site Settings - Calypsoification

Manager.description: Implement the Writing portion of the Site Settings. This includes Default Post Category and Default Post Format. EDIT: Expanding the scope of this to include self-hosted account settings. Username and Password fields should be added and shown for self-hosted logins Update #3036
Manager.title: Writing Site Settings

Manager.description: Implement the Discussion portion of the Site Settings. This includes Other Comment Settings, E-mail notifications, Before a comment appears, Comment moderation, and Comment blacklist. Update #3036
Manager.title: Discussion Site Settings

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Fix margins on tablets

Manager.description: CardViews default to using #FAFAFA as the background color, but in the app they should be white. Note that this requires using card_view:cardBackgroundColor rather than android:background.
Manager.title: CardViews should have a white background

Manager.description: The "Switch Site" label on My Sites should be all caps and slightly smaller (11sp). On the left is how it currently looks, on the right is how it should look.
Manager.title: Minor "Switch Site" label tweak

Manager.description: Refactor the current theme bar in the themes browser.
Manager.title: Themes browser: Implement the current theme bar

Manager.description: Redesign the search feature for the themes browser.
Manager.title: Themes browser: Redesign search feature.

Manager.description: Implement the filtering menu for the themes browser.
Manager.title: Themes browser: implement the filtering menu

Manager.description: Implement the "more options" button for themes in the theme browser. The "..." button must open the action bar and not an inline view for iOS
Manager.title: Themes browser: implement the "more options" button for themes

Manager.description: Title has it. Below is a screenshot of what's happening when an error occurs:
Manager.title: Improve errors handling in SingleItemDetailsScreen

Manager.description: Tracks 1.0.4 will contain a fix for this issue here Automattic/Automattic-Tracks-Android#14 and it's recommended upgrade.
Manager.title: Update to Track 1.0.4

Manager.description: In develop, the notifications settings fragment is blank, I think this is a result of the changes to the pin lock library integration.
Manager.title: Notifications settings blank

Manager.description:
When attempting to log in to my self-hosted install, I get an error that I could not be logged in, and the following application log output: WordPress Android version: 4.1 Android device name: Motorola Nexus 6
01 - resetting suggestion tables 02 - Number of old stats deleted : 0 03 - NewAccountAbstractOage.onCreate() 04 - trackLastActivity, activityId: Login Screen 05 - SSLPeerUnverifiedException failed. Erroneous SSL certificate detected. 06 - Exception received from XMLRPC call wp.getUsersBlogs - exception: No peer certificate 07 - StackTrace: javax.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException: No peer certificate at com.android.org.conscrypt.SSLNullSession.getPeerCertificates(SSLNullSession.java:104) at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier.verify(AbstractVerifier.java:98) at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLSocketFactory.createSocket(SSLSocketFactory.java:393) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultClientConnectionOperator.openConnection(DefaultClientConnectionOperator.java:170) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.AbstractPoolEntry.open(AbstractPoolEntry.java:169) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.AbstractPooledConnAdapter.open(AbstractPooledConnAdapter.java:124) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:365) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:560) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:492) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:470) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient$Caller.callXMLRPC(XMLRPCClient.java:482) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient$Caller.access$000(XMLRPCClient.java:412) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient.call(XMLRPCClient.java:229) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient.call(XMLRPCClient.java:213) at org.wordpress.android.ui.accounts.helpers.FetchBlogListWPOrg$FetchBlogListTask.doInBackground(FetchBlogListWPOrg.java:254) at org.wordpress.android.ui.accounts.helpers.FetchBlogListWPOrg$FetchBlogListTask.doInBackground(FetchBlogListWPOrg.java:225) at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:292) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1112) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:587) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818)
08 - Server response: I know that my SSL certificate is valid, and I have verified that using SSL Labs. This leads me to believe that it's an issue with the implementation of SSL authentication in the app.

Manager.description: We can take a few steps to decrease the download size of this git repo: Set the start of the repo to some time after we stopped committing the build (or maybe bin) folder. This happened many years ago, and we can always go back to the svn repo if we need to see an earlier commit (which is highly unlikely I think) Remove the libs/*.jar files from the history
Manager.title: Repo download is large

Manager.description: Ref: wordpress-mobile/WordPressCom-Analytics-iOS#26 Events to add (in the iOS naming conventions): WPAnalyticsStatStatsInsightsAccessed, WPAnalyticsStatStatsPeriodDaysAccessed, WPAnalyticsStatStatsPeriodWeeksAccessed, WPAnalyticsStatStatsPeriodMonthsAccessed, WPAnalyticsStatStatsPeriodYearsAccessed,
Manager.title: Add analytics tracking for Stats Insights

Manager.description: The app doesn't show the correct error message if the user tries to show stats on a site where he doesn't have permissions to see them.
Manager.title: Show the correct error message if the user can't access Stats on a .com site

Manager.description: When trying to follow a blog by URL in ReaderSubsActivity fails, we simply show a toast saying "Unable to follow this blog." It would be more helpful if we could display friendlier toasts for the most common problems (ie: 301, 401 and 404).
Manager.title: Reader: problems trying to follow by url

Manager.description: The tag icon in the reader toolbar has never been obvious, but it's even less so since the masterbar release. Replacing it with a simple "+" icon would be an improvement.
Manager.title: Reader: not obvious how to manage tags/blogs

Manager.description: The FAB on the site picker doesn't make sense since adding a site isn't the primary function of that screen. Replace it with a plus icon in the toolbar which displays a menu to choose between creating a wp.com site and adding a self-hosted site. Next, replace the third-party FABs on "My Site" and the post list with the design library FAB. Once that's done, the third-part FAB is no longer necessary and can be removed from build.gradle. Note: The decision to remove the site picker FAB has been approved by design.
Manager.title: Remove third-party FAB

Manager.description: Add a lot of images (I tested with 15) to a new post. Save the post as a draft. Edit the post again. Quick! Before the images load in the content area, press Publish. The post will be uploaded empty, because the app grabs whatever is in the EditText and uploads it (which is nothing because the content loading task hasn't finished yet) Pretty simple solution would be to just disable the Publish/Save button until the content loading task completes.
Manager.title: Post content can be lost if you publish before editor loads images

Manager.description: I've had a few reports and have now tested on a couple of test sites. When you input your credentials it asks if you want to see details, and either accept or not accept the certificate. Details shows a blank screen and choosing Yes to accept just brings back the same message again. This is an example line from the app logs: SSLHandshakeException failed. Erroneous SSL certificate detected.
Manager.title: Can't Choose to Trush Self Signed SSL

Manager.description: In WordPress.java we have singletons for the v1.0 and v1.1 REST API clients. Add one for v1.2 (needed for some upcoming reader-related work). Work on this needs to wait until this PR is merged in android-wordpress-com-rest and the updated REST client is available to the app.
Manager.title: Add v1.2 REST client

Manager.description: Selecting Me > Account Settings > Manage Notifications results in a blank screen. Tapping the back button from there results in a blank Settings screen. Bug does not exist in 4.1 or 4.2.
Manager.title: Notification settings are empty

Manager.description: Issue #2875 redesigns the post list to use a card view that includes featured images (which were added to the post model and posts table in #2915). In an effort to keep the PR for #2875 smaller, it will only show the featured image if it already exists in the local media store. Once that PR has been completed and merged, a new PR which requests featured images that aren't already cached should be prepared.
Manager.title: Calypsofication: request post featured image when not in media library

Manager.description: The post preview screen which currently appears after tapping a post in the post list needs a redesign. Drop the toolbar below the preview (including the ability to comment) Add an "edit" button to the toolbar to open the post for editing Use Merriweather font for post title and content Drop the use of a TextView for local drafts (should be able to use the WebView that's already used for uploaded posts) Note: #2875 should be completed and merged before tackling this.
Manager.title: Calypsofication: Redesign ViewPostFragment

Manager.description: Dividers are no longer showing in the post list, most likely as a result of #2802.
Manager.title: Post list needs dividers

Manager.description: /cc @roundhill
Manager.title: Dividers in Notifications list are off for unread notifications
"Your Stats are booming" Notification doesn't open native stats

Manager.description: Adds the missing implementation for the app upgraded event to Tracks. Ref. iOS: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#3960
Manager.title: Add missing event to Tracks

Manager.description: MediaGridFragment uses a series of hacks to prevent the spinner listener from firing when the selection is made programmatically. and to avoid it firing when ActionMode is enabled. See here and here and likely elsewhere. Hat tip to @fliespl for noticing this problem in #2901.
Manager.title: Media grid spinner hacks

Manager.description: Need to make sure mComment isn't null. java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.comments.CommentDetailFragment$3.onClick(CommentDetailFragment.java:269) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:4654) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:19438) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:733) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:146) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5487) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1283) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1099) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)
Manager.title: Crash report 4.2 - NPE CommentDetailFragment

Manager.description: On the web and iOS, below the last item in the posts/pages lists there's a "W" logo with a horizontal rule. Android mockup below, assets here. Note: #2934 should be merged before tackling this.
Manager.title: Calypsofication: add "W" logo to end of posts/pages

Manager.description: Right now the post list silently skips the automatic refresh if local changes exist, since those local changes would be overwritten during the refresh. This means that new posts will never appear during an automatic refresh if there are local changes. If the refresh was due to the user initiating a pull-to-refresh, the user is presented with this unfriendly dialog: Assuming the user understands this dialog, it means we're asking them to choose between seeing new posts and overwriting ones with changes that haven't been uploaded. The post list should be smart enough to preserve local changes after a refresh, doing away with the need for this dialog and the need to skip automatic refresh if there are local changes.
Manager.title: Do away with "local changes" limitation in the post list refresh

Manager.description: @drw158 noticed you did this for the iOS app, can you update the coloring for the reader box for Android as well? It's currently still grey and kinda ugly. Ref: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS@5727495 The current box images are named box_with_pages* in the android app.
Manager.title: Update colors of Reader box animation

Manager.description: In the reader discover branch we switched to v1.2 of the REST client when requesting posts, but a hack was added to use v1.1 for Freshly Pressed since there currently isn't a v1.2 FP endpoint yet. This issue is a reminder to switch to the v1.2 FP endpoint when it becomes available.
Manager.title: Reader: use v1.2 Freshly Pressed endpoint

Manager.description: When the tag toolbar is shown in ReaderPostListFragment, the ReaderPostAdapter adds a blank space to the first post so there's room for the toolbar. This is proving to be a buggy solution, since the spacer won't automatically disappear when new posts are added above the one currently showing the spacer. A better solution would be to rely on getItemViewType() to return a different view type when the spacer should appear.
Manager.title: Reader: use a separate view type for the toolbar spacer

Manager.description: The app relies on ReaderTagList.isSameList to determine when followed tags have changed, but this routine doesn't consider changes to the endpoints of existing tags.

Manager.description: Related: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#4081 Update tracking of publishing a post to include the four properties, as booleans, for with_videos, with_tags, with_categories, and with_photos on the original event. EDITOR_PUBLISHED_POST should be the only enum for publishing a post. This will help reduce the counts of publish_post in Tracks. Mixpanel will also need to be updated to not track those other four enums - case EDITOR_PUBLISHED_POST_WITH_PHOTO: case EDITOR_PUBLISHED_POST_WITH_VIDEO: case EDITOR_PUBLISHED_POST_WITH_CATEGORIES: case EDITOR_PUBLISHED_POST_WITH_TAGS: cc: @daniloercoli
Manager.title: Analytics: Update published post tracking to match iOS

Manager.description: The event application_started is only used on Android to track the event when the app is started from scratch ("Starting from scratch" doesn't mean that the app is visible to the user). application_started has been source of confusion for people that have to do with funnels, and we've never used it for real. It's source of confusion even for me, that I need to check the document where all events are listed to understand what's tracking. We already have the event application_opened that tracks usage of the app It's fired when the user opens the app for real, and it's in par with iOS. On Lollipop, for example, if you shutdown the device when there is an active instance of wp-android, it will be restored on the next device startup, and the application onCreate event will be called, and thus the application_started is tracked.
Manager.title: Analytics: Remove application_started event, but keep application_opened to match iOS

Manager.description: We should remove setElevation(0.0f) from the Activities that are calling it and allow Android to determine the elevation of the ActionBar for consistency. Note to implementer: double check API20-. If they get a shadow when elevation is explicitly set then we should use setElevation(getResources().getDimen(R.dimen.appbar_elevation)). If they can't draw a shadow just remove the setElevation(0.0f) call altogether. (list stolen from #2389) Post editor Post settings Post categories Post preview Comment editor Stats detail Settings Settings > Show/hide blogs Settings > Single blog settings Settings > Manage notifications Settings > Licenses Application log

Manager.description: When you get multiple notifications directly from the phone's lock screen, and you open them, the notification screen is opened, but the orange notification marker doesn't go away. Here are the steps to reproduce: 1/ See 2 or more notifications on lock screen: 2/ Click on the Android notification to open the WordPress app. See the notification screen and notice that the orange icon is still there: 3/ Try to go to a different tab - maybe the orange notification circle will go away? No, that doesn't happen. The orange circle remains: 4/ If you go back to the notifications tab, the orange circle goes away as expected: What I expected: After clicking the Android notification, I should see the notifications screen and the orange circle shouldn't be there. It should look like this: Tested on Nexus 6, 4.4-rc1
Manager.title: Multiple notifications do not get marked as read when opened from lock screen
