Manager.title: Cant compile part 2

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: ConnectionChangeReceiver.onReceive will end up calling WordPress.onCreate if the app was killed by the OS

Manager.description: We're not tracking Jetpack logins...and it's not easy to do it. We need to wait until blog options are synched, and bump stats if the value of the option jetpack_client_id is changed. (On the XML-RPC layer the only way to know if a blog is Jetpack powered is to read a blog option).
Manager.title: [Analytics] Track Jetpack installations

Manager.description: The post list used to exclude posts where (localDraft=1 AND uploaded=1), which on the face of it doesn’t make sense since local drafts by definition haven’t been uploaded. But it turns out that we previously kept these uploaded local drafts in the table (which is why there were excluded!). Version 4.5 dropped the uploaded column but left these "uploaded local drafts" intact. A simple fix should be to perform DELETE FROM posts WHERE uploaded=1 AND localDraft=1 the first time the app is run (ie: when the db is upgraded). Be sure to wrap this in an exception handler to deal with the case that the uploaded column doesn't exist.
Manager.title: Uploaded local drafts duplicated in post list

Manager.description: It was removed in #3136
Manager.title: Add the connection bar back

Manager.description: When the user tries to follow a blog by URL, the reader first does a quick GET request so see whether that URL is reachable before trying to follow it. Right now Volley is treating a 301 on this GET request as a failure. Simple fix: treat 301 as success here.
Manager.title: Reader follow by URL treats a 301 as a failure

Manager.description: Found in #3104; After clicking Reply to reply to a comment I notice the input EditText changes to Reply to comment... but I can't figure out how to cancel that and change back to Reply to post... It's probably best to solve this by returning to Reply to post... if the keyboard is dismissed from a Reply to comment... state.
Manager.title: After selecting Reply to a comment on an article there is no way to reply directly to the post

Manager.description: Found in #3104; Sometimes comments deleted via the Comments page (accessed from My Site fragment) are still being shown in the reader comments section. I deleted all those Test* comments then went back to add more to the article. All the deleted comments were still there ... I couldn't reproduce it until I replied to a comment.
Manager.title: Deleted comments still shown in reader

Manager.description: "Press this" used on desktop is wonderful while on mobile it isn't that great. It would be wonderful to give "share with wordpress" a design like "press this", as it would greatly improve its usability. PS: I searching a little the repo but could't find how to properly post a feature request. Please forgive me as this is this the first time I post at Wordpress-Android repo
Manager.title: (feature request) Press-this-like sharing

Manager.description: Change Updates from WordPress.com to Email from WordPress.com
Manager.title: Notification Settings: String update

Manager.description: Users were used to share short links of their posts via the "Share" button on the Post preview screen (prior 4.4). We should reintroduce the short link shortening when a user share a post via the "new" preview screen. Note: useWPMeShortlinks
Manager.title: Bring back link shortening feature

Manager.description: Assets in 36x36, 48x48, 72x72 in PNG format: Customize Details Support gridicons-themes.svg Image (any size) of color Gray color lighten( $gray, 20% ). Only requirement is that it's aspect ratio is 1 *0.75
Manager.title: Themes assets

Manager.description: Searching themes on M1
Manager.title: Themes Search

Manager.description: Reminder to use this: https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1204802/9765858/8acd4e6e-5716-11e5-8408-43f5dce44565.png ref #3159
Manager.title: Change the Store Listing hi-res icon after 4.6 release

Manager.description: Currently the reader uses read/sites/{siteId}/posts/{postId} to request a single post, which is done when entering the detail view to ensure the most recent copy of the post is reflected. That endpoint is missing the newer feedbag additions, such as word-count, which are used by the Calypso reader. To correct this, we should switch to the new v1.2 /read/feed/:feed/posts/:item endpoint in both requestPost() and updatePost().
Manager.title: Reader: change endpoint used to request single reader post

Manager.description: Some posts are missing a word count, which is caused by the endpoint issue described in #3163. Resolving this problem requires rewriting updatePost so it doesn't overwrite existing information in the post. ie: When the updated post is requested, copy the updated posts's like count, comment count, etc., to the local post and retain the local post's other information (including the word count).
Manager.title: Reader: missing word count in some posts

Manager.description: Liking should always be enabled for wp.com and jp posts in the reader, with the exception of discover posts.
Manager.title: Reader: enable likes even when isLikesEnabled = false

Manager.description: Should show: thestylechair.com.
Manager.title: WordPress.com address shown instead of custom domain

Manager.description: Example: Google Drive
Manager.title: When a post is uploaded, show a "Post uploaded" notification with a "share link" button

Manager.description: If you view the comments for a reader post and reply to an existing comment multiple times, the newly submitted comments are incorrectly nested. Discovered by @tonyr59h while reviewing the Calypso comment redesign here
Manager.title: Reader: incorrect nesting of new child comments

Manager.description: Since we introduced deferredInit, simperium is now initialized here. Notes bucket is null here and Notifications are not loaded. Apparently that only happens onResume, but since the app sometimes "starts" onResume, that's maybe not related.
Manager.title: Probable race condition with Notification due to deferredInit

Manager.description: The reader detail shows liking users immediately below the content, but there's no divider between the content and the liking users which makes them look like part of the content.
Manager.title: Add separator above reader detail liking users

Manager.description: You should be able to tap the post title to open the reader post when viewing from a comment notification. This used to work, probably a regression in 4.5 or 4.6.
Manager.title: Notifications: Open reader post from comment list

Manager.description: "Blogs I Follow" is being renamed "Followed Sites" in the Calypso reader, and the Android reader should be prepared to deal with this change. This will require adjusting the app to deal with either "Blogs I Follow" or "Followed Sites."
Manager.title: Reader: prepare for "Blogs I Follow" changing to "Followed Sites"

Manager.description: We can move a some calls out off the UI thread during startup. Mixpanel init JSON parsing Suggestion DB reset More details: https://www.nimbledroid.com/play/org.wordpress.android?p=2DHAOt0aeYFLYL
Manager.title: Application startup optimization

Manager.description: Title has it. If the admin of the site has disabled the REST API on the Jetpack site, the app cannot load info about the latest post. {"error":"unauthorized","message":"API calls to this blog have been disabled."} //cc @astralbodies
Manager.title: Latest Post Summary doesn't work if "API calls" are disabled on a Jetpack blog

Manager.description: When it was decided that the reader backend should rename "Blogs I Follow" to "Followed Sites," the rename had to be put on hold until #3188 was in the hands of users (v4.6). This shouldn't have been necessary - the app should be able to deal with a default topic rename without requiring a new build.
Manager.title: Reader: don't require new build when backend renames a default topic

Manager.description: Currently we used a delayed runnable like this to execute code after a snackbar disappears. This can be replaced with the onDismiss event in the snackbar's callback, which didn't exist when we originally used snackbars.
Manager.title: Replace snackbar dismiss detection

Manager.description: The current ripple color is too strong and should be changed to gray_lighten_20.
Manager.title: Change ripple color

Manager.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity.addMedia(EditPostActivity.java:1110) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity.setPostContentFromShareAction(EditPostActivity.java:907) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity.fillContentEditorFields(EditPostActivity.java:843) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity.onEditorFragmentInitialized(EditPostActivity.java:1579) at org.wordpress.android.editor.LegacyEditorFragment.onCreateView(LegacyEditorFragment.java:229) at android.app.FragmentManagerImpl.moveToState(FragmentManager.java:829) at android.app.FragmentManagerImpl.moveToState(FragmentManager.java:1035) at android.app.BackStackRecord.run(BackStackRecord.java:635) at android.app.FragmentManagerImpl.execPendingActions(FragmentManager.java:1397) at android.app.FragmentManagerImpl.executePendingTransactions(FragmentManager.java:437) at android.support.v13.app.FragmentPagerAdapter.finishUpdate(FragmentPagerAdapter.java:145) at android.support.v4.view.ViewPager.populate(ViewPager.java:1105) at android.support.v4.view.ViewPager.populate(ViewPager.java:951) at android.support.v4.view.ViewPager.onMeasure(ViewPager.java:1473) at android.view.View.measure(View.java:15273)
Manager.title: Crash report 4.4.2 - NPE adding media in EditPostActivity

Manager.description: Title has it. Ref: #3193 Make sure analytics are tracked on sharing, on push notification, and when the app is started from scratch. Note to myself: make sure the new Stats widget events are tracked fine.
Manager.title: Make sure Analytics are correctly tracked with the new "deferred initialization"

Manager.description:
I see the following trace in Tracks when opening the app by tapping on a Push Notification: stdClass Object ( [events] => Array ( [0] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852724838 )
[1] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_application_opened [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852725082 )
[2] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852725136 )
[3] => Array ( [last_visible_screen] => Notifications [_en] => wpandroid_application_closed [time_in_app] => 2 [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852727784 ) )
.... The first wpandroid_notifications_accessed is even tracked before the application started event.
Manager.title: Opening app from Push notification double-tracks `wpandroid_notifications_accessed` event.

Manager.description:
Loading account details is deferred, and may happen after we start tracking events. Deferred initialization introduced here b3bc0a0 What's happen in details: The commit above does move the loading of the user account on a separate thread. Meanwhile, before the initialization happens, the Analytics libraries could have already tracked some events when the app is in a state where the main .com account is still blank. Libraries tracks the user as a new anon user that is later (few events later in Tracks) aliased with the correct .com user On Tracks we should not have problems (*need to double check this with the team), but in Mixpanel we have problems since the user is tracked as 2 distinct users. Below is a picture that shows the UNIQUEs in Mixpanel for my account. (already logged in WP). A Tracks stack trace that shows what's happening: stdClass Object ( [events] => Array ( [0] => Array ( [_ui] => 7ea374d2fc1a48578865941018b62a3c [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ut] => anon [_ts] => 1442852632039 )
[1] => Array ( [_en] => _aliasUser [anonId] => 7ea374d2fc1a48578865941018b62a3c [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632383 )
[2] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_application_opened [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632489 )
[3] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632773 )
[4] => Array ( [last_visible_screen] => Notifications [_en] => wpandroid_application_closed [time_in_app] => 3 [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852635782 )
)
Manager.title: Deferred initialization causes problem with Mixpanel

Manager.description: Liking users are cut off or squished on several posts in Andy Peatling's blog (and likely other blogs, too). Problem does not occur on v4.5. .
Manager.title: Reader detail liking users cut off

Manager.description: Under some circumstances the login form is not triggered by the Stats Service. Basically the service can't check if the blog is a Jetpack or not by using the remoteBlogID. This is due to the fact that there are 2 entries in the DB for each Jetpack blog linked with the main wpcom account. The Stats service were loading the localBlogID by using the remoteID, and can happen, if you first logged to wpcom and then added the Jetpack blog, that the localblogID returned was the wrong one. That's due to the fact we're synching (and hiding) all blogs (wpcom + jetpack) when first logging to wpcom.
Manager.title: Jetpack + Stats : The login form is not shown under some circumstances

Manager.description: Noticed this post in the Reader had a very long tag, and it overlaps the like/comment buttons:
Manager.title: Reader: Long tag name can overlap buttons

Manager.description: My wpcom account has some .org Jetpack blogs linked with it. When I disconnect from wpcom the sites screen doesn't get refreshed. The previously selected .com blog is already there. Even after logout. See the gif below:
Manager.title: Logging out from wpcom doesn't refresh the Sites screen properly

Manager.description: If you tap to add a comment on a reader post that doesn't have any comments, the keyboard pushes up the "No comments" message so it overlaps the post header.
Manager.title: Reader: soft keyboard overlaps "No comments"

Manager.description: I did a couple of logins/logouts and found out that resetFragments doesn't actually recreate new fragments when called. I set a breakpoint in WPMainTabAdapter.getItem and it doesn't get called upon login. Sorry for the long GIF. At the end of the login process you can see that the Sites tab is still empty. Other tabs get populated with a delay (that's because i'm throttling the connection) instead the Sites tab isn't get updated. /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Login to wpcom doesn't refresh the main tabbed interface

Manager.description: Sometimes (?) notifications staking doesn't work, and user gets a growing list of notifications. I can't repro, but @daniloercoli was affected by the bug too. From a Play Store comment: Notifications issue. With the latest update the notifications are not aggregated anymore. In a few minutes I had my status bar filled with a ton of notifications; annoying. I wonder if that could come from this patch f8d5108
Manager.title: Notification stacking issue on 4.5.1

Manager.description: ...and left the app in a weird state. Steps to repro: Suppose you're already logged to wpcom in the app. Open the app and go to me ME tab. Tap on "Disconnect", confirm, and wait few secs. Tap on "Connect to WordPress.com", insert the username, the password and tap on "Sign In". Tap back while there is still the loading indicator going. The app takes you back to the ME screen. Wait few secs. Tap on "Connect"...and BOOM! You're already logged to wpcom.
Manager.title: Tapping back while logging into wpcom doesn't stop the underlying connections...

Manager.description: Currently there is no way to change the photo within the app.
Manager.title: Change gravatar photo in app

Manager.description: If you first log into a WordPress.com account that has no sites attached to it, trying to add a self hosted site is very difficult because the My Site tabs "Add Site" button in this situation (see screenshot) only enables creating a wp.com blog. Instead, it should show the same menu that the site picker does when you add a site, which enables choosing between creating a wp.com blog and adding a self-hosted one.
Manager.title: Hard to add a self-hosted site when signed into a siteless wp.com account

Manager.description: This PR added a drop shadow to the toolbar, but the shadow shouldn't appear on activities that have tabs below the toolbar (ReaderSubsActivity and ThemeBrowserActivity). For example, reader subs should look like this: But right now it looks like this:
Manager.title: Toolbar shadow shouldn't appear above tabs

Manager.description: With high-traffic tags, or with users who don't sync very often, gaps may exist between the most recent existing post and the ones just retrieved from the server. These gaps mean the user is missing posts. Detect when these gaps occur and provide a way for the user to load the missing posts, similar to how Twitter handles this situation. See this PR for @aerych's solution to this issue on iOS.
Manager.title: Reader: handle gaps between posts

Manager.description: Notications settings are hidden if there is no push device id. Instead it should just check for a wp.com account, and if there is no device id we can hide the 'app notifications' setting.
Manager.title: Notifications: Allow settings access for wp.com user

Manager.description: Stick the time header to the top of the list to match the other apps. Should be fairly simple using an AppBar w/ a CoordinatorLayout.
Manager.title: Notifications: Stick time header to the top of the list

Manager.description: Noticed that the reader header doesn't apply the correct margin when in landscape on a tablet:
Manager.title: Reader: Header needs margin on landscape tablet

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: From a fresh install launch the app. Dismiss the keyboard and rotate to landscape orientation. The top right Help (?) icon stays aligned with the right edge of the text fields rather than the right edge of the screen. By comparison, if you tap to launch the Help screen, you'll notice the close (X) button is left aligned to the screen edge.
Manager.title: Sign In: Top right Help icon is not right aligned in landscape orientation

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: From a fresh install, tap the Help button at the top of the sign in screen to launch the Help screen. Tap the close (X) button. Watch closely as the button's tap animates. You'll see the button highlight is cut off at the bottom.
Manager.title: Sign in: Bottom of the help screen's close button is cropped when pressed

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Be offline. From a fresh install, tap the Help icon to launch the help screen. Tap the "Browse our FAQ" button. When the new Activity loads a toast is displayed reading: "Unable to reach support" This is a little confusion since I tapped to view the FAQ not contact "support". Maybe the message could be more specific?
Manager.title: Nux: FAQ - offline error message is confusing

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 From a fresh install tap to create a new WordPress.com account. Tap to edit the username field. Notice that the keyboard shown is for a URL. Maybe a regular text keyboard would be a better fit?
Manager.title: Nux: Create wpcom account, username field keyboard is for URLs

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 I'm seeing some extra white space in some of the posts in the post list. In these cases, the post is a title, followed by an image. The image is selected to feature and I'm guessing the mark up is being parsed out of the summary, but maybe not the carriage returns?
Manager.title: Post List: Extra white space in some summaries.

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 Self-hosted, no WPCom account. Immediately after signing in the first time I swiped left across the screen to view the Reader (as opposed to tapping the Reader tab). A spinner was present on screen and did not dismiss after waiting some time. Pull to refresh did not banish it. Switching to a different tab and back did not banish it. I tapped the home button, then tapped on the app's icon to resume the app. The spinner remained.
Manager.title: Reader: Stuck loading spinner

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Switch to the Reader tab Tap the gear icon to view the menu. Swipe twice right until you are viewing Sites You May Like Swipe once left to view Followed Sites The screen is now briefly frozen Happens when logged in to WPcom and when not.
Manager.title: Reader: UI momentarily frozen on Followed Sites

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Go to the first tab and select Comments. Tap any comment in the list to view its detail. From the detail, tap the back button to return to the list. Rotate your device. You are now back on the detail screen. Tap the back button to return to the list. Rotate your device. Go to step 5.
Manager.title: Comments: Detail view comes back on rotation

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 Title has it. The comment list in the screenshot contains three comments each with an image in the comment content. Notice the broken image glyph in each of the rows.
Manager.title: Comments: Broken images visible in comments list.

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: From the comments list, tap to view comment detail. Tap to approve or unapprove the comment. You are taken back to the list. You'll see an activity spinner over the comment's avatar. In a few moments the spinner will stop, and after a few more moments the Pending label will appear or disappear as appropriate. The delay between the spinner stopping and the label status updating made me think the moderation had failed the first time I tried it. Then when I attempted again I ended up confused about what state the comment was in as things were updating when I didn't expect. Could the spinner and label update at the same time?
Manager.title: Comments: Moderation has a visual delay

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 To Reproduce: From the comments list, tap to view a comment detail. Reply to the comment. After a moment you'll see a toast that the reply was sent. Return to the list. The reply is not present until you refresh the list. Comment moderation updates the list immediately so not showing the newly made comment is a little confusion.
Manager.title: Comments: Reply to a comment doesn't update the list.

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 View the reader while logged out of wpcom. Find a post showing a like button and tap the button. Note that nothing happens. Seems like the tap should push the detail view in this case.
Manager.title: Reader: Like button swallows taps when logged out

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 While logged out of wpcom, view a post detail in the reader. Note there is a follow button present in the post header. Tapping the follow button momentarily appears to succeed, then a toast says it was unable to follow the blog. Perhaps follow buttons should not be shown while logged out.
Manager.title: Reader: Detail shows follow button while logged out

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 While logged out of wpcom, tap the tag on a post card to preview the tag. Notice there is a follow button present in the preview header. Tap the button and notice you are now "following" the tag.... while logged out. The tag will appear in the topic drop down, however, it will be purged after tapping the Gear icon. For consistency with sites should following tags be unavailable while signed out?
Manager.title: Reader: Following tags appears to succeed while logged out.

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 While signed out, view the reader and tap the gear icon to view the menu. Tap the "X" button on any of the tags under "Followed Tags" to remove it. Return to the list and notice that the same tags were removed from the dropdown. Tap the gear icon again. Notice that the deleted tags are restored when the menu syncs.
Manager.title: Reader: Menu allows deleting tags, but they return when refreshed.

Manager.description: Title has it. Maybe hide these pages when logged out?
Manager.title: Reader: Logged out Reader shows empty lists for Followed Sites, Sites you may like

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 While logged out, view the reader's menu. Try to add a site or tag via the text field. Following a site will fail, but following a tag will appear to succeed, even though the tag does not show up in the list. Interestingly an added tag will be the current topic when you dismiss the menu. Maybe don't show the text field while logged out?
Manager.title: Reader: Logged out reader shows text field to follow site/tag

Manager.description: @aerych's latest round of breaking the app uncovered a number of problems with the logged-out reader: #3273 Logged out reader shows text field to follow site/tag #3272 Logged out Reader shows empty lists for Followed Sites, Sites you may like #3271 Menu allows deleting tags, but they return when refreshed #3270 Following tags appears to succeed while logged out #3269 Detail shows follow button while logged out #3268 Like button swallows taps when logged out #3282 Detail shows comment and like buttons when logged out and no comments or likes
Manager.title: Logged Out Reader Punch List

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce. I'd started signed into a self-hosted account and later connected to wpcom. Choose the notifications tab Tap on a "Follow" notification "so and so followed your blog.." Tap the notification detail header to preview the site. In this case it was my self-hosted site. In the site preview, notice the posts have like buttons but not comment buttons. Tap a like button. A comment button appears.
Manager.title: Reader: Comment button missing, then appears for previewed Jetpack site.

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: From a fresh install, sign into the app with a self-hosted blog. Switch to the "Me" tab and connect to WordPress.com. I used an account different from the Jetpack account connected to the self-hosted blog. Sign out of WordPress.com. Switch to the notifications tab. Instead of an option to sign in to use Jetpack, you see a message that says "No notifications"
Manager.title: Notifications: Unable to sign in to Jetpack after signing out of wpcom.

Manager.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 It goes by very quickly, but the "Other Recent Stats" labels are briefly visible at the top of the screen the first time the Stats page is visited. It is hidden as soon as the sync starts.
Manager.title: Stats: The "Other Recent Stats" label is briefly visible before the first sync

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 From a fresh install fill out the sign in screen for wpcom. Tapping return while the cursor is in the username field does nothing.
Manager.title: Sign in: Tapping return from username field should move to password field

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 (Saw this on the Nexus 4 also) To reproduce: (there may be other paths) Tap a comment notification for a comment that you have replied to, and your reply includes images. In the notification detail, scroll down and tap the "You replied to this comment." message. You're reply will show up in the list of comments that appears. Wait a bit. Notice the images do not load. Scroll away from the images and back. The images will now appear.
Manager.title: Comments: Images do not show when loaded.

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Sign into the app with just a self-hosted blog (no wpcom). Choose one of the default topics where its unlikely there will be likes/comments on recent posts. Scroll the list til you find a post card that has neither likes nor comments shown. Tap to view the detail. Notice that the like button and the comment button are visible, even though there are no likes or comments to view.
Manager.title: Reader: Detail shows comment and like buttons when logged out and no comments or likes

Manager.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Be logged into wpcom. Tap the button to disconnect wpcom. Rotate the device while the spinner is visible. Boom.
Manager.title: Crash: App crashes when rotating while signing out.

Manager.description: Reader analytics in the Android app are out of sync with the iOS app now that this PR has been merged.
Manager.title: Add missing reader analytics

Manager.description: Implement team management as part of people management for blogs. Here are the initial screenshots for the feature: https://cloudup.com/cSrd17DVG6r

Manager.description: Good catch @roundhill.

Manager.description: Icons have been updated on the Web version so we need these updated on the Android app. Update: As an example, iOS icons (using Noticons): Web icons (using Gridicons): /cc @daniloercoli
Manager.title: Stats: Icons need to be updated from Noticons to Gridicons

Manager.description: Started getting this bug when uploading posts with images (or individual images, e.g. through adding a gallery or using the new visual editor). The post/image upload will get stuck, and the upload will never complete. Posts with no images upload successfully. Log: Notes: Only happens on mobile devices (the bug doesn't occur when using emulators or when using a device proxied through Charles or Fiddler) - specifically, a Nexus 4, a Nexus 6 and a Nexus 9. Occurs 100% of the time on some days, and on other days it never happens Tested on develop and on the current beta Have only been able to test this on a single Wi-Fi network (in Germany) cc @daniloercoli
Manager.title: Media uploads sometimes fail with NoHttpResponseException

Manager.description: Demo: https://cloudup.com/cx675nqeZtR
Manager.title: FAB icon jumps under the snack bar when trashing 2 posts in a row

Manager.description: I've got a Nexus 7 (2013) Android Tablet with the WordPress for Android App (4.5.2), WordPress 4.3.1, and Android 5.1.1 (although this problem has existed for as long as I have used this tablet). When I go to "View Admin," I get this:
Manager.title: "Your Browser is Out of Date" when Viewing Admin in Nexus 7

Manager.description: Note that only the content of the comment should be Merriweather. Also the same applies to Comments under My Sites. cc @roundhill
Manager.title: Notifications: detail view of comments should use Merriweather font

Manager.description: When uploading a picture to the media library I see it show up in the view momentarily, and then it disappears. After leaving and going back in it shows up just fine. Here's a screencap recorded off of my emulator (on a self-compiled apk using the latest source from git) connected to a self-hosted site, although I saw the same problem on the latest beta on my OnePlus One connected to WordPress.com. https://cloudup.com/iyGvmEjotjP The difference is that the logfile on the emulator has an exception relating to the media library that isn't present on the real device. Although you'll see in the video that re-opening the Media Library was unresponsive for a moment, so the exception may be related to that. The full logfile can be found here: http://wp-srstancil.rhcloud.com/2015/10/09/wordpress-application-log/
Manager.title: Media Library: Image disappears from view shortly after upload - 4.6-rc-3

Manager.description: If you add a video to a post, it shows an image icon. I believe it used to have a video icon. Maybe these days we can get a thumbnail preview of the video?
Manager.title: Adding a Video to a Post Show Wrong Icon

Manager.description: On my Galaxy S6, uploading a video appeared to hang my entire device, it wasn't responsive until the video finished uploading... very bad experience.
Manager.title: Uploading Video Hangs Device

Manager.description: In WordPress.getBlog there is a catch Exception without any logging. Better to add a log line there.
Manager.title: Missing log in case of errors in `WordPress.getBlog`

Manager.description: We should remove all hardcoded strings from the app: Some should be replaced by translatable strings (e.g. Start Date in res/layout/date_range_dialog.xml), some by non-translatable strings (e.g. automattic.com in res/layout/about_activity.xml), some can be dropped (e.g. This is a text in res/layout/theme_details_fragment.xml) and some can be replaced with tools:text if needed in the visual editor (e.g. date in res/layout/comment_listitem.xml). Run the following command to list them: pushd WordPress/src/main ; lint --check HardcodedText . ; popd Once this is done, we must define the HardcodedText lint check as an error instead of a warning. The reason behind that: make sure we can't add new hardcoded strings by mistake.
Manager.title: Remove all hardcoded strings from the app

Manager.description: That featured died with permission requests. See #3328 and this Android issue.

Manager.description: No matter what filter I am viewing, if I rotate my device between portrait and landscape it will return to the "All" filter view. Steps: Hold device in Portrait orientation Tap from All to another filter view (Unread, Comments, Follows, or Likes) Rotate device to Landscape orientation. Result: Notifications show "All" filter Tap from All to another filter view (Unread, Comments, Follows, or Likes) Rotate device back to Portrait orientation. Result Notifications show "All" filter Expected behavior: After rotating the device, it is still on the same filter view I selected before rotating. Tested on Nexus 7 (first gen), Android 5.1.1, WordPress app beta 4.7-rc-1
Manager.title: Notifications returns to "All" filter after rotating device

Manager.title: Replace GCMBaseIntentService with GcmListenerService

Manager.description: When capturing a video from inside the app and trying to upload it, while at the same time you don't have VideoPress enabled (because not self-hosed or no subscription on wp.com), then you get the error: Media error: An error occurred while uploading media. While you should get: Media error: Get the VideoPress upgrade to ... The problem is due to a bug where the newly captured video (media) is not classified as a video. (isVideo() = false).
Manager.title: Uploading newly captured video gives wrong error

Manager.description: Device: Nexus 6P Running the beta, I clicked comments on a post with ~25 comments. All were made within the last 20 minutes. It kept saying that there were no comments though. After closing it from the open apps dialog, and then reopening it, the comments loaded. Sorry I don't have any more info - I realise this may be a bit hard to debug/replicate, but thought I should mention it.
Manager.title: Comments not showing until app reset

Manager.description: Right now the reader uses "Freshly Pressed" as the default topic. This should be changed to the new Discover topic.

Manager.description: Right now the app tracks when Freshly Pressed is viewed (via READER_FRESHLY_PRESSED_LOADED). This should be changed to track Discover now that it has replaced Freshly Pressed.

Manager.title: "Huge" font size cuts off text

Manager.description: Reported by @roundhill, sometimes the featured image in the post list is incorrect (it shows the image from another post). This may be happening only with posts that have embeds/videos as featured images (ie: featured videos).
Manager.title: Reader shows incorrect featured image

Manager.description: General The "More" link that opens the detailed Discussion settings is black and in Roboto; it should match the other items in the list. In the following dialogs, there is a border above the button row that isn't needed, as the dialog doesn't scroll: Privacy, Default category, Close after, Sort by, Threading, Paging, Automatically approve. https://cloudup.com/cJZYXXAJCB0 Language In the language dialog, there is an extra translucent border (or shadow?) on top of the one that should be there. Tagline The "Tagline" header is set in Roboto, #212121; it should be Open Sans Semibold, grey_dark. The text field is set in Roboto, #212121; it should be Open Sans Regular, grey_dark. The buttons are set in Roboto, orange_jazzy; they should be using Open Sans Semibold, blue_medium (other dialog buttons elsewhere are correct). If I hit "Cancel" sometimes the dialog goes away, but the keyboard doesn't: Links in comments There are a few issues on this screen, so I've made an annotated copy of the original mockup for comparison. Note that the latest Material Design guidelines don't use borders around the selected item in a picker: https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/pickers.html#pickers-date-pickers ## Related Posts There are a few fonts and colors that are wrong in this section; here's an annotated comparison: ## Hold for moderation "No items" has no padding; it should have the same amount of padding as an item in the list. When adding an item to the hold for moderation/blacklist, the dialog has a few issues, noted here: There are also a few issues in the multi-selection mode:
Manager.title: Site Settings design issues

Manager.description: When I make a bunch of text into a hyperlink in the Android app, the text input field for the link is pre-loaded with http:// which is actually kind of inconvenient, since almost all links on mobile are copy-pasted from my mobile browser window. Since the field doesn't filter out the double http:// I have to delete it every time. Just a quick thought I wanted to put out there while it was fresh in the mind. Happy to discuss.
Manager.title: Add Link Pre-loaded Text Inconvenient

Manager.description: We're at a pretty low rate of usage and there is little feature-wise missing from the native stats implementation. Related: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPressCom-Stats-iOS/issues/357 cc: @daniloercoli
Manager.title: Remove View Web Version of stats

Manager.description: Might be related to #3332. I've noticed that if I select many images (say 5-10) in the Photos app and then share to the WP media library, it will only upload one or two of the images. And usually the second image is corrupted like in #3332. Overall, Media seems really buggy and needs a good rework.
Manager.title: Media Library: Sharing multiple images to media library doesn't upload all images

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Open the theme picker Search for a theme Rotate your device Result: The top bar is still white (like the search bar) but it is empty and the theme picker now displays all of the theme instead of the search results After searching (searched for "twenty" and results are displaying): After rotating the device (top bar is blank and results are gone): Device: Nexus 9 OS: 6.0 App: 4.8-rc-1

Manager.title: Media browser blank images

Manager.description: Media Browser. When you don't have permissions to upload media to a site, you only get a "Media upload error" Toast. We should show a specific message (XMLRPC message is: You do not have permission to upload files. [Code: 401]) and hide the "retry" button.
Manager.title: Inaccurate error message when user doesn't have permissions to upload media to a site

Manager.description: 46.139.84.148 - - [30/Nov/2015:10:55:50 +0000] "GET /xmlrpc.php HTTP/1.0" 405 42 "-" "wp-android/4.8-rc-1 (Android 5.1.1; en_US; Sony D5803/D5803)" Steps to reproduce: Open the app, write a post. It can include images, but doesn’t have to. I can reproduce the issue whether I include images or not. Click “Save” or “Publish” to push your changes to the site. Reported by @jeherve Could be the host

Manager.description: On specific combination of screen size / language, filter buttons text can be truncated like here (Galaxy S2, Czech): I don't think there is a simple fix here that won't need a full redesign of this radio buttons. We could at least use android:ellipsize="none" or android:ellipsize="marquee" so the ellipsis character … won't use half of the screen.
Manager.title: Truncated text in Notification screen

Manager.description: I'm not 100% sure if this is an error, but we may want to revise the way READER_ACCESSED is tracked in the app. In details, the READER_ACCESSED event is tracked every time the Reader Posts List activity is shown on the screen. So if you go from the Article Details Screen back to the Reader Posts List screen READER_ACCESSED is fired. It's then fired twice when a user opens the reader and just read one article. Steps to reproduce the issue: Open the Reader (READER_ACCESSED fired) Tap on a Article (reader_article_opened fired) Go back to the posts list (READER_ACCESSED fired) @astralbodies - IIRC there were discrepancies on Reader Usage on the two platforms? /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Analytics - READER_ACCESSED event is fired too often

Manager.description:
Hey @astralbodies do you remember what we should track in user_info_number_of_blogs ? Is it meaning the number of visible blogs? or the number of total blogs for a user? Asking this because we're tracking it wrong on sign in, since the me endpoint is called asynchronously in the app, resulting in empty visible blogs list. [1] => Array ( [_en] => _aliasUser [_ts] => 1449658481331 [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ut] => wpcom:user_id [user_info_number_of_blogs] => 0 [anonId] => 29188508a93f4bdb98f990719d3ed414 )
Manager.title: Analytics - Tracking user_info_number_of_blogs property

Manager.description: Tested in both current production version and current beta version. When you trash a post from the app it is permanently deleted. It would make more sense if it were sent to the Trash instead so that you have the ability to restore before it is gone for good.
Manager.title: Trashing Post From App Permenantly Deletes It

Manager.description: This hack which worked around our favorite design lib issue is no longer necessary.
Manager.title: Remove masterbar tab reselect hack
Truncated text (numbers) in Stats widget on xperia Z5 Compact

Manager.description: In places such as this we're assuming onDismissed is called once, but in fact it fires multiple times due to this bug in the design library. This causes multiple calls to the endpoints for trashing a post, comment, or notification.
Manager.title: Snackbar onDismissed fires multiple times

Manager.description: Note this is the same user, some gravatars are shown while others default to mystery man, before scroll everything looks OK: https://cloudup.com/c7IB6B3260w

Manager.title: Reader comment images requested multiple times

Manager.description: When reader detail requests a post that isn't already cached, upon failure it simply displays a toast alerting to the failure. This is fine for current use since it rarely happens, but once we add cross-post handling we'll need a way to better handle permission failures.
Manager.title: Reader detail should handle get post failure better

Manager.description: Open the "Likers" screen for a post in the reader, and check avatars. I noticed sometimes they're duplicated (like in the picture below) or assigned to the wrong person. I bet this happen if you rotate the device when avatars are loading. See Danilo and Tony ^
Manager.title: Reader - Wrong liker avatar

Manager.description: The post list preview is sometimes unable to load images from private sites because the WebView doesn't call its WebViewClient.shouldInterceptRequest() method, which adds the necessary Authorization header (as well as the custom UserAgent). This can happen with non-private sites as well, but in that case only the custom UserAgent is missing. This also affects the new editor's WebView and possibly other WebViews in the app. Happens much more frequently on emulators than real devices, and somewhat more frequently on older devices than new ones. Possibly caused by the WebView processing the request before its WebViewClient has been initialized properly.
Manager.title: Custom headers are sometimes ignored by the post list preview (and other WebViews)

Manager.description: There's a flow that, as a user, feels pretty weird to me. you are in the app, in your post list Click on 'view' in one of the posts In the post, click on 'edit' You are taken to calypso editor. I'm not sure if this is feasible to do, but in this case, being inside the app, I would expect to be taken to the app editor instead of the web one.
Manager.title: Edit button from post takes you to calypso editor

Manager.description: Open the site picker Select site XYZ Select a hidden site with the search feature on the site picker Tap back Tap the New Post button Notice the ActionBar title is XYZ and not the one previously picked This could produce other errorr. We should probably make selected sites via search visible is they're hidden.
Manager.title: Use the search to select a hidden site result in app weirdness

Manager.description: There is a bug in WordPress 4.4 that changed the post_date from local time to gmt time. https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/35053 This results in the post not posting at the correct time. The fix will be in 4.4.1, but 4.4 will always have this issue. We'll need a special case for self-hosted sites on 4.4
Manager.title: WordPress 4.4 post date is incorrect

Manager.description: As per this discussion on #3594.
Manager.title: Use WebSettings.getDefaultUserAgent() when possible

Manager.description: If you update your site's title and then return to the main menu, you'll still see the old title at the top of the page until you either tap Switch Site and re-select it, or close and re-launch the app. Screencast: https://cloudup.com/c-6J8y6dzmM
Manager.title: Site Settings: Updating site title isn't reflected in the rest of the app without reselecting the site

Manager.description: While editing the fields in the My Profile section in /me, I rotated my device. This closed the window where I was making the changes without saving anything, so my changes were lost. That wouldn't be so terrible for the first/last name or display name, but I had added a big chunk of text to the "About Me" section and it was frustrating to lose it and have to start over. Ideally, I should be able to rotate the device and have the field I was editing stay open so I can continue editing it until I save or cancel the changes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, beta 5.0-rc-1
Manager.title: My Profile: Rotating device loses unsaved changes

Manager.description: Media events are currently counted twice for the new editor (or would be once launched), once in EditPostActivity (here) and once again in the editor fragment itself (here). We should change EditPostActivity to only register the events if the legacy editor is being used; otherwise, defer to the editor itself for tracking the events. Must be merged against feature/visual-editor.
Manager.title: Fix double-counting of media tracking events for new editor

Manager.description: Add infos about string aliases and key strings #3609 (comment) Change the "Drawable Resources" section to reflect our new policy (Vector assets + let android-gradle generates bitmaps).
Manager.title: Update CONTRIBUTING.md

Manager.description: Steps to repro: Go to Themes. Tap the search icon and write the search word "dd". There should only be 1 theme in the result page. "Edda" Tap on "Edda" and then tap back when in the details page. The app takes you back to the search page, the search input field is blank, and it starts a new empty search, making all the themes showing in the page after a while. A fix for this issue should be in #3571 See https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/pull/3571/files#diff-657f5b9cb48627e41f20d73414d51c63R27
Manager.title: Theme - Last searched keyword is lost if you open the details of a theme

Manager.title: Missing default translation for string name="none"

Manager.description: When I tap to open the Site Title or Tagline settings, the keyboard appears briefly and then immediately closes. I still see the cursor at the end of the text field, but I have to tap again on the text field to re-open the keyboard to make changes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1
Manager.title: Site Settings: Keyboard disappears immediately after opening Site Title or Tagline settings

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Select a site and open the Settings Select Language (to choose the blog language) Note that the list of languages displays the name of each language in that language and below displays the name of each language in your language (e.g. English/English, Deutsch/German, Español/Spanish). Select a new language from the list. Result: The second name of each language changes to the name of that language in the language you just selected (so if you select Español/Spanish, the list becomes e.g. English/Inglés, Deutsch/Alemán, Español/Español). The blog language shouldn't affect the UI language, so the list of languages should always respect the device/app UI language and not the selected blog language. Screenshot with English selected as the blog language: Screenshot with Greek selected as the blog language: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.
Manager.title: Site Settings: Selecting new blog language changes the names of the languages in the Language list

Manager.description: You have the option to export a site and when you click the "export site" button, it will send you to a webview where you can export your site.
Manager.title: Delete Site - export site

Manager.description: When deleting a site the preference will show you what domains will be deleted
Manager.title: Delete site - domains removed

Manager.description: When clicking on Themes in the Android app, and then Menus, it’s almost impossible to scroll down to “Add Item” in Menu if there are existing items as it thinks you are just trying to reorder the existing items... We were able to get around this by scrolling on the tiny margin on the side, but it's quite hard! :)
Manager.title: Themes - Menus - Difficult to Scroll to Add Items

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Select a site and open Settings Under "Discussion" select "More" Leave the app (e.g. return to the device home screen) Return to the app Result: The message "Unfortunately, WordPress has stopped." appears, and you are returned to your site's My Sites screen. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.
Manager.title: Site Settings: Leaving the app after opening the detailed discussion settings crashes the app

Manager.description: Under Settings > Discussion: More > Threading, setting the threading to "None" correctly disables comment threading on the site but doesn't uncheck the "Enable threaded (nested) comments" setting in the site's settings in a browser. As a result, the browser settings are out of sync and don't correctly control the site's comment threading. Steps to reproduce: In the app, select a site and go to Settings Under Discussion, select More and then Threading In the Threading window, select "None" and then "OK" Check the front of the site and confirm that threading is off. (I used a post with a comment and a threaded reply, and the two comments were not threaded after making this change. Check the site's discussion settings at https://wordpress.com/settings/discussion Result: The browser settings have "Enable threaded (nested) comments up to 2 levels deep" checked. (Note that if you choose a different level of threading in the app settings, the browser settings change accordingly. The only issue is when "None" is selected.) This doesn't only cause a syncing problem. After this, it's no longer possible to enable comment threading in the browser settings by simply unchecking/re-checking the "Enable threaded (nested) comments" setting. (This makes no change on the front of the site.) The only solution is to change the level of threading in the browser settings or re-enable threading from the app settings. Testing on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.
Manager.title: Site Settings: Changing discussion threading to "none" causes settings to get out of sync in browser

Manager.description: In the discussion settings, the "Paging" setting always display the select number ("# comments per page") even if those settings are toggled off. Steps to reproduce: Select a site and go to Settings Under Discussion, select More Tap on "Paging" and toggle it on, selecting a number of days, and tap "OK." Confirm that under "Paging" it shows the number of days you selected. Tap on "Paging" again and toggle it off, and tap "OK." Under "Paging" it still shows the number of days selected, instead of noting that Paging is disabled. The "Close after" setting is also sometimes affected by this issue. Right after toggling "Close after" off, it will say "Never" under that setting in the discussion settings. However, if you exit the app and come back, it will go back to saying "# days" instead of "Never" (although the setting is still disabled). Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.
Manager.title: Site Settings: Confusing display in discussion settings when "Paging" is toggled off

Manager.description: This issue is a part of #3551 Currently StatsActivity serves as a container for multiple abstract stats fragments that display stats data. Stats are supposed to be a default view in upcoming double pane layout (like it's currently on the website). To be able to show stas as a part of dual pane layout we need to move all the code from StatsActivity to StatsFragment. Design wise, the main change will be to move the time frame spinner from toolbar to fragment (we can't use toolbar in dual pane layout). So the dual pane layout will look something like this: About the code. Most of the code nicely fits into fragment's lifecycle, except for couple of tricky parts: There are multiple places in StatsActivity where finish() is called when something goes wrong, and activity just closes after showing error toast. This is fine in case of activity, but if the fragment is in dual pane layout this won't work, especially if stats will be a default fragment. Easy solution is to make StatsFragment remove itself after showing Toast/Snack with error message. This will leave us with confused user and some empty space (we could put WP logo there, or something like this). Apart from issues with finish(), at some points user interaction might be required: Missing Jetpack modal dialog could be converted into Snackbar, but we would only have one button - YES Or, we can expand on error view idea, like this: The one issue I'm not exactly sure what to do about is the Sign in requirement for self-hosted site. I'm not sure at what circumstances exactly it happens (why would account not be signed in while browsing stats), but current code just launches SignInActivity without any prompt. I don't think this will work well within dual pane layout, especially when the fragment is default.
Manager.title: Make Stats compatible with dual pane layout

Manager.description: In the site settings, some fields should only allow single-line entries, but currently the on-screen keyboard allows you to start a new line for a multi-line entry: Site Title (General settings) Tagline (General settings) Hold for Moderation (Discussion settings: Comments) Blacklist (Discussion settings: Comments) This doesn't break anything, but it's confusing that the UI allows multi-line entries in these cases. For site titles and taglines, the multiple lines are collapsed into a single line after saving. Before saving: After saving and reopening the site title setting: For the comment moderation and blacklist, the multiple lines are divided into separate entries once the screen is refreshed (and so they work correctly), but they are shown in a single entry at first which is confusing and hard to modify. Entering multiple lines: After saving the multi-line entry: After refreshing the screen: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.
Manager.title: Site Settings: Some fields allow multi-line entries when they should be single-line fields

Manager.description: When first opening the app, if you go to the self-hosted login screen, leave the screen (either within the app or by exiting and reopening the app), and the return to the login screen, it will revert back to the WordPress.com login screen. Steps to reproduce: Open the app while logged out Select "Add self-hosted site" Optional: begin to enter your account information Tap on the Help icon (?) in the top right, or exit the app on your device Go back to the login screen Result: You see the WordPress.com login screen instead of the self-hosted login screen you were just on I encountered this in a very normal login flow, where I entered my username and site URL but had to leave the app to get my password. When I reopened the app, I saw the wrong login screen. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.
Manager.title: Sign In: Leaving the self-hosted login screen, it reverts back to WordPress.com login

Manager.description: The Site Settings language dialog does not sort language entries, it should take a hint from Account Settings ;)
Manager.title: Sort language entries in language picker dialog

Manager.description: Make sure the feature/delete-site has been looked over by @oguzkocer, @nbradbury, @mattmiklic, and @adambbecker for the following: Wording Design Icons Address primary domain label Remove Site for self-hosted pass (Not going to do anything right now as that will be deprecated soon) Verify all font is Roboto (No more open sans in app #3814) Align all icons/headers/text views Verify all error messages I recommend adding if (!NetworkUtils.checkConnection(getActivity())) return; before making the network calls
Manager.title: Delete site - polish

Manager.description: The "start over" section does not match the rest of "Delete Site" preferences. Use WPIconWidgetPreference to make them the same.
Manager.title: Delete site - start over match style

Manager.description: Since adding the Stats widget feature a couple of releases ago, there’s only been a small percentage of users using it relative to overall Stats usage. This may be because the only way to find out about it is if they’ve read previous release notes or accidentally stumbled upon it. To make this more discoverable, we want to try adding a dialog box to call out this feature and maybe help increase engagement.
Manager.title: Make Stats Widget more discoverable

Manager.description: I've been trying to use TalkBack to navigate the app and create a new Post. The navigation is super hard and some buttons are just unlabeled. First step is to add contentDescription to all image buttons (icons) to make sure users don't need to select "button 35" to create a new post. Related: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#183
Manager.title: Bring better accessibility to the app

Manager.description: First alpha builds will be used to test the new editor.
Manager.title: Create a new variant for alpha builds

Manager.description: Sites with an active subscription must remove their subscriptions before they can delete their site. We can link them to their subscriptions in a webview that they can handle.
Manager.title: Delete site - disallow sites with active subscription from deleting their site

Manager.description: According to code, when post, created through MySite fragment's FAB, is saved as draft, the "Blog Posts" row should blink twice. Looks like it's not working because of the bug in RelativeLayout. From official documentation: Note: In platform version 17 and lower, RelativeLayout was affected by a measurement bug that could cause child views to be measured with incorrect MeasureSpec values. (See MeasureSpec.makeMeasureSpec for more details.) This was triggered when a RelativeLayout container was placed in a scrolling container, such as a ScrollView or HorizontalScrollView. If a custom view not equipped to properly measure with the MeasureSpec mode UNSPECIFIED was placed in a RelativeLayout, this would silently work anyway as RelativeLayout would pass a very large AT_MOST MeasureSpec instead.
Manager.title: "Blog Posts" row in MySite fragment is not blinking when post is saved as draft

Manager.description: Posts can have images in the media attachments that do not appear in the post body. It can be confusing to the post author if one of these images happens to be selected as the "featured" image in the post cards and detail. Let's filter attachments missing from the post body from the featured image candidate pool.
Manager.title: Reader: Featured image selection should not include attachments missing from the post body.

Manager.description: When you use the in-app browser to view a site's wp admin dashboard, any time you rotate the device it refreshes and goes back to the main dashboard screen at /wp-admin. This loses your place and loses any unsaved work. Steps to reproduce: Select a site in the app and select "View Admin" In the wp admin dashboard, navigate to another part of the dashboard (e.g. Settings > General) Rotate your device Result: You are returned to the main dashboard screen (instead of staying in the part of the dashboard you had navigated to). Reported in an app review; tested and reproduced on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2
Manager.title: View Admin: In-app browser refreshes view after rotating device

Manager.description: When trying to dismiss the popup by touching the area surrounding it, it's possible to do it from the right side, but not from the left side. A screenshot to illustrate: This happens on the Nexus 6
Manager.title: Site Settings: "Learn More" popup not dismissible from left side

Manager.description: The "Learn More" pop up displays the links present in the webpage as usual, and therefore it's possible to go to unintuitive places from there. Maybe it would be better to open the support page using a new browser tab instead of as a pop up? Here are some screenshots to illustrate: This is related to #3638
Manager.title: Site Settings: "Learn More" popup can follow links in browser to odd pages

Manager.description: When I select the 'Known users' comments' at the 'Automatically approve' section like this: It saves the following two settings as on in wp-admin: Comment must be manually approved Comment author must have a previously approved comment I expected only the 'Comment author must have a previously approved comment' checkbox to be checked, though, like this:
Manager.title: Site Settings: Automatically approve setting from known users does not work as expected

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to site settings while online Turn off internet connectivity See that you can change the site title and it gets saved in the UI, even though there's a toast indicating that the change was not saved: I expected not to be able to click on any of the settings while offline (and for the settings to be greyed out), and for the orange no connection indicator to be shown. If I do click on a setting that's usually enabled, I expect a toast indicating why I'm not able to use it (i.e. no internet connectivity).
Manager.title: Site Settings: should not allow user to make changes when offline

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to Site Settings > Discussion > More > Blacklist or Hold for Moderation Click orange Plus button See that you can enter a new line and it gets saved: Note that the newline character does not get saved in the backend, so it's a UI issue only.
Manager.title: Site settings: Blacklist/Moderation: should not be able to add newline character in item

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to Site Settings > Discussion > More > Paging or Site Settings > Discussion > More > Close after See that the modal has duplicate text:
Manager.title: Site Settings: Close comments and paging modals should not have duplicate text

Manager.description: Steps: Open WordPress app (already logged as a user with a site) Go to wp-admin > Settings > General for your site Change the site title and save Go to the Site Settings page for the site on the app, and see that the old site title is displayed instead Try to refresh the page by pulling down, and see that it's not possible You can get the app to display the new title by swiping the WordPress app from the recent apps list and opening it again. Note that this behaviour doesn't happen in MyProfile: when making changes directly on the web, it's possible to see them in the app almost immediately by going to a different page and then returning to My Profile.
Manager.title: Site settings: when changing settings in wp-admin, it should be possible to see changes on app

Manager.description: Steps: Open Comments activity from MySites tab. Long press on any comment. Contextual action bar (CAB) appears at top of the screen. Rotate device. Selected comments and CAB are gone. Issue with dialogs on this screen: When CAB is visible try to delete/approve/unapprove some comments, and while progress dialog is displayed, rotate your device - progress dialog will stick, and won't be dismissed, the only way out of this is to kill an app. When "Trash comments" confirmation dialog is visible rotate devices - the dialog will disappear (along with selected comments). I discovered those issues while working on CommentActivity as part of #3551 . Fix is included in upcoming PR (will be submitted after #3663 is merged).
Manager.title: Comments list not retaining state on orientation change

Manager.description: If an author name contains, for example, an ampersand, it is not decoded when displayed: We recently ran into this on Calypso too: Automattic/wp-calypso#2901
Manager.title: Me: HTML entities are not decoded in author name

Manager.description: When attempting to upload an image, I was prompted with the new dialog to grant permissions to view media on the device / upload (2 separate permissions). After granting permission to both of them, rather than allowing me to upload an image (expected), it took me back to the editor and I had to start the process again. Would be great if the flow wasn't interrupted after granting permission.
Manager.title: After granting permissions for media upload, taken back to editor

Manager.description: In the Post list and Pages list, dates on the posts/pages are not localized. For example, these screenshots show the dates in English when the app's language is set to German: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2.
Manager.title: Reader Post List: relative time spans are not localized

Manager.description: When a notifications section is empty, it includes an explanation and a "View Reader" button to open the Reader tab. However, the notifications icon stays highlighted at the top of the app even after it sends you to the Reader. Empty notifications screen: Reader icon is underlined, but notifications icon is still highlighted (white) while Reader icon is greyed out: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2.
Manager.title: Reader icon isn't highlighted after tapping the "View Reader" button from notifications

Manager.description: When the app language (set in Account Settings) is set to a language other than English, rotating the device while viewing stats returns the error "Stats couldn't be loaded for the required blog." (I couldn't reproduce this issue with the app language set to English.) Stats error from the logs: 02-01 17:48:28.521 5608 5608 E WordPress-STATS: The blog with local_blog_id -1 cannot be loaded from the DB. Screenshot before rotating: After rotating: Tested and confirmed in Spanish, German, and Arabic on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2.
Manager.title: Stats returns an error when the app language is non-English and the device is rotated

Manager.description: There is no way to control the length of translated text, so button text could be much longer than what's expected, here is the Snackbar displayed in French:
Manager.title: Snackbars with long text button are pretty ugly

Manager.description: Related to #3643 and #3691. The Spinner now resides in the Activity's toolbar, but in order to be able to be used as a component, (as the filter acts on the data displayed by the RecyclerView), it needs be taken out of the Activity and moved into a fragment where the RecyclerView resides.
Manager.title: Comments: make Spinner status type filter part of the fragment

Manager.description: Repro: Click Learn More -> Loading view shows Background the app Foreground the app -> Loading view never disappears
Manager.title: Site Settings - Learn More stuck loading if app is backgrounded when loading completes

Manager.description: The only change that occurs is the hint goes from "Reply to post" to "Reply to comment". Unless you're looking for it, it doesn't look like anything is happening. Suggested fix: Pop up the keyboard when it is clicked
Manager.title: Clicking reply to comment doesn't open the keyboard

Manager.description: Steps: Open Themes from MySite. Scroll down to the end of the list (might take a while). While additional themes are loading and progress indicator is visible, rotate your device. You are near the end of the list, progress indicator is jittering and the additional themes won't load. And here is the bad part, after doing all abovementioned: Go back to MySite. Again, open Themes. Scroll down to the end of the list. Additional themes won't load. (In same orientation!). Only thing that helps is app reinstall (maybe logout/login will help too). Tested on Nexus 5 and Nexus 7 (2013).
Manager.title: Theme browser won't load new themes when end of the list is reached.

Manager.description: Spotted on the Play Store: The Wordpress Reader doesn't work. If you lock your phone, when you unlock it the page is blank. I can reproduce: Open a Reader post detail. Lock your phone (or switch app / activity). Unlock. Webview is blank.
Manager.title: Reader post detail blank webview on activity pause/resume

Manager.description: We'll be looking to improve the Settings page to add a couple more features, update it's style and refactor out some old code. The work is already ongoing on feature/account-settings branch, and it's a bit late to open the issue. Here is a screenshot to show some of the changes we're looking to implement:
Manager.title: Account Settings

Manager.description: If "enable location" is turned off in site settings, you still get a permission dialog about location when creating a post. It should only request location permission when location is enabled.
Manager.title: Location permission shouldn't appear unless location is enabled

Manager.description: I am going to separate this issue from #3726 since it doesn't affect the functionality and a bit blocked by the #3676. I'll take care of this once the Account Settings changes merged in to develop. https://cloudup.com/iCP_cIADt0L
Manager.title: Add a hint message to web address dialog in Account Settings

Manager.description: PR #3719 introduced a new issue, where the virtual keyboard stays on if the popup dialog is dismissed by tapping outside of it while editing. Tapping Cancel or OK on the dialog does dismiss the keyboard but not if tapped outside of it. /cc @tonyr59h
Manager.title: Virtual keyboard is not dismissed in site settings

Manager.description: Comes from #3729 (comment) I just noticed that if you view the detail of a trashed comment, you can trash it again - which removes it from the list of trashed comments until you next refresh. This bug didn't come up before because prior to this PR we didn't show trashed comments. What should happen is you're able to untrash the trashed comment. I think this can be a separate issue with a separate PR - just wanted to mention it. Same goes for long-pressing/group actions on trashed list items. Following the wp-admin site, actions on trashed list items should be: untrash (restore) spam delete permanently (check if there's API support for that)
Manager.title: Allow trashed comments to be "untrashed"

Manager.description: Steps: Go to Account setting. Set language to something other than devices. Go to any activity (Comments list, for example) or just open a Reader tab. Scroll down. Rotate devices. Scroll position (and any other state activity had) is not retained.
Manager.title: Activity state is not retained when using manually set locale.

Manager.description: I wonder if we can save multilple identities and if we can save the URL as well as username/password. https://developers.google.com/identity/smartlock-passwords/android/
Manager.title: Implement Smart Lock for Passwords to save/retrieve credentials

Manager.description: Given we now have the same functionality in Comments for filtering comment types, we can also use the same component on the Stats screen
Manager.title: Use scroll/hide toolbar component from Comments in Stats

Manager.description: As we have discussed on Slack, as part of the improvement of Account Settings, we are removing this feature completely. We believe it's not used often and not worth the trouble of maintenance.
Manager.title: Remove auto-sharing

Manager.description: Similar to #3751, we are removing post signature from Settings since it's not a feature that's often used.
Manager.title: Remove post signature from Settings

Manager.description: Good find @khaykov! Sounds like we're going to have to convert the remainder of our ActionBar usages to Toolbar in order to work around a caching issue. See #3740 for more details.
Manager.title: Locale changes don't update ActionBar titles until there is a configuration change

Manager.description: If you change your device's language to a different locale and go into Site Settings and change your language, the list is not sorted to your locale. So the non-english characters are not sorted correctly (in some cases).
Manager.title: Sorted language display strings doesn't respect Locale

Manager.description: If the user changes the language to non-default and then changes it back to the default language, we don't keep track of it. /cc @daniloercoli
Manager.title: App language change to default is not tracked

Manager.description: I recently tapped on the Turn PIN lock on in Account Settings and I was presented by a screen asking me: Enter your PIN. Now, what PIN would that be? My device pin? I'm sure not, but it might make lots of users sit there and think about it for a sec and still not be sure what this means or does. And what exactly will that lock down after I enter a PIN? I guess we could improve this by adding a bit more detail here. Something like "Enter a new app PIN" (if I do it the first time around) or "Enter your current app PIN" if i'm going to change it. I'll leave to the more design+english fluent here to come up with the best wording ;)
Manager.title: Improve description in PIN lock screen
