Manager.title: Crash report 5.0 - ClassCastException in WPNumberPicker

Manager.description: When the user changes her email, we start showing the email change snackbar immediately, if there is an error in the request, we tell the user about the error but the snackbar doesn't go away.
Manager.title: If the email change request fails Snackbar should be removed

Manager.description: @tonyr59h reported that, even after confirming the email change from web, if the email change snackbar is present, it doesn't go away if the account settings is refreshed.
Manager.title: When you confirm email change from web, the snackbar stays in the app after refresh

Manager.description: ... probably due to how we load a Post.
Manager.title: Having a category with HTML entities make the Post.hasChanges() method returns true

Manager.description: We must upgrade to v23.2 and add vectorDrawables.useSupportLibrary = true in our gradle config, also check that PNGs aren't generated anymore and make sure that works on all API levels.
Manager.title: Upgrade to support library v23.3 and use VectorDrawableCompat

Manager.description: Editor Ref: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#281 Calypso Ref: Automattic/wp-calypso#3016 cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Drop Open Sans for UI and use default font instead - keep Meriweather for user generated content

Manager.description: Android Studio 2.0 beta 6 requires gradle 2.0.0-beta6.
Manager.title: Update gradle to 2.0.0-beta6

Manager.description: For example, WPTextView should extend AppCompatTextView rather than TextView. The AppCompat versions: Support textAllCaps style attribute which works back to Eclair MR1 Allow dynamic tint via the background tint methods in ViewCompat Allow setting of the background tint using backgroundTint and backgroundTintMode attributes Note: this should wait until the Open Sans PR is merged, since that renames some our widgets.
Manager.title: Switch to "AppCompat" versions of WPxxx widgets

Manager.description: When browsing a post/page, the "preview" query param is always set to true. It should only be true for unpublished posts/pages.
Manager.title: Preview query param is always set to true

Manager.description: The login flow for .org sites should look more like the diagrams below. This ticket changes the internals of .org sites login. Among other changes, it tries the user inserted URL at the beginning of the process, and only later, if necessary, the "discover process" is started. These improvements are the companions of the HealthCheck tool, and diagrams above are subject to changes along the way.
Manager.title: Update the "internals" of .ORG login flow

Manager.description: And make sure PNs work with wasabi
Manager.title: Make sure C2D_MESSAGE permission is correctly set for all flavors

Manager.description: app_secret_key was required when registering new PN token but was removed in: 6f971f5
Manager.title: New PN tokens can't be registered

Manager.description: When the user changes her language in the app from Account Settings, we should sync it over the remote.
Manager.title: Sync app language to remote

Manager.description: When viewing a single post n the reader, rotating the screen makes the post disappear. Video: https://cloudup.com/cPdTWiVEjBZ Version: 5.1-rc-2 on Sony Z3C (D5803)
Manager.title: Reader: post view is empty after screen rotation

Manager.description: Note: Do not complete until 5.2 is released. Now that we've dropped Open Sans we should replace screenshots that are supposed to reflect the current state of the app. So far I've come up with: Google Play Store Amazon App Store WordPress.org apps support site (wow these images are old!) Learn More dialog (in-app)
Manager.title: Update public facing images to show updated fonts

Manager.description: The 'New Posts' button that appears in the Reader is handy when you actually want to go to the top of the list. But often, I want to stay where I am instead of going to the top and the button doesn't go away ever so you get stuck with it. Idea: We could hide the button again if the user scrolls the list after the button first appears?
Manager.title: Reader: 'New Posts' button can be a bully.

Manager.description: (Comes from this #3801) Expected behavior The elevation should only be visible for the Toolbar when a toolbar is present. Actual behavior There's 2 degrees of elevation: one in the Actionbar, and another one in the toolbar Steps to reproduce the behavior Just get the code from the cited PR and see the Reader tab. When the toolbar is visible, you'll see the elevation is set twice, once at the bottom of the actionbar, then again there's elevation at the bottom of the toolbar Tested on [device], Android [version]
Manager.title: Reader: using the FilteredRecyclerView component, elevation for actionbar should be eliminated for the Posts tab only

Manager.description: This is a feature request for showing on the calendar when posts are already published or scheduled. Here's what the calendar looks like right now: Maybe we could add circles to indicate the days that already have posts scheduled or published? Calypso does it in a similar way:
Manager.title: Add scheduled posts indicator in calendar when scheduling post

Manager.description: ApiHelper.getResponse() has a very long timeout at https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/WordPress/src/main/java/org/xmlrpc/android/ApiHelper.java#L1045 That should probably be TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS instead of TimeUnit.SECONDS.
Manager.title: ApiHelper timeout is way too long

Manager.description: Opening Stats from a "Booming Notification" doesn't work for Jetpack sites. It's an issue of the app, in the code that does the match between the remoteID (available in the notification object) and the localBlogID of app database. Given a remote ID, the notifications code returns the local blog ID of the "shadow" Jetpack site, and not of the actual site already loaded in the app. I think this was done because a user could not have the Blog already added to the app. Returning the localBlogID of the shadow site is a problem, because options are always null for that site, and thus, we can't match localID back to the correct remoteID used to load Stats. I bet this issue has been there since the night of time.
Manager.title: Stats page doesn’t show from notification on Jetpack sites

Manager.description: It's a source of problem with i18n, it's better to have string-arrays in another file marked untranslatable and have them refering "normal" strings from strings.xml. Also add this:
Manager.title: Move all string-arrays out of strings.xml file

Manager.description: and add
Manager.title: Update translations for 5.2 release

Manager.description: Add analytics that are consistent with iOS for delete site actions
Manager.title: Delete site - analytics

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open a new post. Select formatting (bold, or italic). Start typing. The format button is deselected, and plain text is added. Expected behavior I can start my post with formatted text Actual behavior My formatting is lost and I have to reapply it. Tested with alpha-3 on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1 (physical device as well as emulator shown below)
Manager.title: Visual Editor: Formatting applied before typing is lost

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Write formatted text, copy it to the clipboard, switch to the HTML editor, paste the text in. It looks formatted, but it's not. Switching back to the visual editor loses the formatting. Expected behavior The text should appear without formatting in the HTML editor. There could be an argument for pasting in the text with the markup, but I don't think that's necessary. Actual behavior The text appears with formatting, but it's actually plain text. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1 (shown on emulator below)
Manager.title: Visual Editor: Pasting formatted text into the HTML editor pseudo-retains formatting

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Write, highlight, and copy formatted text. Paste that text into the title bar of the post from the visual editor. It appears formatted. Switch to the HTML editor and you'll see the HTML codes. Switch back to the visual editor, and the HTML remains. If you don't switch to the HTML tab, and just publish instead, then the title shows up properly formatted on the published post. Expected behavior Either pasting formatted text into the title bar should yield plaintext, or else formatting from the HTML editor should be retained when switching back to the visual editor Actual behavior HTML formatting is lost in the title field when moving from HTML to visual editor Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1 (shown below on emulator)
Manager.title: Visual Editor: Pasting formatted text into the title field yields HTML code

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a list (ordered or unordered) inside a block quote. Add a new element, but don't add any text to it. Exit the list format by either pressing the list format button, or just press enter. A second empty block quote is created. Expected behavior You only have a single block quote Actual behavior You end up with two block quotes Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1 (shown on emulator below)
Manager.title: Visual Editor: Exiting a list element inside a block quote yields two block quotes

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a block quote around some text. Copy the text, and paste it into another part of the post, and observe that it looks sort of like a block quote...but look at the HTML and you see it's just got the background color set. Expected behavior The entire block quote is copy/pasted Actual behavior Only a vague imitation of the block quote is copied. Tested on alpha-3 Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1 (shown below on emulator)
Manager.title: Visual Editor: Copy/Pasting a block quote copies CSS formatting, not the blockquote tag

Manager.description: com.mcxiaoke.volley is now deprecated, use the official library: compile 'com.android.volley:volley:1.0.0'. 🎉 3
Manager.title: Use the official volley library

Manager.description: Expected behavior When logging in and going to the Reader for the first time, the feed should be the one that it shows on the tag dropdown. Actual behavior The tag shows "Automattic" but is actually "Discover" Steps to reproduce the behavior Log in Click on Reader tab Check feed contents and compare to tag Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Reader tag is not accurate on initial log in

Manager.description: Expected behavior All Action Bar titles should have the same font. Actual behavior I noticed while testing #3854 that Activities using R.layout.preferences_actionbar end up with lighter fonts. This layout is being used in the following Activities: BlogPreferencesActivity AccountSettingsActivity AppSettingsActivity Steps to reproduce the behavior I'm only able to reproduce this on an emulator with API 16/17, my Nexus 5X and Genymotion API 22 display it correctly. Visit any of the above Activities and check the Action Bar title font. Tested on Nexus 5X/Genymotion/Genymotion, Android 6.0.1 (API 23)/4.1.1 (API 16)/4.2.2 (API 17)
Manager.title: Preference screens Action Bar font is incorrect

Manager.description: In b051669 the string No %s comments was introduced which is hard to translate: it is a string concatenation, translators can't know what %s will mean and depending on %s different translations might be needed. Possible solutions: Revert back to No comments with this status found Change the text to No comments found with status: %s Introduce 5 new strings and use a switch() No Approved comments No Pending comments No Spam comments No Unknown comments No Trashed comments cc @mzorz
Manager.title: i18n: "No %s comments" is hard to translate

Manager.description: The switch back to Roboto has caused some small alignment issues with notifications:
Manager.title: Notifications: Font margins need adjusting

Manager.description: After you login to the app, the Settings link is missing from the My Site page until you restart. See the screenshot below - there should be a "Configuration" section above the "Admin" section which includes Settings:
Manager.title: Settings missing after login

Manager.description: Subscription emails include several calls to action: Read more, comment, like, see all comments, etc. Currently these all open in a browser, but if the app is installed it would be nice to provide the option to view the links in the reader. Requested in the forums.
Manager.title: Investigate support for opening in the Reader links in subscription emails

Manager.description: Tests that depend upon FactoryUtils.initWithTestFactories() do not clear that state after they finish. That's causing situations like this one: #3853 (comment) We need to make sure tearDown() clears the relevant state.
Manager.title: Tests don't clear Factories on tearDown()

Manager.description: We should document some basic instructions on how to pull in changes of the depended libs that live as separate Open Source projects.
Manager.title: Add instructions on pulling subtree'd libs

Manager.description: In the Reader detail view, some posts don't show the likers. You can actually still tap on the area where they should display, and then it loads the likers detail view but it is empty: Other posts display the likers just fine... but here's one that I know for sure doesn't work: https://tekartist.org/2016/03/23/♫-dee-crell-form-2-all-i-am/ Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6, Android 6.0.1 on versions 5.2-rc2
Manager.title: Reader: Empty Likers in Detail View on Certain Posts

Manager.description: From @rachelmcr: A user reported that the Reader in the Android app isn’t updating with new posts from all of the blogs they follow. They see new posts from some blogs (so it does update) but not all blogs. The Reader is working fine for them in a web browser, with all new posts appearing there. The user’s device is an Alcatel One Touch 6010D running Android 4.1.1 with WPAndroid 5.1.1 (in German). I am seeing the same behavior in my Reader on my Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-4 (in English). I am seeing updates from some of the blogs I follow (mostly from RSS feeds I follow, but also one VIP site on wp.com) but other new posts aren’t showing up at all. I do see those new posts in the web Reader and the iOS Reader. When I try refreshing the Android Reader manually, I see [READER] d: requested posts response = UNCHANGED in my application log. I was able to reproduce this with followed sites, but not consistently. Even when new posts are received, sometimes other new posts will be missing from the stream.
Manager.title: Reader missing followed posts

Manager.description: Originally reported in wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#269: It isn't possible to schedule a saved draft. Changing the date does not schedule the post, and changing the date and status publishes the post immediately. Expected behavior It should be possible to open a saved draft in the editor and schedule it to be published at a future date. Actual behavior When you try to schedule a saved draft, it is published immediately instead of being scheduled for the future date you select. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post in the app Open the post settings, change the status to Draft, and tap Save Wait for the post to upload and confirm it is saved as a draft Open the draft in the editor Open the post settings, change the publish date to a future date/time, and tap Update Result: Draft is still saved with current date/time. It isn't scheduled and the future publish date/time is not saved. Open the draft in the editor Open the post settings, change the status to Publish and change the publish date to a future date/time, and tap Schedule Result: The post is published immediately instead of being scheduled for a future date/time Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1 Originally reported by a beta user, tested and reproduced on a Nexus 9, OS 6.0, beta v. 4.8-rc-1. I tested and confirmed this is still an issue using the steps above when publishing from the new visual editor on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, version alpha-4.
Manager.title: Can't schedule a saved draft

Manager.description: Noticed this, when taking screenshots: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Stats in Portrait Tested on Nexus 10 (Genymotion), Android 5 - wpandroid 5.2 (works OK on phone and tablet 7")
Manager.title: Stats: broken view in Portrait mode on tablets

Manager.description: Title has it.
Manager.title: Stats: Insights - Make sure the title label in Latest Post Module is correctly set when the original post title is empty

Manager.description: The feature/gravatar-upload-okhttp branch (at 30fa971) manages to exceed the 64k method limit. We need to decrease the app's current method count.
Manager.title: Exceeding the 64k method limit

Manager.description: Expected behavior When the latest post is deleted the Latest Post Summary stat in Insights should update and use the next most recent post. Actual behavior The Latest Post Summary continues to show the deleted post data, even if another post is made or a refresh performed. Logging out and Steps to reproduce the behavior Have at least two posts on your site Publish a new post and verify the Latest Post Summary stat shows the new post title Delete the new post and see that the Latest Post Summary stat shows the deleted post title Publish a new post and see that the Latest Post Summary stat shows the deleted post title Tested on Genymotion, Android API 22
Manager.title: Stats: Insights - Latest Post Summary continues showing stats for deleted post

Manager.description: GoogleApiClient calls (like this one) trigger an error message when Play Store Services are not installed (emulators or amazon devices for instance) and make the app crash after login if you dismiss the error message. We should check if Play Stores services are availabe and if they aren't, then don't even try to call GoogleApiClient (used only Smart Lock for Password at the moment). This must be fixed before 5.4 release (first version to ship with Smart Lock for Password). cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Make Play Store Services optional

Manager.description: See Automattic/wp-calypso#4482 for details. Related iOS issue
Manager.title: Reader: Bump page view when post is liked via the stream

Manager.description: My self-hosted test blog has the latest version of the Jetpack (3.9.6) plugin installed, but it is not connected to WordPress.com. When tapping the Stats option in the blog details screen, I see the stats activity appear and try to sync. Eventually it stops syncing and I'm prompted with an error that reads: "Jetpack plugin not found, The Jetpack plugin is required for stats. Do you want to install Jetpack? No / Yes" If I tap yes I'm taken to the Add Plugins page and I see in the list of plugins that Jetpack is already installed.
Manager.title: Stats: Incorrectly prompted that Jetpack was not installed.

Manager.description: While signed into the app with just a self-hosted blog, Go to the blog details screen and tap Stats. When prompted that Jetpack needs to be installed, tap the "Back" soft key, or on the screen to dismiss the prompt. My expectation was this would dismiss the stats view as if I was tapping the prompt's No button, however it just dismisses the prompt. I now have the Activity in a state where I can use the picker to switch between Insights, Days, Weeks, etc. There's no data of course. Since the user was just prompted they shouldn't expect the feature to be functional but this behavior seems pretty weird. Perhaps the dropdown should be disabled at least?
Manager.title: Stats: Possible to dismiss the Jetpack prompt, then interact with the dropdown.

Manager.description: To reproduce: Sign into the app with a self-hosted blog sans Jetpack. Go to the blog list. Notice that there is a Stats button shown in the post cards even though the blog is not connected to JP. Tap the Stats button in one of the post cards. The stats screen loads with an error that "stats couldn't be refreshed at this time" I'd suggest not showing the stats button for published posts on self-hosted/non-Jetpack sites.
Manager.title: Post List: Stats appears broken for self-hosted / non-Jetpack blogs

Manager.description: To reproduce: From a fresh install open the editor and tap to add media to a post. When prompted to allow access to the camera, tap deny. When prompted to allow access to the library, allow. My expectation is WordPress won't have access to my camera but will still be able to pull media from the phone's gallery, or the blog's media library. Instead I see an error message saying that permission is needed.
Manager.title: Media: Unable to use photos from library when camera permission has been denied.

Manager.description: I have a few comments that include images. In the comments list the images are replaced with a small dotted square, with "OBJ" inside. It looks a bit odd. Maybe we should filter out image tags from the comment in the list? (Nexus 5x)
Manager.title: Comments: Images in a comment in the comment list show up as a small "OBJ" inside a dotted border.

Manager.description: From a fresh install, sign in with a self hosted blog: On the blog details screen tap "Switch Site" On the Choose site screen, tap the + button to add a new site. Notice the Sign in screen launches with the username and URL are already filled out with the previous site's info.
Manager.title: Site Picker: Add site launches with previous sites info filled in.

Manager.description: To reproduce: Sign in with a wpcom site. On the profile tab, select "Notification Settings" In Notification Settings, tap one of your blogs to edit its settings. On the "Notification Types" screen, Optionally, tap an option to display the edit modal. Rotate your phone to a different orientation. You are now back on the Notification Settings screen. My expectation was to still be on the Notification Types screen and for the edit modal to be visible if I had opened it. (Nexus 5x)
Manager.title: Notification Settings: changing orientation returns you to the main settings screen.

Manager.description: On the Post, Pages and Comments lists, when a user's role does not give them permission to view that content we display a label stating so. On the media feature, we display a toast that disappears. What's more, the add media button remains active which just leads to a failed upload. (See attached.) Let's update the media feature to be consistent with Posts, Pages, and Comments. Comment example Media example
Manager.title: Media: Improve experience when a user's role does disallows access to media.

Manager.description: Need a space after the name of the theme in the prompt text:
Manager.title: Themes: Prompt after choosing theme has misformatted text.

Manager.description: To reproduce: Be signed into a wpcom account. Choose the Themes feature on the blog details screen. In the themes list, tap into the search field and search for "Twenty" to get a list of all the default Twenty... themes. Find the action bar at the bottom of a theme card and tap on the menu icon to open the menu. Choose "Activate". Notice that the action bar has not updated to indicate the theme is active. Rotate your device (Nexus 5x). Notice that the action bar has now updated. Interestingly the bar updates immediately when changed from the normal themes list (not in search mode).
Manager.title: Themes: Newly activated theme is not immedately reflected in the list when searching

Manager.description: This might be a bit of an edge case, but check this out: I have a ghost Jetpack site named "aerychtest-appfog". The site no longer exists and I've never bothered clearing it from Jetpack because testing broken things is fun. ;) This site is still returned from the /me/sites REST API endpoint, is visible in the iOS app's list of blgos, and its visible in the Android app if I look under Notification Settings. However, its absent from the site picker. Is the site picker intentionally filtering out sites if Jetpack reports them as broken? If so I'd expect it to be also absent from Notification Settings. Regardless, my expectation was to still see the site in the list. Notification Settings (Present) Site Picker (Absent)
Manager.title: Site Picker: Jetpack site missing from the site picker.

Manager.description: To reproduce: Go to the reader and tap to view comments on a post. Note the current number of comments on the post, shown both in the post card and in the comment list header. Use the "Reply" form at the bottom of the screen to add a new comment. Notice that the comment count has not updated in the comment list header. Tap back to return to the post list. Notice that the post card shows the old comment count. Pull to refresh the post list. Now the comment count is updated. My expectation is we'd optimistically increment and refresh the comment count without needing to sync.
Manager.title: Reader: Comment count is not updated after replying

Manager.description: Once we get the response for the /me endpoint, we can fill the name and profile picture url in smart lock for password credentials to present a nicer picker (the picker is only visible if the user has several credentials saved). https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/credentials/Credential.Builder.html#public-methods
Manager.title: Improve Smart Lock for Password by adding Name and Profile Picture url to credentials

Manager.description: Rather than describe it, here are screen shots of the list view and detail view. List view: Detail view:
Manager.title: Reader has problems with emoji

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and have the old primary site selection cleared. Actual behavior I open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and two sites (the old primary site and the new one) are now selected in the list. (However, selecting OK makes the correct change.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to the Me tab Select Account Settings Select Primary site Note that your current primary site is selected, and select a different site. Result: Both sites are now selected in the list of sites. If you tap on your current primary site first, and then select a different site, the radio buttons work as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-6
Manager.title: Account Settings: Primary site selection persists when you select a different site

Manager.description: Implement "Magic Links" much like how Slack does. Instead of asking the user to enter their password, they can enter their email and get a link to login. Mirrors wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#4912
Manager.title: Implement Magic Link sign in

When connecting to Jetpack from Stats or Notifications let's let the user know if Jetpack is not installed, or installed and disconnected, or installed but having problems and provide them proper guidance.
Manager.title: Jetpack: Add support for detecting connection status.

Manager.description: To reproduce: Sign in to a self-hosted wpcom account. Sign in to wpcom. Switch to the reader tab. In the tag picker, select a tag you are following that is not one of the default/recommended tags shown to a signed out user. Switch to the profile tab and sign out of wpcom. Switch back to the reader. Notice the tag picker has vanished.
Manager.title: Reader: Tag/Topic picker can vanish when signing out of wpcom

Manager.description: For Magic Link V1 (when #3973 and #3988 is merged), Smart Lock will be disabled if the user is sent through the Magic Link sign in flow. This issue is to enable Smart lock in the Magic link sign in flow. Requirements: Make sure we only save to Smart Lock when username and password is entered. If using Magic Link/email login, there will be no password. Enable the password field and auto-fill it if the user already has a username/password combo in Smart Lock (should happen automatically, but written down just in case)
Manager.title: Enable Smart Lock in Magic Link sign in flow

Manager.description: Hello, developers of WordPress-Android, I have just found out AsyncTask.execute is used in many places like 3 times in EditPostSettingsFragment, 4 times in ThemeBrowserActivity, etc. However, this API is slower on devices with version higher than Android 3.0. As tasks started by this API are executed serially on a single background thread on those devices (stated in API guide). Using method executeOnExecutor to achieve real multi-thread may improve the performance. Thanks a lot.
Manager.title: Performance Issues caused by AsyncTask

Manager.description: Expected behavior Local draft deleted Actual behavior Toast is shown "No network connection"
Manager.title: Can't delete local drafts when network is down (airplane on)

Manager.description: This is a bit of an edge case I think. Here are the steps I took: Choose the business-technology tag. Find a post titled "The fallacy of overnight success" https://wordpress.com/read/blogs/72626863/posts/30269 The tag displayed on the post card is the-fallacy-of-overnight-success Tap to preview the tag. The preview list appears but is empty. I guess we're excluding the previewed post in the Android app? Makes sense, but an empty list is a bit odd. Fwiw, on the web we show the post and iOS app we show the post.
Manager.title: Reader: Empty list after previewing tag.

Manager.description: I noticed this trying to follow a particular site. To reproduce: Open the reader Open the reader's settings screen At the bottom of the screen try to follow either: http://arstechnica.com or arstechnica.com. I get an error saying unable to follow this blog I tried again with mashable.com and got the same error. Both can be followed from the web.
Manager.title: Reader: Can't follow some sites from the reader settings screen.

Manager.description: @tonyr59h noticed that Themes are never automatically refreshed in the Theme browser. Add a timestamp preference of when the latest request for themes was, and automatically refresh if older than a week(?) when entering the Theme browser.
Manager.title: Themes are never automatically refreshed

Manager.description: Expected behavior The Themes option should be available when visiting the My Site tab after signing into an account with admin privileges. Actual behavior The Themes option is unavailable until the app is restarted. Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign out Sign in with an account that has admin privileges Go to the My Site tab The Themes option is not visible. Likely due to admin privileges not being verified before creating the My Site tab. See this PR for similar issue with the Settings option. Tested on Genymotion emulator, Android API 17
Manager.title: Themes option not available under My Sites tab after signing in

Manager.description: Expected behavior The View Admin option should be available when visiting the My Site tab when the app starts and the user account has admin privileges. Actual behavior The View Admin option is unavailable until the app is restarted. Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign in with an account that has admin privileges Go to the My Site tab Force stop the app (or swipe from backstack) Start the app The View Admin option is not visible. Tested on Genymotion emulator, Android API 17
Manager.title: View Admin option not available under My Sites tab when app is restarted

Manager.description: Another edge case, and rather nitpicky. A custom list that has no posts shows a message that is specific to tags. Maybe tweak the wording for lists to match the web:
Manager.title: Reader: Custom list with no posts shows "No posts with this tag" message.

Manager.description: When you go into App Settings and your language is set to a language like en_US, en_CA, es_CL etc, when you open the language picker it should be pre-selected to your current language. However, for these custom cases it's not. We have changed the available_languages.xml array before to fix this issue, but that file is auto-generated, so it came back. To fix it, we need to update the script that generates this file, so it doesn't happen again.
Manager.title: Language dialog is not pre-selected

Manager.description: Expected behavior “preview post” (eye icon) should show the preview for the post you're editing. Actual behavior it's showing nothing the first time, but works ok second time. Steps to reproduce the behavior write a post, enter a title and some content tap on the preview (eye) icon to see the preview the preview screen is blank Tested on Google Nexus 6 image on Genymotion, Android 5.1.0
Manager.title: Reader: "Preview Post" (eye icon while you're editing a post) shows nothing the first time

Manager.description: When I open the app when the pin lock is enabled, I can open a new keyboard by clicking in the text box: Expected behavior I expected that the keyboard would not open when clicking the textbox, since the numberpad is already displayed: Tested on the Nexus 6, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Pin lock screen should not open new keyboard

Manager.description: Expected behavior The pin lock screen should show up every time I open the screen: Actual behavior Instead, the pin lock screen only shows up when the app is opened for the first time and is not in the recents screen. If it's already in the recents screen list, then the pin lock does not show up. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the WordPress app If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin Close the app Open the app and notice that you are not asked for your pin code (problem # 1) Close the app and swipe the app away from the recents screen Open the WordPress app again, and see the pin lock Close the app Open it again and see that you are not asked for a pin code (problem # 2) Tested on Nexus 6, Android 6.0.01
Manager.title: Pin lock screen should show every time app opens

Manager.description: Expected behavior On the 'When I enter the wrong pin multiple times, I should see an error telling me what's going wrong. Actual behavior When I enter the wrong pin, I don't see an error. Instead, the pin textbox is cleared out and nothing else changes. On the opening screen, the app also 'shakes' Steps to reproduce the behavior There are three places this can happen. Place 1: 'Change PIN' If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin. Go to User > App > App Settings and click on 'Change PIN' See a screen to enter your old pin. Enter an incorrect pin. See that the incorrect pin is not accepted, the pin textbox is cleared, but there is no error message displayed. Place 2: 'Turn PIN lock off' If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin. Go to User > App > App Settings and click on 'Turn PIN lock off' See a screen to enter your old pin. Enter an incorrect pin. See that the incorrect pin is not accepted, the pin textbox is cleared, but there is no error message displayed. Place 3: The initial screen If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin. Then close the app and swipe it off your recents screen. Open the WordPress app and see the 'Enter your PIN' screen Enter the wrong pin See the pin textbox is cleared, and the screen shakes. No error message is displayed. Enter the wrong pin again See the pin textbox is cleared, and the screen shakes. No error message is displayed. Tested on [device], Android [version]
Manager.title: There should be an error message displayed when entering incorrect pin

Manager.description: Expected behavior Scrolling through the Theme browser, the app should continue to load new themes as a user goes to the end of the list. Once the user reaches the end, there is no longer a loading indicator. Actual behavior Sometimes there is a loading indicator that never goes away and themes do not continue to load. Steps to reproduce the behavior Load up Theme Browser Scroll quickly (only happens intermittently) Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Scrolling through Themes Browser sometimes results in stuck loading

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the site picker Tap the "+" button Select "Add self-hosted site" Smart Lock is enabled (should not).
Manager.title: Disable Smart Lock when specifically adding a self hosted

Manager.description: When a new comment comes in, I get a notification saying "User X commented on your post Y". I'd love to be able to expand the notification and also see: The body of the comment The options to at least Like/Approve the comment in addition to replying. Adding Trash and Spam might crowd things too much, but maybe not. Which site the comment was on (not critical, but sometimes I forget where I published a given post, and it would be a nice reminder) Numbers 1 and 2 will go a long way towards making WordPress notifications more usable on Android Wear as well. Right now the only option is to Reply, which opens up the notification on the phone. I'm going to write a separate issue requesting the Reply option be expanded to allow speech-to-text.
Manager.title: Notifications: Add more detail to Android notification

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a new comment notification comes in on my watch, I see the Reply option. I expect to be able to click that and dictate a reply, or choose from some preset options. http://developer.android.com/training/wearables/notifications/voice-input.html Actual behavior Clicking Reply just opens the WordPress notification on my phone, which negates the purpose of dealing with the notification on my watch. And this isn't anything to do with the WordPress-Android code, but there's no indication that this is what's happening. At first I thought the Reply button just didn't do anything on Wear. It was only when I was writing up this Issue that I noticed it was actually opening on the phone, since I had them both up and visible. Note: For this to be worth using, the body of the comment needs to be added to the notification, per #4031 Tested on LG G Watch, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Notifications: Allow RemoteInput on Reply option to enable Android Wear interaction

Manager.description: We're not correctly disabling the ConnectionChangeReceiver listeners, and bumping analytics, when the app goes background while the device is running in low memory conditions. Also the variable mIsInBackground is not set to true. Basically ApplicationLifecycleMonitor.onTrimMemory(final int level) is called with a level that's not the classic TRIM_MEMORY_UI_HIDDEN (level used when the process had been showing a user interface, and is no longer doing so), and then all of our code is not running. In my test case that was called with TRIM_MEMORY_COMPLETE, but we should check all other available constants. Note that onTrimMemory(final int level) could be called anytime if the device is running in low memory conditions. Don't think we can just redo the same thing we're already doing in TRIM_MEMORY_UI_HIDDEN. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, 6.X
Manager.title: Fix App's background state on low memory conditions

Manager.description: If you're following a topic that has the same name as a default tag (such as "Posts I Like" or "Followed Sites"), tapping that topic in the dropdown list of tags will show posts from the default tag.
Manager.title: Reader: Can't follow topic with same name as default tag

Manager.description: When I add a smiley to a post using the text :), the post shows a broken image in the Reader. Instead, I expected it to show a smiling emoji. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to any blog that you can read on the reader, and publish a post that includes the text :) View the post in the reader and see a broken image instead of a smiley emoji: Tested on Nexus 6, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Smiley text shows broken image in Reader

It does contain an "important" security fix, and a bug that affects the keyboard on the unlock screen. The latter fix is currently under review. @tonyr59h I think we should update the library asap, and include it in v5.4 of wp-android.

Manager.description: We could a) Save a row in my sites and b) match up closer to the web if we remove the 'View Site' row in my sites, and instead make the header clickable so that it loads the site in the in-app browser. Would this be discoverable though? It might help to add an icon to the header to indicate what will happen if you tap on it. Video concept: https://cloudup.com/cYmQ9AwbLKQ 👍 1

Manager.description: Because of the gravity of the action, changing the wording may help clarify what the action does. also per google: First person, “I” or “my”: In some cases, you may need to use this form of address to emphasize the user's ownership of content or actions.
Manager.title: Change "Delete your site" to "Delete site" for clarity

Manager.description: Expected behavior After adding a new Gravatar, the user should be able to rotate the device between portrait and landscape. Actual behavior After adding a new Gravatar, if the new Gravatar image is still loading on the Me screen, the app crashes. This is especially noticeable if you were using the app in landscape prior to adding a new Gravatar. The Edit Photo screen forces a portrait view, so the next possible opportunity to rotate back to landscape (to continue using the app that way) is when the new Gravatar is loading on the Me screen. Steps to reproduce the behavior Tap on Gravatar on Me screen Select and edit photo On Edit Photo screen, select OK While new Gravatar is loading, rotate device from portrait to landscape Result: App crashes if the new Gravatar hasn't finished loading on the Me screen. Screenshot This is the point (while the new Gravatar is loading) where the app will crash if you rotate it: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-8.
Manager.title: Gravatar: App crashes if device is rotated while new Gravatar is loading on me screen

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I upload a new Gravatar using the app, it should ask me for a rating. Like here: ### Actual behavior The new Gravatar saves without a rating. Tested on Nexus 6, Android 6.0.1, WordPress alpha-8
Manager.title: Gravatar: should ask for image rating

Manager.description: Expected behavior Select bold or italic in visual editor Type word(s) in formatted text Select bold/italic again to clear selection Press space key and type next word in non-formatted text Actual behavior Pressing space re-applies the bold or italic formatting to the next word. The user must then manually re-clear the formatting a second time before they can begin typing. Screenshots: https://cldup.com/0P4QYC7Bhb.png (showing I've finished typing a word in bold and have cleared the formatting in the visual editor) https://cldup.com/SPLxOlwyRE.png (I pressed space - note that the bold formatting re-applied) https://cldup.com/aQb92uhMtY.png (on the next line I was able to reproduce with italics) Steps to reproduce the behavior Apply bold or italic text in visual editor Proceed to type a word Un-apply formatting Press space Type another word, formatting will have been re-applied despite manual clear by user Tested on... This was tested in 5.4-RC-1 on my Nexus 5X (running Android Marshmallow 6.0.1, unrooted, up to April 2 security patch).
Manager.title: Visual editor: Removed bold/italic formatting re-applies after removal in 5.4-RC-1

Manager.description: Master issue: #3901. While we have been working on the people management v1 #4100 we have discussed that in the current detail page it might not be obvious that the user can change the role of the user. @hypest also mentioned that you can change the role, but can't change the username and since they share the same design, it might lead to confusion. @rickybanister came up with an alternative design below: When I initially explored this, I came up with a solution but it felt very hacky to us. It basically removes the elevation from the toolbar when you go into detail fragment and adds it back when you go back to the list. The alternative is for us to extend the toolbar, but then comes the challenge with the behavior when you change the fragments, especially considering we'll be adding more fragments to people management as we build on it. I'll also explore if we could make the toolbar a part of the fragment instead of the activity. This is everything that's discussed so far, I'll update the issue as I explore this more. If anyone has any insight on how to handle this, please do let me know. /cc @nbradbury as you raised similar concerns.
Manager.title: Person detail page design improvement
Gradient is black on the Country view in Stats

Manager.description: Currently, the app's "View Admin" and "View Site" links open in an in-app browser. The problem: This leads to confusion when users try to use features that don't work well or at all in the in-app browser. Some things (like uploading media) are broken and/or don't work as well as features we have already implemented in the app itself. Possible solution: By changing "View Site" and "View Admin" to launch in the device browser, we can cut down on that confusion (and other effects like negative app reviews). We could also add contextual cues in the app to items that launch outside the app, similar to the icon Calypso uses to identify external links: Potential downsides: If the user isn't already logged in to the site in their browser, the visit to their site will be counted in their stats Users may be frustrated/confused about where they landed, having to log in again, getting back to the app.
Manager.title: Launch "View Site" and "View Admin" in device browser instead of in-app browser

Manager.description: Currently, when you preview a post you get a fully functional in-app browser. As a result, you can follow links e.g. to WP Admin or Calypso in that browser view, which causes confusion (and frustration when the in-app browser does not behave as expected). Steps to reproduce Open the WordPress app Go to the My Site tab Select a site Select Blog Posts For a non-local post (published or draft), select View On the preview screen, tap a link in the admin bar to navigate away from the site. For example, tap "Reader" and then "Followed Sites" to open the Reader. Result: You can navigate away from the site and end up using the in-app browser as a regular browser. We should disable links in the post preview screen so users can't browser/navigate away from the preview. (This feature is already in the iOS app.) Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-10
Manager.title: Disable links in post preview

Manager.description: All users will have access to the new editor, but keep the legacy editor code and switch in App Settings.
Manager.title: Set the Visual Editor as default editor

Manager.description: Expected behavior If I try to create a username with capital letters in it, I expect the system to autocorrect my chosen username to all lowercase letters. For example, the Calypso signup form at https://wordpress.com/start/account/user autocorrects the username, making it all lowercase if any capital letters were entered. Actual behavior I can enter a username with capital letters, and a message appears to the right: Username can only contain lowercase letters (a-z) and numbers This is problematic for a few reasons: It's easy to overlook the word "lowercase" in that message It's annoying to have to move the cursor within the field to switch any capital letters to lowercase That check runs before the app checks to see if the username already exists, so you can end up correcting the username only to run into the error "That username already exists" when you try to create the account. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the WordPress app (and log out if you are logged in to a WordPress.com account) Select Create Account Enter a new email address, a username with capital letters included, and a password Tap the Create Account button Result: The "lowercase letters and numbers" message appears Desired result: After entering a username with capital letters included, the username is autocorrected to all lowercase letters Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-10
Manager.title: Signup: Suggest or correct usernames with capital letters to lowercase

Manager.description: All magic link analytics properties have loagin_... instead of login_...
Manager.title: Typo in magic links analytics

Manager.description: Expected behaviour Pinch-to-zoom should reliably zoom in/out the picture when in the Gravatar update crop step Actual behaviour The picture get easily rotated at the same time while zooming. It's virtually impossible not to inadvertently rotate the picture. Steps to reproduce the behaviour Navigate to the Me screen Tap Gravatar Select an existing photo Try to zoom in/out 👍 2
Manager.title: Accidental rotation in Gravatar crop dialog

Manager.description: For some time now, WordPress.com has enabled AMP (https://www.ampproject.org/) support for all sites hosted. It would be nice if we start using the AMP versions of posts in the mobile apps. There are at least two places we could consider for using AMP: The Reader The Blog Posts list The idea is to make post reading an even faster experience.
Manager.title: Display Accelerated Mobile Page (AMP) versions of posts

Manager.description: Expected behavior When you try to log in to a site that doesn't support https, the app should fall back to http when it looks for the site's XMLRPC endpoint. Actual behavior The app only looks for the site's XMLRPC endpoint over https and returns an error if the site doesn't support http. In my testing, the app displayed an "Invalid SSL certificate" error: A user also reported this issue, and the app logs showed that the app only checked the https URLs. It then displayed the error "Check that the site URL entered is valid." (107830-h) Steps to reproduce the behavior Reproduce the error: Open the app and go to log in to a self-hosted site (either on the self-hosted login screen or by adding a new self-hosted site to the app) Enter your username, password, and self-hosted site's domain (e.g. yourgroovydomain.com) for a site that doesn't support https Try to sign in Result: You receive an invalid site URL or SSL error Log in successfully: Open the app and go to log in to a self-hosted site (either on the self-hosted login screen or by adding a new self-hosted site to the app) Enter the same username, password, and self-hosted site URL beginning with http:// (e.g. http://yourgroovydomain.com) for a site that doesn't support https Try to sign in Result: You are logged in successfully Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-13 Reported by users with WPAndroid 5.4.
Manager.title: Login: Self-hosted login form not falling back to http

Manager.description: Starting with the relaese of wpandroid 5.4: Expected behavior Try to login to http://bh.wpmt.co should prompt an HTTP Auth dialog asking for HTTP Auth username or password Actual behavior App gives a "Invalid URL" error. cc @hypest
Manager.title: Can't sign in to a Self hosted site with HTTP Auth

Manager.description: Expected behavior Images should be either positioned as a tiled mosaic or as a same-width, single column list. Actual behavior Images form a single column but with various widths that look uneven. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a post with a tiled-mosaic gallery with at least 4-5 images View the post in the reader on a tablet Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung S2 9.7" tablet, Android 5.0.2
Manager.title: Images in posts with tiled mosaic gallery look "randomly" sized when on a tablet

Manager.description: We don't want unexpected things happening when we're developing.
Manager.title: Disable Optimizely for debug builds

Manager.description: Expected behavior Empty view that shows status and error messages should be visible when necessary. Actual behavior Empty view is not visible - screen is blank. Steps to reproduce the behavior For example, open media browser for the website with no media. You will see blank scree instead of empty view with "No media" label.
Manager.title: Empty view is not visible in Media Browser

Manager.title: Crash report 5.4.2: ClassCastException in WPActivityUtils.addToolbarToDialog

Manager.description: Expected behavior When user upload an image with "Use as featured image", the featured image shall be saved. Actual behavior When user upload an image with "Use as featured image", the featured image is not saved. Steps to reproduce the behavior (1) Upload an image (select a photo from gallery or Capture photo) (2) Tap the image to open a modal window "Image setting" (3) Check "Use as featured image" Tested on [device], Android [version] FTJ152A, Android version 5.1 (I reproduced the behavior also Xpedia, but didn't confirmed the model type and version)
Manager.title: "Use as featured image" is not works every time

Manager.description: Expected behavior Posts from blog you started to follow from web appear in Reader when you open app. Actual behavior Posts from blog you started to follow from web do no appear in Reader until you do pull to refresh twice. Steps to reproduce the behavior Follow blog from web. Open app. Go to Reader that set to show "Followed Sites". Posts from blog followed in first step do not appear in reader. I believe this happens because at both onResume and after FollowedBlogsChanged event we reload posts from local DB and not from server.
Manager.title: Posts from blogs followed from web do not appear in Reader until explict refresh.

Manager.description: Check the conversation here for context We need to check all the places where Locale.getDefault() is used and make sure we use RestClientUtils.patchDeviceLanguageCode() instead, wherever needed. Also, for a more grained control I'd suggest refactoring RestClientUtils.getRestLocaleParams() to make use of the currently configured locale, provided by context.getResources().getConfiguration().locale.toString() rather than Locale.getDefault() which is only updated upon application launch. Suggestion: use a new class LanguageUtils with methods getDeviceLanguage and patchDeviceLanguage
Manager.title: Check Locale.getDefault() usage

Manager.description: Swipe-to-refresh should not be available for search results. Search results are basically a snapshot and are unlikely to change due to how posts are sorted by score.
Manager.title: Reader: swipe-to-refresh should be disabled for search results

Manager.description: Under a sites settings (My Sites > Choose Site > Settings) there is a toggle to Upload and link to full image. The wording of this is a bit confusing and I'm not entirely sure what it is meant to do. Expected behavior My expected behavior is if the toggle is turned off when I upload an image to a blog post it would not link the image to the full image. Actual behavior Whether this is turned on or off (in the legacy editor or the visual editor) when I upload an image to a post it includes a link to the full image. Steps to reproduce the behavior Visit My Sites and choose a site Click Settings Turn off Upload and link to full image Start a blog post and add an image In visual editor click image and choose to edit, it will include a link to the full image In legacy editor publish the post then come back to edit Shows code linking to the full image Tested on Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1, WP Android version alpha-13
Manager.title: Upload and link to full image setting toggle not working

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a user opens up a comment notification and then taps on the detail button to load all the corresponding comments we should like the web scroll down to the corresponding comment. Actual behavior Right now tapping on the detail button will load the comments but hang out at the top. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open comment notification. Tap on detail button at the top Parallel WPiOS Issue - wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#5540
Manager.title: When user taps for details on a comment notification we should scroll them down to their actual comment instead

Manager.description: This issue serves as the master issue for the Notifications Refresh which has the stated goal of taking users beyond the browser design, both in terms of UX and utilizing all mobile/tablet screen sizes, but also stickiness (show important notifications on the watch for example).
Manager.title: Notifications Refresh Master Issue

Manager.description: "Reader -> Settings -> Enter URL edit text" feature, currently the code to follow a site does: a GET request on read/feed, to fetch for information (or check validity?) a POST request on read/following/mine/new read/feed must be given an exact url or id, there is no discovery. So the first call could lead to an error if the url passed is not exact. We could either drop the first call (depending what we need to fetch/check before following) and only use read/following/mine/new (that does discovery) or do a GET on read/feed/find (that does discovery) instead of read/feed. cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Revisit how we follow sites/tags in the Reader

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a URL with params such as /path/to/site?param1=value1 is sent to getRestClientUtils_V1.post() with params, the params should be appended to the query string as indepentent parameters Actual behavior The params are appended as strings to the value of the last pre-existing parameter, because we are not taking into account the pre-existing ? (question mark) Additionally, sometimes the path contains a URLencoded domain, such as in /feed/new/http%3A%2F%2Fnickbradbury.com and having it run through Uri.parse makes it back to URLdecoded form i..e /feed/new/http://nickbradbury.com Steps to reproduce the behavior try to follow a site with URL in the reader
Manager.title: Adding new locale param to WPcom REST api doesn't check for pre-existing querystring params

Manager.description: Expected behavior Clicking on the Edit button in the Post list should open the post and displays the content. Actual behavior The editor is empty, showing just a blank space. After switching to HTML view, the content appears. Steps to reproduce the behavior Click on the Edit button of any post. Tested on OnePlus One, Android 6.0.1 and Acer Iconia A1-840FHD, Android 4.4.2
Manager.title: Post Editor not showing any content

Manager.description: The Calypso Reader recently added a "related posts" feature which lists two posts related to the current one at the bottom of the detail view. This should be added to the mobile readers. Related iOS issue
Manager.title: Reader: related posts

Manager.description: Expected behavior Properly display all characters Actual behavior Font of the Android app doesn't support utf-8 characters. I write in Greek and some characters appear with different style. You could use a font like open sans which supports all languages. Steps to reproduce the behavior Use Greek? Tested on [device], Android [version] Not tested.
Manager.title: Missing characters in Greek

Manager.description: When you have a couple of pages under same date, deleting the leading one, causes the date header to disappear.
Manager.title: Pages list date header disappears after deleting the leading page

Manager.description: Expected behavior In the Comments section of the app, I send a reply to a pending comment. I expect this to approve the comment and post my reply because that is how it works from notifications and WP Admin. Actual behavior My reply gets 'posted' but the comment I replied to is not automatically approved, so neither appears on my site. Steps to reproduce the behavior Have a comment in moderation. Open the Comments section of the app and find that comment. Reply to that comment. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1 Raised in Helpshift: 111856-h
Manager.title: Comments: replying to comment does not auto-approve

Manager.description: We are not leaving Mixpanel yet and for consistency with iOS, we're going away from Optimizely. Also we already hit Optimizely's monthly limit doing one test.
Manager.title: Replace Optimizely A/B testing framework with Mixpanel

Manager.description: Our EmailCheckerIntegrationTest needs to be updated to use emailchecker2.
Manager.title: EmailCheckerIntegrationTest uses old version of EmailChecker

Manager.description: Suggested behavior Three settings options for the app to relock: Lock app at device screen off Lock app after screen of for... minutes Enter password once to unlock app Came in through HS: 112091-h
Manager.title: Improve app lock settings

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Comments. Select Spam from dropdown list. Select multiple comments using long press. From context menu select SPAM. Nothing happens. Expected behavior Context menu label should say "Not Spam" and comments will be “unspammed” after clicking on it.
Manager.title: Batch “Unspam" of comments is unclear

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Comments. Select multiple comments using long press. Change filter. Selected positions persist even though the comments at those positions might be different. Expected behavior Selection should be based on comment id and not on index.
Manager.title: Multi-selection of comments persist during filter change.

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Comments. Select Pending or Approved filter. Select multiple comments using long press. Perform Approve/Disapprove action from Content Action Bar. Comments will remain in current list even though their status will no longer match the filter. Expected behavior Comments will disaster from filter list after their status no longer match the filter. Everything works as it should if you moderate individual comments.
Manager.title: Comments are not removed from filtered list after their status changes

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Comments. Select All filter. Open any comment. Mark it as Spam or Trash it. While “Undo” snack bar is visible, select Spam or Trashed filter (depending on what you did with the comment) Wait till snack bar disappears. Comments does not appear in list. Expected behavior Comment should appear in filtered list after it’s status have been changed to match filter.
Manager.title: Deleted/Marked as spam Comment does not appear in filtered list after snack bar dissmised

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Comments. Scroll down to load more. Notice that existing comments in the list are replaced with the older comments, that were supposed to go to the end of the list. In addition, after this, “Load more” stops working at all. Expected behavior Older comments should be added to the end of the list.
Manager.title: “Load more” at Comments list doesn’t work as expected

Manager.description: Expected Image thumbnails maintain correct preview of media (i.e. image/audio/video). Observed When flinging to scroll, some image thumbnails show incorrect preview. See video for details. Focus on the Angry Birds image at the bottom of the grid in the video. Reproduced Go to Sites. Tap Media option. Scroll to bottom of grid. Notice Angry Birds image. Fling to middle of grid. Fling to bottom of grid. Notice Angry Birds image. Fling to middle of grid. Fling to bottom of grid. Notice Angry Birds image. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.4.2
Manager.title: Media Library Displays Incorrect Thumbnail in Grid

Manager.description: Expected Show full-width image when viewing item details from Media library. Observed Some images are too small when displayed on high-density screens. See screenshots for details. Reproduced Go to Sites. Tap Media option. Tap image with 700 width by 100 height. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.4.2
Manager.title: Media Image Too Small for High-Density Screens

Manager.description: Expected behavior Altering the system's font size setting should affect the Reader's content font size accordingly. Actual behavior Reader's content font size doesn't change at all. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open any post in the Reader Switch to device's system settings and change the system font size Switch back to the app (should land on the Reader) Notice that the post font size hasn't changed in any way Notice that the tag name and comments/likes count texts have changed Tested on [device], Android [version] Tested on a variety of tablet and phone devices.
Manager.title: Reader content doesn't follow the system font size setting

Manager.description: Currently, wp-admin does not allow replying to comments marked as trashed or spam. The mobile app does and it automatically approves the original comment after a reply. Therefore, replying should be disabled for spam/trashed comments.
Manager.title: Replying to spam/trashed comments

Manager.description: We're incorrectly using a fixed position for RecyclerViews in a couple of places, which could result in the wrong position being used when an item is tapped. Explanation:
Manager.title: Don't use fixed position in RecyclerView

Manager.description: 5.6 should have run the A/B test to determine if Magic Links was successful. Decide which log in screen to show to users. Also verify that Optimizely has been removed in 5.7 by #4263
Manager.title: Decide between Magic Link or regular Sign In

Manager.description: Expected behavior Be able to edit the Follow Blog widget in the app. Actual behavior The Follow Blog widget settings pop out to the side, not below. So I can't see the entire form and it makes it difficult to modify the widget. Steps to reproduce the behavior In the app, W > Themes > Customize > Widgets. Search for the Follow Blog widget and add it. ##### Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Widgets with slideout settings don't display correctly

Manager.description: The site preview on Android should be adjusted to match Calypso: Follower count should appear below the description Site preview header should include blavatar Blavatar and header should be removed from individual posts Calypso: Android:
Manager.title: Reader: site preview doesn't match Calypso

Manager.description: Related posts (#4269) introduced a navigation system to the reader detail view that added an "X" button to toolbar to close the activity (regardless of how many related posts were viewed) while still supporting using the back button to navigate through related posts history. This same concept should be added to navigating #tags in the reader list view.
Manager.title: Reader: tag navigation should be similar to related posts navigation
