Manager.description: We have decided to separate viewers section from the followers issue #4142.
Manager.title: Viewers section in People Management

Manager.description: I didn't catch this in the review, but #4310 introduced a NPE [here]https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/pull/4310/files#diff-204e59c94fe33997c26fd2c5350090f3R242) due to mComment being null.
Manager.title: NPE in comment detail when disabling reply

Manager.description: Based on a discussion here #4240, I thought it could be useful to have a separate thread about the new auto-saving mechanism, because there a few open questions. Conclusion from our discussion on Slack We ditch the Save alert dialog On editor exit, a Snackbar is displayed with a timeout, when users can discard the changes If a user reverts the changes, all local changes are discarded. Otherwise, after the timeout the post gets uploaded (if a device is offline, changes are saved locally) Imagine a scenario: I have a draft post both online and in my phone. I make some changes but since the phone is offline the changes are saved locally. Later someone makes changes on the website. Because the app ignores updates on posts with local changes, I'll never see this new draft on my phone. After I make additional changes on the phone, the post gets uploaded and overwrites the previous changes. So my question is -- Is there a way to detect remote changes and shouldn't we tell the users about it? CC: @hypest, @diegoreymendez, @nbradbury, @maxme
Manager.title: Post auto-save mechanism

Manager.description: Expected behavior When replying to a comment notification, if you leave the same comment twice, a message pops up that should say "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you've already said that!" Actual behavior The message doesn't render the apostrophe correctly, and actually reads as "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you#8217;ve already said that! This only happens when replying from the notification. Replying from the Reader displays a more basic "Couldn't post your comment" popup. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and tap the notifications icon Scroll down to a comment notification, and open it Use the 'Reply to [Commenter Name] field to submit a comment Once the comment is submitted, try saying the same thing again to trigger the popup Tested on HTC One M9, Android 6.0
Manager.title: Apostrophe displayed incorrectly when replying from a notification

Manager.description: Expected behavior When searching in Switch Sites, the results show matches based on site title or URL - tapping the site you want should open that site's options Actual behavior If the site title matches your search string, the correct site opens. If the site URL matches (but the title doesn't) the app will open the wrong site. In that case, if the site you choose from the results is the third in the list, the app opens the third site in the main Switch Sites list, not from your search results Steps to reproduce the behavior In an account with multiple sites, find or create a test site that has a different site title than its URL (Example: 'This Is A Testing Site' as the title and 'reallyobscurebug.wordpress.com' for the URL). Open the app and tap Switch Sites. Note the order of sites listed. Which ones are first, second, third, and so on. Tap the magnifying glass to search and enter a string that matches your test site URL, but not its title. In the above example you would use the first few characters of 'reallyobscurebug.wordpress.com' When your test site appears in the list, notice how far down it is (is it the first, second, third, etc., result). Tap the test site to try opening it. Notice the site that actually opened - it will be the site from the corresponding position in the main Switch Sites list. Tested on HTC One M9, Android 6.0
Manager.title: Switch Sites search results open the wrong site on URL matches

Manager.description: After some discussion, we've decided that related reading should not be shown for private posts.
Manager.title: Reader: don't show related reading for private posts

Manager.description: Expected behavior In the user Invite Screen, tapping "SEND" while typing a username should bring up some form of error message to denote the inability to perform the action while offline Actual behavior Tapping SEND in those conditions only buttonizes the username and then nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go into the user Invites screen by visiting MySite > People and tapping the "+" button on the actionbar Put the device to offline mode Start typing a username and before hitting "enter" Tap the "SEND" action The username mutates into a "button" like widget Nothing else happens. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X emulator running Android 6.0
Manager.title: Nothing happens when offline and tapping the SEND button in user Invite screen

Manager.description: TIcket to track the following editor issues: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#432 (addressed by wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#435) wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#429 (addressed by wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#430)
Manager.title: Editor issues to fix for 5.5.1

Manager.description: Expected On the Hold for Moderation screen, adding multiple words does not affect the Add floating action button position or size. Observed As the screen is filled with words, the Add floating action button is minimized and eventually disappears. See the screenshot below. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Settings option under Configuration section. Tap More option under Discussion section. Tap Hold for Moderation under Comments section. Tap Add floating action button. Enter unique word. Repeat Step 5 and Step 6 until screen is full. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.5
Manager.title: Floating Action Button Disappears on Moderation Word Screen

Manager.description: Expected To delete a word from the Hold for Moderation screen, long-press on the list item to activate the action mode and contextual action bar. Observed When the Hold for Moderation word list exceeds the size of the device screen, long-pressing on items near the end of the list causes the app to crash. See the animation and stack trace below. 07-02 18:56:56.150 30629-30629/? E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main Process: org.wordpress.android, PID: 30629 Theme: themes:{} java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void android.view.View.setBackgroundColor(int)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.MultiSelectListView.onItemLongClick(MultiSelectListView.java:68) at android.widget.AbsListView.performLongPress(AbsListView.java:3151) at android.widget.AbsListView$CheckForLongPress.run(AbsListView.java:3083) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5461) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:726) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:616) Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Settings option under Configuration section. Tap More option under Discussion section. Tap Hold for Moderation under Comments section. Scroll to bottom of list. Long-press last item in list. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.5
Manager.title: Crash report 5.5: NPE in SiteSettingsFragment

Manager.description: Similar to #3897 but we should show that (kind of) dialog with all publishing ways (from the Post List, from the Editor). Not doing it could cause published post to contain broken media.
Manager.title: Warn the user to clear failed images (or edit the post) on publish from Post List

Manager.description: Expected behavior Users should be able to reply to comments (e.g. from the notifications comment detail view) no matter what device language they use. Actual behavior Comment replies fail when the device language is set to Arabic or Farsi (Persian). Replies work as expected with other languages (tested in Spanish and Hebrew) or with the device language set to English and keyboard language set to Arabic. I get this error when I try to reply to a comment with my device language set to Farsi: 07-04 13:07:06.996 11904-11947/? E/WordPress: [11795] BasicNetwork.performRequest: Unexpected response code 404 for https://public-api.wordpress.com/rest/v1/sites/۷۶۰۲۶۹۶۲/comments/۳۷/replies/new?locale=fa_IR 07-04 13:07:07.010 11904-11904/? E/WordPress-COMMENTS: com.android.volley.ServerError at com.android.volley.toolbox.BasicNetwork.performRequest(BasicNetwork.java:179) at com.android.volley.NetworkDispatcher.run(NetworkDispatcher.java:114) It looks like the issue is that these languages use different numerals, so the site ID and comment ID in the API request are being sent in the wrong numeral system. Steps to reproduce the behavior On a WordPress.com or Jetpack blog, leave a comment (to trigger a notification) In the app, open the comment notification and approve the comment if needed Reply to the comment. Result: Comment is successfully published. In the device settings, switch the language to Arabic or Farsi (Persian) Return to the app and reply to the comment. Result: Comment fails. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16 Reported by a user in 114004-h using WPAndroid 5.5 (h/t Sandy for the report)
Manager.title: Error 404 when replying to comments with device language set to Arabic or Farsi (Persian)

Manager.description: Expected behavior Images should be resized in the reader according to the image's original width/height ratio. Actual behavior Images with a height attribute (e.g.
Manager.title: Reader: Images with height attribute are displayed with incorrect ratio

Manager.description: Expected behavior The related posts section should always be visible in the post detail view in the reader Actual behavior If you rotate your device after viewing the post detail, the related posts section disappears Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the reader tab Tap on a blog post to open the post detail Scroll to the bottom and confirm that the related posts appear at the bottom Rotate your device. Result: The post reloads (you are taken to the top of the post) and when you scroll down, the related posts section is gone If you rotate again or pull down to reload the post it doesn't bring the related posts back. You have to exit the post detail and open it again to get the related posts back. Screenshots Related posts in the post detail view: After rotating the device and scrolling down to the bottom of the post: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16
Manager.title: Reader: Related posts disappear after rotating device

Manager.description: Expected behavior Each of the custom notification sounds should be different. Actual behavior The "Default notification sound" is the same sound as "Tethys." Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to Notification Settings Select "Notification sound" Tap on "Default notification sound" and "Tethys" — both play the same sound. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16
Manager.title: Notification settings: Two of the notification sounds are the same

Manager.description: Expected behavior WordPress-Android project have to get compiled without any error. Actual behavior Failed to sync gradle project Wordpress-Android-develop Failed to open zip file Gradle dependency cache may be corrupt this sometimes occurs after a network connection timeout Re-download dependencies and synch project(Requires network) Steps to reproduce the behavior Download the project from Github / Clone project and compile it in Android studio Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung galaxy s4
Manager.title: Unable to build as a Gradle project in Android Studio.

Manager.description: Expected behavior When inviting a new user, after entering a username or email address in the invitation form I expect to be able to backspace or tap the "x" to remove them. (Both methods work in Calypso web for removing an invited user from the invitation form.) Actual behavior I can only tap the "x" to remove the username or email address I entered in the invitation. Although I have a cursor (for entering more in the username/email field) I can't backspace to remove a previous entry in that field: Steps to reproduce the behavior In the app, go to the site dashboard > People Tap the plus icon to invite a new user Enter a username or email address in the "Usernames or Emails" field Tap enter or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field to complete the entry (an "x" will appear next to the username/email you entered) Backspace to try to remove that username/email. Result: The cursor can't backspace over that username/email. Tap the "x" to try to remove that username/email. Result: the username/email is removed. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16
Manager.title: People: Backspace v. tapping to remove a username/email address from an invitation

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I try to invite a user who is already the member of a site, I expect the invite form to do the same validation and display the same error message no matter what site I'm on. Actual behavior The invite form has different behavior depending on whether I'm inviting a user to a public or private site. On a public site: I can enter the username or email for an existing member of the site. When I try to send the invite: The username turns red The message USERNAME: Already a member appears below the username I get the error Invite sent but error(s) ocurred! (Note: There's a typo in that error — it should be occurred with two c's.) On a private site: As soon as I hit enter after entering a username/email or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field: The username turns red I see the message There's already a member with username 'USERNAME' If I try to send the invite anyway, I get the error Cannot send: A username or email is invalid Screenshots Public site, before sending the invite: Public site, after sending the invite: Private site, before sending the invite: Private site, after sending the invite: Steps to reproduce the behavior In the app, go to the site dashboard > People for a public site Tap the plus icon to invite a new user Enter the username of an existing member on the site in the "Usernames or Emails" field Tap enter or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field to complete the entry (an "x" will appear next to the username you entered) Tap "Send" on the invite Go back to the site dashboard and switch to a private site Tap the plus icon to invite a new user Enter the username of an existing member on the site in the "Usernames or Emails" field Tap enter or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field to complete the entry (an "x" will appear next to the username you entered) Tap "Send" on the invite Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16
Manager.title: People: Validation when inviting an existing member differs for public and private sites

Manager.description: When I was viewing a post with only one Like, I wasn't sure what the gravatar was because it seemed out of place. Had to check other posts for me to remember that it's actually supposed to be a list of people who liked that post. Expected behavior I think a heading similar to "Related Reading" would be nice. Actual behavior Steps to reproduce the behavior Visit a post with only one like. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5 simulator, Android 6.0 /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Reader: It's not obvious what the row of gravatars are (especially if there's only one Like)

Manager.description: Expected behavior For timestamp to be next to Author's name just like in Calypso: Actual behavior Timestamp is next to the site name/URL: The timestamp refers to the time post was published so it shouldn't be next to the site's name/URL. Steps to reproduce the behavior Tap on a post from Reader Notice how timestamp on full-post view is next to the site name/URL Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5 simulator, Android 6.0 /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Reader: Timestamp should be next to Author's name

Manager.description: Expected behavior For Follow/Following icons to be using the latest version: Here are the SVGs in case you need them: https://cloudup.com/cqULXWspuwT Colors: Follow: grey_dark / #2e4453 Following: alert_green / #4ab866 Actual behavior Follow/Following icons are still using the old version: Steps to reproduce the behavior Visit any site stream on Reader. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5 simulator, Android 6.0 /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Reader: Follow/Following icons are still using old version

Manager.description: Expected behavior Backing out of full-screen video from a post in the Reader should show the post again Actual behavior Backing out of full-screen video from a post in the Reader causes the post to become empty Steps to reproduce the behavior View a post in the Reader that has a video embed in it Play and full screen the video Back out of the video Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Reader: Backing out of full-screen video causes post to be empty

Manager.description: Expected behavior When inviting users to join a site, I expect the invite form to limit me to 10 usernames/emails at a time, like in Calypso web: After entering 10 usernames/emails in that web form, the "Usernames or Emails" field won't accept any more entries. Actual behavior I can enter as many usernames/emails as I want in the "Usernames or Emails" field in the invite form. However, after I hit "Send" 10 of the usernames/emails I entered (not necessarily the first 10) disappear from the form, and this message appears: An error occured while trying to send the invite! After that message disappears, this message appears: Invite sent successfully The 10 usernames/emails that disappeared receive an invite, but any remaining usernames/emails in the invite form don't get the invite. It isn't clear from the app messaging what happened and why. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the site dashboard > People in the app Tap the plus icon in the top right to invite new users In the "Usernames or Emails" field, enter at least 11 usernames/emails Tap SEND in the top right to send the invite Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16
Manager.title: People: Should not be possible to enter more than 10 usernames/emails in invite form

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I type in multiple users into the 'Usernames or Emails' textbox, I expect to be able to separate them using a comma. Actual behavior Instead, the comma is added as part of the email/username and the email/username is marked as invalid Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the People area for a site Click on the '+' Try to add new users with a comma separating the users on the list Tested on [device], Android [version] alpha-16, nexus 6, android 6.0.1
Manager.title: People Management: comma should act as separator when inviting users

Manager.description: Expected behavior When an error occurs and the invite is not sent, I expect the error toast message to say that the invite was not sent. Actual behavior Instead, the toast error messages says that the invite was sent in these two cases: the email blocked invite emails from wp.com the username already exists as a user on the site In both of these cases, I got a toast that 'Invites sent but error(s) occured!' However, invites were not in fact sent (and should not be sent) Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the People area for a site Click the '+' sign Type in an email or username that is a member of the site (do not move cursor away from textbox area) Click 'Send' See this: If you add a user that blocked invites, you'll see this instead: Tested on [device], Android [version] alpha-16, nexus 6, android 6.0.1
Manager.title: People: confusing 'Invite sent' toast message

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to view media in the site's media library (My Site > Media or in the Editor > Add media > Select from media library). Actual behavior If a site has basic HTTP auth, media in the media library doesn't load and a placeholder is displayed instead: (Images added from the media library or uploaded to a new post also display as broken images in the editor.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Add a self-hosted site with basic HTTP auth to the app Visit the My Site tab > Media Result: The media thumbnails don't load. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16 Reported on Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid 5.5 in 114458-h
Manager.title: Media: Media library does not load media for sites with basic HTTP auth

Manager.description: Expected behavior Removing username before it's validated is possible. Actual behavior Removing username before it's validated leads to crash. Steps to reproduce the behavior To test this add username and immediately press X to remove it. You might want to try it couple of times, depending on how fast validation is. Crash report: E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main Process: org.wordpress.android, PID: 29275 java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'android.view.View android.view.ViewGroup.findViewById(int)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.PeopleInviteFragment.styleButton(PeopleInviteFragment.java:354) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.PeopleInviteFragment.access$800(PeopleInviteFragment.java:38) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.PeopleInviteFragment$8.onUsernameValidation(PeopleInviteFragment.java:321) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.utils.PeopleUtils$11.onResponse(PeopleUtils.java:289) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.utils.PeopleUtils$11.onResponse(PeopleUtils.java:267) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:76) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:19) at com.android.volley.ExecutorDelivery$ResponseDeliveryRunnable.run(ExecutorDelivery.java:99) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5221) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:899) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:694)
Manager.title: People Management: Removing username before it's validated leads to crash.

Manager.description: Expected behavior Long usernames have X mark near them that let's you remove them. Actual behavior Long usernames do not X mark near them. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add the long username to invite text field.
Manager.title: People Management: Long usernames do not have X mark near them.

Manager.description: Expected behavior Fragment/Activity transitions should look good on multi-window tablets. Actual behavior Under certain configurations (wpandroid being the left window in a multi-window setup), the slide in/out animation overlaps with the other window Steps to reproduce the behavior On an Android 6.0 tablet, in landscape, engage in multi-window mode and have the wpandroid app be the left of the two windows On the MySite screen, tap on "Comments" to enter the comments screen Notice how the screen animation overlaps with the window on the right side of the device screen A video showing the issue: https://cldup.com/JXW_DFD0ML.mp4 Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung T810, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Slide in/out animations don't look good on multi-window

Manager.description: Expected behavior App should allow dragging and dropping text or images from other apps into the editor when in multi-window mode Actual behavior App doesn't respond to dropping text/images from other apps when in multi-window mode. Steps to reproduce the behavior On an Android 6.0 tablet, in landscape, engage in multi-window mode and have the wpandroid app be the left of the two windows Open a second app on the right-side window that supports drag-and-drop (for example, the photos app or the Samsung Memo app) In wpandroid, navigate to the post editor From the right-side window, drag a photo or some selected text and drop it into the editor Nothing happens to the editor Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung T810, Android v6.0.1
Manager.title: Support drag and drop when multiple-windows

Manager.description: Expected behavior When signing into the app as a 'self-hosted' site, but specifying a WordPress.com username/password and a '.wordpress.com' site url, I should be logged into WordPress.com and everything should behave as though I hadn't selected 'self-hosted' when I signed in. Actual behavior While I can see my WordPress.com sites, the 'Me' screen doesn't have the WordPress.com options, and still shows 'Connect to WordPress.com.` Steps to reproduce the behavior Start from a fresh app install, or sign out of WordPress.com At the sign-in screen, select 'Add self-hosted site' Enter a correct WordPress.com username and password, and set the url to anything.wordpress.com ('anything' can be a real blog owned by that user, or not) Once signed in, go to the 'Me' screen Observe that the 'Me' screen is the one shown when not logged into WordPress.com Tested on Nexus 5X, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: WordPress.com options not showing when logged in as 'self-hosted'

Manager.description: Expected behavior Text fields look normal. Actual behavior Tested on Galaxy Nexus, Android 4.1.1 using alpha-17
Manager.title: People Management: Text fields at Invite screen are black on api 16 (4.1.1)

Manager.description: Expected behavior When you click on Username text field in landscape soft keyboard pops up. Actual behavior When you click on Username text field in landscape nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Rotate your device so it would be in landscape mode. Go to Invite screen of People Management. Click on "Usernames or Emails" text field. In addition, if you open the keyboard in portrait mode and rotate the device, keyboard reopens. Tested on Galaxy Nexus (4.1.1), Nexus 4 (4.4.4), Nexus 5 (5.0.0)
Manager.title: People Management: Keyboard for Username text field on Invite screen not showing up in landscape

Manager.description: Expected behavior If the dialog is present, then it should keep showing the same option list regardless of screen orientation changes. Actual behavior In portrait mode, open up the notification settings dialog and then change the device orientation to landscape. Some notification options in the list do not fit the screen, (so either the bottom items are not shown or are displayed partially) and the dialog doesn't allow scrolling down. Portrait mode (choosing either "Notifications tab" or "App notifications" in step 4 below). Rotated to landscape mode (choosing either "Notifications tab" or "App notifications" in step 4 below). Tapping on "Email from WordPress.com" as per alternative step 4.1 below: Portrait Landscape (see the options are "cut") . Steps to reproduce the behavior log in to Android WP app, and keep your phone in protrait mode go to the profile tab tap on "Notification Settings" Pick any site and then choose either "Notifications tab" or "App notifications" 4.1 (alternatively, instead of picking a site, tap on "Email from WordPress.com") the dialog is shown rotate your device the dialog shows as described in the Actual behavior section. Tested on Moto X, Android 5.1
Manager.title: Notifications settings dialog doesn't show all options when screen is rotated
Use `dexInProcess` in our gradle config to speed up the dexing step

Manager.description: Stores integration: Integrate AccountStore - @maxme Integrate SiteStore - @maxme Integrate PostStore - @aforcier Integrate MediaStore - @tonyr59h / @oguzkocer Integrate CommentStore - @maxme Integrate TaxonomyStore - @aforcier Rewrite MediaUploadService and PostUploadService Misc: Access token migration to the AccountStore from any wpandroid version - @tonyr59h Integrate discovery to the sign in screen (and to the add new site screen) - @maxme Integrate HTTP Auth and SSL certificate management - @maxme Integrate 2FA - @tonyr59h Migrate .org sites from older app version #5027 Migrate local drafts from older app version (@aforcier) Make sure some key analytics are still there and well tracked (sign in / sign in errors for instance). Kill SelfSignedSSLCertsManager (ref #4395) "Detect" self hosted sites with Jetpack not added via .com login and ask the user to login if they want to access specific screens (Stats, themes, site settings, ?)

Here's the current post slug option in the Calypso editor, after saving a draft: Related iOS issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#501

Manager.description: As discussed here: #4359 (comment) Expected behavior For Follow/Following text to use correct color on the get go Actual behavior They're using the correct color now, however, they first are in gray before that happens Video: https://cloudup.com/ccjLsyWHTMR After the icon update in #4359, this old text color behavior still exists Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Reader Visit any feed Click on the Follow button (or if you're already Following, click it again to unfollow) Notice how the button's text color first uses gray then shifts to its correct color Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung Note 4, Android 4.4.4, WordPress 4.2

Manager.description: Originally reported by @mjangda Expected behavior When a post is scheduled, a notification should be triggered with the basic information about the post being published Actual behavior _I received a scheduled post notification just now and it looked like this in the notification drawer. Clicking through, the notification looks fine but lacked a lot of information when viewed in the drawer._ Steps to reproduce the behavior Schedule a post Wait for the schedule to happen, with the app in the background Tested on: Android version seems Lollipop

Manager.description: I came across differences between Android and Calypso Reader. Basically, I noticed this mainly because I feel like the timestamp is in the wrong place - it doesn't seem like it pertains to the post itself, rather the entire site: For Followed Sites: Card: I also noticed that if it's a non-wpcom site, their URL is not shown: For main Discover stream: In Calypso, we have a single site header at the very top of the main Discover stream to avoid site header repetition: Card: For Full-post view: Let me know if I should break this up into several smaller issues. /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Reader: Stream and card layout differences with Calypso

Manager.description: Expected behavior If the app is offline and can't sync/display the correct information on a screen, I expect to see a toast message or other error message explaining that. In most cases, when an action fails while offline, we display this toast message: There is no network available Actual behavior There are a couple screens where there is no error or the error is generic, not explaining the offline state: Plans: A toast message appears Unable to load plans Themes: When you first open the Themes section, the full list of themes does not appear and there is no error or other message to explain why Editor - Post Settings - Select categories: A blank screen appears (no categories load) and there is no error or other message to explain why Editor - Post Settings - Add a new category: A toast message appears Adding category failed with no explanation why Me - My Profile: It looks like the changes are saved (no error message), but if you exit the My Profile section and open it again the changes are gone. Screenshots Examples of clear toast/error messages: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-17
Manager.title: Improve errors when the app is offline

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Share an image to WordPress and select the Media Library Once the image has uploaded, press the Back button to return to the previous app Attempt to task switch back to WordPress Expected behavior WordPress opens Actual behavior WordPress fails to open and throws an error https://cloudup.com/cQsK0hUQ6sS Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Sharing to Media Library then task-switching crashes app

Manager.description: When viewing Discover in the reader list view, there should be single site header at the top, and the post header should be removed to avoid repetition. Originally reported with issue #4404
Manager.title: Reader list view should show a site header for Discover

Manager.description: We should use Fragments as much as possible for the possible multi-pane layouts.
Manager.title: Convert MyProfileActivity to Fragment

Manager.description: Right now JavaScript is disabled for security reasons when viewing reader post detail for non-wpcom sites. This has the side effect of breaking embedded videos. The security risk has been resolved on the backend via scrubbing, so we can now always enable JavaScript.
Manager.title: Enable JavaScript in reader post detail

Manager.description: Expected behavior Creating a new site triggers a "created new blog" event Actual behavior Creating a new site triggers a "created new account" event Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new a blog from the "add a site" prompt. Tested on Nexus 6P
Manager.title: Correctly track creating a new site

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect audio embedded with the [audio] shortcode to either be embedded in the Reader or to appear as a link that I can tap to listen to the audio file. Actual behavior The audio shortcode is not rendered at all, leaving a blank space in the Reader: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post Embed an audio file in the post with the [audio] shortcode (shortcode details in the Codex) Publish the post View the post in the Reader Result: A blank space appears where the audio embed should be in the post. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-18
Manager.title: Audio shortcode is not rendered correctly / doesn't play in the Reader

Manager.description: Expected behavior If I have a saved draft in the app, I expect to be able to preview how it will look on my site before I publish it. Actual behavior In version 5.5, drafts could be viewed to see how they will look on the site (and on-site preview). Steps: Open the app and go to the Blog Posts list Find a saved draft (marked "Draft" in the list) Tap the "View" link to view an on-site preview As of version 5.6, though, drafts can only be previewed in the in-app preview, not the on-site preview. Steps: Open the app and go to the Blog Posts list Find a saved draft (marked "Draft" in the list) Tap the "Preview" link to view an in-app preview @0nko could this have been introduced along with the Publish button in #4189, and if so, was it intentional? Unfortunately this prevents users from seeing a "real" preview of how the draft will look on their site. Screenshots On-site preview in version 5.5: In-app preview in version 5.6: Current behavior tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-18 Behavior from 5.5 and 5.6 tested with APKs in an emulator
Manager.title: Can't preview how a draft looks on the site anymore

Manager.description: Related issue: #1603 When the notifications TAB is opened on any of the 3 client apps on the web, send a CLEAR ALL (badge-reset) notification to the remaining devices. This is what we are doing already for iOS and the web (if you open the notifications tab on the web, a badge-reset PN is triggered for iOS). Same should be done on Android: a badge-reset type PN should be sent to this users's registered Android devices and the client app should be able to handle that type of PN and thus clear any outstanding / read-pending notification from the native notifications dashboard. This specific behavior is first commented / described here #1603 (comment)
Manager.title: Send "read signal" PNs to automatically dismiss notifications on Android when Notifications Tab is seen on the web

Manager.description: I’ve split the notifications sync work into tackling 3 broadly incremental cases #4438 When the notifications TAB is opened on the web client, send a CLEAR ALL (badge-reset) notification to the remaining devices. This is what we are doing already for iOS and the web, and my patch augments its scope to do the same thing for Android. PR sent here: #4444 augment the previous case to “when notifications TAB is opened ON ANY CLIENT, send a CLEAR ALL (badge-reset) notification to the remaining devices.” This way, if you see the notifications tab on iOS, a few seconds later the pending notifications on any other device (being it iOS or Android or the web) should be dismissed and the badge should be cleared. This is being synced by Simperium, so basically when you see the notifications tab on Android atm Simperium syncs the meta bucket and changes are reflected on the web, but for some reason the push notification is not being triggered for mobile devices (for instance for iOS atm). (This is not strictly Android work, rather it is likely going to be backend work on API and Simperium, but leaving it here for consistency in my incremental approach.) EDIT: this has proven be tackled by Simperium among iOS devices / the web, and with the addition of the previous #4438 issue this will be tackled as well #1603 When a specific item is opened on any device, send a CLEAR for THAT ITEM ONLY to the rest of devices. EDIT this will need special treatment on iOS, as this can only be tackled starting on iOS 10
Manager.title: Notifications: "Read Signal Sync" master issue

Manager.description: Continuing on #4422, we're going to add the "Site Created" analytics when a user creates a new account as well (because a new site is created at that time). Same as wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#5795
Manager.title: Add "Site Created" analytics also when a user creates a new account

Manager.description: Following is one of the most important actions a user can take in Reader, however, I noticed that this is hidden behind an ellipsis. There are also some inconsistencies on its location. When I'm following a tag, I have to tap on the ellipsis to follow it: When I search for something, I have to tap on the site header then be taken to that site's stream where I can find the Follow button: For Discover, since we're adding the Discover stream header topmost (#4404), then we have the Follow button on there. But the ellipsis needs to be moved next to the Comment/Like icons where it will contain another Follow button and "Report" this post. This way they don't have to scroll back up to get to the Discover site header to follow it. /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Reader: Follow action is not obvious

Manager.description: Comment doesn't have a label so we should just drop the word "Likes" for consistency. /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Reader: Likes has a label, but Comment does not

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to invite followers or viewers to a site, as in Calypso (web). Calypso invite for a public site (option to invite a follower): Calypso invite for a private site (option to invite a viewer): ### Actual behavior Currently you can only invite someone as an Administrator, Editor, Author, or Contributor. On a public site there is no option to invite someone as a follower, and on a private site there is no option to invite someone as a viewer. Steps to reproduce the behavior Try the following steps for both a public site and a private site: Go to the My Site screen for a site Select "People" Tap the + icon to send an invite Tap on "Role" to select the role Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-18
Manager.title: People: Invite Followers/Viewers to a site

Manager.description: Expected behavior If you change a site to private, the Viewer section should appear in People Management. Likewise, if you change a site from private to public, the Viewer section should be removed from People Management. Actual behavior The Viewer section is not added/removed from People Management until you close and reopen the app. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the My Sites tab and select a public site Go to Settings Change the Privacy setting to Private Go back to the My Sites tab and go to People Tap to view the People filter (Team/Followers/Email Followers). Result: The Viewer section does not appear in the app Swipe to close the app completely Reopen the app and go to People Tap to view the People filter (Team/Followers/Email Followers/Viewers). Result: The Viewer section now appears in the app. You can also repeat these steps, changing the Privacy setting back to Public/Hidden, and the Viewer section does not go away until you close and reopen the app. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-18 h/t @designsimply for the original report
Manager.title: People: Viewer section isn't immediately added/removed when you change site privacy

Manager.description: Reader: Add consistent search Tracks events and traintracks events Now that search is launched on all three platforms there are a few places where the stats we are tracking do not exactly match each other. Here are the set of Tracks events in Calypso that I think we should also implement on mobile (with the appropriate name changes): calypso_reader_search_loaded: wordpress.com/read/search is loaded with an empty search string calypso_reader_search_performed: a search request has been sent to the API. The web does search as you type with the search getting sent once there is a 500ms delay, but I think there is no reason the mobile apps wouldn't work with a similar event. calypso_reader_searchcard_clicked: User clicks on a result to do an article open. calypso_traintracks_render (example props: fetch_algo: read:search:posts/1, fetch_blog_id: 123, fetch_post_id:123, query: news): a search result is rendered for the user to see. This means that if the client requests 10 results, then when it gets those results to display (and ideally when it actually shows them to the user) it will fire 10 separate events. See "traintracks" below. calypso_traintracks_interact (example props: action: follow, fetch_algo: read:search:posts/1, fetch_blog_id: 123, fetch_post_id:123, query: news): a search result is interacted with by the user (could also be in the full post view). List of interaction actions is: article_liked, article_opened, searchcard_clicked, site_followed, site_unfollowed. This is sort of a meta event that wraps up other Tracks events in a common way. See "traintrackss below". Mobile apps also have some support for suggesting searches to users based on their past search history. It would be good to make sure we have tracks events for these and also pass through the query that the user selected. Maybe call it wpios_reader_search_suggest_selected and wpios_reader_search_suggest_shown? What are TrainTracks? We want a way to improve our algorithms (A/B test new ones) without having to change the clients. TrainTracks is a common method for tracking results from any api endpoint and we are deploying it for related posts, cold start, search, recommendations, etc Key problem it solves is that a data scientist can develop and deploy an algorithm change and launch it to all platforms with no coordination. This should help is continually improve our algorithms over time. The idea is loosely inspired by this article: http://multithreaded.stitchfix.com/blog/2016/03/16/engineers-shouldnt-write-etl/ Make launching new algorithms routine and streamlined. Avoid having to sync up between the front end and back end. For instance, I ran an A/B test looking at whether to rank more recent content higher last week. And now we are running an A/B test where we let older content rank higher. I don't currently have a way to track these results on our mobile platforms because they aren't sending TrainTracks events. So what is our framework (currently it may evolve as we find problems): When an algorithmic api responds to a request for results we return a "railcar" attached to each result (yes, we're taking this metaphor a little far ;) ) Railcar contains the following fields: fetch_alg - string identifying the algorithm that generated th fetch_position - integer. The ranked position within the results fetch_lang - the language(s) the algorithm was performed against fetch_query - the user entered query railcar - a unique ID that we use for matching render and interaction events rec_blog_id - the blog id for this result rec_post_id - the post id for this result rec_feed_id - the feed id for this result rec_feed_item_id - the feed item id for this result more to be added in the future That's a lot of fields, but as a client of TrainTracks, all the client needs to do is take every property in the railcar and add it as an event property to the render and interact traintracks events The API also returns a top level "algorithm" field which is a string that should be used when paging the API. This ensures that we get the same algorithm when paging and so we won't see duplicate results. What events trigger "Interaction" events? Anything the user can do on result (open, like, comment, follow, etc). There is a list in Calypso here: https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/ca16ae870a6c8df1cb050936f40abb53fc1a2994/client/reader/stats.js#L93 These events then get truncated to remove the prefix and are added to the "action" property: https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/ca16ae870a6c8df1cb050936f40abb53fc1a2994/client/reader/stats.js#L107 cc @xyu
Manager.title: Reader: Add consistent search Tracks events and traintracks events

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expected Kickstarter URLs starting with kickstarter.com/projects or kck.st to be embedded in a post, per the oEmbed list here: https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/blob/master/wp-includes/class-oembed.php#L94 This works as expected when publishing from the web and viewing the post on the web. Actual behavior Kickstarter URLs are displayed as plain links in the published post (in the app and on the web) instead of being embedded. Steps to reproduce the behavior Find a Kickstarter project and copy the link to it (both the full URL and the short kck.st version) In the app, start a new post Paste the links to the Kickstarter project on their own lines in the editor Publish the post Result: The projects are not embedded in the post. Screenshots Kickstarter URLs posted from the web editor and viewed in a browser: The same Kickstarter URLs posted from the Android editor and viewed in a browser: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-19
Manager.title: Kickstarter oEmbed URLs not embedding in posts published from the app

Manager.description: Expected behavior I have a shared server with a Wordpress instance which is only used by me. I tried to use the Wordpress iOS and Android app to manage posts and stuff. The server is hosted at german provider Netcup. Actual behavior Everytime I am doing a single action with the app (eg. edit post, upload media), the hoster's firewall triggers because of too many concurrent connections (as they say). The device's IP is then banned for this so the server is unreachable. Steps to reproduce the behavior Actually to reproduce one needs a server at Netcup. I tried another fresh Wordpress, same thing. So should the app really trigger the firewall? I am sure that I cannot make the provider change his firewall rules. Tested on [device], Android [version] OnePlus X (latest Oxygen), iPhone SE (latest) Netcup support answer: [...] Dies ist in der Tat ein serverseitiger Sicherheitsmechanismus und (leider) im Zusammenhang mit der Wordpress App bekannt. Diese baut, warum auch immer, zu viele gleichzeitige Verbindungen zum Server auf, sodass dann unsere Firewall eingreift. [...]
Manager.title: Too many concurrent connections

Manager.description: We have a roles.xml string resource with translatable="true" flag, however the strings.xml file is the only resource that's translated. Also, more importantly, once the roles values are translated it can not be used as REST API parameters.
Manager.title: Move roles string array to `strings.xml`

Manager.description: Title has it. The value of score can change so its not the most reliable method for sorting. From Xiao Yu: Using and resorting based on score could be unreliable / unnecessary because results are already sorted based on the current search context. The score for the same document with the same query could also change across contexts as we index more docs. I think paging with offsets or adding a must not array of ids already seen are the safest approaches. Related iOS issue here
Manager.title: Reader: Use offset instead of score for sorting search results

Manager.description: originally reported here: #4402 (comment) Expected behavior When a blog is imported and import finishes, a notification should be triggered with the basic information about the blog that has been imported. Actual behavior _empty notification shown in the notification drawer.
Manager.title: Import successful notification empty

Manager.description: Expected behavior Each time the client app registers itself by means of calling /devices/new endpoint, we should be sending the versionCode as part of its meta-data. Version code is an incremental integer and thus is the right way to correctly identify / compare among versions. Actual behavior Right now we are sending versionName (a String) for registering, and the server-side code is plagued with different ways for comparing app versions thus leading to possible bugs (and certainly confusion). The place in Android where this is being tracked and sent is here https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/WordPress/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/ui/notifications/utils/NotificationsUtils.java#L98 (check parameter app_version). IMPORTANT NOTE Please note that this change should be taken carefully as will probably need carefully going through analyzing already-registered values and evaluating the impact as we change both the registered value and the code that evaluates the value server-side Steps to reproduce the behavior Just install the app on a device to make this part of the code run. Tested on Moto X, Android 5.1
Manager.title: Use versionCode instead of versionName for registering devices to our PN server

Manager.description: Expected behavior When opening the app with PIN lock on you should only be allowed to see anything once the correct PIN/fingerprint has been used. Actual behavior When I see the PIN/fingerprint screen then hit my phone's back button, the app is then reopened without the PIN/fingerprint screen. This means that anyone can open the app and easily bypass the security check. Steps to reproduce the behavior Switch PIN lock on Exit the app Wait a few seconds and then reopen the app - you should see the PIN/fingerprint screen Press your phone's back button Quickly reopen the app - you should now be in the app without having to go through the PIN/fingerprint security check Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge, Android 6.0.1, App version alpha-19
Manager.title: PIN input screen can be easily bypassed

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a user is going through the Team, Followers, Email Followers, and Viewers, the correct user role (or lack of) should show up next to the username. Actual behavior Going from Team > Followers > Viewers in rapid succession results in the user role of someone in Team showing up as the user role next to the Viewer's username. ### Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Site dashboard > People. Add viewer to site. Start with Team selected, then select Followers (or Email Followers), then Viewers. Result: A user role of a user in Team will show up as the user role of the viewer, despite the viewer not having a user role. You must go from Team > Followers or Email Followers > Viewers to replicate the issue, going from Team > Viewers will result in seeing no user role next to the viewer, which is correct. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Plus, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-20
Manager.title: People: User role from Team shows up next to non-user viewer

Refreshing by pulling down successfully re-loads the list. It happens whether there are tags in the Follow list or not Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Reader: Discover list not loading posts after viewing the Following list

Manager.description: The reader posts table (tbl_posts) currently uses post_id + blog_id as the primary key, and relies on selecting tagged posts based on those two fields. It would be more efficient to switch to using the single fieldpseudo_id, which is unique across blogs.
Manager.title: Reader: rely on pseudo_id rather than post_id + blog_id

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect the post header to appear on all posts in the Reader except in the Discover list (where the Discover section should have a site header but the posts shouldn't have post headers). Actual behavior In the Reader post list, some posts have a header and others don't. I saw this on multiple lists, including Followed Sites and tag lists. I also noticed that the problem was not consistent — the same site may have some posts with post headers and some without. Also, if I pulled down to refresh the list it didn't have an effect, but if I rotated the device between portrait and landscape the post header appeared on all the posts in the list. However, when I tapped on a post with no post header, I did consistently see a post header on the post detail view. @nbradbury could this be an unintended effect of #4436? Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to the Reader Select a list other than Discover Scroll through the post list and look for posts with/without post headers Screenshot Posts with and without the post header, with the Food tag: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-20
Manager.title: Reader: Post header doesn't appear on all posts in the post list

Manager.description: Comes from #4031 We only have the "Reply" action. Adding Like / Approve actions to the notification for quick access to these actions.
Manager.title: Add 'Like/Approve' actions to a Comment Notification in addition to replying.

Manager.description: Based on this comment from @blowery, tag streams in the reader should be sorted by the date they were tagged because this is the order used by the backend.
Manager.title: Reader: sort tag streams by tagged date

Manager.description: In the class org.wordpress.android.WordPressDB: Expected behavior In the saveMediaFile() method (lines 1606 - 1609), the database cursor should be closed regardless it is empty or not (i.e., whether cursor.moveToFirst() returns true or false) Actual behavior the database cursor is only closed when it is not empty (i.e., when cursor.moveToFirst() returns true)
Manager.title: Potential resource leak in the org.wordpress.android.WordPressDB class

Manager.description: Expected behaviour As a user, I want to be able to use my Authy 2FA code to log in to my self-hosted WordPress via the Android App. Actual behaviour There is no option to add a 2FA code in the WordPress app. Authy disables XML-RPC services because they don't support 2FA. I can re-enable XML-RPC, but that negates the security aspect of 2FA. As far as I can tell, 2FA isn't natively supported on WordPress. Steps to reproduce the behaviour Install Authy and configure on blog. Try to log in to blog with Android app. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6, Android 6.0.1 See also authy/authy-wordpress#21
Manager.title: Support Authy 2FA

Manager.description: Expected behavior I can login to my self-hosted wordpress site using wordpress for android app Actual behavior When trying to login it gives me error "Invalid SSL certificate" Steps to reproduce the behavior after installing the wordpress for android. enter login and password with self-hosted website url. Tested on [device], Android [version] android version 5.7 Samsung SM-T230NU
Manager.title: I can't login to my self hosted site.

Manager.description: Expected behavior When in multi-window mode, focusing the second app to interact with should not cause the Floating Action Button (FAB) in MySite screen to hide. Actual behavior The FAB hides when focusing the other app. Steps to reproduce the behavior Put the app in multi-window mode (needs Android 7) Make sure the MySite screen/tab is selected Tap on the other app's window to bring the focus to that Notice the FAB animating out of view in wpandroid Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 10 emulator running Android v7.0

Manager.description: feature request: it looks like there's no way to disable the "Your stats are booming!" app (ie push) notification. i have all of the notification toggles turned off in Notification Settings => [site] => App notifications, but evidently none of them affect this. i have one self hosted site and a few wordpress.com sites in the app, and this has only ever happened for the self hosted site. (that site gets the most traffic by far, though.) this is on wordpress app version 5.8 and earlier, on a nexus 5x, android versions 6.x and 7.0. (apologies for filing here, btw! i tried to post on https://android.forums.wordpress.org/ , but the New Topic in this Forum link at the bottom is text, not a link, even when i'm logged in, and i couldn't find any other way to post.)
Manager.title: can't disable "Your stats are booming!" app notification

Actual behavior Text color is white: Steps to reproduce the behavior Type a keyword in Search to bring up the saved searched dropdown. Tested on [device], Android [version] WordPress Android Version Alpha-19 /cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Search: Text color in saved searches is white

Manager.description: Currently, for self-hosted blogs, the editor defaults to a Standard post format, regardless of what a user has set in Settings > Writing in wp-admin. It would be nice if we could respect this setting.
Manager.title: Posting/Editing: Respect self-hosted blog's default post format when creating new posts.

Manager.description: Expected behavior When tapping a .pdf link in an article while in the Reader, I am expecting the PDF document to open and be readable. Actual behavior Tapping a .pdf link in the Reader opens a WebView showing an empty white screen with a toolbar at the top. Steps to reproduce the behavior Write a post that has a link to a PDF file Open the post in the Reader Tap the PDF link Empty WebView should have come up Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung Galaxy S4, Android v5.0.1, App version 5.8
Manager.title: PDF links from the Reader show empty WebView

Manager.description: Expected behavior I often log in to self-hosted sites with these steps: Enter my Username Skip the password field Enter my Site URL Switch to my password manager app Copy my password Switch back to the WordPress app and enter my password in the login form Sign in to the site I expect my username and site URL to stay in the login form when I leave and reopen the app, so I can just paste in my password and continue on. Actual behavior Enter my Username Skip the password field Enter my Site URL Switch to my password manager app Copy my password Switch back to the WordPress app -> My site URL is erased from the login form (the username remains) This also happens if I enter all of my details (username, password, and site URL) and then switch away and back. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-21
Manager.title: NUX: Site URL erased from self-hosted login form when app goes to background

Manager.description: Expected behavior Followed Sites in the Reader is always expected to appear in order of the publish date on the posts. Actual behavior The changes in #4527 sort posts by the date they were tagged, instead of their publish date. This should only affect tag streams (with a tagged_on date) and not the Followed Sites view. However, if a post exists in both your followed sites and a tag stream, it will appear out of order on the Followed Sites view. Reported by a user in 131783-h
Manager.title: Reader: Followed Sites view can show tagged posts out of order

Manager.description: We're using an older version of the noticons font that is missing a vaultpress noticon. Update to the current .ttf.
Manager.title: Notifications: Update noticons font to latest

Manager.description: In the past it was possible to follow a blog that had a 302 redirect, but it appears to fail now. Try to follow ma.tt in the reader and it will fail, citing 302 as the failure status code.
Manager.title: Reader: can't follow blog with 302 temporary redirect
