Manager.description: We're stripping the inline css from iframe embeds. This can causes some layout/styling issues for certain iframes, case in point: Mesh. Original report from Joen: Here’s the oembed code for a Mesh:
Manager.title: Reader: Some iframe embeds can appear mis-styled after stripping inline css.

Manager.description: Expected behavior Posts in Reader Blog view of followed site appear in order of publication. Actual behavior In some cases posts in Reader Blog view of followed site appear in out of order. Steps to reproduce the behavior Here is the video that illustrates problem: https://cloudup.com/cOpwyYiRFrr Open "Followed Sites" tab in reader. Click on the blog name (pick one with lot's of posts) of a a post to open Reader Blog screen. Look at post dates to make sure they are in correct order. Open first post, wait for it to load. Return to Reader Blog screen. Notice how the lists changes and some posts are displayed without chronological order. PS. Sometimes it takes couple of tries to reproduce this behaviour. Tested with alpha-23 on Nexus 5x 6.0.0
Manager.title: Reader: Reader Blog post's sometimes appear out of order

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to Liked Posts, Followed Sites or Reader Blog. Open any post. Change device orientation. The post that goes before the one you loaded, appears in post view. (sometimes you need to change the orientation back to original for wrong post to appear). Video to illustrate the problem: https://cloudup.com/cP_UswVjfPf Tested on alpha-23 with Nexus 5x 6.0.0 and Nexus 5 5.0.0
Manager.title: Reader: Wrong post is loaded after orientation change

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a WordPress.com user signs up on the web, they are prompted to confirm their email address at the end of the signup flow: If the user doesn't confirm their email address at that step, they are blocked from publishing new posts and see a notice/reminder in the Calypso editor: Currently, those same users are blocked from publishing in the WordPress app as well, but the publish button isn't deactivated — their posts just inexplicably become drafts instead of publishing. (They often have to reach out to support for an explanation of what's happening and for help confirming their email address.) Instead, we should offer a similar notice/reminder within the app to help these users. Steps to reproduce the behavior While logged out of WordPress.com, open https://wordpress.com/start Sign up for a new account but don't confirm your email address In the app, log in to your new account Create a new post and try to publish it Result: The post becomes a draft. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-22 Related issue for iOS: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6035
Manager.title: NUX: Add email confirmation prompt for WordPress.com users

Manager.description: Expected behavior Comments awaiting moderation should have "Reply / Approve" actions Actual behavior I received "Reply / Like" actions Steps to reproduce the behavior I was unable to reproduce this, but I wanted a bug report out there in case others see the problem. This is what I did (on a blog with moderation required only for the first time a user comments on the site): Left a comment on a blog as a new user -- Received the "Reply / Approve" notification, the Approve button worked Left several new comments as that user -- Received the "Reply / Like" notification, both buttons worked Left a comment as another new user -- Received the "Reply / Like" notification, despite the fact that the comment required moderation Here's a screenshot showing the corresponding e-mail notification for context: ##### Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.0, alpha-23
Manager.title: Notifications: Comment requiring moderation still provided "Like" option

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I click the Like button in a notification I expect to remain in whatever app I'm currently using Actual behavior I'm taken out of my current activity and placed into the WordPress app's notification view. I'd much rather just get a toast message indicating success/failure rather than having the whole app open up and interrupt whatever else I'm doing. This can be especially jarring when I interact with the notification from my Android Wear watch, since then the next time I unlock my phone it's in a different app from where I left it. I'm labelling the issue with [Type] Bug, but if others feel strongly that this is the desired behavior it can be re-labelled an Enhancement and worked on later Steps to reproduce the behavior Receive a notification of a comment, and click Like Tested on Nexus 6P Android 7.0, alpha-23 👍 1
Manager.title: Notifications: "Like" button shouldn't open the app

Manager.description: When uploading something via the Media section in the Android app, the “uploading”, “queued”, and “retry” text (on failed uploads) is a bit hard to read. The tap target for “retry” seems very small (and it’s not obvious that it is tappable since it looks the same as the other states). per @mjangda
Manager.title: Media library status text is hard to read

Manager.description: Expected behavior In #4537 the actions on the push notifications are evenly spaced, with icons next to each action (e.g. a checkmark for Approve, a star for Like): Actual behavior I see both actions left-aligned with no icon: Is that the expected formatting for the push notification on Android 7.0? If it's possible, it would be nice to at least space out the actions more to avoid accidentally tapping the wrong one. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-23
Manager.title: Notifications: Comment PNs missing action icons

Manager.description: Looks like certain self hosted responses to upload media return a Boolean (?) instead of a string as the media url. Fatal Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Boolean cannot be cast to java.lang.String at org.xmlrpc.android.ApiHelper$UploadMediaTask.onPostExecute(ApiHelper.java:863) at org.xmlrpc.android.ApiHelper$UploadMediaTask.onPostExecute(ApiHelper.java:744) at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:636) at android.os.AsyncTask.access$500(AsyncTask.java:177) at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:653) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:111) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:210) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5830) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1113) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:879)
Manager.title: Crash report 5.9: ClassCastException in UploadMediaTask

Manager.description: To reproduce: Try adding the tag "a8cdayz". You'll see a toast that the tag was added. A moment later you'll see a toast that the tag could not be added. Its a bit confusing to a user.
Manager.title: Reader: Some tags show added toast, then a toast they couldn't be added.

Manager.description: This is a bit weird, and definitely an edge case, but here we go: Start with several of your blogs hidden from the site picker and having your default site selected and its site detail visible. Tap Switch Site Tap Search to view all your sites, including those that are hidden. Tap one of the hidden sites. The site should be selected and unhidden when you tap it. Tap switch site to return to the site list. Select the default site again. Go back to the site list. Hide again the site you previously tapped. Still on the site list, tap Search. Tap the site you just hid to try to select it. Notice that nothing happens when you tap the site now. Seems like you should.
Manager.title: Site Picker: Can't pick re-hidden site while searching

Manager.description: User feature request: Please add big text box area in tags in android app, its difficult to paste multiple tags in current single line tag area It might be nice if the tag field expanded to show its content vs staying a single line.
Manager.title: Posting: Make tag field multiline

Manager.description: Originally reported by @rachelmcr A user reported an issue in the Android app v. 5.6, using a Galaxy Tab S2 (SM-T815) with Android 6.0.1 and a bluetooth keyboard. When they are leaving comments on other blogs or replying to comments on their own blog, and they hit the backspace key, it goes back two spaces instead of just one. This is a consistent problem but doesn’t happen with the same keyboard elsewhere in the app (e.g. the editor) or in other apps. Needs confirmation.
Manager.title: Editor: Issue with backspace with bluetooth keyboard

Manager.description: Originally reported by Chrissie P WordPress – 5.6.1 SM-P601 android – 4.4.2 Persian Video clip of issue (very helpful) – http://sendvid.com/lhr8mdg4 Persian writing keyboard. User creates a post and it falls under the correct date when published. The user edits the post, and the post goes to the bottom of the posting list. On the web, the posts show in the correct order. Follow up by @rachelmcr On the web, the date was actually changed on the page, as well. Here’s the page from the user’s screencast: https://lokht.wordpress.com/%D8%AA%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C-%D9%88-%D8%A8%DB%8C-%D8%A2%D8%BA%D9%88%D8%B4%DB%8C-%D8%B3%D9%85-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA-%D9%86%D8%B3%D8%AE%D9%87-1-0/ The publish date on that page is now January 1, 1970. I can reproduce this when I switch my device language to Persian and edit a page on a test site, but I haven’t yet tracked down why that’s happening. [...] Just a quick note that I tested this in Arabic and found that if I change the device language to Arabic it causes this issue, but if I only change the interface language in the app settings to Arabic (with English as the device language) there’s no problem. I’m pretty sure there’s a problem with the date being sent in the wrong numerals
Manager.title: Edited Post Changes Date to 1999

Manager.description: @rachelmcr reports: A user reported that they were working on a draft (with lots of text and photos) for a number of days. They then opened it in the editor to keep working on it and discovered that the draft was empty. I checked the logs that came in with the issue, and I noticed that there is a connection error near the beginning of the log: 08 - java.net.UnknownHostException: Unable to resolve host "public-api.wordpress.com": No address associated with hostname Could that connection error have caused the content loss in the editor? And if so, can we prevent that from happening? I have seen some reports of similar issues in app reviews and when it happens with a local draft we can’t recover the content, so it’s a pretty serious issue. Opening this issue to track possible/related occurrences
Manager.title: Editor: Empty draft after opening editor

Manager.description: It would be nice if the font size of the editor could be adjusted for accessibility sake.
Manager.title: Editor: Increase font size of text in editor

Manager.description: Member report shared by Chrissie P When I make local changes on the Android app I get a message that “this post has local changes which haven’t been published” with the option to “Publish” or “Revert”. “Publish” is misleading here. The post in question is a draft. I don’t want it published yet. I suggest this be escalated as bug. But as it happens, nothing happens. When I hit the “Publish” button I get a brief spinning circle with no message to indicate if the action has succeeded it failed. However when I switch back to the Posts screen the post is marked as having “local changes”. We loop round several times accepting the offer to “Publish” but although the spinning wheel takes longer to go away each time, the changes still remain local. The same thing happens if I use the “revert” button. I still get the report that there are “local changes. Screencast at http://ChBQNAP.myqnapcloud.com:8080/share.cgi?ssid=0OAnMJd
Manager.title: Posting: Local changes warning misleading

Manager.description: @drw158 requests: Adding a link to the app’s device settings [...] would be great for power users. Slack does a similar thing.
Manager.title: Add a link to Device Settings

Manager.description: Expected behavior Offer the user some potentially useful FAQ articles that might be related to the chat request. Actual behavior Chat is initiated without offering the user any FAQ pointers. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android v7.0, WordPress app v5.9
Manager.title: Enable FAQ search before send in Helpshift

Manager.description: It would be helpful for the Helpshift audience to have a flag in the ticket metadata to denote whether the user has any paid upgrades purchased on any of her account's sites.
Manager.title: Paid upgrades flag in Helpshift metadata

Manager.description: Along with all the other great improvements currently being made to the WordPress-Android notifications, it would be great of the Ignore/Approve actions were available directly from the "Verify sign in" notification (used in place of a code for 2FA), enabling the user to approve a login without leaving their current activity (or enable the actions from a smartwatch). The current notification: 👍 1
Manager.title: Notifications: Add Ignore/Approve options to 2FA notifications

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that when I view a single post in the Reader, I can tap the share icon to share it to any service that appears there. Actual behavior If I try to share the post to certain services (such as Pinterest) I get the error "Please use a valid Web address." (A similar error has been reported for users with WhatsApp, although I haven't confirmed that error yet.) I am guessing this is because the post's URL is prefixed by the post title, instead of being the URL on its own. If I share the post from the Blog Posts list, instead of the Reader, I can share it without any error. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Reader in the app Open the post detail for a post Tap the Share icon in the top right Select a sharing service such as Pinterest Result: You see the error "Please use a valid Web address." Alternate steps that work: Open the My Sites tab in the app Open the Blog Posts section Tap "View" under a blog post Tap the Share icon in the top right Select a sharing service such as Pinterest Result: The post is shared as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-23 Reported on WPAndroid 6.0.1 in 135352-h
Manager.title: Reader: Can't share posts to some services

Manager.description: The featured images added in #4626 are stretched vertically, whereas they should be cropped to fit the size of the ImageView. Note: wait for #4626 to be merged before tackling this, then make sure to branch from reader-full-post-refresh-master.
Manager.title: Reader: stretched images in full post refresh

Manager.description: While reviewing #4430, I noticed we could get stream canceled volley request when using a very slow network (throttled), these errors are ignored during signin in SignInFragment, and the user is stuck on that screen with a progress bar and can't do nothing. We should make sure 1. FluxC generate onChanged events with the error field filled and 2. all errors are treated in SignInFragment.
Manager.title: FluxC integration: Better error management in SignInFragment

Manager.description: Expected behavior Jetpack does not currently support Comment Likes, so it doesn't make sense for "Like" to be an action on comment notifications for Jetpack sites. Actual behavior In comment notifications (in the notifications tab and push notifications) there is an option to "Like" a comment on a Jetpack site. Push notification: Notifications tab: In contrast, the Comments section for the same Jetpack site does not have the "Like" option: Steps to reproduce the behavior On a Jetpack site, make sure the site is set to approve incoming comments From another account, make a comment on the site to trigger a notification Check the notification and confirm it shows the "Like" action Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-23 Reported by a beta tester here
Manager.title: Notifications: "Like" should not be an option for comments on Jetpack sites

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I have the WordPress app on the foreground and I receive a push notification, the notification icon should stay there even if I rotate the device. Actual behavior When I have the WordPress app on the foreground and I receive a push notification, I notice the notification icon appears in the system bar. If I rotate the device, the notification icon for the WordPress app is now gone. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and leave it in the foreground make something happen in the outside that triggers a push notification (for example, have some other user comment on a blog post you're an admin of) observe the notification icon appear rotate the device observe the notification icon disappear Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.1]
Manager.title: Notification is dismissed when device is rotated

Manager.description: Expected behavior "Uncategorized" category should be allowed to be added even when other categories are already added. Actual behavior "Uncategorized" category is blocked from adding when other categories have already been added. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the editor to edit a post Tap the "gear" action to edit the post settings If "uncategorized" is already added, remove it Tap the "+" icon in the categories section to add some categories If "Uncategorized" is the only one shown in the list, tap the "+" action and create an additional one Tap the "Uncategorized" list item to select it Nothing changes. List item remains unchecked. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android v7.0, WPAndroid vAlpha-24
Manager.title: "Uncategorized" post category blocked for adding

Manager.description: Expected behavior I should be receiving notifications from WP if I have the app installed, no matter what the running state for the app itself is. Actual behavior after stopping the app, no notifications are received / processed / shown to the user. They start appearing after I first launch the app again. if you power off your device and turn it back on, but never launch WordPress manually, you never get any notifs. Steps to reproduce the behavior CASE A) (notifications are received) Log in to the Android WordPress app Have someone like/comment on a blog post of yours See the notification arrive at your device CASE B) (notifications are not received) Turn your phone off and then back on, but do not launch the WordPress App. Alternatively, you can also go to Apps-> WordPress and then hit FORCE STOP. Have someone like/comment on a blog post of yours See the notification NEVER arrive at your device. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.1]
Manager.title: Notifications: if the app is stopped, no notifications are displayed

Manager.description: After a first approach to implementing quick actions (#4523) and voice reply (#4032) on Notifications it follows it would be expected for these actions to be self-contained and have as less user interaction as possible after user has made a decision and acted upon a notification (#4602). For this, a service that actually takes care of "liking" , "approving", or "replying" would have to be done, so the user doesn't need to follow these actions on-screen. Furthermore, having this kind of service would also allow us to solve #4657 as well, improving overall UX for Notifications.
Manager.title: Notifications: service for background processing - master issue

Manager.description: Overview We would remove Simperium from the app and agreed in the weekly chat that using the Rest API + PingHub + Push Notification payload is the way to go. Implementation details still need to be defined, especially on the PingHub side (we have a solid foundations on what REST and PNs should look like). Details Switch to REST (based on @roundhill 's work on this branch) PR #4674 Make sure the Notifications badge is consistent with unread count and the web. Details here #4674 (comment) Addressed in the PR above. Tapping on tabs should filter the list accordingly (All, Unread, Comments, Follows, or Likes) The placeholder views that show when the list is empty aren't hooked up. If a notification is received while looking at the notifications list and the new item (index zero) is visible, the bell icon should switch from orange dot to white Infinite scroll should stop fetching more notes when it gets to the end (receives zero notes back from the api). Infinite scrolling is disabled on purpose . We've decided to synch the latest 200 notes only (Same of Simperium). Infinite scroll needs an indicator at the bottom. #4743 If a notification is received while looking at the notifications list, it'd be great to have a floating "New notes" button appear, and when you tap on it you're taken all the way up without having to scroll. Check edge cases that might be missing starting off from that branch. #4761 Implement a PingHub WebSocket client, to receive updates, regardless of the Push Notifications setting. [Future -Not required for this first version]. Master branch https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/tree/remove/simperium-master Related iOS issue here: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6086 cc @dmsnell @jleandroperez @kwonye @daniloercoli 🎉 1
Manager.title: Remove Simperium Master

Manager.description: This class is not used anymore, except for a constant being used elsewhere.
Manager.title: Remove class WPRestClient

Manager.description: Expected behavior All files get uploaded. Actual behavior The uploading starts and then grinds to a halt at various levels of progress. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create New Post Insert multiple large photos or videos via Add Media > Select using multi-picker Pictures begin to upload to post Some are successful (varies how many) while others get “stuck” with a non-moving progress bar Tested on OnePlus One, Android 6.0.1, WP alpha-24 Original report: https://mobilerequests.wordpress.com/2016/07/01/android-trouble-uploading-multiple-images
Manager.title: Editor: Uploading multiple images/videos does not finish

Manager.description: Android has a ton of stuff we can do with notifications that we're not doing yet. Let's figure out what those are and what we'd like to do! Ideas: Allow users to reply to notifications within the notification itself Right now all quick actions open the app. Let's do it more like Gmail where it doesn't open the app. We can create custom views now in notifications. Example here (look at the Screenshot captured notification) We can look into how the notifications tab overall looks (the list, details, etc). Also, here are web notifications so that we can keep them consistent https://cloudup.com/cmHKG-EptZE cc @daniloercoli and @mzorz 👍 1 🎉 1
Manager.title: Notifications Refresh Design
Capital letters in account email causing Gravatar validation error

Manager.description: Expected behavior The notification title to be something like "Linked to your post". Actual behavior Notification title is "New comment". See screenshot: Steps to reproduce the behavior Copy the public link to a post from a site you own and paste it to another post of yours. Update the post to save the change. Notification should arrive to your mobile Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung Galaxy S4, Android v5.0.1
Manager.title: Notification title says "New comment" but PN is for linked post

At this point I can't seem to do anything to get it to change. Android: Web: Steps to reproduce the behavior View a post in the Reader from a user with no gravatar or site icon Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1 (beta), alpha-25

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Using WPAndroid 6.1-rc-1, open a post with legacy sharing links in the feed, such as https://wordpress.com/read/feeds/5649174/posts/1202645527 Scroll to the bottom of the post Click on any of the sharing links Result: legacy sharing links like this look unprofessional and do not work if you tap on them. Those images should not ever appear in the Reader. Clicking the share icon and then "Copy to clipboard" resulted in this text: Being organized about computer security - http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/unclutterer/~3/0cQBz0bpX9A/ The same images do not appear when viewing the same post in the Reader on the web. Seen at https://wordpress.com/read/feeds/5649174/posts/1202645527 using Safari 10.0 on Mac OS X 10.11.6
Manager.title: Reader: legacy sharing links open an image when clicked

Manager.description: After closing and reopening a local draft, images appear as html and I expecting that they would still appear as images. Steps to reproduce: Start a new post using WPAndroid 6.1-rc-1 Add a title Add an image to the body of the post Tap back until you see the list of posts Notice the new post is labeled "Local draft" Tap on the new post that was just created Result: The image appears as html, but I expected it to show up as an image. New post screen on WPAndroid 6.1-rc-1 on a Samsung Galaxy Tab4 (SM-T330NU) Android 5.1.1
Manager.title: Posting: images appear as html in local drafts

Manager.description: Expected behavior The notifications list should show the same icon and noticon as WordPress.com (in this case, a Jetpack icon and an "i" noticon.) See top notification as it looks on WordPress.com: Actual behavior On the Android app, the notification shows default grey icons for the notification (see top notification in screen shot.) Steps to reproduce the behavior View a notification with icon https://s.wp.com/wp-content/mu-plugins/jetpack/i/logotype-jetpack.svg and noticon "info". Tested on [device], Android [version] Device: Droid Turbo Android: 5.1 App: alpha-25

Manager.description: Expected behavior When receiving a comment notification, 2 actions are typically shown: Reply Like (or) Approve Actual behavior Only Reply is being shown. Steps to reproduce the behavior Have someone comment on a post of yours, and wait for hte notification appear on your handset and wearable. The notification on the handset should have REPLY and LIKE / APPROVE (these latter depend on your blog settings for comments). The notif on the wearable has only REPLY and the default wearable actions (block app). Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1] cc @hoverduck
Manager.title: Notifications: wearable doesn't show Like/Approve (only Reply)

Manager.description: Expected behavior After commenting on a post from Notifications, then opening up a new comment, the comment reply field should be empty. Actual behavior The previous comment I made persists in all comment fields, even other posts or blogs. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open Android app Click Notifications menu item Click on a comment on on of your posts Type a reply and click SEND action Comment is added Now, navigate to another comment, and see your reply text from step 4 is pre-filled in the form — instead of an empty form field Screenshots #### Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, Android version 7.0, WordPress Android app version alpha-25 Reference: https://make.wordpress.org/mobile/2016/10/27/call-for-testing-wordpress-for-android-6-1/
Manager.title: Notifications: comment reply text persists to new comments (field should be empty)

Manager.description: Right now the mobile web has up/down arrows to go the the next/previous notification without having to go back to the notifications list. We're going to be adding that to the mobile apps. (note that Apple Mail has something similar)
Manager.title: Notifications: horizontal notification detail navigation (swipe)

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a 2fa notification is received, quick actions APPROVE and IGNORE are offered. If your screen is locked, APPROVE should tell you you can't approve while the screen is locked. Actual behavior When you tap APPROVE, the approval is sent to wp.com even if the screen is locked. Steps to reproduce the behavior enable 2FA on your website log in to your app, then lock your phone's screen once logged in log in to your website on a desktop browser the 2FA auth push is received, with quick actions available and actionable. Tap "Approve" to log in to your site you get to log in even when the device screen is locked. Tested on Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Notifications: 2fa should only act on "Approve" if device screen is unlocked

Manager.description: Receive a PN on the device. Tap on it and open the app. The app takes you to the notification details screen. When you tap back, the app takes you on the notifications list, that contains for a very short period (a sec or two) one notification only. The one you've just seen. After a while the whole notifications list is updated with note. [Remove Simperium]
Manager.title: Notifications List is empty for a short period after opening the app from PN

Manager.description: Expected behavior Denies access to other author's media gallerys. Prohibits use of other's media Actual behavior Permits access to and use of media in other author's media libaries even though permission has been restricted for the internet site at www.___.com Steps to reproduce the behavior None, no error message. Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung Galaxy Note II, Android 4.4.2. Detailed description I've setup a self-hosted multi-author website that would deny authors to view or use other author's media (photos, video, sounds). This is done via the plugin WPFront User Role Pro, because WP 4.6.1 appears not to have a similar limitation for the author roles. Using the WP App in my smart phone, I find that the restrictions are circumvented and the authors can use any media of other author's libraries. I only know this of the Android-Version so far. Is there a way to prevent the Wordpress APPs (regardless of OS or version) from accessing the site at all? Thanks for the help
Manager.title: Denying access to self-hosted WP-Site.

Manager.description: Expected behavior Pressing backspace on hardware keyboard only removes one character in Reader Comment text field. Actual behavior Pressing backspace on hardware keyboard removes two characters in Reader Comment text field. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to reader. Tap on the comments counter in any post. At the bottom of the screen tap on "Reply to post.." Input some text. Pres backspace. Confirm that the two characters are removed instead of one.
Manager.title: Pressing backspace on hardware keyboard removes two characters at Reader Comment text field

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect the same blavatar to appear on the post card (top left) in the Reader posts list and on the single post view. Actual behavior I see a blavatar and author avatar on the single post view, but no blavatar on the same post in the post list. Looking through my Followed Sites list in the Reader, it looks like most blavatars are not showing there. (I do see them for an RSS feed I follow and en.blog.wordpress.com.) cc @nbradbury Screenshots Reader post list: Single post view: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-26
Manager.title: Reader: Blavatars missing from posts in Reader posts list

Manager.title: Change logo to WordPress.com when logging in to WordPress.com

Manager.description: If a notification is received while looking at the notifications list, it'd be great to have a floating "New notes" button appear, and when you tap on it you're taken all the way up without having to scroll.

Manager.description: Quick Actions are not shown on the lock screen. (Ref: #4736). When you unlock the device notifications are recreated and action buttons added. Instead I checked the GMail app and it seems to have quick actions even on the lock screen. If one of those quick action buttons are clicked the device shows the numeric keyboard to unlock it....
Manager.title: Show quick actions when the device is locked

Manager.description: Retrieving and parsing the latest reader posts (when the user does a PTR, for example) takes longer than it should, especially on slower connections. Investigate whether we can use the fields parameter when requesting posts to exclude the content field (and any fields we don't currently use) as a way to speed things up. We would then request the content field the first time the user views the post detail (or perhaps separately in the background after the stream has been populated). cc: @aerych 👍 1
Manager.title: Reader: investigate skipping content when populating stream
Add support for some additional helpshift events.

Manager.description: After considering our specific cases in a separate way and comparing to what other well-known apps do, wrapping up quick actions behavior as per the following: always show the quick actions on all Notifications. This would put us on par with the other apps considered (Gmail, FB, Twitter). only hide/show quick actions on notifications if the user has WordPress PIN lock enabled (that means, they really want extra security, so it makes sense to conceal actions and such for this kind of users). for the very specific case of 2FA, tapping on YES would open the activity like Facebook does, thus ensuring the user unlocked the screen. OR we could just not have any quick actions at all, making tapping the notification body itself the only option (which is how it's been done ever since the feature was introduced)
Manager.title: Notifications: quick actions wrap up

Manager.description: If the device language is set to a non-English language, the FAQ just says something like "No questions found". We should either translate our FAQ and upload it to Helpshift OR at least show the English version. /cc @rachelmcr
Manager.title: FAQ is empty for non-English languages

Manager.description: Implement Pinghub WebSocket client, to receive updates, regardless of the Push Notifications setting. Details: Maybe create Automattic/pinghub-android repository. Keep synching notifications right after launch / login, and introduce updates driven by Pinghub. Make PingHub working fine together with Push Notification payload. Verify: Verify that Notification Actions (Edit Comment / Reply) result in a Pinghub update message Verify that marking a Note as Read (in another device) results in a Pinghub update message Verify that destructive actions result in "notification deleted" notification
Manager.title: Notifications + Pinghub

Manager.description:
Expected behavior When you enter an invalid username/password 3 times, the screen shown should provide a direct help/hint for your problem. From checking the Helpshift queue it became apparent that most of the issues were resolved when users followed the actions suggested in this text: If you’d like to sign into your self-hosted WordPress site using the app, please tap on the ‘Add Self-Hosted Site’ link at the bottom of the login screen.
This will add another field to the form where you will enter your Site URL.
So we'd like to add this text directly in that screen, so users can help themselves get in the app. Actual behavior Right now when you enter an invalid username/password 3 times, a screen is presented and 2 main options are shown: a) Lost your password? b) Contact us When you tap on Contact Us, you get a Helpshift message: If you’d like to sign into your self-hosted WordPress site using the app, please tap on the ‘Add Self-Hosted Site’ link at the bottom of the login screen.
This will add another field to the form where you will enter your Site URL.
So users have to basically try logging in and then they have to tap on "Contact us" before getting any further help. Steps to reproduce the behavior a) try an invalid username/password combination 3 times b) check the results Tested on Nexus 5, Android [6.0.1] ❤️ 2
Manager.title: Sign in: add message from helpshift in the "login failed" screen

Manager.description: Expected behavior When you log in to the app with your jetpack-connected, self hosted site credentials and URL, you should also get all the functionality from wp.com. In order for that to happen, once you're logged in using your self-hosted site credentials, you should be hinted/requested your wp.com credentials if we can verify your site is a Jetpack-connected site. Actual behavior When you log in to the app with your jetpack-connected, self hosted site credentials and URL, the app only logs you in and shows the Profile screen. It also shows the rest of the functionality such as the Reader and main screen, but you can't go much further without login in to WordPress.com. We're landing on the Profile screen, which shows a "Log in to wordpress.com" option, but that's pretty much it. Steps to reproduce the behavior App start, sign in screen is shown Enter username, password, url for your Jetpack connected self-hosted site Tap Sign In button The Profile screen is shown Tested on Nexus 5, Android [6.0.1]
Manager.title: Sign in: jetpack-connected sites are not fully logged in to the app

Manager.description: Expected behavior Show a better error message in the full screen dialog, something like: You host is blocking POST requests, the app needs that to communicate to your site. Contact your host, blablabla. Also, we must add a button the the FAQ page. Actual behavior Full screen dialog with a generic message. Steps to reproduce the behavior Try to sign in our test instance here: http://do.wpmt.co/405
Manager.title: Improve error when we detect the host is blocking POST requests on a self hosted site

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open a new post Kill the app from the overview screen Open the app back up and navigate to the Blog Posts page Observe the (Untitled) local draft Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1 (seen above in 4.4.2 emulator)
Manager.title: Killing app while editor is open leaves an (Untitled) draft

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the editor for a new post, setting the title and body Open post settings and set a featured image. Back out of the editor Navigate to the Blog Posts list and edit the post Open post settings and confirm the featured image is still set Publish the post Note that your post no longer has a featured image Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1 (shown above on an Android 4.4 emulator)
Manager.title: Leaving the editor removes Featured Image from post

Manager.description: In feature/fluxc-integration, when the xmlrpc endpoints return a 403 ( on listMethods), we show a HTTP Auth dialog to the user when we should show a "Access to your XMLRPC endpoint is forbidden, you should check your http server config or contact your host". We should also redirect the user to the right FAQ page on that screen.
Manager.title: HTTP Auth dialog is shown when we should show a specific error message.

Manager.description: To make way for the up/down arrows in the nav bar, we'll be moving the edit button as shown in this mockup: iOS: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6140
Manager.title: Notification edit button moved to below comment

Manager.description: When user fails to enter valid credentials more than once for a given username we should kick off a IS_AVAILABLE_USERNAME action (from AccountStore) and conditionally show the URL field if the username isn't recognized.
Manager.title: Sign in: Auto-check username after incorrect username/password error to suggest URL field

Manager.description: Expected behavior The shadow around the Gravatar in the Me screen should be OK. Actual behavior The shadow is clipped at the bottom. Here's a screenshot: Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android 7.0
Manager.title: Gravatar botton shadow is clipped

Manager.description: This is the master issue for the reader stream (card/list view) refresh, which will update the reader stream to match the Calypso web reader. The refresh will be split into several PRs: Post card refresh (#4777) Photo card (#4808) Gallery card (#4811) XPost card refresh (#4804) Video card (#4820) Add sharing to post card (will come later) Below are the rules used for the Calypso reader cards: If the post has 0 images: Text card. If the post has 1 or more images and less than 100 characters: Photo card (using featured image or first image). If the post has 1-3 images and over 100 characters: Default card (using featured image or first image). If the post has 4 or more images and over 100 characters: Gallery card (using first 4 images). If the post has a video as featured image or a video as first usable media: Video card. For the text excerpts, we use the excerpt attached to the post. If no excerpt, we use the first X words (whatever we’re doing now). Links, paragraph tags, and break tags should be removed from the excerpt. Bold and italics can stay, so long as the tag gets closed and it doesn’t include all of the text in the excerpt. Default Card The Default card is the most common. It shows some text and one image. The image is the featured image (if the user set one, and it’s not busted). If the user has not set a featured image, it’s the first usable (over 350px) image in the post. The text should be about three lines. This is also the card format used if the post has three or fewer images. If it has four, it uses the Gallery format below. Text Card The Text card is used when the post contains no usable images. It should also be limited to about three lines. Because there’s no image, the total amount of text is greater. Photo Card The Photo card is used when the post contains one or more images (if more than one, use the first image) and under 100 characters of text. Note that the photo card displays the post title on a single line on top of the image (in SF UI Text Medium 14px – sans serif is easier to read on a busy background). The post title should never wrap! The image also has a fade applied to the lower quarter so the title can be read easily. (Note: a fade on the lower quarter – not the whole image darkened.) Gallery Card The Gallery card is used when the post contains text and 4 or more images (excluding the featured image – the featured image is ignored for the Gallery card to avoid duplications if the author used the image in the post as well). The card gets a row of four images above the headline. These images should be the first four usable (over 350px) images in the post. Each image gets 25% of the width. 1px of whitespace in between each image. Mobile Web Screenshot
Manager.title: Reader stream refresh

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Add an image to a post Edit the image Set the width to anything greater than 2000px and save Expected behavior To either be able to set the width to an arbitrary value, or be warned that >2000px is not allowed Actual behavior The field is silently set back to 2000px with no errors or indications of a problem Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, wp alpha-27
Manager.title: Editor: Setting media width >2000px silently fails

Manager.description: Likes/approve/inline reply is executed twice.
Manager.title: Notifications: double processing of quick actions

Manager.description: Expected behavior The note should be marked as read. Actual behavior The comment/note you liked, or replied to, is not marked as read. Tested on Android 7.X
Manager.title: Notifications - Quick actions: Reply To a note, or Like a note, straight from the notifications center don't mark the note as read

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that if I enter an email address linked to a WordPress.com account in the login form, I will proceed through the magic link login flow. Actual behavior Some email addresses are not recognized as being linked to a WordPress.com account, so after entering the email address I am taken to the self-hosted login form. Tapping "Log in to WordPress.com" takes me back to the previous login form (username/email only), but I still can't force a WordPress.com login — when I try to go to the next screen I am taken again to the self-hosted login form. I noticed that this seemed to consistently happen with Gmail addresses using + addressing, e.g. example+wordpress@gmail.com. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app (logged out) on the WordPress.com login screen Enter a Gmail address with + addressing linked to a WordPress.com account Tap the "Next" button Result: The form takes you to the self-hosted login form, even though the email is linked to a WordPress.com account. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28
Manager.title: Magic Link: Some emails linked to WordPress.com accounts aren't recognized

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect the screens in the magic link login flow to be center-aligned. Actual behavior The "Check your email" screen is not centered — it's slightly off-center to the left. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app (logged out) on the login screen Enter an email address linked to a WordPress.com account and tap Next Tap "Send link" (to send the magic link) Result: You end up on a "Check your email" screen where the text and button are off-center. Screenshots Correctly centered: Off-center: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28
Manager.title: Magic Link: "Check your email" screen not center-aligned

Manager.description: Expected behavior I enter the app via a comments link on a wpcom notification e-mail. The comments section opens up. The arrow button on the top left or tapping on the title brings me to the post. Actual behavior The post title is not clickable and the arrow button takes me back to the e-mail app. Steps to reproduce the behavior see above Tested on [device], Android [version] 6.2 alpha-28 👍 1
Manager.title: Unable to view wpcom post when loading a comments link

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I open a link to comment a post, e.g. from a WordPress.com subscription email, I expect the comment view for that post to open in the Reader with the focus on the reply box. The URL format for this link is this: https://*.wordpress.com/{year}/{month}/{day]/{post-slug}/#respond Actual behavior The comment view for that post opens in the Reader, but the focus isn't on the reply box. I have to tap on the reply box to start commenting. Steps to reproduce the behavior Subscribe to a WordPress.com site (with a *.wordpress.com URL) Open an email subscription notification in your email app on your device At the bottom of the email, tap the "Comment" button If prompted, select to open the link in the WordPress Reader Result: The comments view for that post opens in the Reader, but the focus is not on the reply box. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28
Manager.title: Opening a link to comment on a post (/#respond) does not put focus on the reply box

Manager.description: As mentioned here, the Android app shows the Follow button in every stream but the Calypso reader doesn't. It should be removed from Followed Sites and a8c streams.
Manager.title: Reader: hide follow button to match Calypso reader

Manager.description: The reader currently uses 12dp dividers between cards in the stream (via reader_card_gutters). These should be replaced with a 1dp divider.
Manager.title: Reader: use single line dividers in stream

Manager.description: In Calypso web, if you have 15 or more sites, there is a "recent sites" group that appears at the top of the site picker (see Automattic/wp-calypso#2742) to keep you from having to scroll every time to find recently used sites. This shows your most recently used sites at the top of your site list, with other sites shown alphabetically beneath it: We could do the same in the app, showing the three most recently used sites at the top of the site list. Currently, we show the primary site at the top of the list with other sites listed alphabetically beneath that: h/t Ryan for raising this issue. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28 Related iOS issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6217
Manager.title: Site Picker: Sort recently used sites to the top of the site list

Manager.description: We are transitioning to "Write" as the verb for the new post button in the tab bar. Update the accessibility label accordingly. No plans yet to visually change the UI based upon this label on larger screens as of yet. Related iOS issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6222
Manager.title: Change New Post button accessibility label to Write

Manager.description: Expected behavior When you tap like on a comment, the comment is liked and when you return to the notifications list and come back in, the liked status should be reflected. Actual behavior The liked status is missed sometimes. Steps to reproduce the behavior go to notifications tab choose a comment tap on it like the comment go back to the list tap on the same comment see the 'like' option is greyed, as if it hasn't been liked. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

Manager.title: Push notification sound is played twice

Manager.description: The app doesn't have push notifications sound enabled by default; same for the notification led. Since it's quite common to have it enabled by default, we should turn them both on. Users can disable them in Notifications Settings.
Manager.title: Enable default push notification sound and blink light

Manager.description: Overview Currently podcasts posts can be played within the Reader and they still play with the app in the background but are immediately stopped when you go back from the Reader’s post detail screen. It’d be great to be able to find podcasts / embedded playable media and start that off and keep listening to it while you still browse the app or use your phone for whatever other thing, in the background. This issue is about making any playable content in WP sites (podcasts, audio in general, etc.) available through Lock Screen Notifications, enabling users to “read (listen) on the go”. I would also not only implement play controls (back, forward, pause/play, etc) but also Like and Comment on this very screen, to launch the comment editor on that post right away so you can capture your idea as it comes fresh out of your head as you listen to something interesting. Some well known media players have this in place: Discovery flow for podcasts: I found it difficult to find podcasts - a search for the keyword “podcasts” returns all kind of posts that have such keyword in it, but not necessarily audio or podcasts themselves. So it’s relevant that we first think about how to make podcasts easily discovered so users easily find something to listen to in the first place. investigate how to detect a site is podcast-enabled (has a podcast category), and discoverability (how to make up a list of podcasts to play? maybe come up with a wp.com search url that brings this kind of result?) search for blogs that have podcast category set up? Make a result list for this once the user selects a podcast-category-enabled site, build the podcast feed URL out of the site hostname plus podcast category name. Then make a list to browse all available audio files in that feed. Pick one and start playing. Discoverability in Reader: investigate best way to show a post can be "played" (a quick button to start playing) in the Reader list cards if a given post has playable content embedded within (not particularly podcasts, but including these). Player: investigate WPcom API to get the audio stream / audio file implement lock screen design implement player and player controls implement Like and Comment actions (also check cases like self-hosted, jetpack sites, etc.) Other: investigate access to media and podcast category feed on jetpack sites and self-hosted sites.
Manager.title: Notifications: lock screen player - Master Issue

Manager.description: When an audio file is embedded in a post, you can only play it while you've got the post opened in the Reader. The audio stops as soon as you leave that screen. We're going to implement the ability to play audio content in the background with a lock screen notification, allowing you to still keep browsing the app / move on to other apps without stopping the audio stream. investigate WPcom API and reader post content to get the audio stream / audio file implement lock screen design implement player and player controls implement Like and Comment actions (also check cases like self-hosted, jetpack sites, etc.) implement sharing functionality if possible (maybe open another issue for this)
Manager.title: Notifications (audio): lock screen notification base implementation

Manager.description: The ViewPager swipe indicator added in #4837 is inconsistent with Discover. It appears if the user taps the first post in the Discover stream but not otherwise.
Manager.title: ViewPager swipe indicator inconsistent with reader Discover

Manager.description: It would be useful to have timestamps on the log entries the user can share to us via the "Application log" help screen entry or Helpshift. With timestamps, it would be easier to debug cases and correlate them with known downtimes of services, etc.
Manager.title: Add timestamp to log entries

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Set a PIN lock on the WP app Click a link to a post, and select "Open with WordPress.com Reader" if prompted Input PIN Expected behavior The post opens in Reader What actually happens The post appears extremely briefly before the PIN lock screen opens. After inputting the PIN we're then left on whatever screen was last open in the app. Note that this works fine if you open the link first in an app's internal browser, then click "Open in Chrome" before being redirected to the Reader. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-28
Manager.title: PIN Lock breaks "Open with Reader" flow

Manager.description: Expected behavior The WPAndroid app should be available / eligible for Samsung multiwindow support (please to not be confused with Android 7 native multiwindow support). Actual behavior The application is not listed as eligible anymore, as reported on some Samsung devices. Steps to reproduce the behavior WP is no longer available as an app that you can access in the split screen menu when using other apps Tested on Samsung Note 5, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Samsung Multiwindow support not working

Manager.description: Use the new /v1.2/read/tag/:tag/images endpoint to add a header image to tag streams. See this Calypso PR for details, and also this one.

Manager.description: Update to the latest release of the Passcode Lock library (i.e. v1.5.1). Bug Fixes Fix PIN input screen bypass

Manager.description: Expected behavior When the loading operation in the Posts list for a given site is in progress, some indicator should be shown. Actual behavior Sometimes it takes a bit to load, but no progress is shown. This specially happens when I load a self hosted site first time (after having added it to my site list). Steps to reproduce the behavior add a self hosted site to WPAndroid go to BLog posts options Wait for it to load, and observe there is no progress indicator that the app is doing anything Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

Manager.description: Expected behavior When the loading operation in the site chooser list is in progress, some indicator should be shown. Actual behavior Sometimes it takes a bit to load, but no progress is shown. Steps to reproduce the behavior be an admin for lots of sites, like me :) got to switch site for first time Wait for it to load, and observe there is no progress indicator that the app is doing anything Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

Manager.description: When you have a lot of sites, the notification settings screen in the WordPress Android app gets very, very long as the sites are listed before the “Other” and “Sights and Sounds” sections. It might be better for folks with lots of sites if the more general settings were first, and the site-specific afterwards to make getting to the general settings easier. EDIT: following iOS implementation here as per @rachelmcr 's comment here #4866 (comment)
Manager.title: Notification Settings: make the site list show the first 3 sites to give room for other settings

Manager.description: Expected Reader crossposts remain in the order which they are originally displayed. Observed Reader crossposts are replaced when returning to their original position quickly. It might due to a logic error in the RecyclerView.ViewHolder view assignments. Reproduced Go to Reader tab. Select site with multiple crossposts. Scroll down past multiple crossposts. Fling back up to first few crossposts. Notice the original crossposts have changed. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1 with WordPress 6.1
Manager.title: Reader Crossposts Recycled Out of Order

Manager.description: Since the latest merge with develop, sign in errors on self hosted sites re-open the .com sign in screen.
Manager.title: FluxC: since develop merge, sign in errors on self hosted site seems broken

Manager.description: Expected behavior Plans Item should not be in the left menu if the logged user is an author or a contributor. Check what we should do for editors. I guess only the admin should have access to Plans menu item. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add yourself to a .com/Jepack blog with a user level of Author. Start the app, change site, and check the Plans menu item. It is there.
Manager.title: Remove the Plans menu item if the user is not an Admin of the site

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to view a blog post (published or draft) by tapping the "View" link in the post list. Actual behavior This behavior does not work as expected if a site uses plain permalinks (e.g. ?p=123) instead of another permalink structure. (All other permalink structures I tried worked as expected.) When I tap "View" for a draft post, the live site preview loads expected. However, when I tap "View" for a published post, I get a blank screen and the error "Links are disabled on the preview screen: Steps to reproduce the behavior On a self-hosted WordPress site, go to Settings > Permalinks in the WP Admin dashboard. Select "Plain" for the permalink structure. In the WordPress app, add that site (or select it from the site picker if it already exists). Open the Blog Posts and make sure the list of posts is synced. Find or create a draft post and select "View" — result: you can preview the post as expected. Find or create a published post and select "View" — result: you get a blank screen with the error noted above. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-30
Manager.title: Live site view breaks for published posts when site uses plain permalinks

Manager.description: Currently, the notification tab is empty after a log in.
Manager.title: FluxC branch: just after .com user logs in, we should pull recent notifications

Manager.description: Expected A quote containing an ordered list is shown as it is in a browser (i.e. as a quote with an ordered list). Observed A bullet list with a quote is shown when viewing a comment with a quote containing an ordered list in the app. The comment contents are shown below.
Manager.title: Quote with Ordered List in Comment Displays as Bullet List

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to use an account without a Gravatar if I choose not to upload one. Actual behavior Using an account with no Gravatar, every time I launch the app (after closing it, not just putting it in the background) I get the error message "Error reloading your Gravatar." After uploading a Gravatar, the Gravatar appears on the Me screen and the error stops appearing. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new account in the app, or log in to an account with no Gravatar On the Me screen, the error "Error reloading your Gravatar" appears Swipe the app closed Relaunch the app, and the error reappears Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-30 Reported in 147872-h
Manager.title: Me: Gravatar error when account has no Gravatar image set

Manager.description: Report: "As of the last day or so, I’ve noticed the timestamp in the “pull down” resets whenever I unlock my device. It says now upon unlock and counts up until the device locks again, then starts over. I’m on a Google Pixel, latest software. WordPress 6.3-rc-1." I can reproduce this consistently. Note the "1m" timestamp in this notification: When I return to the lock screen, that same notification has a "now" timestamp. And the "now" timestamp persists after unlocking.
Manager.title: Notification timestamp resets after device is locked

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Set a PIN lock in the WP app Click a link to the comments of a post (i.e https://gh908testing9.wordpress.com/2016/11/28/new-post-without-pin/#comments) Select "Open with WordPress Reader" if prompted Expected behavior To be prompted for my PIN before being able to view the comments Actual behavior The PIN lock screen appears briefly, but is then overlaid by the comments screen. Related: #4847 Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30
Manager.title: 'Open in Reader' bypasses PIN lock for links to comments

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Spawn a WP.com notification, such as by leaving a comment on your site as another user Open the Android notification, which should launch the app to the WP notification Try to swipe to older notifications Expected behavior To have the same swiping behavior as when opening the notification from inside the app Actual behavior Nothing happens. Backing out of the notification and re-opening it restores the swiping ability Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30
Manager.title: Notifications: Unable to swipe between in-app notifs after opening from system notification

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Spawn a WP.com notification, such as by leaving a comment on your site as another user Open the Android notification, which should launch the app to the WP notification Back out to the notifications list Expected behavior To have the notification marked as read Actual behavior The notification still appears unread. It's a display issue only, looking at the notification on another device it appears read (or if you refresh the in-app notifications list) Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30 👍 1
Manager.title: Notifications: Opening WP notif from Android system notification doesn't appear as Read

Manager.description: Expected behavior Always handle quick actions show/hide when WPPin enabled (they should not be shown on the lock screen, and be shown again when the device is unlocked) Actual behavior When debugger is detached (wondering if this might happen in other, real world situations), notifications are not being re-built anymore, so setting a WPPin and locking/unlocking the device doesn't make any difference - notifications remain with or without quick actions, depending on the state things were when the debugger was detached. Things start working again when a new notification is received (thus triggering the initialization of a new NotificationHelper) Steps to reproduce the behavior I think this only happens to me... But managed to reproduce by setting up a debugging session then unplugging the USB cable when on a breakpoint. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]
Manager.title: Notifications are not rebuilt anymore when debugger is detached

Manager.description: Expected behavior When setting WPPin enabled, locking/unlocking the device re-builds notifications to hide/show quick actions. The avatar and icon for the notification should remain unchanged. Actual behavior When setting WPPin enabled, locking/unlocking the device re-builds notifications to hide/show quick actions. In this, the avatar is sometimes lost and replaced by the W logo placeholder. Steps to reproduce the behavior Having WPPin enabled, receive a notification from a user that has an avatar configured. Observe the avatar is shown in the notification in the system's dashboard lock the screen and unlock observe the avatar is not shown in the notification anymore Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]
Manager.title: Notifications: avatar is not shown when notification is rebuilt
