Manager.description: This is a master ticket for the group of Sign-in related events we'd like to add Tracks for. Additional events will be added to this list as we investigate the sign-in flows. Events to add Default/Main Sign in screen displayed Create account initiated Email already used (error) when creating a new account/user Username already exists (error) when creating a new account/user Failed to create a new account
Manager.title: New Sign-in related Tracks events

Manager.description: Navigate to Me -> Notification Settings, then choose a site. Notice that there's no margin between the top of the display and the first menu item ("Notifications tab"). It makes me feel like I'm scrolled part-way down already, and I keep wanting to scroll up to see what I'm missing. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30
Manager.title: Poor formatting on site Notification Settings pages

Manager.description: Expected behavior Pasting a Youtube link into the editor I expect the post to include an expanded YouTube video, like it does on the web, but it’s just the text of the link. Actual behavior The post does contain a simple link. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post in the Android app. Pick any title you like. Paste a youtube link into the body of the post (https://youtu.be/RbXchpAZR8c) Hit publish Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-30
Manager.title: YouTube embeds are not expanding

Manager.description: We need add to our Helpshift implementation the tag to identify signup errors. At the moment signup errors and issues are not tagged in HS, instead login errors and issues are marked with the tag origin:login-screen-error and origin:login-screen-help.
Manager.title: Identify failed signups in Helpshift

Manager.description: Track how many login issues in Helpshift come from WordPress.com attempts versus self-hosted login attempts vs Jetpack attempts. At the moment the tag origin:login-screen-error is used for both of them, instead we could use different tags such origin:wpcom-login-screen-error and origin:wporg-login-screen-error. Also, a tag like origin:jetpack-login-screen-error would be useful when users are on the WordPress.com login screen for Jetpack sites (on the stats and notifications screens), to further differentiate that from other login errors. Related old ticket #4069
Manager.title: Better tracking of login issues in Helpshift

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a post with no title is collected by the pending drafts feature (#4399), we should show You drafted “(Untitled)” but never published it. Actual behavior Steps to reproduce the behavior Draft a local untitled post on Android, then wait for 3 days (or change the corresponding static values for this in NotificationsPendingDraftsService.java), you'll see this notification come up. Tested on [device], Android [version]
Manager.title: Notifications: pending drafts with no title show weird message

Manager.description: This is an edge case and only happens once as you give the app permissions, but: Expected behavior When you install the app for the first time and start using features that require permissions from the system, since Android 6.0 system dialogs are presented to interact with the user so they can allow access to the required system features (for example, attempting to include some media while editing a post). Once the user allows this, the flow should continue in the app seamlessly, regardless of the user having PIN lock enabled or not. Actual behavior When PIN lock is enabled, and you have not allowed permissions for the first time to access media and record audio/video, tapping the “add image” icon in a draft post being edited asks for the permissions and then presents the PIN lock screen (which looks awkward) Steps to reproduce the behavior install the app for first time log in to it enable PIN lock start a new draft post tap on the include image icon give the app the necessary permissions by accepting the system dialogs that appear there the PIN lock screen is shown. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]
Manager.title: Pin lock screen appears after requesting Android M permissions

Manager.description: We only want it to be true when the user actually logs in with magic links
Manager.title: All sign in events are being tracked as magic link logins

Manager.description: I'm sometimes unable to switch sites using the site picker in the fluxc-integration branch. There is no error, but I'm returned to the site fragment with the same site active as before. The only way to change sites is to remove the current site (or sign out of WP.com). I've so far only been able to reproduce this on an emulator (API 23). This will happen every time I use the site picker until the app is reinstalled (and most recently, the issue persists even after multiple clean installs). After some testing, I'm seeing that getSiteFragment() is returning null here, so the result of the SitePickerActivity seems to be discarded, and that's the reason the site doesn't changed.
Manager.title: FluxC integration: Site picker sometimes doesn't work

Manager.description: Expected behavior Notes shouldn't be duplicate. Actual behavior When liking and unliking shows 2 equal Notes on the Notifications tab. Steps to reproduce the behavior I can repro by liking a post on the web, viewing the note on Android, then unliking and liking the same post again. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]
Manager.title: Notifications: duplicate Like note

Manager.description: Expected behavior Consider expanding the region to trigger the like a comment I expect to tap the star or the number beside the star to like a comment. I believe this behavior exists for liking a post Actual behavior You can only tap the star (not the number beside the star) to like a comment Steps to reproduce the behavior View the comments in a post Like a comment Tested on [device], Android [version] Google Pixel, Android 7.1, WordPress Android alpha-30
Manager.title: Like comment "tap region" is small

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect the language setting under Me > App Settings > Interface Language to persist until I change the setting (or perhaps until I log out). Actual behavior When the app goes to the background, the language setting persists. However, if I swipe to close the app completely, when I reopen the app the interface language is reset to my device language. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Me > App Settings > Interface Language Select a language other than your device language Tap OK Completely close the app Reopen the app Result: The interface language is now your device language, instead of the language you selected as the app's interface language. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-30 Reported in 150629-h on Samsung Galaxy A7, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid 6.2
Manager.title: App Settings: Interface Language setting does not persist after closing app completely

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect all the visible UI elements in the customizer to work as they do in a web browser. Actual behavior I can't upload images using the customizer's "Select Files" button. Two places this appears: Site Logo > Select logo > Upload Files Header image > Add new image > Upload Files The button doesn't do anything when I tap on it, so I have to exit the customizer, upload the image to the Media section, and then re-open the customizer to use it. If the button won't work within the app, it'd be best if we could hide that Upload Files tab to avoid creating the expectation that files can be uploaded there. Steps to reproduce the behavior In the app, open a site's Themes section Tap "Customize" to open the site's customizer Open the Site Logo section Tap the "Select logo" button Go to the Upload Files tab Tap the "Select Files" button to try to upload a file Result: Nothing happens, so you can't upload a file there. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-31 Originally reported in an app review.
Manager.title: Customizer: "Select Files" button doesn't work

Manager.description: Fatal Exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'int org.wordpress.android.models.Blog.getLocalTableBlogId()' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.services.NotificationsPendingDraftsService$1.run(NotificationsPendingDraftsService.java:97) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818)
Manager.title: Crash report 6.4-rc-1: NPE in NotificationsPendingDraftsService

Manager.description: Expected behavior Pending drafts notifications should be triggered if you have drafts sitting there for more than 3 days. (read #4835 for a detailed spec) Actual behavior Pending drafts notifications not ever triggered if first time you launch the app you have no drafts in your blog posts list. Steps to reproduce the behavior open blog post list make sure you delete all the drafts you have if any force stop the app launch the app again and go to blog posts write a draft change the device date to something beyond 3 days in the future get back to the app it should show the pending drafts notification, but it doesn't. Note: if you had a draft post already there, and forced stop the app then started it back again (with the date set to 3 days ahead), it would work Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1], and emulator on 7.1.1
Manager.title: Pending Draft Notifications not working when no pending drafts at launch

Manager.description: Behavior When viewing a list of published Posts, the posts' images will disappear if you perform the following: Scroll down Scroll back up Some posts now do not show images Before scrolling down: After scrolling down and then scrolling back up: Tested on [device], Android [version] Google Pixel, Android 7.1.1, WordPress Android Alpha-31
Manager.title: Post images disappear after scroll in Posts view

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to see the self-hosted login screen added in #4851 whenever I add a self-hosted site to the app. Actual behavior If I am already logged in to the app, and I add another self-hosted site, the self-hosted login screen has the WordPress.com styles on it (including "WordPress.com" below the logo): Steps to reproduce the behavior Log in to a WordPress.com account in the app, or add a self-hosted site. After logging in, go to the site picker Tap the + icon and select "Add self-hosted site" Result: The self-hosted login screen has WordPress.com styles instead of self-hosted styles. cc @hypest Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-31
Manager.title: Login: WordPress.com styles appear on logged-in "add self-hosted site" login screen

Manager.description: Expected behavior If Jetpack is installed on my site but deactivated, and I visit the Stats section for that site, I expect to see a message about installing/activating Jetpack. Actual behavior When I visit the Stats section, I see a message that Jetpack is installed but not connected to WordPress.com. When I tap "Yes" to connect Jetpack, I get the error "Sorry, you are not allowed to access this page" (because Jetpack is installed but not activated): If I activate the Jetpack plugin, it works as expected — I am taken to the Jetpack section of my site's dashboard where I can connect Jetpack to WordPress.com: Steps to reproduce the behavior On a self-hosted site, install the Jetpack plugin but do not activate it. In the app, log in to that self-hosted site. Open the Stats section. When the prompt appears, tap "Yes" to connect Jetpack to WordPress.com. Result: Error message. In your site's dashboard, activate the Jetpack plugin. Open the Stats section again. When the prompt appears, tap "Yes" again to connect Jetpack to WordPress.com. Result: You are taken to your site's dashboard to connect Jetpack. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-31
Manager.title: Jetpack: Stats prompt leads to error if Jetpack is installed but deactivated

Manager.description: Expected behavior Actual behavior Steps to reproduce the behavior Tested on [device], Android [version]
Manager.title: how to hide the title when the fragment is initialized?

Manager.description: When Smart Lock auto-fills a username/password and the user hasn't modified any textfields, if the user clicks "add a self-hosted site", we should clear out the WordPress.com username/password. Repro steps: Open the app and have Smart Lock auto-fill the username/password Tap "Add a self-hosted site" The app goes to the self-hosted login with the wp.com username/password still filled in.
Manager.title: Remove Smart Lock for self-hosted

Manager.description: I wish to built a login system for my app for my wordpress site. I have tried to understand the self hosted login system but I find it too complicated. Please can you explain it to me?
Manager.title: Understanding how self hosted login works

Manager.description: Expected behavior While writing a post, I apply bold or italic to a word. I move the cursor to the next position. Since bold(or italic) is still selected, it will be applied to the next letters too. However, when I click on bold again, it should remove the application of bold so that I can continue to write without making the words in bold. Actual behavior When I click on bold again, it selects the previous word and removes bold from it. The only way for me to keep it bold and remove the bold application for next letters is to click on space first and then click on bold again. This shouldn't be necessary if I didn't select the word that was bolded. And if I don't want my ! or , to be bolded too, I have to add space, click on bold again, add ! and then remove the space. Steps to reproduce the behavior Mark a word in the editor in bold Move the cursor past that word so that it's not selected Click on the bold icon again It's the same thing with italic. I am not sure if this is intended behavior but in my opinion, it shouldn't be. Adding it here to hear your thoughts. Cheers :) Tested on Asus Zenfone 3, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Removing bold/italic removes it from the previously applied word(s)

Manager.description: Expected behavior To be able to see the full calendar for scheduling a post regardless of screen orientation Actual behavior The calendar appears cut off in two different ways depending on where you start: A) With the device starting in portrait orientation open the post options page and select the PUBLISH option to open the calendar. Now rotate the device to landscape orientation and observe that the calendar is cutoff halfway down. B) With the device starting in landscape orientation open the post options page and select the PUBLISH option to open the calendar. Notice that the bottom row of the calendar is cutoff. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-31 (Originally reported on mi redmi 3s prime and Andorid OS is 6.0.1)
Manager.title: Schedule Post calendar formatting problems when switching screen orientation

Manager.description: Happens on 4.x devices: Fatal Exception: android.app.RemoteServiceException: Bad notification posted from package org.wordpress.android: Couldn't expand RemoteViews for: StatusBarNotification(pkg=org.wordpress.android id=60001 tag=null score=20 notn=Notification(pri=2 contentView=org.wordpress.android/0x10900a8 vibrate=null sound=null defaults=0x0 flags=0x10 kind=[null] 2 actions)) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1394) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4895) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:994) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:761) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)
Manager.title: Crash Report 6.4-rc-1: Bad notification posted from package org.wordpress.android: Couldn't expand RemoteViews

Manager.description: Having one 24h reminder is a thing but having the same notification coming back every day is showing up to not be useful but rather annoying. Have +1 day, +1 week, +1 month reminders, with different messages randomly chosen, that could even be fun: 1 day: You drafted “post title” yesterday. Don’t forget to publish it! Did you know that “post title” is still a draft? Publish away! 1 week: Your draft, “post title” awaits you — be sure to publish it! “Post title” remains a draft. Remember to publish it! 1 month Don’t leave it hanging! “Post title” is waiting to be published.
Manager.title: Notifications: enhance pending drafts notifications texts and behavior

Manager.description: Expected behavior: Present proper Post Format fields in app after changing the Post Format type in the Post Settings. Actual behavior: There is only 1 post format presented regardless of the Post Format selected. This requires saving posts as a draft and using the web admin via a browser to properly complete posts. Steps to reproduce the behavior: Choose any other Post Format from the Post Settings when starting a new Post. Tested on Nexus 5X, Android 7.1.1, WordPress for Android 6.4-rc-1
Manager.title: Support Standard WordPress Post Formats

Manager.description: From a user comment: Whenever checking blog stats, the app doesn’t free used memory. After a while, it saturates RAM.
Manager.title: Investigate memory issue in Stats

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create several local draft posts Push your device date 3+ days into the future Open the WordPress app Click the notification or its edit button Expected behavior To be directed to the Posts List Actual behavior The WP app opens to the notifications pane Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-31
Manager.title: Notifications: Multiple pending draft notification links to Notifications display instead of Post List

Manager.description: Expected behavior When scrolling through the reader, featured images always appear Actual behavior Sometimes images do not show on posts that come back into view, even if they were visible before they went out of view. I've found two causes of this: Scrolling up and down the reader Returning from viewing a single post. Steps to reproduce the behavior Scrolling: Open the reader to "Followed Sites" Scroll up and down through posts with featured images. Single post: Open the reader to "Followed Sites" Open a single post Press back to return to the reader. Tested on Motorola Moto X Force, Android alpha-31
Manager.title: Reader images disappear

Manager.description: Expected behavior write a draft write a second draft set the device date beyond 3 days in the future “grouped” notification should appear Actual behavior write a draft write a second draft set the device date beyond 3 days in the future “grouped” notification should appear, but it doesn’t It'll work correctly if you: write a draft set the device date beyond 3 days in the future bring the app to the foreground the first notification is shown write a second draft change the date to +1 day in the future from the date set in step 2 it now works, because there is at least one draft that made longestLivingDraft be different than zero Steps to reproduce the behavior write a draft write a second draft set the device date beyond 3 days in the future “grouped” notification should appear (but it doesn't) Tested on [Samsung Galaxy S3], Android [4.2.2]
Manager.title: Notifications: pending drafts notification won't trigger the first time

Manager.description: If you enter an email and get sent to the magic link request view, pressing the "Enter your password instead" doesn't allow you to enter your password.
Manager.title: Cannot log in to WordPress.com with a password

Manager.description: Logout of the app Sign into wp.com using your email address Tap "Next" Tap "Send Link" Tap "Launch your email app" Open the sign in email and tap "Sign in to WordPress.com" You'll be directed to the page below, which instructs that you'll receive a push notification in the WordPress app - which of course you never receive, since you're not signed in.
Manager.title: Magic links "Send Link" doesn't work with 2fa

Manager.description: Hey there, When I watch my feed in WordPress for Android, it appears aliased. As my screen is in FullHD (1920x1080), my image in 4K with a low weight (less than 50 ko) and my internet connection is 4G, it should: Expected behavior Appear in a great quality without any aliasing. Actual behavior Appear in a bad quality with aliasing. http://image.noelshack.com/fichiers/2017/02/1483963241-screenshot-20161226-115812.png Steps to reproduce the behavior Create an article on your WordPress website, Upload a featured image to this article, Search for your article on WordPress App. Tested on LG Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1
Manager.title: Featured image are showing in low resolution

Manager.description: Delete site network call added to FluxC in wordpress-mobile/WordPress-FluxC-Android#266, we need to integrate that in.
Manager.title: Delete Site FluxC integration

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expected to be able to see oEmbeds working for post previews in the app. Actual behavior Embeds just look like plain links in post previews. Steps to reproduce the behavior Install WPAndroid 6.5-rc-1. Create and publish a post with a kickstarter, reddit, twitter moments, or facebook news embed. From the Posts page in the app, click the title of the post to see a preview. Check to see if the embed is working there. Tested on Samsung Galaxy Tab4 (SM-T330NU), Android 5.1.1
Manager.title: Show embeds in Post previews

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expected embedded Kickstarter videos to look fabulous on mobile. Actual behavior There's a funny extra space below embedded Kickstarter videos. Steps to reproduce the behavior Install WPAndroid 6.5-rc-1. Create and publish a post with a Kickstarter URL on it's own line with a line of text above. Open a web browser on any mobile device and check to see if there's excessive extra space below the embedded video. Tested on Samsung Galaxy Tab4 (SM-T330NU), Android 5.1.1 and Pixel, Android 7.1.1
Manager.title: Remove excessive extra space from below Kickstarter embeds

Manager.description: Currently we are sending all users who want to start over to Helpshift. Instead we'll be sending users to either a pre-filled email form if they are a paid customer or a webview to https://en.support.wordpress.com/empty-site/ if they are a free customer. Same as wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#5131
Manager.title: Stop sending users who want to start over to Helpshift

Manager.description: We got a request from user: I want to search my posts in the App, sometimes I need to modify an older post or just read it. But I can't do it easily with the mobile clients. I think it is a useful feature, and I'm willing to see it in next version. :D This feature already exists in iOS so it only makes sense to add it to Android version too.
Manager.title: Add ability to search your own posts/pages

Manager.description: Right now when clicking into a post, the Action Bar shows "Reader Blog" for every site. Change it to be the title of the site. Same as wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6333
Manager.title: Change title of Reader Stream Detail from "Reader Blog" to the title of the site

Manager.description: It looks like SitePicker doesn't do a refresh when it's displayed. This is especially important when a site is removed or deleted and the site picker is shown. Currently, the deleted site shows up in the list even though it's supposed to be deleted from the DB. You can even select the site, but when you select something like "Posts" it will show a permission error. We should at least handle events like OnSiteRemoved or OnSiteDeleted. /cc @maxme
Manager.title: FluxC: SitePicker Refresh

Manager.description: Expected behavior When browsing my Followed Sites in Android app, I'd expect each card to only display the text and image from that blog post. Actual behavior I noticed a post from Andrew Spittle's blog included a gallery preview (4-thumb up) from Maureen's blog post. Steps to reproduce the behavior I'm not sure how to reproduce... maybe with: Follow both those blogs in Reader. View the Reader stream to see if the gallery is duplicated in the other post's card. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WordPress for Android version alpha-32
Manager.title: Reader Stream Refresh: gallery from post 1 duplicated in post 2 card

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: FluxC: Migrate .org sites from older app version

Manager.title: Add Setting for Aztec Editor

Manager.title: Visiting Stats on a self hosted site should show an "Install Jetpack" dialog or an error message

Manager.description: While reviewing the site migration, I've found that the method WordPressDB.hasAnyJetpackBlogs() never worked. It assumes the field api_blogid defaults to 0, which is incorrect. This never worked and will be fixed when FluxC is merged.
Manager.title: [Analytics] Jetpack user not tracked correctly

Also, the format toolbar button remains active. See the screenshots below for details. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating action button. Tap Media format toolbar button. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33

Manager.description: Expected The post title text box for the Aztec editor has hint text when empty. Observed The post title text box for the Aztec editor does not have hint test. See the screenshots below for details. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating action button. Notice no post title hint text. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33
Manager.title: No Post Title Hint Text is Shown for Aztec Editor

Manager.description: Expected The format toolbar is disabled when the post title field is selected. Observed The format toolbar is enabled when the post title field is selected. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating action button. Notice format toolbar buttons are active with post title field selected. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33

Manager.description: Expected Choosing an option from the media menu performs associated action within the app. Observed Choosing an option from the media menu shows message or does nothing. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating action button. Tap Media format toolbar button. Tap Gallery option. Notice "Launch gallery" message. Tap Media format toolbar button. Tap Photo option. Tap Device camera option. Notice nothing happens. Tap Media format toolbar button. Tap Photo option. Tap Device photos option. Notice nothing happens. Tap Media format toolbar button. Tap Photo option. Tap Media library option. Notice "Open library" message. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33
Manager.title: Connect Aztec Media Options to WordPress App Actions

Manager.description: Expected behavior The post details screen not to be empty. Actual behavior When I rotate the device from portrait to landscape, the post details screen sometime is blank in landscape orientation. Note: Rotate --> Rotate many times. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open post details screen Rotate back and forth the device to landscape (repeat this some times if you can't reproduce the issue immediately) At certain point the device shows an empty post on landscape orientation Best to reproduce on a post with multiple pictures, or long post Tested on Nexus 5X, Android 7.1
Manager.title: Reader: Single post screen could be empty when device is rotated landscape

Manager.description: Currently, the login screen tags the Helpshift launch via the ? button on the login screen with the origin:login-screen-help tag. Let's differentiate the tag based on the login "mode" displayed at the time the user taps the ? button. Let's also remove the -help term as it's redundant. So, let's use origin:wpcom-login-screen for when in wpcom or magiclink mode, origin:wporg-login-screen when in selfhosted mode and origin:jetpack-login-screen when asking the user to login with wpcom to see the stats on a jetpack site.
Manager.title: Differentiate Helpshift login tag among wpcom/wporg/jetpack modes

Manager.description: As mentioned in #4911 (comment), the -error term in the Helpshift tag names are not really needed so, remove it.
Manager.title: Remove the `-error` term from the Helpshift origin tags

Manager.description: In this routine the reader bumps the page view and tracks analytics for the full post view. This relies on the HashSet mTrackedPositions to avoid tracking posts we've already tracked, but this HashSet isn't retained and restored upon rotation. As a result, rotating the device causes the same post(s) to be tracked again.
Manager.title: Reader: full post view duplicate tracking

Manager.description: See this iOS issue for details.
Manager.title: Reader: attached image not in a gallery is used as a featured image

Manager.description: Expected behavior When going to the Media section within the app's main menu, a grid with the available media for the currently active site is shown. On top of that, a filter reads "All(xx)" and when you tap there, these options are shown: All (xx) Images (yy) Unattached (zz) Custom Date... Tapping on any of these should apply the selected filter and update the list accordingly (i.e. if you tap Images, just show images, or if you tap Unattached, just show those items in the library that have not yet been included in any of your site's posts). Actual behavior Tapping on any of those filters does nothing, and not even refreshing the list (pull to refresh gesture) makes any changes to the list (it just shows all available content in the library). Steps to reproduce the behavior Log in to WPAndroid app go to your site's Media section (first tab) Check the filters appear. If you don't have any items in your library, please add some (2 at least). Tap on any filter Watch the list remains the same. Tested on [Pixel], Android [7.1.1]
Manager.title: Media: filters don't work

Manager.description: Expected Tapping a crosspost goes to the linked site. Observed Tapping a crosspost hides the post contents. See the screenshots below for example. screenshot removed Reproduced Go to Reader tab. Tap a post with a crosspost link. Notice the post content (see Before above). Tap the crosspost link. Notice the post content disappears (see After above). Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5
Manager.title: Crossposts Do Not Follow Links and Hide Post Content

Manager.description: Expected Notifications are marked as read when returning to the Notification tab after opening a system notification. Observed Notifications remain unread when returning to the Notification tab after opening a system notification until the tab is refreshed manually or the notification is opened from the Notification tab. Reproduced Refresh Open a system notification from the WordPress app. Tap the back arrow or back button. Notice the notification is still unread (i.e. light blue background). Swipe down to refresh the Notifications tab. Notice the notification is now read (i.e. white background). Reread Open a system notification from the WordPress app. Tap the back arrow or back button. Notice the notification is still unread (i.e. light blue background). Tap the notification from the list. Tap the back arrow or back button. Notice the notification is now read (i.e. white background). Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5
Manager.title: Notification Remains Unread After Opening From System Notification

Manager.description: Expected Rotating the device retains comment like status. Observed Rotating the device reverts comment like status. The like/unlike is saved on the backend, but the interface does not reflect the correct state. Reproduced Go to Notifications tab. Tap a comment notification. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button. Rotate the device. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button is unchanged. Tap the Like/Liked button. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button is changed. Rotate the device. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button reverts to the original state. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5
Manager.title: Comment Like Status is Reverted When Device is Rotated

Manager.description: Expected behavior The login screen mode should still stay in "Jetpack auth" mode when dropping out of magic-link login mode back to password mode. Actual behavior The login screen is presented as normal login, losing the "To view your stats, log in to the WordPress.com account you used to connect Jetpack." message and offering self-hosted login and account creation on the spot. Steps to reproduce the behavior With no WPCOM account connected and only a Jetpack selfhosted site added to the app Tap on the "Stats" item on the site screen. The app asks to login to the WPCOM account connected to Jetpack Enter the email address and tap "Next" Tap on "Enter your password instead" to switch back to password login mode Boom. Login screen is no longer Jetpack auth configured Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android v7.1.1
Manager.title: Jetpack auth login screen mode bypassed when switching to password login

Manager.description: Expected The editor cursor is the same for both the title and content. Observed The editor cursor is different for both the title and content. See the screenshots below for example. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating action button. Notice cursor in title field with "Title" text. Tap in content field with "Tenochtitlan is the hint" text. Notice cursor in content field with "Tenochtitlan is the hint" text. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33
Manager.title: Editor Cursor is Different for Title and Content

Manager.description: Expected The editor content hint text shows "Share your story here..." in the visual view and "
Manager.title: Update Content Hint Text for Aztec Editor

Manager.description: Expected All format buttons show a disabled state when in the HTML view. Observed The Heading and Page format buttons are disabled, but do not show a disabled state when in the HTML view. See the screenshots below for example. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating action button. Notice Heading and Page format buttons. Tap HTML format button. Notice Heading and Page format buttons. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33
Manager.title: Heading and Page Format Buttons Do Not Show Disabled State in HTML View

Manager.description: WordPress.imageLoader no longer gets the bearer token for WPcom requests, which means images from private sites aren't working anywhere that relies on it (e.g. the legacy editor, and soon Aztec). This used to be handled in WPDelayedHurlStack. The proposed solution is to inject FluxC's volley queue so it can be used by the ImageLoader.
Manager.title: Use FluxC's volley queue for the ImageLoader

Manager.description: To reproduce: Create a new wpcom blog. Follow the blog In your Reader's following stream, confirm that posts from the blog appear. Delete the wpcom blog. Go to the Reader's Manage Sites screen and try to unfollow the delete blog. You'll see an error message stating that API requests have been disabled for that site, and the site is not removed from your following list. I tried to reproduce this in the web reader and was able to successfully unfollow the site. This suggests we need to update which endpoints the app calls to unfollow a site. @nbradbury cc @aerych as this is present in the iOS reader as well. wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6457
Manager.title: Reader: Error unfollowing a site that has been deleted

Manager.description: Expected Post newlines are retained when opened. Observed Post newlines are removed when opened. See the screenshots below for example. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating button. Enter text with newlines like left screenshot above. Tap back arrow in action bar. Tap Edit button for post created in Step 3. Notice newlines are removed shown in right screenshot above. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33
Manager.title: Opening Post with Aztec Editor Removes Newlines

Manager.description: Expected The post title for the Aztec editor does not allow newlines similar to the current visual editor. Observed The post title for the Aztec editor does allot newlines unlike the current visual editor. Reproduced Aztec Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating button. Tap in title text area. Tap enter key. Notice newlines are input. Visual Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating button. Tap in title text area. Tap enter key. Notice no newlines are input. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33
Manager.title: Exclude Newlines in Post Title

Manager.description: Expected Refresh graphics show WordPress colors like blue_wordpress, blue_medium, blue_light, or orange_jazzy. Observed Refresh graphics show black or holo_blue_dark. Reproduced Black Go to Notification tab. Swipe down notifications list. Notice refresh color is black. Blue Go to Sites tab. Tap Blog Posts option. Swipe down blog posts list. Notice refresh color is holo_blue_dark. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5
Manager.title: Refresh Graphic Shows Non-WordPress Color

Manager.description: Expected behavior If you are viewing the Site Details screen for a site, any links to that site's Site Details should be disabled so you can't reopen the same screen twice in a row. Actual behavior If you are viewing the Site Details screen for a site, you can tap on the site title at the top of one of the blog posts in the post list to re-open the same Site Details screen. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Reader in the app. Tap the title of a site to open the Site Details screen. At the top of any of the posts in the post list, tap the Gravatar/author/site title again. Result: The same Site Details screen re-opens. You can do this repeatedly, and when you close the screen you'll see that each time you opened a new view that needs to be closed. Reported in 158887-h. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-34
Manager.title: Reader: Site Details for the same site can be opened repeatedly
FluxC integration: Sign Up - Some error from the server should not be displayed

Manager.description: Expected Aztec editor is styled like Calypso. Observed Aztec editor is not styled like Calypso. Reproduced Open Aztec editor in the WordPress app. Open Calypso editor in a web browser. Compare styling. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress alpha-33
Manager.title: Style Aztec Integration Like Calypso

Manager.description: If a post in a private site contains a local (private) image that's mistakenly using http:// (probably through manual editing - images inserted from the library should have https:// added automatically), the app is unable to load the image using the custom ImageLoader (in the fluxc-integration branch). This is working in develop: Request private site’s image using http:// Request is sent, no headers are added (expected, we don't send auth tokens over HTTP) Receive 301 redirect to same URL with https:// Follow HTTPS redirect, applying the auth header now that it’s secure Image request succeeds This is what's happening in the fluxc-integration branch: Request private site’s image using http:// Request is sent, no headers are added (expected, we don't send auth tokens over HTTP) Receive 301 redirect to same URL with https:// Follow HTTPS redirect, but no headers are added Image request fails (receive 403 from server)
Manager.title: Private site images using HTTP aren't fetched

Manager.description: As noted here, if you clear the search string in the reader followed sites page, the list of sites isn't changed.
Manager.title: Reader: followed search doesn't reset when cleared

Manager.description:
The analytic event deep_link_not_default_handler is bumped at the very first startup. Steps to repro: Make sure the app is not running in BG. (No WP in the recent apps list). Start the app. The following 2 events are bumped: [0] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_deep_link_not_default_handler [_ts] => 1485880268924 [_ul] => XXXXXXXXXX [_ut] => wpcom:user_id [interceptor_classname] => org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderPostPagerActivity )
[1] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_application_opened [_ts] => 1485880268993 [_ul] => XXXXXXXXX [_ut] => wpcom:user_id ) deep_link_not_default_handler is even bumped before application_opened (not a problem I think, but worth to mention). Tested on Nexus 5X, Android 7
Manager.title: Analytic event `deep_link_not_default_handler` is bumped at startup

Manager.description: The header in the reader full post view currently does a call to get the info for a blog solely to find out the URLs for the blog's avatar + blavatar. These image URLs are now included in the post model, so we can skip the extra request and just rely on the post model.
Manager.title: Reader: full post view header doesn't need to request blog info

Manager.description: Right now the Android app defaults to Discover the first time the user accesses the reader. Based on a discussion with the reader squad, it should instead default to Followed Sites.
Manager.title: Reader: make "Followed Sites" the default

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to manage the users/followers on my site (in the People section) for WordPress.com and Jetpack-connected sites. (This includes Business sites that were automatically transferred.) Actual behavior The People section is only supported for WordPress.com sites. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-34
Manager.title: People: Add support for People Management to Jetpack-connected sites

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to manage my site's settings (in the Settings section) for WordPress.com and Jetpack-connected sites. (This includes Business sites that were automatically transferred.) Settings I should have access to: General (title, tagline, address, privacy, language) Writing Discussion This device Advanced (maybe not for Jetpack sites) Actual behavior I only have access to these settings for WordPress.com sites. Jetpack-connected sites still show these settings only: Account details HTTP credentials (optional) Media Remove site button Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-34
Manager.title: Settings: Add support for full site settings to Jetpack-connected sites

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior From another app select a picture or text and click the Share action Select WordPress The site picker dialog functions well, but could probably use a design refresh. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, wp alpha-34
Manager.title: Improve design styling of share-to-post dialog

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a draft post, then quit back to the Posts List Tap on the card itself, not one of the buttons at the bottom The question is whether this should open to the editor by default, or into the post preview like it does for published posts. Personally I could see it go either way. Both options are available from the toolbar on the bottom of the post, so changing the default behavior doesn't remove any functionality. But keeping it to the Preview mode keeps the behavior consistent across all cards regardless of status. If changing the behavior we also need to consider what should happen for scheduled posts. The behavior on iOS is a little different. If you click the card of a local draft, it opens up the editor. But if you click the card of a draft post saved online, then it opens the preview. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, wp alpha-34
Manager.title: Posts List: Consider opening drafts in Edit mode instead of Preview when tapping on card

Manager.description: When changing the primary domain for a site, the app isn't updating to display the new URL. Logging out and then in again will force showing the new URL, but future changes will once again be ignored.
Manager.title: Primary domain URL doesn't update

Manager.description: Go into a post detail and start editing it Make some changes, but don't update the post (so keep the changes local) Go back to post detail page and notice that the changes are not there and the previous version is shown
Manager.title: FluxC: Editing post for local changes don't update the post detail

Manager.description: Edit a post and go back without updating the remote (keep the changes local only) Go back to post list, because the detail page won't update right now #5136 Go into the detail page and revert the changes Notice that the page is not updated
Manager.title: FluxC: Reverting changes don't update post detail page

Manager.description: At the initial login screen, where you're asked for a username or e-mail address, some users enter their WordPress.com site URL: From here you're currently sent to the self-hosted login screen (this is because we recognize wordpress as a string not allowed in a WordPress.com username, and so conclude this is a self-hosted user). We should instead direct the user to the WordPress.com sign in screen. From there I think we could do a few things: Keep the URL in the username field, and show an error on the field immediately ('invalid username') Empty the username field (I'm not sure I like this one, it'll look confusing since we 'lost' their information) Strip the 'wordpress.com' part (this will work well for users whose username is the same as their site, but might be confusing to others) Make a call to is-available/username on the * part of *.wordpress.com - if it exists, do 3, otherwise do 1 (or 2) 👍 1
Manager.title: Handle WordPress.com URL used as username gracefully

Manager.description: We must not migrate any kind of Jetpack sites when the app is upgraded to FluxC. It seems that Jetpack sites that are connected to non main wpcom account are migrated, see this example: #5134 (comment)
Manager.title: FluxC: make sure we don't migrate any kind Jetpack sites

Manager.description: When a user deletes their site in the app (My Sites > Settings > Delete Site), we warn them that their site will be gone forever, but we don't clearly state that the site address will also be unavailable: This leads users to delete their sites when they want to start over, and then they are blocked when they can't recreate a site at the same address. We should clarify, before the user deletes the site, that the site address will be unavailable. Related warnings in Calypso: Reference: p77Llu-3Uf-p2 Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-34
Manager.title: Add warning about the site's address when deleting a site

Manager.title: FluxC: Support migration for multisites

Manager.description: Expected behavior The app should remember the "post status" set the last time the user posted something and use the same status when creating a new post again unless the user change it. Reported here: https://appbot.co/apps/723515-wordpress/reviews/375371642 What's more, the only intuitive options for a post are "local draft" or "publish". I can't get the app to default to "draft", in which it is uploaded and able to be edited on my computer. Actual behavior Post status default to "Publish"
Manager.title: Posting: Remember Post status when when creating new posts

Manager.description: We should use the /me/sites endpoint to save the hidden state of sites on remote. This was originally planned for FluxC here, but we decided it makes more sense to have a separate REST request for it.
Manager.title: FluxC: Save hidden state of a site on remote

Manager.description: Expected behavior If my role on a site is Contributor, I shouldn't see an option to Publish in the editor. Instead of Publish, the primary action I see should be "Submit for Review." Actual behavior When I use the app as a Contributor, and write a post, I see a big Publish button. If I click on it, the editor closes like normal. But if I navigate to my Posts list, I see that it's only been saved locally; it's not actually uploaded to my site at all. After a minute, I'll get a bad error message. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add a contributor to a site Login to the app as that user Open the editor Write a post and click Publish. Current flow:
Manager.title: Editor: Contributors should not see the option to publish posts

Manager.description: We should add a comprensive set of analytics events to the new Media Picker. Below are some of the events we want to track ((brainstorming required): Took a picture / Recorded a video Selected one of the most recent photo/video (calculate the delta between today and date of picture?) Selected a media on the stock picker Accessed the preview screen Selected more than one file Things to remember: keep actions and properties in par with the iOS where applicable, and update the doc with the list of events. 👍 1
Manager.title: Add Analytics to the new Media Picker

Manager.description: This issue serves as the master issue for Improve posting experience - focus on Errors - which has the stated goal of improve error messages, improve error UI, localize most common errors, try to introduce error recovering on failed uploads. Old ticket here: #5109 Starting with this following list: Enhancements #5158 Media - Make sure errors are reported as we expect from FluxC #5109 Media - Better error messaging on failed uploads #5110 Media - No Permissions to Upload Media #5166 Auto-Retry on Errors #5168 Add Analytics to media uploads (both successful and errors)
Manager.title: Improve posting experience - focus on Errors - Master Thread

Manager.description: We should add analytics to media uploads (both successful and errors). Brainstorming the events /properties we may want to track: Would be cool to track the dimensions of the picture uploaded as property. Should we just track small-medium-large-xlarge by using some sort of classification? Uploading the width/height pixels could produce a fairly large amount of waste in the DB, and make the funneling phase/query hard. Would be cool to track the size in MB. Should we just track small-medium-large-xlarge by using some sort of classification? File type uploaded Successful upload / Upload Error -- File type -- File size in MB (should we use clusters small-medium-large?) -- File size in px for pictures (should we use clusters small-medium-large?) -- Network connection type -- Error type
Manager.title: Add Analytics to Media uploads

Manager.description: This issue serves as the master issue for Improve posting experience - focus on publishing - which has the stated goal of improve the whole posting experience - Being stuck in the editor while pictures are uploaded isn’t a great experience. Also error recovery isn't handled in a nice way. Current Status Publishing media is a blocking task. If you tap back there is a modal that says you have to stay in the editor. In case of errors, you have to tap on Publish again. Or you have to tap on the single picture to retry the upload of the media. Proposed Improvements (still in draft) Make the posting experience async, with auto retry on errors, and notifications manager. Async Publish #5252 Uploads files + the whole post in background. Notification about the status/progress of the process. Tapping on the notification should take the user to post preview. With a clear indication that we’re uploading it. Giving the ability of edit the post again. In case of unrecoverable errors, you can reopen the post or retry directly from the notification. The notification (while uploading is in progress) should include a Cancel button (that really stops the uploading and the underlying network connections). And takes you back to the edit screen. Other improvements Auto-Retry on some errors. Add Analytics.
Manager.title: Improve posting experience - Media Publishing - Master Thread

Manager.description: I think as a first step of "picture optimization" we should add a new setting in site settings that turns on/off picture compression device side (not resizing, just compression). Having it ON as default value. We may label it Save bandwidth. Together with Default Image Width should give us enough flexibility, and save bandwidth. We should be careful with this setting, since people may not expect we compress picture before uploading. Note 1: We should be careful when applying the compression, since we can probably easily fall on Out of Memory errors and such. Note 2: A step further could be the removal of both those options above, and instead just add one single "optimize picture" setting. Don't know how it could fit for all blogs/sites/themes out there. cc @SergioEstevao
Manager.title: Compress pictures locally before uploading to the site

Manager.description: We can fix them (Jetpack plans API needs some love) and re-enable after we finished the first step integration.

Manager.description: It is worth noting that this issue has been detected on a self hosted blog where server access logs are redily available. Expected behavior From the media view click (press) an image to view the attachment page. From there click (press) the image. Expected: Download the actual image not a resized version. Also Expected: Download direct and not via third party servers. Actual behavior From the media view click (press) an image to view the attachment page. From there click (press) the image. Actual Behaviour: Initially the user is presented with "unable to view image". If you retry in a few minutes the image loads. Also Actual Behaviour: Third party server from 192.0.99.x to 192.0.101.x downloads the image. It appears that the image is being sent to the device via a third party server Request from tablet: 77.___.___.___ - - [19/Feb/2017:19:50:03 +0000] "GET /wp-content/uploads/2017/02/p1020442-01.jpeg?w=800 HTTP/1.1" 200 3328764 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 4.4.2; SM-T230 Build/KOT49H) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0 Chrome/30.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 wp-android/6.7". Request from third pary server: 192.0.101.168 - - [19/Feb/2017:19:50:08 +0000] "GET /wp-content/uploads/2017/02/p1020442-01.jpeg HTTP/1.1" 200 3321177 "-" "Photon/1.0" Steps to reproduce the behavior Set up self hosted blog Log in android tablet Upload an image From the Media view click the image From from the resulting view, click the image Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung galaxy tab 4. App Version 6.7 (downloaded from Play store).
Manager.title: Attempting to dowload an image from self hosted blog fails until third party server downloads it

Manager.description: Being stuck in the editor while pictures are uploaded isn’t a great experience. The idea here is to build a service that takes care of all the hurdles of uploading, while letting the user use the rest of the app without caring. investigate current state of media upload service with FluxC design an upload service that doesn't depend on the Editor being present as it currently is be able to upload media files for different posts all at the same time balance / queueuing to make the most of bandwidth (have n parallel upoads if possible, maybe even with a setting the user can change) also, if a draft for which some media is being uploaded is DELETED while the transfer is in progress, the transfer should be canceled. recover from errors automatically when possible restart the service if not running or if pending uploads when app starts (phone off / on). test for number of files and file size 👍 2 🎉 1
Manager.title: Async publish: background upload

Manager.description: In feature/fluxc-integration branch, if the user is logged in with a self-hosted account and tries to add another site from the sitepicker, she can skip the url field and it'll try to login to .com. If the credentials are for a valid .com account, then the user can login. This is somewhat unexpected as the add-site popup says, "Add a self-hosted site", so we either need to disable .com login from this flow or improve the flow to support .com accounts as well. Note: When this issue is worked on, this will probably in the develop branch. I just wanted to mention the fluxc branch so we don't try to fix it in develop before it's merged in. /cc @maxme
Manager.title: Don't allow for .com login or improve UX if the user is already logged in with self-hosted

Manager.description: Steps: Open the post list. Create a new post and hit publish. Go back to "My site". Open the post list. You should see a duplicated post (local only). Might be a local id issue or a post list adapter quirk? Note: the duplicated post is removed on refresh and that never happens if you don't go back to "My site" during upload. Demo video: https://cloudup.com/c0WTpG7u5X1
Manager.title: Duplicate posts in the post list after publishing

Manager.description: Some work is needed in PostUploadService so it can handle media uploads in FluxC. This is only currently needed by the legacy editor - for the visual and Aztec editors, media are already uploaded by the time the post reaches PostUploadService. Even after we drop the legacy editor, we'll probably want to keep this capability, since we'll want to support handling media uploads during post publishing as part of async media/post uploading.
Manager.title: FluxC: Fix uploading media from PostUploadService

Manager.description: I don't know if this is an integration issue or a FluxC one, but I thought it's better to open it here. When I trash a comment and switch to "Trashed" filter, the comment doesn't show up there. It does an auto-fetch due to changing the filters, but it doesn't show up after the fetch either. Most likely that's because the comment trash request is not yet completed, or it's a caching issue. I'd expect for us to change the status of a comment to "Trashed" when this happens, at least after the trashing request is completed and throw an event, so the list is updated.
Manager.title: FluxC: Trashing comment doesn't show it in Trashed for a while

Manager.description: Expected When inputing text into the editor, I expect the first letter to be capitalized. Observed The text isn't capitalized Reproduced Open the editor Type a word in both the Title and Content field Tested Nexus 6P on 7.1.2 with alpha-35 Note Copied from wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Aztec-Android#266.
Manager.title: Both the title and content fields do not auto-capitalize the first letter

Manager.description: Expected behavior When adding captions to images using the Aztec editor, I'd expect to see captions. Actual behavior Captions don't get added. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add image to post Tap on image to add details to image Add caption Tap "save" See message saying "changes saved" - notice that there is no caption - HTML isn't updated to reflect the added caption. Tested on [device], Android [version] Moto G (3rd Gen), Android 6.0, WP app alpha-36
Manager.title: Aztec editor image captions won't save

Manager.description: Expected I expect to be able to tap on an image to edit its image settings, and have those changes reflected in the post. Observed I can tap on an image to open its settings, but any changes I make there are lost. Reproduced Create a new post. Add an image. Tap the image to open the image settings. Make a change to the image (e.g. add a caption, change the alignment). Tap "Save" to save the changes. Check the HTML and note that the changes don't appear there. Tap again to open the image settings and note that the changes don't appear there. Tested Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-35 Moto G (3rd Gen), Android 6.0, WPAndroid alpha-36 Note Copied from wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Aztec-Android#263.
Manager.title: Changes to image settings aren't saved

But that issue's priority is low, so I'm creating this one, as well. WordPress – 6.6 HUAWEI RIO-L02 android – 5.1 English

E/Volley: [1233] BasicNetwork.performRequest: Unexpected response code 403 for https://public-api.wordpress.com/rest/v1.1/sites/XXXX?locale=it_IT I/WordPress-NOTIFS: Sending GCM token to our remote services: XXXXXXXXXX E/Volley: [1233] BasicNetwork.performRequest: Unexpected response code 403 for https://public-api.wordpress.com/rest/v1.1/sites/XXXXXX?locale=it_IT E/WordPress-API: Volley error com.android.volley.AuthFailureError at com.android.volley.toolbox.BasicNetwork.performRequest(BasicNetwork.java:171) at com.android.volley.NetworkDispatcher.run(NetworkDispatcher.java:114) D/WordPress-API: Dispatching action: SiteAction-UPDATE_SITE I/WordPress-NUX: onSiteChanged: org.wordpress.android.fluxc.store.SiteStore$OnSiteChanged@14a95bfc E/WordPress-API: onSiteChanged has error: GENERIC_ERROR - org.wordpress.android.fluxc.store.SiteStore$SiteError@70b2285 I see a call to the .com REST API, (+ the GCM token is sent to our server), even if i'm not logged in the app.
Manager.title: FluxC: Make sure to completely erase all info on logout

Manager.description: Troublemakers: SiteModel.mIsVisible: should be fixed by initializing this field as true, it can only be false for WP.com sites (wordpress-mobile/WordPress-FluxC-Android#337) SiteModel.mIsSelfHostedAdmin: should be set during migration from the isAdmin field in accounts (#5307) SiteModel.mName: should be populated in FluxC by the FETCH_SITE action (it's returned by wp.getOptions) (nevermind, we already do this) 👍 1
Manager.title: FluxC: Make sure all SiteModel fields are set during migration

Manager.description: It seems that we're always sending the GCM token to our backend. Logged out, and self-hosted users should not send the GCM token to our backend. Seen in alpha-36 and FluxC integration branch. This should be fixed in develop.
Manager.title: Do not send GCM tokens for logged-out users or self-hosted ones

Manager.description: I'm pretty sure this is a regression. Start a new post. Go to post settings. Select a featured image: nothing happens in the post settings when the media picker comes back.
Manager.title: Featured images can't be added or updated in the post settings

Manager.description: Expected behavior Stats should use the blog's timezone setting. Actual behavior It's using UTC time (not even device's time). I bet the blog's timezone setting returned from the blog object is incorrectly set to UTC. Tested on: alpha-37 on a 3gen Moto G (Android 6.0), alpha-38, Nexus 6 with stock 7.1 alpha-37 or -38, Nexus 5x, Android 7.1.1 (stock)
Manager.title: Stats are using UTC time

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect to get an authenticated webview when I select "View" on a published or draft post in the posts list. Actual behavior The webview is not authenticated, so viewing a published post bumps the stats and viewing a draft leads to a 404 error. h/t Davor for reporting this issue in the alpha version. cc @maxme — possibly due to FluxC changes? Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Blog Posts section for a site. Find a draft (marked "Draft" - not a local draft) in the posts list. Tap "View" on the post's card. Result: 404 error. Find a published post in the posts list. Tap "View" on the post's card. Result: The post loads but with a logged-out view, so the view is counted in the site's stats. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-38
Manager.title: Posts: Unauthenticated webview when viewing a post from the posts list

Manager.description: Expected behavior Within the media chooser (main tab, Media), if PIN lock is enabled and you try to add media by hitting the + sign on the top-right corner of the screen, the permissions are requested to the user and then the native picker should be shown. Actual behavior Within the media chooser (main tab, Media), if PIN lock is enabled and you try to add media by hitting the + sign on the top-right corner of the screen, the permissions are requested to the user and then the PIN lock screen is presented, blocking any further interaction when it should be a seamless flow. Steps to reproduce the behavior install the app for the first time (clean install) log in and setup PIN lock (go to 3rd tab, then into App Settings, find PIN lock and turn it on) enter your 4 digit pin, then re-enter it to save it. now go to the media chooser (1st tab, Media option) hit the + button on the top-right corner of the screen the permission request dialog appears Either choose to allow or not allow the pin lock screen is shown, and you are prompted to enter your PIN in order to continue any interactions in the app. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.1]
Manager.title: Media chooser: PIN lock screen shown when permissions requested on Android 6.0+

Manager.description: Local images in existing drafts aren't shown when the drafts are re-opened in the legacy editor. The legacy editor-only post preview also never displays images. Preview the post (using the preview button only available in the legacy editor)
Manager.title: FluxC: Images in existing local drafts aren't displayed in legacy editor

Manager.description: It seems that the new Media Picker, already integrated in Aztec, doesn't give me the ability to add a picture to posts. The single tap event does't get handled fine (see the video): https://cloudup.com/clgo41x7cTY Long press is working fine, but If I select 2 or more pictures I have the same problem: https://cloudup.com/cTRUFI1doFd Tested on Wiko Ridge 4G, Android 5.0.2
Manager.title: Can't select pictures in the New Media Picker on Android 5

Manager.description: Undo/redo actions do not work (buttons seem to be disabled).
Manager.title: Undo/redo not working

Manager.description: Expected behavior To either allow for background uploading of media, or warn me when an upload is canceled Actual behavior If you leave the editor while a video is uploading, it silently fails and is removed from the post. The same action during a picture upload leaves a placeholder for the image that indicates the upload failed, and alerts you to the error when you attempt to publish. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post and insert a video Navigate away while the video is uploading Return to the editor for that post and notice it's empty Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.2, wp alpha-38
Manager.title: Alert the user to canceled video upload when leaving editor

Manager.description: Expected behavior To see an error message saying I can't log in with no network Actual behavior The app crashes, and on re-opening it gives me a weird logged-out interface: Restarting the app again afterward gives me the login screen again. Steps to reproduce the behavior Disable the network Try to log in via magic link Attempting to log in via password gives a "No network available" error Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.2, wp alpha-39
Manager.title: Login: Need error message when attempting magic link login with no network

Manager.description: As seen on iOS wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6861, it looks like we're also only syncing the default 100 categories via REST for Android: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/libs/networking/WordPressNetworking/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/networking/RestClientUtils.java#L90 Also sorta-fixed for iOS in wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6862
Manager.title: Categories: only syncing default 100 categories

Manager.description: Expected behavior Image with Unicode in the file name shows correctly Actual behavior Unicode file name is not shown properly. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add an image with unicode in title (e.g.: 长名字.png) from desktop browser. From Android app, create a new post, insert media and try to Create gallery. In the image selection, unicode title is not shown properly. Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: Media library doesn't show unicode filename properly

Manager.description: Expected behavior Video shows thumbnail correctly in media library Actual behavior It shows Loading... forever Steps to reproduce the behavior Add a video from Android app in a post. Start a new post, try to insert an image gallery. In the media library, notice the video stays as Loading... forever. Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: Previously added video in media library unable to be loaded

Manager.description: Expected behavior Able to Cancel in the middle of gallery creation Actual behavior Once started, always go to the edit step no matter if there is image selected or not Steps to reproduce the behavior There is no Cancel option after the user clicks on insert media and start the gallery creation process. If a user decides to abort the process and go back to edit the new post, it still goes to the Edit gallery step, even when no image is selected, which is quite confusing. Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: No Cancel option during the gallery creation process

Manager.description: Expected behavior Less and more clear option after click on Insert media from new post Actual behavior 7 options to choose from Steps to reproduce the behavior After click on insert media in the new post, there are 7 different ways of adding media to choose from, which is too many and unnecessary: Do we really need to differentiate photo from video? Select a photo from gallery and Select from media library cause confusion to regular user Multi-select with the new picker sounds like an experimental option that will eventually be merged into Select a photo from gallery option Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: Too many options after clicking on 'insert media'

Manager.description: Expected behavior More clear hint there is more gallery settings at the bottom Actual behavior Steps to reproduce the behavior After select images to be added to image gallery, the Gallery setting button at the bottom is not very obvious. Without the arrow on it in the first place, user hardly notices it has a pull up settings menu: After click on it, and pull down the menu, it will show the arrow. If we show this arrow in the first place, it will make it more clear and obvious to the user: Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: Gallery setting not obvious

Manager.description: Expected behavior Actual behavior Steps to reproduce the behavior After the image selection is finished, user has to click on the back arrow to go the next step, which is a bit counter intuitive. Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: No Done or Next option in the gallery creation process

Manager.description: Expected behavior A better name of some visual effect on Reverse button Actual behavior Steps to reproduce the behavior The REVERSE button in Gallery settings is not clear to the user what it actually does. After clicking on it, there is no visual effect change to be seen, user will be likely to try it multiple times which could revert the effect and causes more confusion. And not quite clear why only this option is all capital letters. Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: Reverse button in Gallery setting is not clear on what it does

Manager.description: Expected behavior Publish is disabled before a newly created account from desktop browser confirms its email address Actual behavior Publish is enabled as usual, and all "published" posts go to draft instead. Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign up a new user from desktop browser (Note this has to be from desktop, Sign up from mobile devices doesn't seem to require email confirmation). Do NOT confirm the email address from your email inbox. Notice the Publish is disabled from desktop browser and there is a hint to ask for email confirmation first: Log in from Android app, create a new post, and notice the Publish button is enabled contrary to the desktop behavior. After click on it, the post will be only saved to draft, instead of published. This is very misleading. It might take a while for the user to find out that all the "published" posts were still sitting as draft. The user has to log in from desktop browser to find out what was the reason that the "published" posts are all just saved to draft. Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: Publish option is enabled for account that hasn't confirmed email yet

Manager.description: Expected behavior When asked "Stop uploading", a simple "Yes" or "No" is more clear Actual behavior Both "CANCEL" and "STOP UPLOAD" sounds a yes to me somehow Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post, insert a video, and try to abort in the middle of upload. Tested on [device], Android [version] WorePress Android App Version 6.9 Samsung Galaxy S5, Android version 6.0.1
Manager.title: Stop uploading confirmation confusion

Manager.description: For consistency with Calypso, the media library should drop file names and file types from the bottom image cells. For non-images, though, we should keep the file name and type and display them centered in the cell.
Manager.title: Media library: drop file name and file type from images

Manager.description: Expected behavior To be able to tap the card with my site name at the top of the My Sites page and view my site, similar to the action in Calypso web Note that with this action we could drop the "View Site" button from the External section Actual behavior Nothing Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app Navigate to the My Site(s) tab Tap on your site name Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.2, wp alpha-39
Manager.title: Site name should be clickable on My Sites tab

Manager.description: As of 7.0-rc-1, images added from our app's media cache folder (WordPress/images/) are turned into empty files and fail to be added (and the local file becomes empty too). Either we’re just not resolving media from our own cache directory correctly, or we’re corrupting them when we try to load them. Steps to reproduce the behavior In 7.0-rc-1, upload an image using any editor Find the file in the local cache directory (WordPress/images) - adb pull it and make sure it's non-empty Open the media picker again, and select the same image from our cache directory (it might show up at the top of 'Recent', otherwise navigate to the cache directory and find it there) The upload should fail, and you should get an 'File is empty' error in the log adb pull the same image from cache - it should be an empty file
Manager.title: Images added to editor from the WordPress media cache are empty

Manager.description: From a beta tester: After updating the android WordPress app to the 7.0-rc1 release on a Nexus 5X device (unfortunately I don’t remember the previous version id), I started viewing the following error “Migration process failed: try launching the app when you have a network connection.” every time I unlocked the screen, even with a working 4g/wifi connection. I initially thought this was an android issue and I even restarted the phone but it didn’t make a difference. After failing to find issues related to the error message above, I started looking at what Apps were last updated until I got a positive match on the WordPress-Android source code. Opening the WP app fixed the issue. I guess it’d be good to only show the modal when the WP app is active? Otherwise it’s not obvious from what app the message error is coming from. We might have 2 issues: Why do we show this Toast if the network is available? Shoud we move migration to WPLaunchActivity? (Can we do it?)
Manager.title: Under certain circumstances, "Migration Error: No network" can show up after app update

Manager.description: Currently we only track that a login failed. It would be helpful to include error information (if any) as properties for the login failure event. Properties can include: error_code : An HTTP status code, or domain specific error code. error_description : The plain text description of the error. error_domain : A platform specific "domain" for the error, if one is defined. to match what is tracked on iOS.
Manager.title: Analytics/Login: Include error information as properties when tracking login failures.

Manager.description: Should we add some padding? Or a section title?
Manager.title: Stats item feels cramped

Manager.description: Happened on a Jetpack site (That could happen on other sites). Posts have all different featured images but the same (garage shelves) is used.
Manager.title: Post list: duplicate featured image

Manager.description: From a user on a Nexus 9 (landscape): Post was in the centre of the screen, then I pressed the star button, and it moved to the left. After this, some posts (x-posts) were centred, and others were right aligned.
Manager.title: Reader post detail became left aligned after liking.

Manager.description: User commented: Can we turn on the scrolling indicator for reading through here? I came across a huge article but wanted a visual reference to know how far along I was.
Manager.title: Reader Post detail: add the vertical scrollbar back
