Manager.title: Media Library - Can't delete item in "Retry" state
New analytics event to track PIN lock usage before we remove it

Manager.description: I was testing uploading in the Media Library and found out a couple of issues that I think are all related each other. So i'm opening this single issue, but feel free to decouple, if they're different issues. Issue 1 (Video here: https://cloudup.com/cbfyyY7d-4l ) Not sure how, but I found myself with 2 items in the "Uploading" state in the library. Only one should be in the uploading state, and the other one should be in the "Queued" state. Adding a new item to the queue switches the status of the 3 new items to "Queued" and the spinning is running on the top of the text. Issue 2 (Video here: https://cloudup.com/cCKVhkgeRl7 ) Starting from an incoherent state where all the 3 items are in the "Queued" state. PTR and the state issue seems to be fixed. Again, not sure why there is the spinner running in the Queued state though. Single click on the queue files does nothing, or it's hard to tap on the correct area to open the details screen. Long clicked, selected an item in the Queued state, and selected Delete. All the 3 items disappeared from the screen. When I did PTR the one in the uploading state reappeared on the library. Issue 3 (Video here: https://cloudup.com/chaZh-1rFwl ) Long click are enabled on the items in "Uploading" state. It should not be enabled I think. Only the single tap to stop the uploading should be available. (Open to suggestions on this). cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Media Library - The "state" of items seems to be inconsistent

Manager.description: Before: After:
Manager.title: Media Browser menu disappears after cancelling search

Manager.description: Only the first 20 pages on the site are loading on the Pages list. If you scroll down to the bottom of the list, you get a loading indicator but the rest of the pages don’t load.
Manager.title: Unable to load more than 20 pages

Manager.description: If you select a couple of items in the Media Library, and tap on delete icon, the label that appears over the items has text Delete in it, and the spinner on the top. I think the correct wording for it is Deleting. It's a kind of weird to have a spinner running on the top and the "delete" text below it.
Manager.title: Media Library - Label "delete" should be renamed to "deleting"

Manager.description: The following endpoints have been updated to accept a source parameter identifying who is making the request. This is used for certain analytics tracking by the API. Update the calls made to /read/following/mine/new and /sites/:site/follows/new to include a source parameter set to android.
Manager.title: Reader: Pass source parameter when following sites

Manager.description: User reported a transient bug in notifications: New notification shows up in the notification list. Tapping through to either, get a "not found" error. After 20 secs, it just showed blank content (on the single notification detail screen). Then it started working fine. Happened on alpha-43 (probably happen in 7.0 as well). I think there is a missing loading indicator, or it's hidden. Not sure about the "not found error". Investigation needed.
Manager.title: Recent notification "not found" and blank notifications

Manager.description: User review in the Play Store: The app was working perfectly till the last update. After the recent update I am unable to open comments written on my blog. Please fix it. This is a serious issue. In the notifications only the likes notifications opens up others show "unable to open" please fix this bug! A second one: It's not showing comments since the latest update I'm not sure if this is only related to notifications or if it's a problem in the Comment list.
Manager.title: Bug report 7.0: Unable to open comments

Manager.description: Description for optimize images setting can be accessed by long-pressing the field. While this is a common patter on Android, we should probably add a small text field (always visible) with the description text in it. See "App settings, Send Statistics".
Manager.title: Add description to "optimize images" setting item

Manager.description: Create new post Add new media Quit the editor before media has been uploaded (tap back button) Re-open the same post Tap the "retry" button on the image -> upload never end 💥 Note: it seems caused by the mCurrentUpload state not being reset after upload cancellation
Manager.title: Fail to retry media uploads

Manager.description: We've dismissed the old picture resize setting in favor of the new optimize images setting without adding anything to make it discoverable. (For the record, the old setting item wasn't hugely discoverable as well). We should ask the users whether they’d like to enable it and tell them where to change it in the future. Asking this at first image uploading in the Editor. 😕 1
Manager.title: Advertise "Optimize Images" setting

Manager.description: After a fresh install, featured image won't show up for the first time it's fetched. This is probably overlooked during fluxc integration.
Manager.title: Featured image missing in posts list

Manager.description: Expected behavior I should be able to upload Actual behavior I can not upload Steps to reproduce the behavior Take a picture, select share > WordPress and try to attach it to a post Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, latest Android, latest WordPress app. Nothing has changed from my WordPress install, I just updated the app.
Manager.title: Can no longer upload media

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect text in both the title and post content to be spellchecked, so that misspelled words are marked as such. h/t @maxme for the report. Actual behavior Only text in the post content is spellchecked/marked: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-46.
Manager.title: Aztec: Title field does not get spellcheck

Manager.description: I'm trying to upload an image from within a post or from within the Media section of the app. The image appears to upload (the progress bar fills up), but the upload fails at the last moment and returns parse error. not well formed I'm using a OnePlus 2, with version 7.0 of the app.
Manager.title: Image upload returns parse error

Manager.description: Prompt them to connect to WordPress.com but only when they try to access a .com feature (Stats / People / Notifications)
Manager.title: Allow Jetpack users to connect via XMLRPC

Manager.description: Expected When tapping the See all of your followers button link at the bottom of the Recent Followers screen, a list of all of your followers is displayed in the Followers screen. Observed An empty card is displayed on the Followers screen as shown in the screenshot below. Reproduced Go to Notifications tab. Tap Follows button. Scroll to bottom of list. Tap See all of your followers button link.
Manager.title: Followers Screen Does Not Load

Manager.description: Expected behavior Only drafts should be saved online automatically when user exits the editor. Actual behavior All posts that are not published are saved online. This can create undesired behavior for scheduled posts, for example, which should not be automatically modified online. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open @catehstn's notes post Make some changes Exit the editor without saving Notice the post gets uploaded Freak out a little 😄 1
Manager.title: Non-draft posts get saved online on back-press

Manager.description: The date shown on MediaItemFragment isn't friendly, it should be formatted using the current locale's short date format.
Manager.title: Media detail shows technical date

Manager.description: Expected behavior When in a 2FA activated account, and trying to log in to a jetpack-connected site and switching to the Authenticator app to get the 2FA code, username should be kept if already entered. Actual behavior When I switch from the WPAndroid app to the Authenticator app to get the code, then back to the WPAndroid app, the username field is emptied, and thus the login button is greyed, and I spent 5-6 seconds trying to figure why I couldn't log in until I realised the username field is getting wiped Steps to reproduce the behavior make sure you activate 2FA on your wordpress.com account Login to the wp android app by adding a jetpack connected site when the wp.com credentials are requested, and the field for entering the verification code is shown, switch to another app (i.e. to the Authenticator app to get the new code) switch back to WPAndroid to see the username field is wiped out. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.1]
Manager.title: Jetpack-connected site - username wiped in login screen if 2FA activated

Manager.description: The WP media library shows the available images but it's not possible to add an image from it.
Manager.title: Add support for WP media library

Manager.description: Reproducing Start a new post Add 5+ images to it Wait for the upload to finish Switch to HTML mode Switch back to visual Notice the images are not loaded, just placeholders
Manager.title: Post with multiple images shows only placeholders

Manager.description: Expected behavior All application sections with comments should support Likes for Jetpack sites once that feature is implemented server side.
Manager.title: Once Jetpack comment likes are launched make sure they are supported in the app

Manager.description: The font of the title is different than the post content's.
Manager.title: The post title has wrong font

Manager.description: The new draft auto-save feature, combined with this bug causes empty posts to be auto-saved when user leaves the editor with a back button.
Manager.title: Empty post is auto-saved when user leaves editor

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Type some text in the post content area Copy a word Paste it in the title area Notice the title starts with "aztec_cursor"
Manager.title: Text copy/pasted from content to title includes "aztec_cursor"

Manager.description: It looks like a change here has caused the appendMediaFile() call to be skipped for media already in the local media store (URL starts with content://media), which means those media aren't added to the editor (but are uploaded to the site anyway). Steps to reproduce the behavior When launching the native media picker, select media from a source that will provide a content://media URL (local media store). One example is the Gallery app in older stock Android. For example, in a 5.0.0 Genymotion emulator: Any media added from the 'Gallery' source should upload, but won't be added to the editor.
Manager.title: Media in local device media store aren't added to editor

Manager.description: No description provided. 👍 1
Manager.title: Drop the pre-FluxC migration code introduced for 7.0

Manager.description: Expected behavior While media is uploading in a new post in the editor, exiting the post should store it as a draft. Upon re-opening the draft, the images that were uploading should be set to 'failed', allowing me to retry to upload them. Actual behavior The post is saved to the server as a draft, with the local URL of the media file and editor-internal HTML:
Manager.title: Posts with uploading media are sent to server when leaving the editor

Manager.description: Expected behavior Copy a URL on my phone's clipboard, open a post, edit it, and highlight a word. Then click an editor toolbar icon for "Add Link" — which opens a dialog to paste in the URL, creating a hyperlink. Here's what it looks like with the Visual editor enabled. Actual behavior There's no link or button for adding a link when I enable the Aztec editor. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, WordPress for Android alpha-48.
Manager.title: Editor: with Aztec enabled, can't add a link with visual editor

Manager.description: This change is in the latest alpha but not in the release/7.2 branch, and it's needed to fix a crash when inserting media in Aztec (among other fixes).
Manager.title: Use Aztec v0.5.0-alpha.5 in 7.2

Manager.description: It looks like we haven't been setting the with_images and with_videos properties of the editor_post_published event for posts with media for any editor other than legacy. Those properties are set to true here if an uploading post has media, but that routine is only triggered for local media - which never exist at the post upload stage for the (hybrid) visual editor or for Aztec (media are already uploaded and converted to remote URLs before a post can be uploaded using those editors). cc @daniloercoli
Manager.title: Fix with_images/with_videos property tracking

Manager.description: Reproducing Type something in the visual mode Switch to HTML mode Change the text Tap back to exit the editor (without switching to the visual mode) Open the post again Notice the changes made in HTML mode are lost
Manager.title: Changes in HTML mode not saved

Manager.description: Customer reports an "unexpected end of stream" error when uploading images. This issue in Square's repo may help with the fix.
Manager.title: OkHttp "Unexpected end of stream" uploading image

Manager.description: It looks like we stopped attaching the site id to media events from the editor (EDITOR_ADDED_PHOTO_NEW, for example) about a year ago. I don't think it was intentional (unless you remember something I don't @maxme?). We should probably go back to using trackWithSiteDetails() for those events so we can use the blogid property in analytics. Events in question: EDITOR_ADDED_PHOTO_VIA_DEVICE_LIBRARY EDITOR_ADDED_VIDEO_VIA_DEVICE_LIBRARY EDITOR_ADDED_PHOTO_NEW EDITOR_ADDED_VIDEO_NEW EDITOR_ADDED_PHOTO_VIA_WP_MEDIA_LIBRARY EDITOR_ADDED_VIDEO_VIA_WP_MEDIA_LIBRARY
Manager.title: Analytics: Add site details to editor media events

Manager.description: Add a property editor_source to all editor-related analytics events so we know which editor they were using. On iOS use legacy, hybrid, and aztec values to indicate which editor. Equivalent iOS issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#7051
Manager.title: Add editor source properties to editor analytics events

Manager.description:
Mobile request originally reported by @rachelmcr Android: Autosaves empty Aztec posts Steps to reproduce:
Enable the Aztec editor. Start a new post but don’t enter any text. Exit the editor. Result: The post is autosaved as a draft even though it is empty.
Manager.title: Regression: Empty new post gets saved instead of being discarded

Manager.description: On sign out, it can be pushed once here and a second time there when we remove the sites. This creates weird behavior when the user sign out and then sign in or create a new account.
Manager.title: SignInActivity can be pushed twice to the stack

Manager.description: Post list: Button to update Scheduled posts should be labelled "save" not "publish" Example: the 2 posts on this screen are scheduled, but the first one has local change, the button to update it should say "Save", not "Publish" (misleading, user might think the post will be published as soon as it's tapped).
Manager.title: Post list: Button to update Scheduled posts should be labelled "save" not "publish"

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Launch the new picker Select the W to open the WP media library Rotate the device Picker exits and returns to editor, and "An error occurred when accessing this blog" toast is displayed Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2
Manager.title: New media picker: Rotating in WP media library exits the picker

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that if I am swiping through my notifications, leave the app, and then return to the app, I will return to the same notification where I left off. Actual behavior If I am swiping through my notifications, leave the app, and then return to the app, I see the notification where I left off for a moment and then the screen refreshes. The refresh takes me back to the first notification I viewed. h/t @catehstn for spotting this issue. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open your notifications. Tap to open a notification detail. Swipe through several notifications. Leave the app. Return to the app and wait a few seconds. Result: The screen refreshes and the first notification detail appears. (You can also see this refresh occur if you only opened one notification, but in that case nothing will change since you haven't swiped away from it.) Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-49.
Manager.title: Notifications: Loses place in notifications after leaving/returning to the app

Manager.description: The SiteModel.getUnmappedUrl() method can be used to get around the server-side issue that causes custom WordPress.com domains to load unauthenticated in the WebView. Probably anything using WPWebViewActivity.openUrlByUsingGlobalWPCOMCredentials() can be updated to use the unmapped URL if available (maybe we can refactor the method itself). See #5715 for a usage example and #5326 for some background.
Manager.title: Use unmapped URL where an authenticated WP.com WebView is needed

Manager.description: They jump to the center of the screen as soon as you tap them. https://cloudup.com/cEfj3nu1vpX
Manager.title: Media Detail Screen: small pictures are not centered in the view

Manager.description: See https://cloudup.com/c1MZNPgNaik I guess this can be fixed along with #5739 - just wanted to report both issues.
Manager.title: Media Detail Screen: landscape pictures are cropped and not scrollable horizontally

Manager.description: eg. via a download button in the full screen view toolbar for instance. Usage: my favorite pony picture is stored in my WP library, I want to download the original picture so I can edit and add filters or save it in my dropbox.
Manager.title: Add a way to share/download media from WP Media Library (Preview Screen)

Manager.description: Caused by java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'boolean java.lang.String.startsWith(java.lang.String)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.media.MediaPreviewActivity.loadImage(MediaPreviewActivity.java:308) at org.wordpress.android.ui.media.MediaPreviewActivity.onCreate(MediaPreviewActivity.java:207) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:6948) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1126) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2924) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3042) at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap14(ActivityThread.java) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1639) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6780) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1496) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1386)
Manager.title: Crash report 7.3-rc-1: NPE in MediaPreviewActivity.loadImage

Manager.description: The endpoint for reader menu items has been patched to include localized strings. We should rollback the changes made in #5240 and use the new endpoint for those strings. 👍 1
Manager.title: Use endpoint for internationlizing Reader Menu items text

Manager.description: WordPress galleries depend on shortcode support. It turns out that the Visual editor doesn't treat the [gallery] shortcode in any special way and it just adds it as a plain text. Therefore, this can be already implemented in WordPress without any changes to the library.
Manager.title: Add support for WordPress galleries

Manager.description: Captions depend on shortcode support.
Manager.title: Add support for image captions

Manager.description: We should add the ability to show/change the slug for the post just like in Calypso and in iOS.
Manager.title: Add slug to Post Settings

Manager.description: It seems there are "content loss" issues in the old visual editor, writing a new post or modifying an existing one. New post Title is missing and part of the body is also missing: https://cloudup.com/c5m5vFU83Sg Edit post Can't add new content to the body: https://cloudup.com/cH7FQt1IrzM (Sorry for the long video, in which I repeat the same action 3 or 4 times). Tested on Android 5.X
Manager.title: 7.2: Missing title and part of the content - New post in the (old) visual editor

Manager.description: Some self-hosted users with Android 7.1 are reporting that they are unable to use their sites in the app. They describe the issue like this: They add their self-hosted site to the app. The login is successful. They close the app. They reopen the app and are presented with the login screen again. When they try to log in again, they get a duplicate site error (“that site already exists in the app”). I can reproduce the issue if I log in to my Jetpack-connected site as a regular self-hosted site, without logging in to WordPress.com. (Non-Jetpack self-hosted sites work as expected, based on my testing.) Another case: the user is logged in to a different WordPress.com account in the app (not the account linked to the Jetpack site), and they are having the same problem.
Manager.title: Jetpack users logging in via their self hosted credentials get asked to sign in again

Manager.description: As reported by @designsimply - might be related to #5755 Expected behavior Removing a self hosted site should never show it again. Actual behavior Removing a self hosted site, logging out and back in shows the site again. Steps to reproduce the behavior I was able to remove a self-hosted site, but if I log out and log back in then the site is there again. Steps to reproduce: Log in to an account with a self-hosted site. Tap the W icon. Long-press on a self-hosted site. Tap “Yes” when prompted with “Remove this site from the app?” Confirm that the site was removed. Log out. Log back in. Look for the site that was previously removed. Result: after removing a self-hosted site and logging out and back in again, I can still see the site listed in the site picker. Tested on [device], Android [version]
Manager.title: Self hosted site removal not removing completely

Manager.description: Originally reported by @designsimply Expected behavior Uploading an image to the media library should also show in the image picker within the editor. Actual behavior Images uploaded from google drive to the media library do not show up in the image picker within the editor. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Media > + > Select a photo from gallery. Tap the hamburger icon at top left and select a Google Drive account with an image in it. Select an image to upload. Verify the image was uploaded to the media library. Start a new post. Tap into the content area. Tap the add media icon. Look for the image that was just added. Result: the image uploaded to Media from Google Drive wasn’t available in the photo picker in the Editor. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2] cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: New photo picker doesn't show images uploaded to WP Media Library from Google Drive

Manager.description: Make the camera icon the center icon at the bottom of the photo picker. Via @mzorz: "putting it in the middle could probably augment the information you visually have, centering the view on it, and making the W more prominent this way."
Manager.title: Re-order the photo picker icons

Manager.description: Expected behavior I don't expect to see an "Advanced" section in the settings for self-hosted (non-Jetpack) sites, since there's nothing to show there. Actual behavior The section "Advanced" appears in settings with nothing underneath it. Screenshot Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-50
Manager.title: Settings: Empty "Advanced" section appears for self-hosted sites

Manager.description: Rename site getters in the SiteStore, some of them are misleading. We probably want something like getSitesAccessedViaWpComRest and getSitesAccessedViaXMLRPC. cc @aforcier
Manager.title: Rename getSelfHostedSites, drop useless getters (getJetpackSites) in the site store

Manager.description: Self-hosted users on Android (one with app v. 7.1 and one with 7.2-rc-3) who are reporting problems updating pages in the app. In both cases, when they try to update a page their site returns the error “The post type may not be changed.” Should probably be fixed in FluxC (I guess we have to change XMLRPC params or call), worth a new connected test.
Manager.title: Can't update pages on self hosted sites

Manager.description: Make the design of the editor image settings mimic the media details by changing it into a translucent overlay. The new media metadata full-screen preview introduced in #5640 is way better than the current version (shown below) available in Visual Editors. Unfortunately, as explained here #5758 (comment), we can't reuse the same fragment, but we can try to mimic make the two UI look similar. Current version: Video of the new version: https://cloudup.com/cXwi6iFC8We
Manager.title: Make Image Settings screen mimic the Media Details screen

Manager.description: We're receiving feedback that some of the actions in the new photo picker aren't clear. Long-press multi-select isn't very discoverable for new users, and the three icons at the bottom can be confusing. After discussing various solutions, such as a help overlay, tutorial, etc., we decided on this simpler approach: Add a toast explaining long-press, "Tap and hold to select more than one photo." This should appear the first three times the feature is accessed. Change the WP media library title from "Select from media library" to "WordPress media." Change the device icon menu to show "Choose photo from device" and "Choose video from device"
Manager.title: Photo picker help

Manager.description: Noticed there’s a short delay between tapping the preview icon and the preview appearing. There is also a short delay closing the preview screen. I tested the preview screen in WP Media Library, and it works without any dealy there. Would be cool to fix this in 7.3. Otherwise let's work this in 7.4.
Manager.title: New photo picker - delay opening the preview screen

Manager.description: Expected When inserting an image from the WordPress media library, the image's HTML contains all attributes included in the Image Settings screen (i.e. title, alt text, width, and height). Observed When inserting an image from the WordPress media library, the image's HTML only contains the src attribute. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Create floating button. Tap content text field. Tap Media format button. Tap WordPress media picker button. Tap image from library. Tap HTML format button. Notice img tag and src attribute only. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.2 with WordPress alpha-50
Manager.title: Include Attributes When Inserting WordPress Image with Aztec

Manager.description: The current excerpt editor is inlined in the Post Settings. It makes the screen complicated and hard to read. To avoid this, we're going to open a dialog with a text area with a hint.
Manager.title: Post Settings: New dialog to edit the excerpt

Manager.description: Similar to #5807, instead of editing the tags inline in the Post Settings screen. We'll display them inlined but we'll allow edition in a new screen (Title, textarea with tags suggestion, hint).
Manager.title: Post Settings: New screen to edit tags

Manager.description: The current version of the Category Picker is quite ugly. Step 1: use the material grid to align everything (the tree view and the "add new category" dialog). And fix the incoherent font sizes. Step 2: make that tree view more androidy - update the indicator graphic, we might get some inspiration from https://material.io/guidelines/components/lists.html
Manager.title: Post Settings: Redesign the Category Picker

Manager.description: The Post Settings screen is very outdated and needed some design love. @mattmiklic came to the rescue and proposed some changes to match Calypso and respect Material design: Main changes: Re-ordered options Updated graphic style (coherent text size/headings/colors/margin/buttons) Options use dialogs (confirmation dialogs for most things, like we already use in Site Settings; a full screen dialog for location, tags and categories). This makes the main settings screen easier to understand at a glance. New features: (might need some work in FluxC) Stick to the front page, Pending review + Visibility (instead of current "Status"), Slug, Allow comments / Allow pingbacks (in doubt have a look at Calypso). This ticket is related to #5807 #5808 #5809 #5810
Manager.title: Post Settings: general design revamping

Manager.description: To reproduce: Scenario 1 Be signed out of the app. Use the self-hosted login form to add a self-hosted site that is connected to Jetpack. When the Site Details screen appears notice that the Configuration section and Settings option are both present. Wait a moment and rotate your device. Notice that these options have now vanished. Scenario 2 Go to your blog's wp-admin and disconnect Jetpack. Return to the app and let the updated site data sync (tap back to the site picker and then back to site details). Wait a moment and rotate the device. Notice that the Configuration section and Settings option have returned. Scenario 3 Remove the site from the app (as you can do that now). Log in again repeating the steps in Scenario 1. Notice that the Configuration section and Settings option are always present. Scenario 4 Go back to your wp-admin and reconnect Jetpack Repeat the steps in Scenario 2 Notice that the Configuration section and Settings options vanish.
Manager.title: Site Details: Configuration section and Settings option missing for self-hosted site connected to Jetpack

Manager.description: It's possible to time a sign out from WordPress.com while sites are being fetched. This can cause the fetched sites to be saved to the database right after they were cleared from the logout. The sites will appear in the site list, and can be selected. Any network requests (opening the post list, for example) to those sites will fail, as there's no token present anymore. The only way to remove the sites is to sign back in as a different account (or clear app data). The fix is mostly FluxC-side (wordpress-mobile/WordPress-FluxC-Android#433), but it looks like it will also require a few changes in WPAndroid (we'll need to have the account fetched before we call FETCH_SITES). Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign in to a self-hosted site and a WordPress.com account (the self-hosted site isn't necessary for the bug to occur, but it's the only way to observe the bug from the UI) When 15 minutes have passed since the last site fetch, resume the app from the background Resume the app and immediately sign out of WordPress.com With enough sites, or on a slow enough connection, you should end up seeing some of your WordPress.com sites still in the site list
Manager.title: 'Ghost' sites appear when logging out while fetching sites

Manager.description: Expected behavior When the "Login" button is clicked after providing credentials (i.e. mail id, password and site address), app shall proceed to login as the self hosted site is already added in the app. Actual behavior Instead of logging in to the self hosted account, the app tries to add the self hosted site to the app and returns an error message "This site already exist in the app, you can't add it" When the site already exist in the app, it shall login on supplying valid credentials. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start Wordpress app. (Self hosted site account already added to the app during previous invocation of the app) Enter email ID and click "Next" Enter password and click "Log in" Wait for login to succeed Wordpress app flashes error message "This site already exist in the app, you can't add it" and fails to login to self hosted site Tested on [device], Android [version] OnePlus One.
Manager.title: Not able to login to self hosted site account

Manager.description: We should provide a better fix for #5737. Proposed solution is below. If optimize image is ON optimize the picture and do nothing else since the picture is already rotated (if necessary) during the optimization process. The editors must use the optimized file as source of their visual objects. If optimize image is OFF -- Check the blog, if it's wpcom do nothing on the original photo. But use the EXIF metadata before adding it to the editor(s). -- If it's not on wpcom, rotate the picture, The editors must use the optimized file as source of their visual objects. Other things to do: Media Picker should use the orientation data and show thumbnail properly Media Preview screen should use orientation EXIF data and show the picture properly Media Library should take in consideration the optimize picture feature even for local device pictures MediaBrowserActivity should call the same function before adding a media from device library. Not strictly related to this PR, but we we need to provide a way of cleaning the cache folder.
Manager.title: Orientation isn't correct when uploading photos - Take 2

Manager.description: Follows from #5780 It could happen that 2 images are being uploaded, then both finish practically at the same time, then when we try to modify the post’s content (to replace the local image with the remote one) we: take the post from the db, where 2 images are local and “uploading” a) image A gets replaced with the remote one, and this gets saved into the DB b) image B gets replaced with the remote one, and this gets saved into the DB We end up having a post with image A local, and image B remote, because what was saved last is 3) with a copy of the post that had both local images only. How to solve this? We need a way to ensure that all images get saved / replacing the post content. Fortunately, the service runs as long as there’s stuff enqueued for upload. Proposed solution: In the MediaUploadService, what I’m going to do now is wait for all images in the queue (for a given post) to complete, and only then a) get a copy of the post’s content and b) make all replacements at once, then save.
Manager.title: Media Async upload: different working copies of PostModel
EditorFragment is missing the profiling stop calls

Manager.description: Expected behavior if I start a draft and do nothing, get out of the editor, we should delete the post entirely Actual behavior if I start a draft and do nothing, get out of the editor, it gets saved, so I get an empty draft in the list. Tested on [device], Android [version]
Manager.title: Don't keep an empty draft

Manager.description: Observed in #5780. Enable 'don't keep activities' Start new post, upload media While media is uploading, background the app (don't leave the editor) Wait for upload to complete The post is updated asynchronously, and the store copy of the store is updated Re-open the app The editor is recreated, but uses the PostModel it saved in onSaveInstanceState(), which doesn't have the updated post with the remote media URL We should change EditPostActivity to try and fetch the latest copy from the PostStore if it's restoring a post from saved state.
Manager.title: Media async upload: Refresh the PostModel when recreating the editor activity

Manager.description: Expected behavior After you log out and log in into the app the reader works as expected. Actual behavior After you log out and log in into the app the reader does not load any posts. Steps to reproduce the behavior Login into app, make sure that Reader is working. Log out from the app. Immediately log in again. Switch to Reader tab and confirm that posts are not loaded. Pull to refresh is not working in this case either. Tested on Google Pixel (7.1) and Genymotion Nexus 6P (7.0) with alpha-56
Manager.title: Unable to retrieve posts in Reader after relogin

Manager.description: Saw this in some production app log: There is NO match for the event EDITOR_AZTEC_TOGGLED_OFFstat. That means the track definition is incomplete.
Manager.title: Incomplete Tracks event definition for Aztec

Manager.description: As brought up in #5841 (comment) we could improve the Media Library on self-hosted sites by loading smaller images instead full pictures. We tried to use media.getThumbnailUrl, but the default thumbnails size in WordPress is 150x150px wide, that makes the media grid ugly but images load much faster (Average of 8kb images vs. 2Mb). @nbradbury suggested to load the thumbnail first, then load the larger image This could be an option, but it will not save bandwidth, since you've to download the full size pictures anyway. Not sure if we've a way to access the medium, and large, picture URLs in the app. If not, we can open a ticket in core for this. If we can access the large version of the picture, we can use the thumbnail first, and then load the large file.
Manager.title: Media Library - Improve pictures loading time/save bandwidth

Manager.description: Expected behavior Keyboard should be hidden when entering the Post Settings screen. Actual behavior Keyboard shows up with focus on the Tag input field. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to post editor Hide or show keyboard (doesn't matter) Go to Post Settings, keyboard automatically pops up Tested on Genymotion, API 23 (Android 6.0.0)
Manager.title: Keyboard shows up automatically when entering Post Settings

Manager.description: As mentioned in #5888, the MediaEditFragment could use some attention. The recent redesign of that fragment left a lot of old code intact that needs reworking, especially in regards to how the media model is loaded and the media ID is handled.
Manager.title: Refactor MediaEditFragment

Manager.description: The "Add Media" menu in the media browser uses captions that are different than those used in the new photo picker. The photo picker uses "Take photo" and "Choose photo from device" whereas the media browser uses "Capture photo" and "Choose photo from gallery." We should use the same captions in both places.
Manager.title: Inconsistent captions in media browser popup menu

Manager.description: A user requests being able to search image by name when adding an image to a post. Tested on Nexus 5, Android 7.4-rc2
Manager.title: Add search to Media Library picker from editor

Manager.description: Now that #5805 is merged, we can do away with a lot of old, unused code related to media galleries.
Manager.title: Remove unused media gallery code

Manager.description: Note This is a companion to the identically-named library issue (wordpress-mobile/AztecEditor-Android#342). Since the changes are required in the app rather than the library, an issue must be created in this repository. This cannot be completely tested until the image loading changes in the library (wordpress-mobile/AztecEditor-Android#340) are released. Expected View remains at scrolled position when uploading images. Observed View scrolls to the cursor position when uploading images below scroll position, but remains at scrolled position when uploading images above. See the animation below for example. Reproduced Place cursor near bottom of view. Tap Media format button. Choose image to insert. Scroll to top of view. Notice view is scrolled to cursor. Place cursor near top of view. Tap Media format button. Choose image to insert. Scroll to bottom of view. Notice view does not scroll to cursor. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.2 with WordPress alpha-57
Manager.title: View Scrolls to Cursor When Uploading Image Below Scroll Position

Manager.description: We've had reports that the ReaderCommentList doesn't always thread comments correctly. In some cases, child comments appear under the wrong parent.
Manager.title: Poor threading of reader comments

Manager.description: Remove Mixpanel integration. Nix Mixpanel. Get it? Related iOS issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#7211 😄 1 🎉 2
Manager.title: Nixpanel

Manager.description: We have separate "media browser" and "media gallery picker" activities, but they're both grids of WordPress media. It should be possible to unify these by adding a "picker" mode to the media browser. A side effect of this is that #5893 would be automatically taken care of. Note: #5903 should be merged before tackling this.
Manager.title: Unify media browser and media gallery picker

Manager.description: When choosing a featured image for a post, the media picker shows all file types (videos, PDFs, etc.). It should only allow choosing an image. Note: #5908 should be completed before starting on this.
Manager.title: Featured image picker should only allow choosing images

Manager.description: Only editor choice is being tracked for Aztec. We should add individual toolbar button usage analytics tracking.
Manager.title: Track toolbar button usage stats

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Switch to the visual editor by going to App Settings > Set Editor Type > Visual. Open the Photos app. Tap an image then tap the share icon and select WordPress. In the site selector, switch to a site with a really long title. Result: the blog selector arrow of can be a little hard to spot with long blog names. Tested with Pixel, Android 7.1.2, WPAndroid alpha-58.
Manager.title: "Share with WordPress" site selector arrow gets overlapped by long site titles

Manager.description: As mentioned in #5914, we should add a way to preview when choosing to insert from the WP media library.
Manager.title: Preview from media picker

Manager.description: Add a featured image to a post Sync the change Remove the featured image Sync the change Edit the same post Featured image will still be attached.
Manager.title: Can't remove featured image

Manager.description: Gridicon replacement: https://github.com/Automattic/gridicons/blob/master/svg-min/gridicons-cloud-download.svg
Manager.title: Replace the floppy disk icon used in media detail by gridicon cloud download

Manager.description: Inserting a local image (at least from some content sources) in Aztec fails to generate a thumbnail, displaying a placeholder and an error toast: The upload proceeds normally, and closing+re-opening the post (or switching to HTML mode and back) after the upload completes will show the image correctly. It looks like this call is returning a null bitmap. This is due to MediaUtils.getRealPathFromURI returning a null path. This looks to have been introduced in #5857 (ImageUtils and MediaUtils were refactored). cc @daniloercoli Steps to reproduce the behavior In Aztec, add an image Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2, alpha-58
Manager.title: Image thumbnails for uploads aren't generated in Aztec

Manager.description: Legacy editor - upload fails when media are available in post content. It seems that processPostMedia fails here. Basically MediaStore.getPostMediaWithPath(mPost.getId(), imageUri) does return null.
Manager.title: Legacy editor - can't post with media

Manager.description: It seems that the media "state label" is left aligned when too long for a single line. cc @nbradbury Tested on Android 5.0.2
Manager.title: Media Library - Alignment issue on media state label

Manager.description: When canceling a media upload from the editor (Aztec or visual), it's correctly removed the post and the network request is cancelled, but the media item continues to show up in the media library. There's no obvious way to remove it (it can be done by long-pressing until a trash icon appears in the action bar) - but it shouldn't appear in the first place.
Manager.title: Cancelled media uploads from editor remain in Media Library

Manager.description: Right now when a post doesn't have a featured image assigned, the reader scans the content looking for the largest image to use as a featured image. This requires the images to have height and width attributes (or w= and h= query params). If a post doesn't have images sizes, then no image will be featured. In this situation we should rescan the images and check whether one has the size-full class. If it does, it should be suitable as a featured image. Corresponding iOS issue here
Manager.title: Reader should consider image class when choosing featured image

Manager.description: Expected behavior To be able to choose the orientation of my device Actual behavior When opening a video in the Media Library the device orientation is forced to landscape. This is especially awkward if the video was recorded in portrait, where the video playback itself is forced to the far left of the screen. Steps to reproduce the behavior Navigate to Site -> Media Open a video Tested on Nexus 6P, Android O (beta build OPP2.170420.019), wp-android alpha-58
Manager.title: Don't force landscape orientation when viewing videos in Media Library

Manager.description: When viewing the reader comment list, the comment count isn't always correct. The post should be updated when this activity is opened to ensure we have the latest comment count.
Manager.title: Reader comment count inaccurate

Manager.description: After signing out of WordPress.com, signing back into a 2FA account leaves you stuck in an endless sign in loop. After inserting your username and password, instead of the 2FA code prompt showing up you get this: The same thing happens if the wrong credentials are entered - the error messages are displayed briefly and then you're sent back to a screen with just the username field. It looks like the problem might be that WPMainActivity also receives the OnAuthenticationChanged event with error (NEEDS_2FA, or another sign-in error), which ends up launching a new SignInActivity with the 'Log in again to continue' message. (On a clean install, or if the app is stopped after sign out, WPMainActivity is not yet running, so this bug doesn't happen.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign into a WordPress.com account (2fa or not does not matter) Sign out of WordPress.com 3a. Attempt to sign into a WordPress.com account with 2fa (using username + password) 3b. Alternatively, enter an invalid username/password and attempt to sign in Reported by @elibud. Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2, WordPress 7.4
Manager.title: Unable to sign in to 2FA accounts under some circumstances

Manager.description: The media download feature relies on the Android DownloadManager, which shows a notification when the download starts. We had a report of this notification not appearing for as long as 30 seconds, so the user thinks tapping the save icon does nothing. We should resolve this by showing a toast when the download starts. The toast that appears when the download completes should be removed, to avoid a quick download resulting in two rapid toasts.
Manager.title: Show toast when media download starts

Manager.description: Expected behavior If I'm already logged into the app and want to add a new site I would expect it to be the selected site when returning to the main (tab) activity. Actual behavior The previously selected site stays selected after adding a new one. Steps to reproduce the behavior Login to WP.com Add a new self-hosted site via the Site Picker Return to the main activity Result -> My WP.com site is still selected Tested on Genymotion, Android 4.1.1 (API 16)
Manager.title: Self hosted site should be selected after authentication via Site Picker

Manager.description: Expected behavior After removing a site via the Site Picker I should either return to the picker or the main activity. Actual behavior When the site is removed another Site Picker activity slides in on top of the existing one. Both instances must be closed to return to the main activity. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add a self-hosted site Long press on it in the site picker and remove it Tested on Genymotion, Android 4.1.1 (API 16)
Manager.title: Two instances of SitePickerActivity when removing a site

Manager.description: Expected behavior After I log in I expect my default site to be selected. Actual behavior The site displayed initially is my sandbox (self hosted + Jetpacked linked to my account), which I almost never use, I have no idea why. Steps to reproduce the behavior Log in to your account and then check to which site you are redirected. If it works correctly for you, ping me and we can troubleshoot together.
Manager.title: Default selected website after logging in

Manager.description: After the recent changes to the media selection, it looks like when you add an image to a post in legacy editor, it just shows a placeholder image. We got some reports about this through Helpshift.
Manager.title: Can't insert images to the legacy editor

Manager.description: Expected behavior To be able to manually refresh the sites list (ala pull-to-refresh). Useful when you know there is a new site and want to update to it. Actual behavior The app will need to be killed to refresh or need to wait for the 15mins-after-last-update to pass to auto-refresh. Test on WP v7.4
Manager.title: No manual refresh of the sites list

Manager.description: Expected behavior While the device is in landscape, previewing a portrait video in the media picker should display OK, possibly with the video centered on the screen. Actual behavior The video is left aligned on the screen Tested on WP v7.4
Manager.title: Media picker: portrait video doesn't preview correctly in landscape

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a new photo is shot via the media picker, the photo should also be available in device's local gallery. Actual behavior The new photo is only available through the WP Media Library. Tested on WP v7.4
Manager.title: Photo shot via the media picker does not appear in device's local gallery

Manager.description: After adding a self hosted site I get a screen with a list of my added site and a done button. The done button does nothing. Demo video: https://cloudup.com/cqojTNnCj0q Note: If I kill the app and restart it, my self hosted site is accessible from the picker.
Manager.title: Can't complete the process to add a self hosted site

Manager.description: Expected While viewing the notification details, returning to the app after putting it in the background (e.g. home button, recents button, lock screen) momentarily does not refresh the notification detail screen. Observed Returning to the app after putting it in the background (e.g. home button, recents button, lock screen) momentarily refreshes the notification detail screen. Some cursory troubleshooting suggests NotificationsDetailActivity.onEventMainThread is called upon return due to NotificationsDetailActivity.onStart. It seems like an unwanted experience if I’m reading a post, switch to another app, switch back to WordPress quickly, and lose my reading position when the screen refreshes. Reproduced Go to Notifications tab. Tap any notification. Scroll to middle of notification detail. Tap recents navigation button. Tap WordPress app in list. Notice notification detail screen is refreshed. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.2 with WordPress alpha-58
Manager.title: Do Not Refresh Notification Detail Screen When Returning to the App

Manager.description: The force-enable feature for Aztec introduced by #6004 was a one-time deal and should be reversed in 7.6.
Manager.title: Revert force-enable of Aztec

Manager.description: Adding an image and then exiting the editor during the upload saves the local storage path as URL, which is incorrect.
Manager.title: Wrong image URL

Manager.description: Under some circumstances, it's possible for the revamped share dialog to load with no pre-selected option: It looks like the cause is that we're using the resource ID stored in preferences to remember the user's choice, but resource IDs can change between different builds. Steps to reproduce the behavior Install a clean beta or release build of the app (I used 7.5 release) Share a photo to the app Notice "New post" is pre-selected Complete the share, adding the photo to either a new post or the media library Without uninstalling or clearing data, install an alpha build with a higher version (I used alpha-59) Share a photo to the app Notice no option is selected, and quickly tapping Share shows a toast 'Unrecognized action requested, ignoring' cc @tonyr59h
Manager.title: Share to WordPress Dialog can load with no default

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I unset a featured image and delete it from the post I expect the post list to remove the featured image thumbnail when I return to it. Actual behavior Unsetting the featured image Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a post with an image and set the featured image to that image Publish/Save/Update the post to return to the post list -> Post list item correctly shows image Edit the post, removing the image from the body and unsetting the featured image Update the post -> Post list item still shows featured image Note: If the list is refreshed or the user exits and returns to the list it will correctly display no featured image. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, alpha-59
Manager.title: Post list doesn't remove featured image when returning from the editor

Manager.description: Coming from #5880 (comment) Expected behavior Exiting the editor while media in it is uploading, then losing connectivity should not leave the post in "uploading" mode forever. Actual behavior Turning airplane mode ON after exiting the Editor leaves the post list with the new post with the spinning wheel forever, see video here https://cloudup.com/ct3G73l8-Hd Steps to reproduce the behavior Create or edit a post, and add media While media are uploading, exit the Editor The post should be in 'Uploading' state in the post list Turn airplane mode ON wait a bit and turn it back on You won't be able to re-open the post, as it stays in "uploading" mode ever since having exited the editor Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.2.1]
Manager.title: Losing connectivity while post is uploading leaves it in uploading state forever

Manager.description: Expected behavior When accessing the Pages section, Pages should be shown. Actual behavior When accessing the Pages section, Posts are shown instead. Steps to reproduce the behavior Tap My Site. Tap Pages. The message Fetching posts will be displayed. Then the list of Blog Posts will appear instead of Pages. Tested on SM-G935P, Android 7.0
Manager.title: Pages section loads Posts instead of Pages

Manager.description: Update media format button in the editor format toolbar with gridicons-add-outline icon.
Manager.title: Format Toolbar Redesign: Update Media Format Button

Manager.description: Update heading menu format button in the editor format toolbar with gridicons-heading, gridicons-heading-h1, gridicons-heading-h2, gridicons-heading-h3, gridicons-heading-h4, gridicons-heading-h5, gridicons-heading-h6 icons. When the text selection contains one of the heading formats or a heading is selected from the popup menu, the heading menu format button icon is replaced by the associated heading icon.
Manager.title: Format Toolbar Redesign: Update Heading Menu Format Button

Manager.description: Once a user has shared to the WordPress app before, updating to the latest version breaks it. I believe this is because we should clear the existing stored pref wp-settings-share-last-used-image-addto once on app update, to clear away any saved value using a resource id instead of an int constant. (ref #6025) Steps to reproduce the behavior Install a clean alpha-59 Share a photo to the app, and complete the action Install alpha-60 Share a photo to the app again Notice that a selection is made, but pressing the 'Share' button shows a toast 'Unrecognized action requested, ignoring' Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2 cc @tonyr59h
Manager.title: Share to WordPress can break after app upgrade

Manager.description: We currently retrieve the default post format from the SiteSettingsInterface as can be seen from here. However, this only works if the user has opened the Site Settings page first and at least tapped on the default post format once. We should re-fetch the site settings before creating a new post and make sure the default post format is up-to-date. This setting is meaningless if it doesn't work properly for new posts and if we default to "Standard" as the first option. This should be done before the Post Settings revamp is finished. /cc @tonyr59h
Manager.title: Default Post Format should be set while instantiating a new post

Manager.description: Add horizontal rule format button to the editor format toolbar using gridicons-minus icon.
Manager.title: Format Toolbar Redesign: Add Horizontal Rule Format Button

Manager.description: Expected behavior You should be able to start a draft, change the status from "Publish" to "Draft" and hit Save. Actual behavior Saving an empty draft where the only change made was to change the status to draft. A message saying “Can’t publish an empty post” is shown, regardless of whether the publish date is Now or in the future. It does get saved as a “Local Draft”, though. When I add a tag it saves just fine. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new draft Tap on the settings wheel on the upper-right corner of the screen change the Status from Publish to Draft Tap on SAVE (upper right corner of the screen) the toast Can’t publish an empty post is shown Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Saving an empty draft shows error

Manager.description: Expected behavior Tapping on a image on the Visual Editor should allow to edit the image settings (name, etc). Actual behavior If you insert an image from the native photo picker, tap Edit, and nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start drafting a new post Add an image by tapping on the media icon Once the image finishes uploading, tap on it. The "Edit" overlay is shown Tap on "Edit" and nothing happens. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.2.1]
Manager.title: Not able to edit an image in a post - Visual Editor

Manager.description: We're not tracking when the user accepts or denies permission to access the camera, storage, or location. This would be helpful in determining the success of soft asks.
Manager.title: Track permissions

Manager.description: Photo picker - show "soft ask" where photos would appear - PR #6067 Photo picker - don't request camera permission until user taps camera icon - PR #6090 Media browser > Add Media - don't request permission until after user taps menu item, show soft ask when camera permissions denied - PR #6090 Post settings > Add Location - show soft ask when location permission denied - PR #6090 ShareIntentReceiverActivity - show soft ask when storage permission denied - PR #6090 Media preview > Download - show soft ask when storage permission denied - PR #6090 #6059 - track permissions - PR #6090 #6063 - store when a permission is asked - PR #6064
Manager.title: Soft Asks Punch List

Manager.description: In order to determine whether a user has permanently denied a permission (ie: denied it and checked "never ask again" in the native permissions dialog), we need to use ActivityCompat.shouldShowRequestPermissionRationale(). If it returns false, then the permission has been permanently denied - with the annoying caveat that it always returns false if the app has never asked for that permission before. To work around this, we need to store (in prefs) whether a permission has been asked for. This will be used in the "soft asks" project.
Manager.title: Store when a permission is asked

Manager.description: Expected behavior Have the app interface displayed in the chosen in-app language setting. Actual behavior The chosen language settings sticks for some languages, but not others. Issues encountered for these languages: Hebrew, Chinese (zh-hk, zh-cn, or zh-tw). Steps to reproduce the behavior Device language setting: English (US) 1- App Settings > Interface Language, choose a language like Hebrew, Chinese (zh-hk, zh-cn, or zh-tw), the dashboard then shows in the chosen language. 2- Close the app 3- Open it again, the dashboard has reverted to English (US) Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung S7 Edge, Android 7.0
Manager.title: In-app language settings not sticking for some languages

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I navigate the Reader in the Android app with a screen reader, I expect to find more context on buttons. Actual behavior I found the "Visit" icon button was unlabeled. The word "Visit" lacked context for a screen reader user. I want to know what I'm visiting. This can be combined into one button, labeled with "Visit Post Title Name" "Post Title Name" can be hidden visually. The Likes button should be labeled with Like "Post Title Name" Has 77 Likes. Or Like "Post Title Name" No Likes yet. You could also communicate state here. So if a post is in a liked state, it could say: Like "Post Title Name" Pressed Has 77 Likes (or No Likes yet). Similarly with the Comments button, it needs a more specific label. Comment on "Post Title Name" The More button is labeled, but could use more context. "Follow Site Menu" maybe? Steps to reproduce the behavior Start Talk Back Open WordPress app Open Reader. Begin navigating a list of post by swiping right to navigate forward, reaching the action button area. Tested on [device], Android [version] Tested on Nexus 6P, Version Alpha-60. 🎉 1
Manager.title: Reader: Add more context to action buttons on posts

Manager.description: Expected behavior The main menu links in the app, which is similar to the menu on WordPress.com could use more context beyond My Sites, Reader, etc. See: https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/a70587157b33783ba4d5e0e4a1e136680d459d51/client/layout/masterbar/logged-in.jsx and https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/blob/a70587157b33783ba4d5e0e4a1e136680d459d51/client/layout/masterbar/logged-out.jsx for strings to be consistent. Example, for My Sites, it can say My Sites (Visually hidden: View a list of your sites and access their dashboards). Actual behavior I get My Sites, Reader, Me, etc. Which is fine, but the extra context would help screen reader users know better what to expect when visiting each page. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start Talk Back Open WordPress app Open Reader. Begin navigating a list of post by swiping right to navigate forward, reaching the main menu. Tested on [device], Android [version] Tested on Nexus 6P, Version Alpha-60.
Manager.title: Masterbar: Add more context to main menu

Manager.description: Add ellipsis icons for expand/collapse buttons and aztec:advanced attribute to AztecToolbar view.
Manager.title: Format Toolbar Redesign: Add Advanced Toolbar Toggle

Manager.description: Update editor format toolbar buttons to 48dp x 48dp and icons to 18dp x 18dp to meet accessibility guidelines.
Manager.title: Format Toolbar Redesign: Update Button and Icon Size

Manager.description: Expected behavior Entering the Editor for a new Post and immediately exiting shouldn't add a new draft to the Posts list Actual behavior Entering the Editor for a new Post and immediately exiting creates a new empty draft post in the Posts list. Steps to reproduce the behavior Tap on the floating "write" button When the editor is shown, tap "back" Observe there's a new empty "(Untitled)" draft pos in the posts list. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.1]
Manager.title: Empty draft should be deleted automatically

Manager.description: Expected behavior Tapping on a image on the Aztec Editor should allow to edit the image settings (name, etc). Actual behavior If you insert an image from the native photo picker, tap Edit, and nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start drafting a new post Add an image by tapping on the media icon Once the image finishes uploading, tap on it. Nothing happens. Tested on [ Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge Duos], Android [7.0], 7.6-rc-2 Please note this is a sister issue with #6049, but observed in Aztec. Also note I haven't been able to reproduce this on the following handsets: Google Pixel, Android 7.1.1 emulator: Samsung Galaxy S3, Android 4.2.2
Manager.title: Not able to edit an image in a post - Aztec

Manager.description: Add analytics tracking for the following features: Number of taps on each format toolbar button. Amount of time spent viewing collapsed toolbar. Amount of time spent viewing expanded toolbar. Amount of time spent viewing visual view. Amount of time spent viewing HTML view. Note Time-based analytics have been pushed to a subsequent iteration.
Manager.title: Format Toolbar Redesign: Add Format Usage Analytics

Manager.description: The Switch Site button is currently 38dp; it should be increased to 48px to match the Material Design recommended touch targets.
Manager.title: My Sites: increase size of Switch Site button to meet recommended size

Manager.description: The avatar on the Me screen should have a content description set, so that users of screen readers know what it is. I recommend calling it "Profile Photo" to match the label we use in Calypso.
Manager.title: Me: add a content description to the Gravatar for screen readers

Manager.description: Expected behavior When I create a new post and submit it, it should be submitted as "Published". Also, when I modify a post status to "Published" this should be reflected. Actual behavior New posts and modified post statuses are published as "Pending Review". The only way to get a post into the "Published" state is to use the "Publish" function on the posts listing screen after tapping on "More". Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post, add a headline and use the "Submit" button in the header (note that on WordPress.com and Jetpack blogs this is a "Publish" button). Tested on Xperia X Compact, Android 7.0, WordPress alpha-60 This is on a WordPress 4.8 install without Jetpack.
Manager.title: .org: New Posts are always posted Pending Review

Manager.description: I think something changed when we switched to vector drawables, the rotate animation is now decentered and feels clumsy, see it in action here. It looks better in the Reader (same kind of animation, icon is smaller but seems centered correctly).
Manager.title: Clumsy like animation on comments

Manager.description: This was an oversight on my part. When storage permission has been permanently denied, the message in the photo picker needs to make it clear the user needs to enable storage permission.
Manager.title: Reword permission denied message in photo picker

Manager.description: In the recently merged sharing feature, we neglected to update the site settings table to include the new columns. This causes the app to crash when editing sharing button prefs.
Manager.title: WordPressDB needs to include sharing columns

Manager.description: Expected behavior After logging in to WordPress.com and dismissing the epilogue screen, rotating the device while on the main app's screen (say, on MySite) should still show the main app screen. Actual behavior The epilogue screen re-appears on rotation. Steps to reproduce the behavior Log into WordPress.com Dismiss the login epilogue screen when it appears. Notice you're now on the main app's screen. Rotate the device and notice the login epilogue screen re-appearing Tested on the feature/new-login branch.
Manager.title: Login rework: Rotation re-opens the epilogue screen

Manager.description: Tap Sharing on the My Site tab Tap Manage Tap any setting that opens a dialog Rotate the device The dialog disappears
Manager.title: Sharing: rotation closes settings dialog

Manager.description: Google recently disabled OAuth requests from WebViews, which means given our current design we can no longer support G+ in sharing/publicize. Down the road we may want to support Google Sign-in to re-enable G+ support, but for now we should remove G+ from this feature in the Android app.
Manager.title: Remove Google+ from Sharing

Manager.description: Tracks the tasks for the post/media redesign for the async project. A work in progress - line items will be added/updated as we scope out the full extent of the required changes. Completed by Async MVP (first alpha release) General: #6233 Display/update snackbar when uploading/exiting the editor #6252 Confirm success/failure notifications both direct the user to the post list for that site #6246 Fix a race condition when uploading 2 posts with media and making one of them fail to update the post remotely #6424 Possibly drop the dialog shown when tapping an error notification, instead relying on the updated messaging in the post card itself (see 'Post list' section below) Post list: #6294 Update post list messaging for uploading media: #6290 Display infinite progress bar for uploading media #6298 revert to stock progress bar drawables #6343 Update progress bar for uploading media from indeterminate to determinate (prerequisite: ref): #6333 Update messaging for failed uploads, and use 'Retry' instead of 'Publish' in the buttons Other items: #6297 Determine what should happen when pressing Delete/Trash while the post has uploading media (ref) #6306/#6385 Implement Dialog to ask user if they want to cancel a progressing Post Upload when they tap Delete/Trash (comes from #6297) #6425 Extend the snackbar functionality to the Main activity (right now it only happens when exiting the editor having entered it from within the Posts list screen) 👍 1
Manager.title: Async Design Master Issue

Manager.description: Implement editor promotion dialog and setting footer design as outlined by @iamthomasbishop. Promotion Dialog Setting Footer Update promotion dialog layout (issue, pull request) Add footer to editor setting (issue, pull request)
Manager.title: Editor Promotion Redesign: Master

Manager.title: Editor Promotion Redesign: Add Footer to Editor Setting

Manager.description: Expected behavior The user should be able to add a video to the post without be blocked for the long time taken by optimization process. In details The user select a video. The "editor" makes the thumbnail from the original file and add it to the content area. The original file is enqueue for optimize+upload. The optimize is done in background and when it ends the new file is actually enqueue in FluxC to be uploaded on the server. UI wise Since the video optimization process is GPU/CPU expensive, and we don't know upfront how long it will take, we should use the progress bar available on the top of the image as undefined progress indicator, when the optimization progress ends, we can reset the progress indicator and use it as usual. Actual behavior Optimization (when enabled on video) is a block task. A progress dialog is shown and it will stay there until the video is optimized, then it's enqueued for upload and you're back to the normal flow. Note that video optimization is only available on alpha releases and debug builds.
Manager.title: Async - Integrate video optimization

Manager.description: iOS mimics Calypso and wp-admin and adds the default size class size-full when the user inserts an image in the editor. The size class can be changed afterward via the edit image feature. This is required because the size class satisfies the selection logic for choosing a photo to show in the post list cards.
Manager.title: Add a size class when adding an image

Manager.description: Expected behavior When you start a draft and start uploading media, leaving it in the background, and the process finishes (media is finished uploading and post is finished being updated) the notification should read "Post updated" Actual behavior We’re using Post published in the success notification, even when the post actually is just a draft NOTE: only applicable to feature/async-media branch Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft include one or 2 pictures in it exit the editor as the pictures are being uploaded asyncrhonously when the process ends, the Post published notification is shown. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Upload notification says "Post Published" for drafts

Manager.description: The magnifying glass icon is generally reserved for searching. Gridicons already has a view-fullscreen icon, I think we should use it in this context. The bottom toolbar isn’t using Gridicons for the image or camera icons; we should swap these out. ❤️ 1
Manager.title: Photo picker design tweaks

Manager.description: Replace the current media browser dropdown filter with a TabBar that mimic the Calypso filter.
Manager.title: Replace media browser filter

Manager.description: A user reported that country map doesn't load fine on their device. Nothing is tracked in the internal webview callbacks logging. SGH-T889 android - 4.3 We should improve the logging, and make sure the map is hidden on first load. I bet the issue reported by the user is due to the internal webview, that doesn't load fine due to the old android version.
Manager.title: Android: Country map doesn’t load

Manager.description: Fatal Exception: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.publicize.services.PublicizeUpdateService.onHandleIntent(PublicizeUpdateService.java:69) at android.app.IntentService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(IntentService.java:65) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:60)
Manager.title: Crash report 7.7-rc-2: NPE in PublicizeUpdateService.onHandleIntent

Manager.description: For certain screen sizes, the last icon in the visual editor toolbar can appear squashed: This is due to the sizing changes here, which were intended for Aztec but also affect the visual editor as the dimensions and resources are shared. The visual editor has several layouts for different screen sizes, which rely on the total width of the toolbar icons, and the increase to 48dp threw those off. The simplest fix is to add the old icons back with different naming, use those in the visual editor, and delete them when Aztec replaces the visual editor. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S3, Android 4.2.2
Manager.title: Visual editor toolbar icons appear squashed

Manager.description: Right now search in the media browser only matches on title, which isn't that useful. It should also match on description, caption, and mime type (so, for example, I could search for "pdf" to see all PDF files).
Manager.title: Improve media search

Manager.description: Expected behavior Part 1: If you start uploading an image in a Post, and you lose connectivity (for instance, by turning airplane mode ON), the upload should be marked FAILED so the user can retry uploading at a later time when connectivity is regained. Part 2: Then also the user should be allowed to start any other uploads on that same or any other posts. Actual behavior Part 1: The upload gets stuck there after losing connectivity, when the actual upload should FAIL (happens for both Aztec and Visual editors, I believe this is a FluxC thing to take care of, but should be investigated deeply) Part 2: if you try and upload one image, then turn airplane mode ON, exit, turn airplane mode off, start another different new draft, attempt to insert a new image -> the image shows a small progress on the screen but never really uploads anything and doesn’t notify the user about it, the logs show this: 06-26 15:05:07.556 30900-30900/org.wordpress.android.beta I/WordPress-MEDIA: Ignoring request to uploadNextInQueue, only one media item can be uploaded at a time. There’s no way to recover from this unless stopping / restarting the app. Steps to reproduce the behavior Part 1: start an upload, let it progress a bit, turn airplane mode ON Observe it gets stuck there Part 2: After completing steps 1-4: 5. start a new draft 6. try inserting an image using the media picker 7. watch it have an initial progress and get stuck there forever. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media upload: connectivity loss leaves upload in inconsistent state

Manager.description: For instance the "Language" setting doesn't exist on Jetpack sites (see Calypso site settings).
Manager.title: Jetpack: Some Site Settings should be hidden on Jetpack Sites

Manager.description: This one comes from a ticket in Calypso: Automattic/wp-calypso#8078 Expected behavior Stats should be hidden for non-admin/editor roles on .com sites. Actual behavior Stats are not hidden for non-admin/editor roles on .com sites. Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign in as a contributor to a .com site and notice that Stats is still available
Manager.title: Hide stats for users who are not admins/editors

Manager.description: Expected behavior If I attempt to add media to the library/post I should be notified that I lack permissions to do so and the media should not be added to the list/post. An actionable message should be shown via toast/dialog detailing the lack of permissions and what they can do to gain them. Something like: You user role restricts media uploads. Please contact your site administrator to request access to this feature. cc @mattmiklic Actual behavior I'm able to add media to the library but the upload fails with a permissions issue. The failed media is added to the post/library but will always fail to upload. The error message toasted is appropriate but media should never get to the point of attempting an upload we know will fail. Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign in as a contributor to a site Add media to library or a post
Manager.title: Prevent media uploads for users without permission

Manager.description: Suggested feature: The ability to swipe between comments in the Comments section. Given we have this already there for Notifications, it might make sense that we add this for Comments as well. Internal ref: p4a5px-1Pg-p2 / 198119-h
Manager.title: Comments: Add swipe between comments
