Manager.title: [Media Crash] Saving media to device : java.lang.IllegalStateException

Manager.description: I noticed that the state label of new media items are not correctly shown in WP Media Library. Try to add a item to the WP Library by taking a new picture. When the picture is took, it is then added and shown in the media grid with the enqueued state label on it. That's ok The state label is then stuck into Enqueued state, even though in the log I see the uploading in progress. When the upload finishes the state is correctly refresh. See the video linked here: https://cloudup.com/cntO_JfoKzQ Tested on Android 5.0 cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Adding new picture to WP Media Library doesn't show the correct uploading state

Manager.description: This is a weird one. Steps to repro: Open WP Media Library Tap on the + sign to add a media When the option menu is on the screen tap back Nothing happens. The only option is to close the app. https://cloudup.com/cbTWZK8Bft0 Tested on Android 5 and Android 4.3 cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Adding media to WP Media Library can freeze the app to death

Manager.description: Add what's new interface as shown in the screenshot below. [Screenshot]
Manager.title: Editor Promotion Redesign: What's New Interface

Manager.description: It seems that some Samsung devices record new video with the format video/3gpp, when the video is taken right within the wp-app. This lead to the "unsupported format" error, thrown by FluxC, since video/3gpp mime type is not whitelisted. A fix for this in hitting FluxC shortly. We just need to upgrade the FluxC hash then.
Manager.title: Can't upload video recorded in the app (Samsung edition)

Manager.description: Jetpack does not have an option to change the language so we should remove it from Site Settings.
Manager.title: Jetpack: Hide language setting in Site Settings for Jetpack sites

Manager.description: We should add more information about Jetpack sites to help Happiness Engineers create happiness. Jetpack installed Jetpack connected ...? cc @maxme
Manager.title: Add more Jetpack meta-data to Helpshift tickets

Manager.description: #5122 will be used to track browsing/displaying themes and should be completed as a pre-requisite to this issue. This issue is for handling theme activation.
Manager.title: Jetpack: Allow themes to be activated on Jetpack sites

Manager.description: Jetpack sites should show a new row on My Sites for managing plugins. Activate/deactivate Toggle auto-update Update
Manager.title: Jetpack: Browse and manage plugins installed on Jetpack sites

Manager.description: Monitor uptime - #6273 Send Notification via e-mail - #6273 Send app Notification - #6273 Prevent brute force attacks - #6408 Whitelisted IP addresses - #6408 - [ ] Spam filtering - Probably not implementing Allow login with .com credentials - #6440 Match accounts using e-mail - #6440 Require 2FA - #6440 Learn More - #6553 Problems to address before merging: Sanitize Whitelist IP's/ranges - #6571 Verify app update path Nest views of nested preferences - #6571 Improve error handling - #6579
Manager.title: Jetpack: Add Jetpack Security Settings

Manager.description: There are several strings in the editor library's strings.xml that should be copied over to the main project's strings.xml, in order for them to be translated. Some of these are new with Aztec, some have been without translation for a while (some pruning of this list might be needed):
Manager.title: Import translatable strings from the editor lib's strings.xml

Manager.description: Expected behavior The tracks event wpandroid_notifications_replied_to should have a field containing the blogid and commentid for the blog and comment that the reply is in reference to. Actual behavior In the Tracks table, these fields are either NULL and not entered. From a live sample of events in Tracks (https://mc.a8c.com/tracks/live/?eventname=wpandroid_notifications_replied_to) anonid: NULL blogid: NULL bloglang: NULL blogtimezone: NULL browserdocumentlocation: NULL browserdocumentreferrer: NULL browserfamily: Other browserfamilyversion: Other browserlang: en_US browserplatform: NULL browserscrollx: 0 browserscrolly: 0 browsertimezone: NULL browsertype: php-agent
Manager.title: Add comment_id and blog_id fields to wpandroid_notifications_replied_to event

Manager.description: If an error occurs refreshing the media library, the error_refresh_media message that appears in MediaGridFragment could be better. And we should get rid of the toast displayed by MediaBrowserActivity in this situation.
Manager.title: Improve the error message after failed media list refresh

Manager.description: We should identify CONNECTION_ERRORs for media uploads from FluxC (pending wordpress-mobile/WordPress-FluxC-Android#505, we'll get those in the OnMediaUploaded events when the network goes down during a media upload), and show a distinct message in error notifications and the visual editor failure overlay: (This is what we currently show, as they're being reported as GENERIC_ERRORs and we just show the raw error message.)
Manager.title: Handle new media upload errors

Manager.description: Expected behavior Uploading a post and getting an error during upload should save the intact failed post as a local draft (or a locally changed post). Actual behavior The post is saved as a local draft, but any changes since the last save are gone. I believe we used to update the local copy immediately before attempting to upload, but we don't seem to anymore. Steps to reproduce the behavior Write a short new post Publish it and induce an upload error Notice that the post is saved as an empty local draft
Manager.title: Post upload errors cause content loss

Manager.description: using branch feature/async-media Confirm success/failure notifications both direct the user to the post list for that site CASE A SUCCESS: choose a site start a new post start a media upload for that post exit the editor repeat steps 1-4 with another site wait till 2 “Post uploaded” notifications are shown. now tap on the finish notification for the first post observe the user is taken to the post list for that site now tap on the finish notification for the second post observe the user is taken to the post list for that site. CASE B FAILURE: choose a site start a new post start a media upload for that post exit the editor repeat steps 1-4 but switching to another site make both uploads fail, for example by interrupting the network connection. Wait till 2 “Upload failed” notifications are shown. now tap on the error notification for the first post observe the user is taken to the post list for that site now tap on the error notification for the second post observe the user is taken to the post list for that site.
Manager.title: Media: confirm notifications tap actions

Manager.description: When fetching more in the media browser, there's no loading spinner letting the user know anything is happening.
Manager.title: Media browser doesn't show loading spinner

Manager.description: On some displays, the filenames in the media browser are cut off.
Manager.title: Media filename is cut off

Manager.description: WordPressMediaUtils.getPlaceholder() needs to be changed to return gridicons rather than the outdated icons we currently return.
Manager.title: Media placeholders should use gridicons

Manager.description: Right now the media browser shows a placeholder icon for videos, but we should be showing thumbnails when available. Note that before this can be tackled, we'll need to fix this on the FluxC side first.
Manager.title: Media browser should show video thumbnails

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce use branch feature/async-media make 2 posts, include media in each, exiting the editor while it is still uploading media. once the first post finishes with ERROR (make the POST upload fail), and the PostUploadService wants to get the next one to upload, it’s still gotten pending media uploading, so the PostUploadService exits, and this second post is never actually even attempted to be sent. Also, the notification remains in the "Uploading media…" state.
Manager.title: Media: race condition when uploading 2 posts with media

Manager.description: When previewing a video from the media browser, there should be a progress spinner while the media loads.
Manager.title: Media video preview needs loading progress

Manager.description: Expected behavior If an upload is in progress and you exit the editor (Aztec), then the media upload fails, then get back into the editor, the image should be shown/marked as available for retry (i.e. marked failed) Actual behavior The image is shown as being still in upload progress, which is incorrect. Steps to reproduce the behavior on branch feature/async-media open a new draft include an image to upload while it's uploading, exit the editor make the image upload fail (i.e. turn airplane mode on) get back to the editor see the image is shown as "still uploading" Proposed solutions We considered 2 options: either the AztecEditorFragment is in charge of this, and when it opens up again, we should check if there’s any canceled images and mark them properly, or when the MediaUploadService service is done with something and ends in error, we can do the same as we were doing for the success case: go ahead and call a static method in AztecEditorFragment that properly replaces the class properties for error ones The PR tackling this, if not otherwise noted, should go with option number 2 Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media async: adjust cancelled uploads when coming back to Aztec

Manager.description: In #6245 we added video thumbnails with a "player" overlay. When used as a picker (to insert media into a post), tapping this overlay does nothing. In addition, having both the player icon and preview icon showing takes up too much space.
Manager.title: Video overlay in media library does nothing when used as a picker

Manager.description: I have problems inserting media (already uploaded to WP) into a post. See the video here: https://cloudup.com/cJ3K7tjk1u0 I got the error inserting media error message and wan't able to add it. Triggering the load more seems to fix the issue. It seems a bit spotty though. cc @nbradbury Edit: It seems to fail here: WordPress-Android/WordPress/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/ui/media/MediaBrowserActivity.java Line 554 in 149e02c if (media == null) {
Manager.title: Error while inserting pre-existing media into a post

Manager.description: Originally coming from this comment by @aforcier The notification when the upload completes has the wrong message in some cases. We don't get 'Draft uploaded' messages when a post is saved as a remote draft. I think this is because we shouldn't run this check if the post is a DRAFT, as mIsFirstTimePublish == false always for remote drafts. We're not flagging first time publishing (and thus also not tracking analytics) at all when uploading from the post list - we should do a check here and use PostUploadService.addPostToUploadAndTrackAnalytics() instead where applicable
Manager.title: Media: improve upload notification messages

Manager.description: These two libraries are no longer used and can be removed from build.gradle and our credits screen: compile 'org.wordpress:drag-sort-listview:0.6.1' // not found in maven central compile 'org.wordpress:slidinguppanel:1.0.0' // not found in maven central
Manager.title: Remove DragSortListView and SlidingUpPanel

Manager.description: Sometimes the Featured image is not shown on posts after having created a post with one or more images, waiting for everything to upload, and then coming back to the Posts list, when using the Visual Editor in particular. Couldn’t figure out a way to reproduce consistently / check if it happens with Aztec as well. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media: featured image is sometimes not shown in Posts list

Manager.description: (known issue as per this ToDo comment) you can’t tap Delete on the Posts list for a post that has media being uploaded. It doesn’t do anything, we should at least show a Toast if we’re keeping it that way on purpose (although cancelling all related uploads would be always a better option). Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Posts list: show a Toast when trying to delete a Post that is being uploaded

Manager.description: Using the Visual Editor in feature/async-media branch: if you start an upload, then exit it, then come back before it finishes, the image is correctly shown as “tap to retry”, but the upload still is progressing in the background. Given we don’t have reattachment here, we should also cancel the upload when we come back inside the editor to reflect the same status Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media: cancel uploads when coming back to the Visual Editor

Manager.description: To test: CASE B: SINGLE UPLOAD, start upload and exit the editor, before it ends get back to the editor, see if it reattaches (Aztec only) Sometimes reattaching shows a very low progress and then jumps to the current progress. We might want to save the progress to the DB for each upload, so we can accurately reflect it for reattachment. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media: reattachment sometimes jumps a bit

Manager.description: Reported on a Pixel, but I can't repro: I observed the multiselect on the mediapicker refreshes all visible items each time I select/deselect a picture https://cloudup.com/ceqRrbEJHgS Update: I can repro this if I rapidly select items.
Manager.title: Photo picker multiselect flicker

Manager.description: Right now it's possible to keep selecting photos while the picker is animating out. We should disable selection when this is happening.
Manager.title: Photo picker - disable selection while sliding out

Manager.description: I was on a poor connection on the device, and ended up with having a media library filled with "horrible" icon placeholder. (As usual I'm on Android 5.0 ;) ) cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Media Library error placeholder looks bad

Manager.description: Check differences / similarities and consist in one way these two: #6285 and UploadUtils.getErrorMessageFromMediaError() Thanks for the headsup on this @nbradbury cc @aforcier
Manager.title: Consist media upload error messages

Manager.description: Our WPNetworkImage is quite outdated. We should bring it in par with the latest code available in Volley. I tried to use our version in EditPostSettingsFragment.java here but had problems with the resulting layout of the picture. The height was way off, once the picture was loaded from the network.
Manager.title: Update WPNetworkImage to match the latest version available in Volley

Manager.description: Title has it. We've removed FadeInNetworkImage here bd2bc21 Without checking usage in xml files. I had done a simple search in java file only.
Manager.title: Develop crashes in Themes since FadeInNetworkImage is not available

Manager.description: Per #6297 we decided to prompt the user to confirm their decision to trash a post with in-progress media uploads. Rather than toasting we will show a dialog that asks them if they want to cancel media uploads and delete the post.
Manager.title: Add dialog to confirm cancelling media uploads when deleting post

Manager.description: It looks like all string resource is removed at some point which results in this weird screenshot:
Manager.title: Notifications "all" label is not translated properly

Manager.description: We got a report that when the Notifications Likes screen is initially loaded a gravatar was shown for 2 subsequent users (first and second in a list of 3) and browsing around a bit fixed the issue.
Manager.title: Wrong gravatar is shown in Notifications Likes screen

Manager.description: No description provided.
Manager.title: Enable Aztec for beta and release users

Manager.description: Expected behavior In the login screen (first screen of the app): entering email, then tapping Add self-hosted site, then tapping back shouldn't dismiss the screen completely and then also clear the email field, but rather bring the previous state of the screen back. Actual behavior When tapping the back button while on the "Add self-hosted site" screen, the app is dismissed, and bringing it up from the recent apps list shows the fields are all cleared up. Steps to reproduce the behavior start the app start typing your email accidentally tap on “Add self-hosted site”, when what you really wanted to do is tap “NEXT” tap back the app is just plainly dismissed, and when you look for it with the recent apps button and bring it up to the foreground again, the email field is cleared now (you have to enter it again). Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Login - tapping back on "Add Self-hosted site" screen clears fields and dismisses screen

Manager.description: Similar to #6307, which reduced memory usage in the photo picker, we should conserve memory in the media browser. I don't think we've had any reports of issues here, but it's definitely a resource-intensive feature that could be lighter in memory use.
Manager.title: Reduce memory usage in the WP media browser

Manager.description: In case of a network error during the IsAvailableEmail action, we show the "A magic link email has been sent" screen while the email can be wrong. In the handleEmailAvailabilityEvent() method, we should check if the event.isError(), and only if it's not we can call the mListener.onMagicLinkRequestSuccess().
Manager.title: SignIn: On email check network error, wrong screen is shown

Manager.description: first reported by @aforcier 🙇 Expected behavior Tapping PUBLISH in the Editor should make sure that the post gets published after all related media uploads finish, including the Post upload, no matter if you exit the editor or keep doing something else (async). Actual behavior If you tap on PUBLISH in the editor while media is being uploaded, and do nothing else, it works. If you otherwise hit PUBLISH but then get back into editing that post while still some media upload is in progress, then tap BACK (either navigation bar arrow or Android back button), the Post finishes uploading as a draft instead. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new post add media (several items as we need to keep media uploads going to perform the test) hit publish while media uploading, open post in the editor again exit editor using back button repeat steps 4 and 5 once more (for all of this, media has still got to be uploading) post is saved as a local draft instead of saved as a remote draft. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.2.1]
Manager.title: Async media: PUBLISH does not work after entering post twice while uploading media

Manager.description: Video uploading is still missing in Aztec. We should probably add it soon.
Manager.title: AztecEditorFragment add support for Video uploading

Manager.description: Start a new post and open the post settings. Select a text entry field such as Password, Slug, or Excerpt. Select “cancel” to close it; the keyboard remains open. Select a text entry field again. Enter text in the modal window and tap “OK” to save the text; the keyboard still remains open. Enter any text while on the main post settings screen and note that you don’t see the text anywhere on the screen. Exit the post settings; the text you entered is visible in the editor. This also happens coming back from the tags page. This issue feels kind of weird. I'd expect the OS to just close the keyboard when the text view is no longer enabled.
Manager.title: Post Settings keyboard stays visible

Manager.description: We don't support multi-line tags and currently it's not clear that , is the separator for tags. So, until #5921 is worked on, we should probably attach a comma whenever enter is tapped.
Manager.title: Enter should attach comma in post tags screen

Manager.description: Related to this comment on #5110, users who don't have permission to upload media shouldn't have upload (or delete) features available to them in the media browser. REF: https://codex.wordpress.org/Roles_and_Capabilities
Manager.title: Media browser should disable uploads depending on role

Manager.description: Users who don't have the capability to upload media shouldn't be shown the photo picker since it enables uploading device media. I think the simplest solution (both for us and our users) is to immediately show the WP media picker when these users tap the "Add Media" button in the editor.
Manager.title: Disable photo picker depending on role

Manager.description: Put the app to bg while on Post Settings Open the app again and the keyboard will just pop open This is more than likely EditPostActivity's or editor's doing.
Manager.title: Keyboard opens while coming from bg in Post Settings

Manager.description: We have two WP media utils files - ui/media/WordPressMediaUtils.java and util/WPMediaUtils.java. We should combine those.
Manager.title: Combine WP media utils

Manager.description: For the case described in this comment, the message and color / icon to be implemented should be as follows: 👍 1
Manager.title: Async media: modify error plus call to action case message

Manager.description: Since #6333, we're showing a different progress notification for posts on repeat uploads. Notification on first upload of a post: Notification after editing and re-uploading that post (without having restarted the app): Those notifications are also not foreground ones, so we're losing the safety of a foreground service for those posts.
Manager.title: Async media: Repeat uploads for the same post get a different progress notification

Manager.description: There are some missing fields from the Image Settings screen in wpandroid: Alignement Link Caption wpios issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#7596
Manager.title: Aztec: Improve Media Settings

Manager.description: When user logs into a selfhosted site, the app should show in the epilogue screen whatever is available for user's gravatar, username and name.
Manager.title: Login Rework: show user profile data in epilogue screen for selfhosted

Manager.description: With reattachment working for Aztec, we should be able to enable the post settings screen while media are uploading.
Manager.title: Async media: Enable post settings screen for Aztec when uploading media

Manager.description: Expected behavior Editing a Post and leaving it unchanged should just leave it as it was. Actual behavior We trigger ‘local changes’ when just opening and closing the editor Steps to reproduce the behavior enter a post that has images in it just exit the editor without modifying anything the post is sent online Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Opening/closing the editor produces Post to be updated

Manager.description: Steps: open the android app. go to reader section, click settings, and navigate to followed sites. introduce nosolosoftware.com in the text field at the bottom and click the follow button. The expected behavior is that the subscription was successful, but I've got a "this blog could not be found" error instead (I have a video I could share, but GitHub doesn't support videos yet). The same steps for a WordPress.com blog worked. Adding the same Jetpack blog from Calypso worked as well. Android version: alpha-64.
Manager.title: Adding a Jetpack blog to reader

Manager.description: This is a list of changes needing a design and copy review, ahead of merging the feature/async-media branch into develop. The async design to-do list is here: #6130. This design/copy review issue focuses on the post+media aspect, and not the media browser. These screenshots reflect the latest BuddyBuild build of that branch. Post list Uploading a single post New elements: The snackbar at the bottom, and its text The cloud icon and 'Uploading post' text The progress bar (it's indeterminate) Uploading multiple posts If multiple posts have media to upload, they'll proceed in parallel, but we currently upload the text body of posts one at a time - any additional posts with no remaining media to upload enter this queued state. New elements: The cloud icon and 'Queued post' text Uploading posts with media New elements: The 'Uploading media...' text The determinate progress bar The card element for the post is no longer grayed out, since the user can re-edit posts that are uploading media (posts that are uploading their content, however, are still unavailable for edit) Completed post upload New elements: The 'Post published' snackbar Upload error in post content This is the state if a post failed due to errors in the post content (and not in the media for that post - this case is shown below). New elements: The error icon and text style (this got a design pass in #6375) The 'Retry' button Upload error in post media New elements: Same as above, the error icon and text style (this got a design pass in #6375) Scheduled post New elements: The scheduled post icon (some relevant discussion in #6294) Notifications Most of the states in the post list have a matching notification state. Uploading post content Shown when uploading the content of a post only - if there are media to be uploaded, the below notification is shown first, and then this one is shown when the media uploads complete. Uploading media for post Published post This is unchanged from what we had before, it's just here for context. Upload error in post content Upload error in post media
Manager.title: Async ('Upload and Publish') MVP Design and Copy Review

Manager.description: When uploading multiple posts, the foreground 'Uploading' notification isn't shared between the posts, causing it to sometimes not be shown. For example: Create a new post, add a lot of large media, upload it Notice 'Uploading media...' notification While it's uploading, start another new post, don't add media, upload it. Notice notification becomes 'Uploading post content...', then disappears when second post completes Observe that first post media uploads are still progressing, but there's no notification Notice that 'Uploading post content...' appears for the post once the media complete This is problematic for two reasons: It breaks our pattern of communicating upload progress The UploadService is no longer foregrounded while the notification is gone, putting it at increased risk of being terminated by the system in a low memory situation There's another issue that builds on the second one. With the upcoming Android O changes, we may run into a situation where the app is backgrounded, the UploadService un-foregrounds itself (when cancelling its foreground notification), and then attempts to re-foreground itself while the system considers it ineligible for foreground tasks, causing a crash. If we accept that we should have a foreground notification, the best solution is probably to permanently show a notification while the service is running (even for just media unattached to posts). We would probably want this notification to show a digest of what's going on ('2 posts uploading', or 'Uploading 2 posts (newline) Uploading 3 media'). This will needs some design work before any actions are taken.
Manager.title: Async: Upload notification conflict with multiple post uploads

Manager.description: If a user has audio files uploaded to their site’s media library, they can run into a bug trying to add the audio file to a blog post or page: Upload an audio file to your site’s media library (in a web browser). In the Android app, start a new post. Tap the Add Media button and select your site’s media library as the source. Select the audio file you uploaded to add it to your post. Result: The audio file is added as an image with the audio file as the image src, so it appears as a broken image in the post. This occurs in both the hybrid editor and Aztec, and it makes little sense to add audio support to the hybrid editor right now. Until we support audio in Aztec, we should simply disable the ability to add audio to posts.
Manager.title: Temporarily disable adding audio to posts

Manager.description: A password is expected by the backend so, don't allow it to be empty on the username+password screen.
Manager.title: Login Rework: disallow empty password in username/password screen

Manager.description: comes from #6358 (comment) Expected behavior Starting a video upload should show a thumbnail of it representing the object, no matter whether we leave the editor and come back, it should still be there. Actual behavior When I start a video upload either from the storage or from the Camera, it shows the thumbnail OK Exiting the editor and coming back again doesn’t show the preview thumbnail as it was shown when I first included the video in the Post. Instead it shows the aztec image placeholder with the retry/failed overlay, or the play video overlay if it succeeded. The same happens if I let the video upload completely without leaving the editor, then coming back to the editor shows no video thumbnail. Steps to reproduce the behavior CASE A: start a new draft in Aztec include a video wait until it finishes uploading exit the editor open the post again see the Aztec placeholder with the video play overlay instead of a thumbnail with the video play overlay. CASE B: start a new draft in Aztec include a video while it's uploading, exit the editor open the post again see the Aztec placeholder with the retry/failed overlay instead of a thumbnail with the retry/failed overlay. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Aztec video upload: thumbnails lost when leaving editor

Manager.description: comes from #6358 (comment) Expected behavior Post list items should not show technical tags - either just display visual content in a visual way (i.e. thumbnails) or text content. Actual behavior The Post list shows the [video] tag when the post is finished uploading in Aztec as of #6358, or the [wpvideo] tag in the Visual Editor. Also if there are no images in the post but a video is in there, it seems to me the post item resizes itself as if it were to hold a featured image, but it shows a blank space instead Steps to reproduce the behavior CASE A: Aztec start a new draft include a video once the video uploads, or even before it finishes, go back to the Posts list. it shows the [video] tag: if the Post has a successfully uploaded video, the full tag is displayed in the post list CASE B: Visual Editor start a new draft include a video once the video uploads, or even before it finishes, go back to the Posts list. it shows the [wpvideo] tag: Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Post list: video uploads show [video] or [wpvideo] tags

Manager.description: With #6358 merged, we need to support asynchronous video upload in Aztec as well. That means, you can start a new draft, add some video, exit the editor, see it keeps uploading, and even it finishes uploading unattended while you can still work on other parts of the app, edit other posts, etc.
Manager.title: Async media: integrate Aztec video support

Manager.description: Not sure if it's an issue on my testing device or not (probably it is a local issue) but the media picker is completely blank in editor. Manager.title: Media Picker is blank in post editor

Manager.description: Similar to wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#7613 but for Android app. Expected behavior When viewing Reader I'd expect to see a photo in the post preview card when the post in question contains an image. Actual behavior Just the title shows, no image. This seems to be related to posts made with the native app Aztec editor only — posts published with visual editor, or Calypso web editor appear as expected. Steps to reproduce the behavior Reader, look at a site like lance.blog or photo.cate.blog View the posts list for a post you've published with an image, via Aztec editors. You'll see some posts missing an image. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android app alpha-66 Possibly related to this Calypso Reader issue: Automattic/wp-calypso#12609
Manager.title: Reader: certain posts with an image don't show the image

Manager.description: Currently, a post that has failed media will show up in the post list like this: To retry the post upload, we need to edit the post and either retry the individual media items, or remove them/replace them. Depending on the type of media error, it would be great if we offered the Retry option from the post list (and eventually the error notification). We already do this when the error is related to the post itself, and there weren't any failed media: Some implementation work is required to actually support retrying post uploads with failed media. Once that's in place, we could enable retries for cases we can reasonably expect the retry to succeed (e.g. connection errors), and work on more automated fixes (maybe offering to resize the failed media automatically if the error was a file limit type).
Manager.title: Async media: Support retrying posts with failed media

Manager.description: Calypso applies a special treatment for Jetpack posts from sites that have RSS excerpts enabled. It only shows the excerpt and the featured image, if any, and shows a notice Visit SITE_NAME for the full post.. Example of this kind of post: https://wordpress.com/read/blogs/67272686/posts/7751
Manager.title: Reader post detail should show the RSS excerpt (if any) for Jetpack sites

Manager.description: At the end of the login flow, button "Continue" is not working when "Don't keep activities" is enabled. See demo video.
Manager.title: At the end of the login flow, "Continue" button is not working when "Don't keep activities" is enabled

Manager.description: There is a missing call to NotificationsUpdateService.startService in the following method: LoginUsernamePasswordFragment.onSiteChanged. I had a quick look at other flows, and I think this is the only missing one.
Manager.title: New login flow: notification service not started in certain cases

Manager.description: Expected behavior When logging in and shown the New Editor promo dialog, I should be able to dismiss one popup and then continue reading the other one that was left behind. Actual behavior Tapping on the grey area of the screen dismisses both popups, so I can't really read the New Editor promo dialog. Steps to reproduce the behavior tried logging in to the app (I have 2FA enabled). so entered email, hit continue, then entered password when given the option to use magic links, then the 2fa field appeared, entered the code, and it was logged in. the “try the new editor” promo dialog came up the smart lock popup came up right afterwards tapping on the grey area of the screen made BOTH go away, so I couldn’t read the promo dialog Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Smart Lock covering New Editor Promo Dialog

Manager.description: Expected behavior When logging in via magic link, the epilogue sites list should have the sites available on the wpcom account that just logged in. Actual behavior The epilogue sites list is empty. This is a regression caused by #6354 (comment) Steps to reproduce the behavior Clear the app data and login to your wpcom via magic link. At the end of the process, the epilogue screen will have no sites listed.
Manager.title: Login Rework: empty sites list in epilogue when magiclink login

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior on an emulator without Play Services installed, clear the app data and launch the app tap on "LOG IN". Nothing happens. tap on "LOG IN" again app goes to the email input screen. Tested on [device], Android [version] API 16 Emulator
Manager.title: Login Rework: first tap on Log In fails if Play Services are missing

Manager.title: Create account from Share to WordPress crashes the app

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expected to copy and paste text into the form field. Actual behavior I cannot seem to long-tap or otherwise pull up the paste function. Steps to reproduce the behavior Use a WP.com user account with 2FA turned on. Log out of the app. Log in. When prompted for the Authenticator verification code, try to copy and paste it into the field. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.2, WordPress for Android app alpha-68
Manager.title: Login Rework: can't paste 2FA code from Authenticor app into Verification code input field

Manager.description: Expected behavior Rotating the device while looking at a certain point in the Posts list shouldn't bring the first item to the top Actual behavior The current position in the list is lost when rotation happens Steps to reproduce the behavior There's one thing I found: if you rotate the device the List is always scrolled to the top. So, say the problematic post is somewhere in the middle, it fails, you tap on the error Notification and are correctly scrolled to it, but then rotate the screen, the list loses its position and the first item is shown. To test: choose from an old draft in your list (something that is below or in the middle of your list) modify it and make it fail sync see the notification appear scroll the item away of your post list tap on the notification observe you're taken to the correct item now rotate the screen the first item is shown Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2] Tested on [Galaxy S3], Android [4.2.2]
Manager.title: PostsList loses its position on rotation

Manager.description: It would be nice to know the % of users who swipe through the screens in the login prologue. Let's add a new analytic stat to track this.
Manager.title: Login: Add analytic to track swipes through the login prologue.

Manager.title: Crash report 7.9: NPE in EditPostSettingsFragment.updatePostFormat

Manager.description: Expected behavior The login prologue animations and promotional texts should be arranged side-by-side with a healthy amount of margin between them when running the app on a tablet holding it in landscape mode Actual behavior The promo text is overlapped by the animated imagery. See screenshot: Steps to reproduce the behavior With the app date cleared, run the app on a tablet and hold it in landscape mode Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung Tab S2, Android v6.0.1
Manager.title: Login Rework: overlapping elements in tablet landscape

Manager.description: Expected behavior When a 2FA code is in the clipboard, the should pick it up and auto-fill the 2FA input field with it like it did before the Login Rework changes. Actual behavior The app doesn't auto-fill the 2FA input field. Steps to reproduce the behavior Try to log in to a wpcom account that is protected with 2FA On the 2FA input screen, switch to your Authenticator app and copy a 2FA code Return to the wpandroid app 💥 the 2FA code is not auto-pasted
Manager.title: Login Rework: re-instate the auto-paste of the 2FA code

Manager.description: Remaining tasks not part of the first alpha release (see #6130 for the original list): Media library: #6545 Display snackbar when media has started uploading it's been decided we're not adding them as per this reason #6546 Notifications for media items Update messaging on failure: Other items: (#6467) Display a promotional dialog about async the first time a post is published (something like Hey, you don't have to wait for posts to publish anymore, you'll go back to the posts list and see the status of your post as it uploads? - we'll get some input from Editorial on this) Integrate video optimize processing --> ref: #6134 Update the page list to use the same design as the post list, so it can also use the design update
Manager.title: Async: Remaining design items

Manager.description: Visual editor doesn't treat the [gallery] shortcode in any special way and it just adds it as a plain text. This can be already implemented for Aztec, as well without any changes to the library.
Manager.title: Add support for WordPress galleries to Aztec editor

Manager.description: Originally reported by @daniloercoli 🙇 Expected behavior When a crash or unexpected stop happens (turn then phone off, for example) while a Post with media is being uploaded, then coming back to the Post should show the interrupted items marked as failed and able to be retried. Actual behavior These items don't show any specific mark and when tapped the "Stop uploading?" popup is displayed. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft include some media items while these are uploading, stop the app (go to settings-> apps -> WordPress -> force stop) open the app again open the draft observe all media items do not show any "retry" mark. tap on any failed item and observe the "Stop uploading?" popup appears. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Async media: inconsistent uploading items after crash

Manager.description: Expected behavior When you're uploading a media item (video or image) in the Editor, and you delete it, the upload should be cancelled. Actual behavior The upload continues and there's no way for you to cancel it. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft on Aztec insert media item delete the item observe the "uploading media" notification is still going on, and if you exit the editor the posts list will show the progress bar as well Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Async media: upload not cancelled when media deleted in Aztec

Manager.description: In the past we simplified login for devs by reading wp.debug.dotcom_login_username and wp.debug.dotcom_login_password from gradle.properties, but it looks like those aren’t supported in the new login flow. Would be nice to get that back so devs don’t need to manually login all the time. ❤️ 1
Manager.title: Restore auto-login for developers

Manager.description: It looks like (at least in certain situations) the error message we're shown to users on the login email screen when an email address is not found is An error occurred while checking the email address!. Let's double check that we're consistently showing the revised text: This email address is not registered on WordPress.com.
Manager.title: Login: Tweak error message shown when an email address is not found.

Manager.description: Once #5122 and #6192 are completed the Customize button in the Themes list needs to be fixed for Jetpack sites. Sister issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#7650
Manager.title: Jetpack: Let users customize their themes the same as .com sites

Manager.description: Releasing sharing to the world (congrats @nbradbury!)
Manager.title: Remove Sharing feature flag

Manager.description: The icon that accompanies the input box in WPLoginInputRow does not convey any useful meaning to a screen reader so, let's remove its contentDescription and mark it not important for accessibility.
Manager.title: Login: mark decorative input icon as such

Manager.description: Currently, the contentDescription of the image in site addresses' help popup ("Site address positioning image") is not informative enough. Let's change that into "The site address can be found in the navigation bar of your web browser" that is more descriptive.
Manager.title: Login: make site address help image's contentDescription more informative

Manager.description: Before/right after async reaches beta, we should show the link text in the promo dialog and add a link to a mobile make release notes page.
Manager.title: Add link to async release notes to promo dialog

Manager.description: Add analytics to track how our ShareIntentReceiver is used. We can maybe reuse events used in wpios to track the share extension.
Manager.title: Add analytics to track how our `ShareIntentReceiver` is used

Manager.description: Expected behavior On very small screens, the magic link screen should be scrollable as to be able to click the "I'll enter the password" link that should be at the bottom Actual behavior There's no way out, leaving the user with the only option to send the magic link, unless you rotate the screen (which looks and behaves alright). Steps to reproduce the behavior Use a very tiny screen, for instance a 240x320 emulator install the app try to login entering your wp.com username see the magic link screen appear and you can't do anything else. Tested on [LG Optimus L3 II], Android [4.1.1]
Manager.title: Login: magic link screen is not scrollable

Manager.description: Expected behavior When you tap on the Login button, it should do something Actual behavior Tapping on Login the first time doesn't do anything on devices without Smart Lock (i.e. without Google Play Services) Steps to reproduce the behavior install the app tap on Login observe nothing happens tap on Login again you're taken to the Login screen. Tested on [LG L3 II], Android [4.1.1]
Manager.title: Login button doesn't work first time if Smart Lock capabilities not present

Manager.description: Comments for Jeatpack sites ares coming soon to reader, we want to fully support them in the apps. iOS issue: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#7660
Manager.title: Jatpack: Add support for comments on reader

Manager.description: Tested on [device], Android [version] Android 7 and 6 Wordpress Android 7.9, 7.9.1 , 8.0 => NOK Wordpress 7.8 ==>> OK ! Error when post new article My conf : Multisite + htaccess auth
Manager.title: [Multisite] Error to send new post since WP 7.9 / 7.9.1 / 8.0

Manager.description: We'll be making the wording/functionality somewhat consistent with iOS Biggest functionality we'll be changing is that we'll limit the image size by width and height dimension, not simply by width.
Manager.title: Media settings design audit

Manager.description: In the flow designed for self-hosted sites, tapping the "Lost your password?" link incorrectly opens the Lost Password page on WordPress.com. Instead, it should open wp-login.php?action=lostpassword on the site address that was entered in the previous step (as it does in the new login flow on WPiOS). Steps to reproduce the behavior In the new login flow: tap "Log in to your site by entering your site address instead" enter a self-hosted site URL tap "Lost your password?" Tested on alpha-69
Manager.title: Site Address login flow uses wrong reset password link

Manager.description: BUG: tapping on a tab that does not have any elements (i.e. DOCUMENTS tab) leaves the “loading” spinner visible (worse, it is never dismissed even if you change tabs, so it stays there until you leave the activity and come back to it) couldn't reproduce BUG: no thumbnail. start a draft and upload a media item, exit the editor while it’s still uploading and open the Media library. you’ll see the UPLOADING item there, and once it’s finished it doesn’t show the video thumbnail. It does show the thumbnail if you leave the Media library and come back again. #6518 BUG: item not refreshed correctly when connectivity lost (might be the cause for the item above too) #6516 BUG: stopping the app while something is uploading makes the media items look UPLOADING on next run, and you can’t do anything (related: #5912 ) [x] integrate video optimisation in media library double checked it, it's already integrated at the MediaUploadHandler/UploadService level
Manager.title: Media library stabilization list

Manager.description: Expected behavior Uploading media items in the Media library should keep a coherent state even when the app is stopped. Actual behavior If a media item was uploading and the app closes itself, the uploading item will remain uploading forever, unless the app's data is deleted (or app uninstalled and re-installed) Steps to reproduce the behavior start uploading somethign (either by including media in a draft or by going to the media library and adding a new item stop the app (settings-> apps -> WordPress -> force stop) open the app again verify the item shows "UPLOADING" in the Media library Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media library inconsistent states

Manager.description: Expected behavior When an item is uploading and connectivity is lost, these items should change to "RETRY" automatically. Actual behavior They still show "UPLOADING" - but if you scroll even just a bit to get those items off the screen and back within the viewport again, they show "RETRY" correctly. Steps to reproduce the behavior go to the media library start uploading a media item turn airplane mode ON see it shows a toast “connectivity lost” but the item keeps saying “UPLOADING”. If you scroll the list a bit to force update, it works correctly. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media library: no updates on connectivity lost

Manager.description: Expected behavior If I leave the editor while uploading media, I expect to see no featured image or a featured image from that post in the posts list. Actual behavior I see a featured image from the previous post while the media is uploading. Once the media finishes uploading, the correct image appears. During upload (note the image on the top post is not in that post at all; it's from the post below it in the list): After upload finishes: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a post with an image in it. Save/publish that post and go back to the posts list. Start a second post and add different images to it. While the media is uploading, exit the editor to go back to the posts list. Result: The image from the first post appears on the second post until the upload finishes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-71
Manager.title: Async Media: Wrong featured image appears on posts list during upload

Manager.description: I experience significant lag when I select multiple images in the media picker. I timed it, and after selected 15 images and tapping the checkmark, the app froze for 15 seconds before adding the images to the post content. The lag increases relative to the number of images selected, and occurs regardless of the editor (happens in both hybrid and Aztec editors). Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post. Tap the Add Media button. Long tap to select multiple images. Tap the checkmark to add the selected images to the post. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-71
Manager.title: Media: Lag when selecting multiple images in media picker

Manager.description: Caused by java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'int org.wordpress.android.fluxc.model.PostModel.getId()' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.uploads.UploadService.addUploadErrorToFailedPosts(UploadService.java:608) at org.wordpress.android.ui.uploads.UploadService.onMediaUploaded(UploadService.java:655) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java) at org.greenrobot.eventbus.EventBus.invokeSubscriber(EventBus.java:485) Looks like we had an error for a media item that was attached to a post, but that post had been deleted by that time.
Manager.title: Crash report 8.1: NPE in UploadService.onMediaUploaded()

Manager.description: Caused by java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void org.wordpress.android.fluxc.model.PostModel.setDateLocallyChanged(java.lang.String)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.fluxc.store.PostStore.updatePost(PostStore.java:548) at org.wordpress.android.fluxc.store.PostStore.onAction(PostStore.java:365) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java) at org.greenrobot.eventbus.EventBus.invokeSubscriber(EventBus.java:485) The crash is in FluxC, but we should understand why we're ending up with a null PostModel when sending an UPDATE_POST action from WPAndroid.
Manager.title: Crash report 8.1: NPE in PostStore.updatePost()

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that with async media uploads, when I exit the editor, the video will continue uploading in the post. Actual behavior In Aztec, if I exit the editor while uploading a video, the video is not uploaded correctly: The draft is uploaded with a reference to a local video file on the device. When I reopen the editor and tap on the video, it tells me the file is still uploading but the progress bar doesn't move and it never finishes the upload. I confirmed that the same video file uploads correctly if I remain in the editor during the upload; it's only a problem if I exit the editor before the upload finishes. Steps to reproduce the behavior Enable the Aztec editor. Start a new post. Add a video to the post. Before the video finishes uploading, exit the editor. Note that there is no message about "Uploading Media" on the post in the post list, and the draft is saved/uploaded to the server. Open the editor again. Tapping on the video or trying to switch to HTML mode indicates that the video is still uploading, but there is no sign that the upload is happening. In a browser, open the post and view it in HTML mode. Note that a reference to a local video on the device is included in the [video] shortcode. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-72
Manager.title: Async Media: Video not uploaded correctly after exiting Aztec editor

Manager.description: We should update the title of the notification shown on upload errors to include the title of the post/page for clarity:
Manager.title: Async media: Add post/page title to upload error notification

Manager.description: Caused by java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'int android.content.Intent.getIntExtra(java.lang.String, int)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment.handleEditPostResult(PostsListFragment.java:215) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListActivity.onActivityResult(PostsListActivity.java:129) at android.app.Activity.dispatchActivityResult(Activity.java:6935) Steps to reproduce Share an image to the WordPress app Choose the 'new post' option Publish the post
Manager.title: Crash report 8.1: NPE in PostsListFragment.handleEditPostResult()

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that errors with pages will refer to a "page." Actual behavior If there is an error uploading media to a page, the error on the page list refers to it as a post: We were unable to upload this post's media. Please edit the post to try again. However, the system notification correctly refers to it as a page: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new page. Add media to the page. Exit the editor while the media is still uploading. Disconnect from the internet (e.g. go into airplane mode) and check the error on that page in the page list. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-72
Manager.title: Async Media: Error in page list calls it a "post" instead of a "page"

Manager.description: It would be nice to know the % of users who swipe through the screens in the login prologue. Let's add a new analytic stat to track this.
Manager.title: Login: Add analytic to track swipes through the login prologue

Manager.description: When a user goes to the Media Browser and starts uploading a media item: Show overlaying label and spinner while on Media screen (as is done currently). Show notification if user leaves Media screen. Also this notification should auto-dismiss once the media has been uploaded, but stay there if there was an error. Show just one notification even if multiple items are being uploaded, ideally showing "real" progress
Manager.title: Async media: upload notifications for media library

Manager.description: I download your source code and build APK . Generate but when install in android device and register a new user then its give an invalid id every time. Login Process Working perfectly
Manager.title: Build app get error

Manager.description: Expected behavior When the "Optimize Images" app setting is OFF the app should not resize images before adding to a post. Actual behavior App resizes images (to 3000px, 85% quality) even when the "Optimize Images" setting is OFF. Steps to reproduce the behavior Clean install the app Navigate to "Me > App Settings" and notice that the "Optimize Images" setting is turned off Using the debugger, insert a breakpoint in WPMediaUtils.getOptimizedMedia() Go create a new post and insert a local image. Notice the breakpoint being hit and the code continuing to resize the photo. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android v7.1.2
Manager.title: WPMediaUtils.getOptimizedMedia() is not guarded by AppPrefs.isImageOptimize()

Manager.description: Currently, when the app optimises (say, resizes) an image to insert into a post, it assigns a new filename to the processed file. The new filename is quite obscure (wp-image-xxxxxxxxx.jpg). Maybe we can try to keep as much of the original filename as possible, perhaps only appending to the filename. For example, perhaps we can have a rotated photo become img1234-rotated.jpg or similar.
Manager.title: Try to keep original media filename when resizing the file

Manager.description: I'll fix this on the FluxC side, but I'm keeping track of some screens here so we can test the PR is actually working.
Manager.title: HTML entities displayed on different screens

Manager.description: Even though long press to multiselect is standard on Android, some users aren’t aware of this so we decided to show a toast in both the media picker and WP media browser letting users know about it. It works but it’s kind of annoying since it pops up as soon as you enter either activity, and it's a shame to show it to users that already know how to multiselect. To rectify this: Only show it in the WP media browser if the user hasn't already seen it in the picker (and vice versa) Only show it if the user has used that feature a few times and hasn’t multiselected yet 👍 1
Manager.title: Media long press toast is annoying

Manager.description: If you add a video to the WP Media Library, the preview thumb is not available while uploading, and tapping to open the details screen shows a toast "Media not available" and closes it. In order to access the details screen you need to wait until the upload is completed. Note: Not sure if video thumb is OFF by design, or we've missed it. Video thumb is already available in the editor for both local video and remote video.
Manager.title: Media Library - Video thumb and details screen aren't available while uploading

Manager.description: The crash happens when you try to download a picture to the device (from the details screen), when the item is in queue, or in the uploading state. I think we should probably disable details screen for items that are not yet uploaded to the server. Related to #6572 where tapping on a video opens and immediately closes the details screen. cc @nbradbury Should we fix this in 8.1?
Manager.title: Crash in Media Library when downloading a picture

Manager.description: Expected behavior When in the Media Browser, deleting an item being uploaded should be possible, and it should also cancel its upload, Also if the upload is attached to a given Post, a warning should be given so the user can go edit the Post and delete it from there. Actual behavior The item is not deleted, and continues to be uploaded, showing a Toast saying wait until upload completes Steps to reproduce the behavior start uploading a video from the Media Browser then long press and delete it observe it continues to be there, uploading, and the toast appears. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media Library: allow uploading items to be canceled/deleted

Manager.description: Expected behavior When opening an existing Post in the editor, and just exiting the editor without modifying anything, should just leave things as they were. Actual behavior For some posts, opening an existing Post in the editor, then just exiting the editor (both Aztec and Visual) triggers the Post saved on device snackbar and marks it Local changes in the Posts list. Steps to reproduce the behavior pick a Post that has images and videos in it, and has been written on the web admin (wp-admin or Calypso) open it in the editor exit the editor observe the snackbar appears, and the post is marked "Local changes" in the Posts list. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Local changes on posts even if not modifying them

Manager.description: Add connected, email found screen as shown in the screenshot below. i2 i3 i4
Manager.title: Google Login: Add Connected, Email Found Screen

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that after I add an image to a post, I can tap to open the image settings. If I don't tap on the image, I can swipe over the image to move up/down in the editor. Actual behavior Immediately after adding an image, if I swipe to move up or down in the editor it opens the image settings instead. This happens no matter how quickly I swipe over the image. If I add an image and then tap somewhere else in the editor to place the cursor there, I can then swipe up and down normally without opening the image settings for the image I just added. This only happens in Aztec. If I add an image to the hybrid editor I can swipe in the editor without any issue. Steps to reproduce the behavior Enable the Aztec (Beta) editor in the app. Start a new post. Add one or more images to the post. Swipe up or down over the image you just added. Result: The image settings open. Tap somewhere else in the editor and then swipe. Result: The editor scrolls as expected. Screencast of the issue: https://cloudup.com/cLCZUHrR5p7 Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-75
Manager.title: Aztec: Swiping over newly added image opens image settings

Manager.description: Only show the Aztec editor promo the first time they hit the editor OR on third time they use the app (on the My Site screen), whichever comes first. So if they open the app for the first time and go to the editor in that first use, we show the alert on the editor. If they don’t go to the editor, we save it until the second or third time they use the app to show it where it currently shows (My Site)
Manager.title: Delay the Aztec promo

Manager.description: The "Tap and hold to select multiple photos" toast we show in the photo picker only appears after the third time the picker is created. Since the picker is kept in memory until the editor is closed, the toast won't appear until after you access the picker in three different editor sessions. It should instead appear after the third time the picker is accessed.
Manager.title: Multiselect toast should show after picker is accessed rather than after picker is created

Manager.description: Deleting items from WP Media Library doesn't show the deleting overlay over them. There is basically no UI feedback on the taken and in progress action. See the video here: https://cloudup.com/cvVRVRt9h39 cc @nbradbury
Manager.title: Media Library - Overlays are missing when deleting items

Manager.description: Comes from #6630 (comment) Expected behavior While items are deleting, refreshes shouldn't affect the visuals Actual behavior If you select several items to delete (i.e. 6 or more items), and then immediately after tapping "OK" on the confirm dialog you do a pull to refresh, you'll see that the refresh action ends in between some items having been deleted and some other still haven't. Those that haven't been deleted yet seem to lose the "DELETING" state (visually at least) for some reason, although they keep being deleted (and thus the disappearing / moving pieces animation can still be seen). Steps to reproduce the behavior go to media library pick several (more than 6 items) to delete (long press) tap on delete (trash icon) tap OK on the confirm dialog immediately pull down to refresh observe there are items that are being removed but weren't showing any "DELETING" overlay Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]
Manager.title: Media Library: refreshing while deleting washes away the status overlays

Manager.description: As per the design of the epilogue screen shown in #5814, the bottom buttons panel should have a shadow on its top when the list has more items than the screen can hold at once.
Manager.title: Login epilogue bottom buttons shadow is missing

Manager.description: As per #5814, the "CONNECT ANOTHER SITE" button should be grey-light when the list overflows the screen.
Manager.title: Login epilogue "connect more" button color when big list

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect the full width of posts in the Reader to be visible in both portrait and landscape views. Actual behavior I can view the full width of posts in landscape view, but the post is wider than the visible area in portrait view so the right edge gets cut off: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Reader. Tap to open a post detail view. Rotate between portrait and landscape. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-75
Manager.title: Reader: Right edge of post cut off in portrait view

Manager.description: When you pick a featured image for a post, you can only choose from images that already exist in your WP media library. There should be a way to add to the library from there.
Manager.title: Can't add to library when choosing a featured image

Manager.description: Expected behavior Deleting/trash a Post in the Posts list should also remove any outstanding Post Upload notifications for such a Post. Actual behavior In particular, if there is an outstanding upload error notification for a Post, and the user decides to delete/trash such Post, the Post is deleted but the upload error notification for such Post remains in their dashbord. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a draft place a breakpoint in uploadPost() in UploadService. insert an image exit the editor when the image is done uploading, the breakpoint will be reached. at this point, turn airplane mode ON let the execution continue a post upload error notification is shown in the user's dashboard. now, trash/delete the Post observe que upload error notification is still there on the users's dashboard. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0], and Geny S3, Android 4.1.1
Manager.title: Deleting a Post should remove any related notifications

Manager.description: Expected behavior You should be able to insert a video or image in a Post and exit the editor or come back into it as many times as you want, and the Post will end up being updated remotely (as long as connectivity exists) each time. Actual behavior When uploading a video, exiting, re-attaching, then waiting to finish: once it finishes, exiting the editor shows a [video] tag in the Post list, and entering the editor again shows the failed/retry overlay on the video. For images, it seems to be working but when you come back again and tap on the image (expecting to see the image settings screen), it RETRIES THE UPLOAD, even when the failed/retry overlay wasn’t showing there. Steps to reproduce the behavior FOR VIDEO: start a new draft insert a video while the video is uploading, exit the editor enter the editor again confirm the progress gets re-attached wait until the video is finished uploading tap on the video, confirm the player is executed exit the editor enter the editor for that post again observe it's shown with the failed/retry overlay FOR IMAGES: start a new draft insert an image while the image is uploading, exit the editor enter the editor again confirm the progress gets re-attached wait until the image is finished uploading tap on the image, confirm the image settings screen is displayed exit the editor enter the editor for that post again tap on the image, observe the image settings screen is not displayed this time, but rather the image starts to upload again, as if it was a failed image. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async media: broken reattachment identification

Manager.description: Expected behavior Sharing to WordPress (a photo for example) should use the new Login flow when no account is yet connected. Actual behavior The older login flow is still used. Steps to reproduce the behavior With the app data cleared, try to share a photo to WordPress from the device's gallery. The old login flow comes up.
Manager.title: Share to WordPress action still uses the old login flow

Manager.description: On mobile devices, if you click on a cross post that comes from a private site where you are not a registered user, the post cannot be retrieved. This problem will only happen for Automatticians (specifically in the a8c stream). The error can be produced on multiple operating systems (both iOS and Android). On Google Pixel Android 8.0.0 - WordPress App alpha-75, we get the following error:
Manager.title: A8C Reader: Error when viewing cross posts to a site you are not a registered user

Manager.description: Caption field has been removed from the image settings in Aztec because shortcodes were not supported. They can now be added back.
Manager.title: Add back the caption to image settings

Manager.description: Would be cool to have swipe gestures (swipe left/swipe right) enabled in Media Details screen and in Media Preview screen. Running thru full screen preview of your items in the media library is a kind pain at the moment, since you need tap twice to reach the full screen preview, then you need to tap back twice (to go back to the Media Library), and tap again twice to see the full screen preview of the next picture. Not sure if Calypso already does this, but IIRC there is an arrow to go back and forth between media. Even if Calypso doesn't have this feature I think we should add it to the app, since it's a common pattern in photos apps. cc @iamthomasbishop
Manager.title: Add "swipe" to Media Details and Media Preview screen

Manager.description: i have a question about insert images. if user select much images, it will crash by out of memory or not ? Anyone test this case ???
Manager.title: Image memory

Manager.description: If you tap to retrying uploading an image you deleted from the device, you get the unhelpful error toast shown below. If it’s not even on the device, we should remove it or at very least say “unavailable” and not allow an action on it
Manager.title: Unhelpful toast when retrying deleted media

Manager.description: Use the ? icon instead of a "Beta" button in Aztec editor, which points to the changelog blog post. This issue was moved from the Aztec repo.
Manager.title: Use an icon instead of the Beta button

Manager.description: It would be helpful to track: when an item is shared whether it's shared to the editor or to the media library how many items are shared what is being shared (image, video, etc)
Manager.title: Add analytics to media sharing

Manager.description: Address technical debt accrued from Google login changes by: Move code specific to Google login to separate fragment Remove feature flag since feature branch is used Add build method to copy Buddybuild secure file Update README.md for Google Sign-In failure
Manager.title: Google Login: Technical Debt

Manager.description: Expected behavior Precondition - User is not logged into WordPress User shares an image/video/text with WordPress. Login flow is shown When the user logs in, the sharing flow continues. Actual behavior User shares an image/video/text with WordPress. Login flow is shown along with an error toast message. When the user logs in, the sharing flow doesn't continue. The Main screen is displayed. Steps to reproduce the behavior Clear app data. Share image/video/text with WordPress app. The app redirects you to the Login screen and displays an error message - "No WordPress account found, add an account and try again". Log in. The app doesn't continue with the sharing flow and displays the Main screen.
Manager.title: Sharing does not continue after login

Manager.description: I noticed that the login screen doesn't suggest the default email address available on the device. As seen in the picture above there are no suggestions when I type the first letters of the email address currently active on the device.
Manager.title: Login - Suggest device default email address

Manager.description: If you switch to another app when the app is actually logging you to your site ( "Logging in" progress dialog is on the screen) there is no way to dismiss the progress dialog, and you are stuck on that screen. Doesn't matter how long you wait. Fix is to close the app and restart it from scratch. Once restarted the app, you are already logged to WP with the credentials given on the step above. I bet there is a receiver that is un-registered on backgrounding the app. To reproduce Clean app-> insert email -> choose insert password -> tap login -> progress dialog is on the screen. Left the app. Going back to WP and the progress dialog is always there.
Manager.title: Login - "Logging in" progress dialog is never dismissed if you left the app during login

Manager.description: Noticed that PNs on mobile devices (tested on Android only) are not automatically dismissed when I read the note on the web, or another device. I bet the "read signal" hidden PNs, used to automatically dismiss PNs on other devices, are not working fine anymore.
Manager.title: Notifications - PNs are not automatically dismissed when you read them on the web or another device

Manager.description: The shared element transition when you tap an image in the media browser to view the media settings could be better. Right now if the full-size image isn't already cached, the transition goes from the thumbnail in the media browser to a dark grey image in media settings. This could be improved by having media settings show the same thumbnail that's already displayed in the media browser before loading the full-sized image.
Manager.title: Use thumbnail for media settings shared element transition

Manager.description: Expected behavior Every time the user inserts media items (other than 1 only item) using the media picker in the Editor, the UploadService should get called once, with a full list of items to be uploaded. Actual behavior Every time the user inserts media items (other than 1 only item) using the media picker in the Editor, the UploadService gets called as many items as items are there in the list, with incremental amounts each time. For example, if you insert 1 item, all is good. Insert 2 items instead, the insertion code gets called once with a list of size=1, then again for a list of size=2 as the second item gets added, adding the first element of the list effectively twice. Same would happen if it’d been 3 items: first item gets added 3 times, second one twice, last item just once. In reality, we're uploading media items just once if they're already enqueued, thanks to this check. However, imagine a situation where a long pending list is due. If we selected many items and repeated the first items again in the last part of the queue, giving these items enough time to upload and end up off the queue before reaching the same items again enqueued in the tail of the list, then these would be uploaded multiple times. Steps to reproduce the behavior Place a breakpoint on this line https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/WordPress/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/ui/uploads/UploadService.java#L163 start a new draft tap on the media picker icon select more than 1 media item to include (in particular, select 2 items for the description in step 5 to match) observe the unpackIntent method gets called twice, first time with a mediaList containing 1 item (size=1) and second time with a mediaList containing 2 items (size=2), resulting in 3 items being enqueued to upload instead of just 2 as per the user's intention. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async - media uploads get enqueued multiple times

Manager.description: On some devices, when you return from media settings the FAB flashes during the transition.
Manager.title: Media settings FAB flashes during transition

Manager.description: Single tap no longer inserts the tapped item, instead it selects it Long press to show media detail Selection circle on every item (to indicate multi-select is possible)
Manager.title: Media Picker Redesign, Part 1

Manager.description: Go to the comment list Long-press to select a comment Tap another comment Boom! java.lang.IllegalStateException: Two different ViewHolders have the same stable ID. Stable IDs in your adapter MUST BE unique and SHOULD NOT change.
Manager.title: Crash selecting multiple comments

Manager.description: For setting a Featured Image in a Post, the app currently shows the Media Browser for the user to pick an existing picture in the blog's WP Media Library. It'd be great to let the user choose their Featured Image from any other sources, and if such a choice is not in their Media Library, make the process seamless and upload the image for them. user opens / starts a post / draft user taps on the settings icon user scrolls down to the “featured image” section and taps to add / change HERE instead of launching the media browser (where you can only pick existing pics from the Media Library), we launch the current Media Picker used in the Editor. This way we’re offering the user all the possibilities they have. In case the user chooses to use a picture that is not already in their Media Library (i.e. a new photo, for instance), we take care of that seamlessly in the background through async upload.
Manager.title: Featured Image: launch the new media picker

Manager.description: In #6718 we changed the behavior of the media picker, we should likewise change the behavior of the media browser when used as a picker.
Manager.title: Media Browser redesign

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post (whether via the web or the app) Save the post as a draft (do not publish) Navigate to the Posts list Open the draft post and make changes Tap Update Tap Update again, because nothing appeared to happen (separate bug? There's a crazy-long delay here before the UI responds to the button click) Expected behavior For the draft to be updated Actual behavior The card in the Posts List shows the new content briefly, but it disappears after the upload is "complete". The changes are lost, and never seen again on the device or on the web. Here's a video of it in action...but fair warning, it takes ~1 minute after making the updates before anything starts to happen, and then another ~1.5 minutes before the updated text disappears. Every piece of this takes a really long time, despite a healthy internet connection (tested at 8Mbps upload, 30Mbps down) https://cloudup.com/cKaxRoL-JTD The problem was seen using all three editors (Legacy / Visual / Beta). I ran through the test probably a dozen times, and was only able to successfully edit the draft once. I can't figure out what was different about that one attempt, but wanted to mention it. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 8.0.0, wp alpha-79
Manager.title: Unable to edit a draft post (changes fail to save)
