Manager.description: These are to be merged into #6713 once it's reviewed and ready #6738 Implement progress bar #6748 implement notifications wording as per the designs: 1 post, 3 of 12 media files remaining 1 post, 1 page, 3 of 12 media files remaining 2 posts, 1 page, 3 of 12 media files remaining 1 post, 2 pages, 3 of 12 media files remaining #6751 bug in error notification being shown even for user-cancelled uploads #6788 tapping on trash post in a Post list item should also delete any outstanding success / error notifications for such a Post, and if it is currently uploading media, it should update the foreground notification text accordingly (i.e. decrement the Post total count and adjust the current count, and the same for the media that this Post had) (note to self: will be easier to code once #6756 below gets merged, as there I introduced new cancelNotification methods and id handling for both success and error notifications). #6756 Implement success notifications for Post uploads only when app is not in the foreground: #6763 Implement error notifications for Post uploads #6786 Implement success notifications for media-only uploads only when app is not in the foreground, and implement Write Post : #6780 Implement error notifications for Media uploads #6814 Implement multiselect to add new files in the Media Browser #6811 add Analytics for notifications quick actions (RETRY, WRITE POST) Other: #6789 Implement Retry failed media for failed uploads #6787 Get old icons for notifications back #6797 improving FORCE STOP recovery handling
Manager.title: Async media: foreground notifications master thread

Manager.description: Expected behavior Aztec help icon should be horizontally aligned to the right and share the same vertical baseline as the Title hint Actual behavior The icon is misaligned Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft observe the misalignment Tested on [Nexus 9], Android [version]
Manager.title: Aztec help icon misalignment

Manager.description: Expected behavior In the Editor, all buttons in the toolbar should be disabled when adding a picture using the media picker Actual behavior The "add show more" button is enabled Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft tap on the body area in the editor tap on the "add media" icon to launch the media picker observe the toolbar has the "add show more" button enabled Tested on [Nexus 9], Android [version]
Manager.title: Editor: "add show more tag" button should be disabled

Manager.description: Expected behavior If a Post is already enqueued to be uploaded, it should be uploaded once Actual behavior A copy of the Post is enqueued to be uploaded each time you enter and exit the editor. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a draft write something and include some media to make the effects visible exit the editor; the Post is enqueued to be uploaded when media is finished uploading enter the editor again, modify the text, and exit again a new copy of the Post is enqueued, but if the media is still uploading, we'll have 2 copies enqueued for the same Post (when only the latest one is all we need to upload) Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async uploads: Posts are enqueued every time the user leaves the editor

Manager.description: When you long press in the media picker to show the preview, sometimes you see a black screen before the image appears. There should be an indeterminate progress bar until the image is loaded.
Manager.title: Media picker preview: add progress spinner

Manager.description: We're seeing a number of these crashes in MediaPreviewActivity: java.lang.IllegalStateException; Can not perform this action after onSaveInstanceState Pretty sure this is caused by the new swipable preview ViewPager we recently added.
Manager.title: IllegalStateException in MediaPreviewActivity

Manager.description: Expected behavior One is able to login with password in small devices. e.g.: Actual behavior No label/button is shown and one is forced to use 'Link in email' login: Steps to reproduce the behavior Run the app in default Android AVD (very small screen) Tested on Android Emulator, Android 25 Created with avdmanager create avd -n test -k "system-images;android-25;google_apis;x86" This discovery was part of the Automated Testing course at Universidad de los Andes.
Manager.title: No 'login with password' option in small devices

Manager.description: While working on #6719 I ran into a number of complications caused by the picker and the browser relying on different methods for determining things like: Whether multi-select is allowed Whether only images should be displayed Whether only device media shopuld be displayed etc. This made it messy to enable selecting a featured image from both the picker and the browser. I've halted work on that and will tackle making the two media sources act more alike first.
Manager.title: Photo picker and media browser refactoring

Manager.description: First reported by @nbradbury in this comment #6763 (comment) the post list was (correctly) showing that a post's media failed to upload yet the upload progress remained visible
Manager.title: Async media: Post list showing both progress and an error

Manager.description: Site picker layout is broken in RTL, the icons appear but not the text. Site menu is also half broken.
Manager.title: Site picker layout is broken in RTL

Manager.description: First reported by @nbradbury in #6789 (comment) Expected behavior In branch issue/6407-retry-failed-post-from-post-list (to be merged in issue/6389-upload-service-notification) we are adding a Retry button in the Posts list for failed uploading Posts. This should be always shown along with the error label (it makes sense to show and error and offering an action to solve it). Actual behavior On small screens, the Retry button is only shown in the second row (which is hidden and is only shown after tapping the More button), while the error label is shown right away, thus generating a lack of intuitivity. It should be shown along with the error label. Steps to reproduce the behavior run the app on a small screen go to the Posts list start a new draft and write something, include a media item go back to the Posts list turn airplane mode ON to trigger the error see the error is shown in the Posts list, but no Retry button is shown unless you tap on More. Tested on [Samsung S3], Android [4.1.1]
Manager.title: Posts list: Retry option should be shown in the first button group

Manager.description: Expected behavior If the app is stopped while an upload is happening, it should recover gracefully next time it's opened. Actual behavior A post that was uploading in the middle of the app being stopped shows as "normal" in the Posts list, but entering the editor shows the cancelled media. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a draft with multiple media force stop the app start the app again see the post is not marked failed edit it see all media is marked failed exit the editor see the post list still doesn’t show the Post as failed Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async media: force stop leaves inconsistent state

Manager.description: Originally reported in #6795 (comment) Expected behavior Tapping on Retry on a failed Post list item should reset its label and first button row to the normal/uploading state Actual behavior The progress bar is shown but both the label and the Retry button are still shown. Steps to reproduce the behavior Steps to reproduce: start a new draft include some media items exit the editor turn airplane mode ON see the error appear tap on Retry on the failed Post list item observe the uploading re-starts (notifications appear, etc.) and the progress bar appears and starts getting updates, but both the status label and button rows stay the same (i.e. in the "error/retry" state) Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async media retry: Post list item not showing right label / first button row

Manager.description: Expected behavior Opening a Post with media written in the Visual editor should show the same way on Aztec Actual behavior Found these weird question marks that respond to touch and offer a dialog with some HTML in them? Steps to reproduce the behavior set visual editor start draft and include some media items exit the editor turn airplane mode ON set editor to Beta turn airplane mode OFF go to posts list tap on RETRY see the uploads start edit the post see the question marks tap on them Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async + Aztec: editing a Post with media produced in the Visual editor shows strange behavior

Manager.description: Expected behavior When editing on Aztec with media being uploaded, deleting an image that is being uploaded should decrement the count in the foreground progress notification accordingly Actual behavior No changes to the totals are seen in the foreground notification (also not sure whether the upload is cancelled) Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft insert 4 media items exit the editor, verify the progress notifications says 4 items are being uploaded open the editor, position the cursor to the right of an image being uploaded hit backspace observe the foreground notification did not count one less item as it should have, and the progress bar jumps to almost at 100% Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async media: count should decrement on item deletion while editing

Manager.description: Error:(15, 0) Due to a limitation of Gradle’s new variant-aware dependency management, loading the Android Gradle plugin in different class loaders leads to a build error. This can occur when the buildscript classpaths that contain the Android Gradle plugin in sub-projects, or included projects in the case of composite builds, are set differently. To resolve this issue, add the Android Gradle plugin to only the buildscript classpath of the top-level build.gradle file. In the case of composite builds, also make sure the build script classpaths that contain the Android Gradle plugin are identical across the main and included projects. If you are using a version of Gradle that has fixed the issue, you can disable this check by setting android.enableBuildScriptClasspathCheck=false in the gradle.properties file. To learn more about this issue, go to https://d.android.com/r/tools/buildscript-classpath-check.html.
Manager.title: Error

W/ActivityManager: Force finishing activity org.wordpress.android/.ui.main.WPMainActivity Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Async media crash when cancelling notifications

Manager.description: Our site picker on Android differs from iOS and the web in some small but important ways. I'm creating this issue to track the changes we should make on Android to better align its picker with other platforms. In Calypso, if the user has 11 or more visible sites, we show the 5 most recently-accessed sites on top of the list. On Android, if the user has 15 or more visible sites, we show the 4 most recent sites. Change the threshold for showing recent sites from 15 to 11 to match Calypso. Show 5 recent sites rather than 4.
Manager.title: Site picker: update behavior to better match other platforms

Manager.description: The error message shown after entering an email address that is not associated with a WordPress.com account reads: "This email is not registered on WordPress.com." Assuming the user is not in a wpcom-only flow, let's edit the message to ask if the user is trying to log in to their self-hosted site. Something like: "Are you trying to log in to your self-hosted site?" might work, but would it also make sense to reference the button to the site address screen? Refs p4a5px-20t-p2 cc @folletto
Manager.title: Login: Edit error message to reference self-hosted site

Manager.description: In the media browser, when you tap the plus icon to add media the menu shows up but tapping a menu item does nothing. This menu has been a source of problems for a while, so perhaps rather than fixing this bug we should look at a different solution?
Manager.title: "Add Media" menu fails on API 16

Manager.description: Expected behavior When adding an image to Editor, it should appear in original size when it's width is not exceding max allowed width of Editor. Actual behavior When adding an image to Editor, if it's width is less then the max allowed width of Editor, it will be scaled up to the max allowed with.
Manager.title: Image added to Aztec sometimes scaled up

Manager.description: Try to share a new link from YouTube, or Chrome (or any other app) to WP. Create a new article, and tap publish without touching the content. The user reported empty content, even though the publication ends without any errors. Tested on wp-android 8.4.1 , SM-G386T1 running Android 4.4.2
Manager.title: Aztec + Sharing to WordPress --> empty post content

Manager.description: It looks like there's an alignment issue in the sign-up screen, causing the password field text, icon, and visibility toggle to overlap:
Manager.title: Visual bug in account creation screen

Manager.description: When selecting a stream in the Reader, the label for liked posts is currently "Posts I Like." This should be updated to "My Likes" to match the Reader on the web.

Testing 8.8rc2 on a Pixel2 running Oreo Activity log: cc @theck13
Manager.title: Google Login: Requesting an SMS 2fa code shows an error

Manager.description: The endpoints we are using for Plugins is only added on 5.6 version of Jetpack. Although there was an endpoint in the previous versions, it was a little buggy and wouldn't work well with a mobile client, so we decided to go this route considering plugins is a new feature for mobile clients. This change might need a FluxC check as well which should be handled in parallel. P.S: This really is a minor issue, but I am not able to make the change right now and I don't want to forget about it.
Manager.title: Disable plugins for pre-5.6 version Jetpack sites

Manager.description: We'd like to add some analytics for the plugin feature. We'll figure out which events we'd like to add when we work on this issue.
Manager.title: Plugin analytics

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect all of the signup fields to be aligned with an icon on the left and the text field to the right of the icon. Actual behavior The password text field is too far left, with the icons (padlock and eye) overlapping the text. Screenshot Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-86
Manager.title: Signup: Password field misaligned with icons overlapping text

Manager.description: Issue needs to be resolved in FluxC, and is tracked here: wordpress-mobile/WordPress-FluxC-Android#632. This issue is a placeholder to attach it to the 8.9 milestone so we don't miss it.
Manager.title: Crash (8.9): NFE in REST client when deserializing theme network response

Manager.description: I am going to keep a list of things that we need to do for plugins before we can ship it. Most of these wouldn't be worth to have separate issues for. Add update available icon to plugin list page Quickly enabling/disabling active and autoupdates states causes issues. Add content description for image views Check that FluxC events in plugin detail page are for the plugin we are interested in Update the sync icon with the new one Don't allow removing Jetpack for any site because plugins will stop working all together Don't allow removing Akismet or VaultPress for Automated Transfer sites While removing a plugin, if the device is rotated, the progress dialog will be dismissed and the user can take actions. Plugins should only work if the user has Jetpack 5.6 or later installed Add analytics (Moved to #6897) Test rotations Test older APIs, smaller devices Test update plugin
Manager.title: Plugins polish

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that if I have "Beta" set as the editor type in the app, Aztec will be enabled. Actual behavior Even if I have previously selected the "Beta" editor type, and the app settings shows "Beta" as the selected editor type, the hybrid editor appears after logging in to an account. Steps to reproduce the behavior To start, make sure that "Beta" is selected as the editor type (in Me > App Settings) and Aztec is showing up when you open the editor. Log out of the app. Log in to the app using the same account. Open Me > App Settings and confirm that "Beta" is still selected. Start a new post. Result: The hybrid editor is loaded. To enable the Aztec editor at this point: Go back to Me > App Settings. Select a different editor type (e.g. "Visual"). Select the "Beta" editor type again. Start a new post and confirm Aztec is now enabled. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-86 and in WPAndroid develop in an emulator
Manager.title: Editor: Aztec (beta) editor isn't correctly enabled after login

Manager.description: I've created an emulator with API 17 to test a crash today and when I tried to login, I got an error that this email address is not registered which is not the case. I haven't really looked into it yet, as I am dealing with a crash and I wanted to open this issue to make sure I don't forget about it. /cc @hypest
Manager.title: Possible login issue with old Android versions

Manager.description: Expected Uploading a video should always keep the thumbnail and thumbnail placeholder the same size. Observed When uploading a video, the placeholder sometimes doesn’t appear and shows a blank space instead on slow a connection Reproduced start a draft post insert a video from the media library, see the thumbnail is shown alright exit the post edit the post again see the camera image for “loading” placeholder is shown (it should be showing the thumbnail), and the “play” icon is shown on top of it (covering the camera loading image) once the placeholder is "done" downloading, but it FAILS to do so, a blank space “white placeholder” takes up a lot of the screen. see the thumbnail is not shown but rather a blank space appears, with a white “play” icon in the center rotate the screen, see the big placeholder space is taken by a blank space and this looks broken Tested [Google Pixel] on [Android 8.0] with [alpha-97]
Manager.title: Aztec: placeholder not sized correctly when failed downloading

Manager.description: Expected behavior The title field should expand vertically, and take 2 or 3 lines, when the title is long and could not be displayed in one row. Note that setting the input types to android:inputType="textCapSentences|textMultiLine" doesn't fix the issue, since WP doesn't have multi lines title concept. We should just make the title field expand vertically if the content doesn't fit. At least do this for at least 3 lines of rows. If you hit Enter when on the title field, on the web, it does simply add a new space. Actual behavior The title field is one line field, and it scrolls horizontally. Steps to reproduce the behavior Just open a new post with a long title in it. Tested on Wiko Ridge 4G, Android 5.0.2, API 21
Manager.title: Long post titles are not properly show in Aztec Editors

Manager.description: We should make sure that Media added to Aztec are properly resized to fit the editor viewport size. Also, we should make sure the same size is used during the uploading process, and failures. See #6942 At the moment picture have different sizes when uploaded from the device, or opened a pre-existing post. Note 1: When the device is rotated we should resize them as well. Note 2: Make sure to not upsample pictures.
Manager.title: Aztec Media Placeholders - Make sure thumbnails are resized accordingly to the editor viewport size

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect any changes to a post to be saved when I exit the editor or tap the "Update" button in the editor. Actual behavior If the only changes to a saved post are adding media from the media library, the changes are not saved. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post. Add some content to the post. Save the draft. Open the post in the editor again. Add media (video or photo) from the media library. Tap the back arrow. Note that autosave does not happen. Open the post in the editor again. Note that the media has disappeared. Add media (video or photo) from the media library again. Tap the "Update" button. Open the post in the editor again. Note that the media has disappeared again. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1
Manager.title: Editor: Changes lost when the only change is adding media from the media library

Manager.description: Expected New lines should be kept at all times Observed New lines are gone after a failed media item is processed by AztecTextParser when a media item is finished uploading Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft write some text entering “ENTER” on purpose, like: “something” “another thing” “bla bla” “bla bla” “bla bla” “bla bla” insert some media items exit the editor while media items are uploading either wait until uploads finish, or if inpatient make the uploads fail, maybe by turning airplane mode ON see the post show the error in the post list now open the Post see all new lines are gone Tested on [Google Nexus 6], Android [5.1.0 API 22]
Manager.title: Aztec: new lines are lost in Calypso mode

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect that when I multi-select in the media picker from my site's Media Library, and one or more selections are videos, the selections will be added as individual photos/videos to the post. (This is the Calypso behavior.) Actual behavior When I multi-select in the media picker from my site's Media Library, I am always offered the option to create a gallery. All of the videos are added to the gallery shortcode, but they don't appear in the published gallery (or in Calypso when editing the post on the web). The same behavior occurs in both Aztec and the hybrid editor. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post. Select the Add Media button. Select the Media Library as the media source. Select multiple media items, including at least one video. Confirm your selection. Note that the "Add multiple photos" dialog appears, with the options to "Add individually" or "Add as gallery." Select "Add as gallery." Note that the gallery shortcode includes the video(s) you selected. Save or publish the post and view it. Note that only the images appear in the gallery. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-87
Manager.title: Editor: Media picker allows adding videos to galleries

Manager.description: Expected behavior I expect the list toolbar button to be highlighted only if you select a list style. Actual behavior The highlighting for the list toolbar button is toggled when you first tap on it, and stays highlighted even if you don't select a list style. The highlighting only toggles off when you start typing. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post in Aztec. Tap the list toolbar button. Note that the button is highlighted. Without selecting a list style, tap another toolbar button or tap into the editor. Note that the button is still highlighted. Start typing. Note that now the toolbar highlighting is toggled off. This can also cause the highlighting for the list toolbar button to be toggled off even when a list style is selected: Start a new post in Aztec. Tap the list toolbar button. Note that the button is highlighted. Without selecting a list style, tap into the editor. Note that the button is still highlighted. Tap the list toolbar button again. Note that the button highlighting is toggled off. Select a list style. Start typing. Note that the toolbar highlighting is still toggled off, even though the list style is applied to the text. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-87
Manager.title: Aztec: Highlighting for list toolbar button is toggled without selecting a list style

Manager.description: Expected behavior Deleting an image in the Aztec Editor should be allowed and the progress notification either decremented or dismissed if only 1 image being uploaded. Actual behavior When an image that is being uploaded is deleted (using backspace) in the Editor, an error notification reading "1 file not uploaded" is shown, when it shouldn't be shown because it was actively deleted by the uer. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a draft with a video, while its being uploaded, delete it from aztec by positioning the cursor on the right of the image and hit BACKSPACE. See the error notification says “1 file not uploaded”. It shouldn’t show an error, as it was deleted by the user. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]
Manager.title: Aztec / media: deleting an image triggers an error notification (it shouldn't)

Manager.description: Update the Jetpack logo to the new version everywhere it appears in the app. We have at least a couple of places: Last paged image in Log In (animation, json file) Install Jetpack prompt (from Stats) Empty notifications state with no .com account prompt (not sure this happens on Android but on iOS we prompt to install Jetpack from here) New icon files: jetpack.json.zip icon-jetpack-gray.svg.zip
Manager.title: Update Jetpack Logo

Manager.description: Expected behavior To be able to delete a plugin Actual behavior The plugin deactivated, but failed to remove: Steps to reproduce the behavior I created a new site on Pressable and connected it via Jetpack I loaded the site in the app and navigated to Plugins I opened Akismet and attempted to Remove it The plugin was deactivated, but threw the above error on delete. Subsequent attempts to delete all throw the same error. Now the plugin says deactivated in the app and wp-admin agrees. I tried re-activating it from the app, and now the app thinks it's active but wp-admin says it's not. The application logs don't show anything relevant. Tested on Pixel 2 XL, Android 8.1, wp-android alpha-90
Manager.title: Plugins: Unable to delete plugin, leads to bad active status

Manager.description: We should add pull to refresh action to plugin list with a progress indicator for when the network request is going on (including when it's auto started).
Manager.title: Add pull to refresh to plugin list

Manager.description: Expected behavior If I type "ABCD" in the title box, the title should say "ABCD" Actual behavior I type A, it says A. I type B, the title becomes "AAB". I type C, I get "AABABC", etc. Steps to reproduce the behavior Make a new post using the beta editor Type a title Note: I can consistently reproduce on my phone even after restarting it. Could be because my phone is old. Tested on LG G4, Android 6.0 Also my updates always seem to lag, so I'm on Alpha 89 You can see a video and screenshot of the issue in action here: https://cloudup.com/cE18S9bfbWY Also, note if I add a space, it resets, as you can see in the screenshot. Pressing backspace also does wonky things, but I can eventually clear out the title. I can type normally in the content area and paste to the title area.
Manager.title: Editor: Repeating characters in title

Manager.description: This was reported during testing: If I’m in airplane mode and I try to disable a plugin, it briefly toggles to disabled and then back to enabled. I maybe would have expected an error message indicating that I wasn’t connected to a network.
Manager.title: Better handle offline mode for plugins

Manager.description: This was reported during testing: If a plugin is deactivated and I go to delete it, I get the same message as an activate plugin that I try to remove. The message includes “This plugin will be deactivated.” If it’s already deactivated, that part of the message doesn’t really apply.
Manager.title: Fix remove plugin message for already deactivated plugin

Manager.description: In case of multiple images uploading failures when in the Editor screen (I tried on Aztec by putting the device in airplane mode), those pictures are all marked with the red overlay, and the "tap to retry" icon in the center. If you switch to HTML mode all the content is erased from the post, even those pictures that successfully uploaded. To Test Add several pictures to the post Put the device in airplane mode Media fails Toggle airplane mode Tap on a picture and wait till the upload finishes switch to HTML mode, and when the app asks if you want to remove failed upload tap Yes The app switches to HTML mode but there is no content in the editor
Manager.title: Aztec/Media - multiple media failures could cause content lost when switching to HTML mode

Manager.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to Plugins > Hello Dolly. Turn off Autoupdates. Deactivate the plugin. Remove the plugin. Go to Calypso and re-install the plugin. Go back to the app and open the Plugins page. Check to see if the "Active" and "Autoupdates" statuses match. Result: the "Active" status is correct but the "Autoupdates" status sometimes gets out of sync with what I see on the web compared to what I see in the app. Tested with Firefox 57.0.1 on macOS 10.13.2 and Pixel, Android 8.1.0, WPAndroid alpha-90.
Manager.title: Autoupdates status for plugins sometimes gets out of sync
